title: Galle Titans prevails in Super Over after thrilling tie
content: Galle Titans prevailed over Dambulla Aura after their match ended in a high scoring thrilling tie the second match of the Lanka Premier League tournament played at the R. Premadasa Stadium today.

title: Along with Japan and India, China can join debt relief effort for Sri Lanka: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: As a large creditor to Sri Lanka, China is welcome to join the effort steered by Japan, India and France to help the island nation cope with its debt distress, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Saturday.

title: Fingerprint mandatory for all executive staff at Health Ministry
content: The use of fingerprint machines for all Staff Grade Officers or executive staff has been made mandatory, beginning August 01, 2023.

title: Man in ’Aswesuma’ queue dies
content: A 77-year-old man who was waiting in a queue to obtain the ’Aswesuma’ relief at the Ella Divisional Secretariat, collapsed and died.

title: Van carrying Italian tourists plunges into precipice in Koslanda
content: A van carrying a group of Italian tourists met with an accident on the Wellawaya-Koslanda Road this morning, as it veered off the road at Icepeella and plunged into a precipice.

title: SL Athletics not responsible for pole vault champ Sachini's move to Dubai
content: Pole Vault women Sri Lanka record holder Sachini Kushalya Perera has left the country and is working as a domestic worker in the Middle East not because of any shortcoming or mistake from the athletics administration, said Sri Lanka Athletic (SLA) General Secretary Saman Kumara Gunawardena in an inquiry by ’Daily Mirror’.

title: Govt.’s new tourism strategy to attract 5 mn tourists: RW
content: Sri Lanka is planning to attract 5 million tourists, including 2.5 million high-end visitors, contributing to the country’s economic growth, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: Bradby Shield: Trinity College pull off stunning win over Royal College
content: Trinity College pulled off a stunning 13-10 win over Royal College in the first leg of the 77th Bradby Encounter in Pallekeke.

title: Dimuth reiterates desire to step down as Test captain
content: Dimuth Karunaratne has requested the national cricket selection committee to reconsider his request to step down as Sri Lanka’s Test captain.

title: Sri Lanka to host Afghanistan’s home series against Pakistan
content: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) is all set to host Afghanistan’s one-day bilateral home series against Pakistan here next month, it is learned.

title: Millionaire arrested for alleged rape at five star hotel
content: A millionaire businessman was taken into custody by the Police Children and Women Bureau on suspicion of the alleged rape of a female employee at a five-star hotel in Colombo.

title: Drug that caused death of young woman at Peradeniya Hospital still in use: Keheliya
content: The drug that is said to have caused the death of a young woman at the Peradeniya Teaching Hospital recently is still in use in hospitals, where more than 66,000 vials of the particular drug are in stock in hospitals islanwide, Health Minister Keheliya Rambuwella said today.

title: UK-based mineral company raises concerns with mines bureau
content: Capital Metals, a UK mineral resources company listed on the London Stock Exchange, said Monday it will raise 364,705 pounds ($477,471) via a subscription and that it will use funds toward accelerating actions aimed at the lifting of the suspension of its industrial mining licenses at a project in Sri Lanka.

title: Deposit Rs. 13mn for uninterrupted power for Kandy Esala Perahera: CEB tells Nilames
content: MP Lakshman Kiriella said the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has informed the Nilames and organizers of the Kandy Esala Perahera to deposit a sum of Rs. 13 million in order to supply an uninterrupted power supply for the festival.

title: Missing Danish woman’s body found
content: Police have found the body of the 32-year-old Danish woman who had reportedly gone missing while hiking on the Alagalla mountain in Kadugannawa.

title: Dimuth a doubt for first Pakistan Test
content: Sri Lanka’s 35-year-old Test captain and opening batter Dimuth Karunaratne is doubtful for the first Test match against Pakistan, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) sources said.

title: Seven deaths at Kandy Hospital due to alleged fungal infection: Probe underway
content: The Health Ministry has initiated a comprehensive investigation into the seven deaths allegedly caused due to fungal infection at the Kandy Hospital, Director General of Health Services Dr. Asela Gunawardena said.

title: Gazette issued to conduct census of population, housing for 2023, 2024
content: An Extraordinary Gazette notification (2340/03) was issued announcing the collection of the census of population and housing in Sri Lanka for the years 2023 and 2024.

title: 26 estate workers injured after bus topples down precipice
content: At least 26 women were injured when a bus transporting estate workers in Pundalu Oya veered off the road and toppled down a precipice.

title: President asks Tiran to decide on IGP post
content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed Public Security Minister Tiran Alles to take the final decision on the appointment of the new IGP, informed sources said.

title: Paddy cultivation saved 300 mn for the country
content: The farmers who cultivate paddy in our country have managed to save 300 million US dollars in foreign exchange this year, Agriculture Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said.

title: Spend money on developing school cricket not on officials for overseas travels, Sports Minister tells SLC
content: Claiming that he would no longer approve overseas travel for Sri Lanka Cricket officials, Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe said that he has requested SLC to spend more on developing school cricket.

title: Sajith, Keheliya in heated argument over quality of drugs
content: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa and Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwela engaged in heated arguments when the latter alleged that people are faced with serious issues due to import of substandard medicinal drugs under emergency purchases.

title: Sri Lanka to play Lord’s Test next year
content: Sri Lanka will play a three Test series in England next year, including a Test at Lord’s.

title: Girl goes missing in Attanagalu Oya while taking selfie
content: A 20-year-old girl who had gone for a bath in the Attanagalu Oya has gone missing after she slid down a slope and fell into the river while taking a selfie, Police said.

title: Parliament approves Domestic Debt Restructuring programme
content: The Domestic Debt Restructuring programme was approved by Parliament with a majority of 60 votes with 122 members voting for and 62 against.

title: Inter-School Rugby: Isipathana lead St. Joseph's 10-08 at half-time
content: Isipathana College held a slender two-point lead at the short-whistle of their Inter-School Rugby League match against St. Joseph’s College, the scores reading 10-08 at half-time.

title: Malik Samarawickrema steps down as Kandy SC Trustee
content: Former Royal Scrum half, Royal Head coach, Sri Lanka Rugby Football Union (SLRFU) President and present Trustee of Kandy Sports Club, Malik Samarawickrema stepped down from his position after a service of more than 3 decades.

title: SL to set up Gambling Regularisation Authority to regulate gaming industry
content: The government has decided to establish a separate authority named Gambling Regularisation Authority to regulate the country’s gaming....

title: Praveena Perera wins ‘Top 50 women’ award
content: Praveena Perera – Associate Vice President & Group Account Director from MullenLowe was recognised as an emerging woman leader and is this year’s recipient of the award for ‘Leadership in the field of Advertising & Public Relations Sector’ at the “Top 50 Professional & Career Women Global Awards – Thirteenth Edition” organised by Women in Management (WIM).

title: First 20 days of June bring in over 61,000 tourists
content:
Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka totalled 61,183 in the first 20 days of June, provisional data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority showed.
As the tourism....

title: Titanic director James Cameron accuses OceanGate of cutting corners
content: Hollywood film director James Cameron, who directed the 1997 movie Titanic, has told the BBC the team who built the submersible which imploded with the loss of five lives had ’’cut corners’’.

title: Penalty announced on foreign visa overstayers
content: The Public Security Minister has issued a Gazette Extraordinary announcing the penalties to be charged for foreigners who overstay in the country beyond the prescribed visa period.

title: Mandatory vaccine administration to Hajj pilgrims unregulated
content: The mandatory Meningococcal vaccine is reportedly being administered to Sri Lankan Hajj pilgrims through unregulated means, Secretary of the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) Dr. Haritha Aluthge said.

title: Harassed by parents; boy flees home
content: A 15-year-old boy who sneaked out from his house to escape harassments of his parents, were taken charge of by the Hatton police when he was liotroing at the Hatton railway station in the early hours of last morning.

title: Change in fuel revision date, no shortage of 95-Octane petrol: CPSTL
content: The Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Limited (CPSTL) assured today that there is no shortage of 95-Octane petrol in the country.

title: Pakistan FM blames ’geopolitics’ for stalled IMF loan package as economic crisis worsens
content: Pakistan’s Finance Minister Ishaq Dar has blamed geopolitics for a stalled IMF loan package and said that global institutions wanted the cash-strapped country to default like Sri Lanka and then take part in the negotiations.

title: Scientists create synthetic human embryos from stem cells, without an egg or sperm
content: A team of researchers in the United States and the United Kingdom say they have created the world’s first synthetic human embryo-like structures from stem cells, bypassing the need for eggs and sperm.

title: Child labour on the rise for first time in 20 years: ILO
content: For the first time in 20 years, child labour is on the rise, the International Labour Organisation (ILO) shared.

title: Cork teacher injured in cycling holiday accident in SL can sue in Ireland, High Court rules
content: A Cork woman who was injured in an accident on a cycling holiday in Sri Lanka can sue the UK-based organisers in the Irish courts, the High Court has ruled.

title: SLR to set up an e-gate system
content: The Sri Lanka Railways (SLR) is to set up an e-gate system at nearly 400 unprotected level crossings in the railway network around the country to put an end to fatal railway accidents that kill nearly 200 people annually and maim about 400, Transport Minister Dr. Bandula Gunawardana said.

title: Import restrictions on nearly 300 items lifted
content: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued lifting the import restrictions imposed on 286 items including tiles, bathroom items, sanitary ware and food items.

title: Value of a perch in Galle Fort increased to Rs. 22mn
content: More than one hundred buildings, located within the Galle Fort, have been purchased by foreigners, increasing the value of one perch to Rs 22 million, the Galle Heritage Foundation said.

title: GCE O/L exams end today, battle against dengue to begin
content: The GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) exams end today (8), and with that the dengue mosquito elimination programme will be conducted in all examination centres, the Examinations Department said.

title: Over 100mm rain expected today: Met. Dept
content: Heavy rains exceeding 100 mm is expected in the Sabaragamuwa Province and in the Galle, Matara and Kalutara districts, the Meteorology Department said today.

title: Gun running taking place parallel to drug trafficking: Minster
content: There is a disturbing trend of gun-running being carried out together with drug trafficking, while arms that were used during the conflict in the North have come into the South after the end of the conflict, Minister of National Security Tilan Alles revealed in Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka on alert over new virus with cold-like symptoms spreading in US
content: In the wake of the recent upsurge cases in little-known respiratory virus called HMPV spreading in the US, Sri Lankan Health authorities said they keep a close eye on the new developments of the virus and have gone on alert.

title: Top ME influencer in SL
content: Leading social media influencer Khalid Al Ameri, who is based in the Middle East, yesterday announced his visit to  Sri Lanka.

title: Indian Coast Guard, DRI seize INR 20 crore worth of gold smuggled from Sri Lanka
content: In a joint operation, the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI), with the help of the Indian Coast Guard (ICG), Mandapam & Ramnad Customs, Preventive Division, intercepted two fishing boats and seized 32.869 kg of foreign origin gold valued at Rs. 20.21 crore that was smuggled into India from Sri Lanka through the coast.

title: Lack of funding for A’pura Poson programme: Govt. refutes allegations
content: The government refutes allegations by various parties about a lack of funding for the Anuradhapura Poson programme, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Maithripala’s leave to appeal application dismissed
content: The leave to appeal application filed by former President Maithripala Sirisena challenging the Negombo District Court’s order to proceed with the cases filed against him by the victims of the Katuwapitiya Church bomb blast while ordering to lay by the said cases against President Ranil Wickremesinghe was dismissed today by the Negombo Civil Appellate High Court.

title: Thief breaks into Sri Lankan temple in Adelaide
content: A man broke into a Sri Lankan Buddhist temple in Adelaide and stole some of the money donated by worshipers.

title: Welikada OIC transferred over death of maid in alleged custody
content: The OIC of the Welikada Police has been transferred to the Police Field Headquarters over the death of a 42-year-old woman who was a domestic worker at popular tele drama producer and business personality Sudharma Nethicumara’s house, and was taken into custody over an alleged theft.

title: President meets Vietnamese Dy. PM; discusses bi-lateral ties
content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is on an official visit in Japan, held a discussion with Vietnamese Deputy Prime Minister Tran Luu Quang, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Consignment of gold not mine: Ali Sabri Raheem
content: MP Ali Sabri Raheem who was charged with smuglling gold said the consignment of gold did not belong to him.

title: ICC announces World Cup Qualifiers full fixtures: SL to play first game on June 19
content: The warm-up fixtures have been confirmed ahead of the upcoming ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup Qualifier tournament in Zimbabwe, with Sri Lanka playing its first Qualifier match against UAE on June 19.

title: Shavendra Silva raises objections on Karannagoda Committee report
content: Former Army Commander General Shavendra Silva through his lawyer today informed Court of Appeal that he is disputing the findings of Karannagoda Committee appointed to inquire into incident of violence following the Galle Face attacks on May 9, 2022.

title: Housemaids leaving safe-house illegally not readmitted- Embassy
content: Referring to the recent video clips circulating on social media alleging ill-treatment of Sri Lankan housemaids at the Embassy’s safe-house, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Oman said it will not re-admit any housemaids who illegally leave the safe-house on their own responsibility...

title: Dinesh Schaffter’s body to be exhumed?
content: The five-member expert committee, comprising of specialist doctors, appointed to prepare a report on the death of businessman, Dinesh Schaffter, yesterday requested in writing to the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that the body of deceased Mr. Schaffter needs to be exhumed to find the cause of his death.

title: Give us EP Governor’s post. We can develop EP within 6 months: MJP leader
content: The Mawbima Janatha Party (MJP) can develop the Eastern Province within six months if they are granted the Governor’s post, MJP leader and Tamil Diaspora General Secretary Nimalan Vishwanathan said.

title: Govt. approves extending fully electric vehicle imports up to Sept. 15
content: The government today approved extending the period for foreign exchange remittances made by Sri Lankan expatriates working overseas in order to obtain a vehicle permit, Cabinet spokesman Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.

title: Protest against higher ordination ceremony in Trinco
content: A protest staged by a group of individuals led by Jaffna District Parliamentarian S.Gajendran near the archaeological site in front of the Trincomalee public playground against a programme to commemorate the 270th anniversary of the higher ordination ceremony was dispersed by the police and the STF (Special Task Force).

title: Prison officer attacked, threatened with death
content: Three unidentified armed men who arrived at the Minuwangoda home of a prison officer attached to the New Magazine Prison in Colombo, had attacked and threatened him with death yesterday.

title: Mocha intensifies into severe cyclonic storm: Meteorology Dept.
content: The cyclonic storm ’’Mocha’’ over the Southwest Bay of Bengal has intensified into a severe cyclonic storm, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Political interference: ICC visits Sri Lanka
content: Mr. Imran Khwaja, the Deputy Chairman of the International Cricket Council, who is a member of the 3-member committee appointed by the International Cricket Council to look into the political interference in administering the game of cricket in Sri Lanka, arrived in the country early this morning.

title: Dengue epidemic situation caused by ministry stopping fumigation: Kumudesh
content: Issuing a circular to halt fumigation has caused a dengue epidemic situation, Academy of Health Professionals (AHP) president Ravi Kumudesh said today.

title: India name KL Rahul’s replacement for WTC final
content: India have named the replacement for the injured KL Rahul in their ICC World Test Championship 2023 Final squad.

title: Matheesha Pathirana will be a great asset for Sri Lanka: MS Dhoni
content: In the opinion of Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni, Matheesha Pathirana should steer clear of red ball cricket. In fact, the legendary cricketer suggested he should be used sparingly in 50-over cricket as well.

title: Court calls for an analytical report on Dinesh Schaffter’s laptop computer
content: The Colombo Chief Magistrate today ordered the Government Analyst to submit in Court an analytical report pertaining to the laptop computers used by late businessman Dinesh Shafter and his family members, in order to facilitate for the ongoing investigations into Shafter’s death.

title: Boy, 14, arrested after nine killed in Serbian school shooting
content: At least eight students and a security guard are dead after a shooting at a school in Serbia’s capital Belgrade.

title: 125 fake web sites offering Indian e-Visa
content: There are more than 125 fake websites which claim to offer Indian e-Visa, the Indian High Commission warned the Sri Lankan public yesterday.

title: Woman raped and murdered in Mihintale, suspect arrested
content: A woman was raped and killed in a house at Doramadalawa in Mihintale yesterday, police said.

title: Sri Lanka beat Ireland by an innings and 10 runs
content: Sri Lanka recorded an emphatic innings and 10-run win over Ireland in the second Test in Galle, to complete a sweep of the series.

title: Govt. to bring in fresh amendments to Inland Revenue Act to broaden tax base
content: With an aim to broaden the tax base by enabling electronic payments coupled with mandatory reporting for state institutions, the government plans to bring in fresh amendments to Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017 in Parliament for approval this Friday.

title: X-Press Pearl disaster: SJB questions why case filed in Singapore court
content: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) today questioned as to why the case with regard to the X-Press Pearl disaster was filed in a Singapore court when the case could have been filed in a local court.

title: Children, expectant mothers at risk, stay hydrated: SLMA
content: Children, expectant mothers, the elderly and those taking treatment for various illnesses are at risk of dehydration due to the extreme temperatures recorded in Sri Lanka, President of the Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA) Dr. Vinya Ariyaratne said.

title: SL a country without responsible rulers? : Buddhist Monk
content: It is unfortunate that there is no one to take responsibility for the Easter Sunday attack though four years have gone since the mayhem, a prominent Buddhist monk said yesterday.

title: Extreme Heat warning issued to 17 districts
content: The Meteorology Department has issued extreme heat weather advisory tomorrow particularly for Western, North-Western, Northern, North-Central and Eastern provinces and Monaragala and Hambantota Districts.

title: Gazette issued further postponing LG polls
content: The Local Government election which was fixed for April 25, 2023 has been further postponed through a gazette notification issued by the District Returning Officers of the respective Districts.

title: Toque monkeys could be heading for labs in China: CEJ
content: The first batch of 100,000 toque monkeys could be heading for test labs in China, Executive Director of the Center for Environmental Justice (CEJ), Hemantha Withanage said.

title: SLTB, private bus services till end of festivities
content: After the completion of the New Year rituals, special bus services have been put into operation from today for the convenience of people returning to Colombo from their home towns, the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and the National Transport Commission (NTC) said.

title: Environmentalist questions move to export monkeys endemic to Sri Lanka
content: Environmental lawyer Dr. Jagath Gunawardana, while questioning the government’s recent decision to appoint a committee to study the export of 100,000 Toque monkeys to China, said that the current legal provisions do not permit the export of animals.

title: Accidents on the rise this festive season
content: In addition to firecracker related incidents, doctors have observed a rise in motor accidents, domestic accidents and accidents involving alcohol consumption, during this festive season, hospital sources said.

title: Trinity and St. Joseph’s declared joint champions
content: St. Joseph’s and Trinity were declared joint champions of the Under-19 Division One Tier ‘A’ two-day inter-schools cricket tournament after the final, which was played at the Ace Capital CC ground in Narahenpita, ended in a draw today.

title: Measures to solve issues faced by pavement hawkers in upcoming festive season
content: An environment will be created for the pavement hawkers to engage in their businesses in a manner that would not obstruct the pedestrians during the upcoming Sinhala and Tamil New Year celebrations,  Senior Advisor to the President on National Security and Chief of Staff of the President Sagala Ratnayake said.

title: Private sector commits Rs.525mn to maintain operations of Suwa Seriya
content: As the 1990 Suwa Seriya ambulance service has run into a Rs.1.5 billion shortfall in funds this year, a number of leading corporates have stepped up to fill the void by committing Rs.525 million up to now, to maintain the operations of the critical service uninterpreted.

title: Fuel quota inceased for New Year festive season
content: The existing fuel quota has been increased for the New Year festive season and will come into effect from midnight today, said the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: ‘Nekath Seettuwa’, the auspicious times for New Year presented to President
content: Following customs and traditions, the ‘Nekath Seettuwa’, the table of auspicious times for this year’s Sinhala and Tamil New Year, was presented to President Ranil Wickremesinghe by Minister of Buddha Sasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs Vidura Wickremanayaka and the Department of Cultural Affairs at the Presidential Secretariat, a statement from the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Kanchana wants CID probe into those who disrupted fuel distribution
content: Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara has requested the Inspector General of Police to conduct an investigation through the CID into the incidents where some CPC and CPSTL employees disrupted the fuel distribution at the Kolonnawa terminal on March 28.

title: January credit card balance slips as cardholders turn cautious on spending
content: The credit card balance, a distant proxy for consumer spending, bucked the recent trend to show a decline in January, reflecting some pullback in spending amid higher interest rates and inflation.

title: Rashid overtakes Wanindu to become new No. 1 bowler in ICC T20I Rankings
content: Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan has pipped Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga to go top of the ICC T20 International (T20I) rankings for bowlers. Rashid, who recently led Afghanistan to a historic 2-1 series win over Pakistan in Sharjah, finished the tournament with three wickets at an economy rate of 5.16.

title: Kanchana threatens legal action against employees
content: Legal action would be taken against the CPC trade union activist or employees who were disrupting the distribution of fuel, disrupting the work of other employees or were acting in violation of the essential services orders, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said.

title: Do not buy cakes baked using imported Indian eggs: Canteen Owners
content: All Island Canteen Owners’ Association (AICOA) today advised people not to buy cakes during the new year season which are baked using eggs imported from India.

title: Kaushalya Navaratne, the new BASL President
content: Senior Attorney Kaushalya Navaratne assumed duties as the 27th President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL).

title: Royal make early breakthroughs in Mustangs Trophy
content: Royal College took early control of the 46th Mustangs Trophy limited overs match restricting S. Thomas College to 55 for 3 in 15 overs.

title: SL to introduce property tax and gift and inheritance tax
content: Sri Lanka is expected to introduce a property tax and a gift and inheritance tax by the beginning of 2025, under the International Monetary Fund programme.

title: Wet zone hill country leopard population is increasing
content: The population of wet zone hill country leopards (Panthera Pardus Kotiya) has been increasing in large proportions, environmentalists say.

title: Fuel prices, electricity tariff can be lowered now: Champika
content: Prices of fuel and tariff on electricity could be reduced by a considerable proportion now as the rupee has gained against the US Dollar, Parliamentarian Patali Champika Ranawaka said.

title: Thomians hold fort after lunch with Royal 4 wickets away
content: Royal College were four wickets away from  from victory in the 144th Battle of the Blues encounter with S. Thomas’ College laying down the anchor post-lunch in their attempts to battle through the final two sessions.

title: Chewing betels with arecanut: majority of population suffers from oral cancer
content: At least 50% of the population is estimated to be suffering from some form of mouth disease, Deputy Director General Dental Services Dr. Ananda Jayalal said.

title: S. Thomas’ win the toss, opt to field
content: S. Thomas’ College captain Romesh Mendis won the toss and opted to field in the 144th Royal-Thomian encounter that began at the SSC Grounds a short while ago.

title: Continuous strikes in SL are plotted by international forces: Vajira
content: NPP member K. D. Lalkantha has understood the reality and is correct in opposing continuous strikes, Presidential Advisor and UNP MP Vajira Abeywardene said today.

title: Police action on protesters: Tiran fails to appear before HRCSL
content: Public Security Minister Tiran Alles, who was asked to appear before the Sri Lanka Human Rights Commission (HRCSL) today, over the actions of the Police and Security Forces to control the recent protests, has denied to appear before the Commission.

title: Transport Ministry to register assembled motorcycles with higher engine capacity
content: The Transport Ministry has decided to register unregistered motorcycles with high engine capacity under a legal framework.

title: March first week tourist arrivals cross 30,000 mark
content: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka crossed the 30,000 mark during the first eight days of March, bringing the cumulative arrivals for the year to-date to 241,270.

title: Rupee likely to lose fifth of its value by end of this year, says Fitch
content: The Sri Lankan rupee, which gained briskly in the last couple of weeks over the hopes of the island nation securing a deal with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), may resume declines by the end of 2023 and is likely to lose a fifth of its value, according to Fitch Solutions.

title: IUSF protest begins causing traffic jam
content: Several roads in the Town Hall area near the Nelum Pokuna Theatre and Independence Square reported heavy traffic due to a protest march by the Inter University Students Federation (IUSF) against the incumbent government, the police said.

title: Foreign Ministry under pressure for appointments to politicos’ relatives
content: The Foreign Ministry is once again under pressure for the appointment of various ruling party politicians’ relatives to diplomatic posts, Daily Mirror learns.

title: CB to do away with forex trading band, mandatory sell down rule
content: As the liquidity in the foreign exchange market is improving steadily, the Central Bank said it would fully lift the trading band introduced in last May along with the complete removal of the foreign currency sell-down rule imposed on exporters from next week onwards.

title: Rupee continues to strengthen due to sound economic decisions taken by govt.: Siyambalapitiya
content: As a result of sound economic decisions taken by the government, the rupee is continuing to strengthen, Finance State Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said.

title: government expects rice prices to fall following SSCL removal
content: The government expects a considerable fall in rice prices following the removal of the Social Security Contribution Levy (SSCL) imposed on the purchasing of paddy, production of rice and marketing.

title: HRCSL orders IGP to submit report on firing tear gas on NPP protest
content: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has directed the IGP to submit a full report within 24 hours regarding the incident of firing tear gas and water cannon at a protest march organised by the National People’s Power  (NPP).

title: ’’Height of absurdity’’ to claim no election declared: Sumanthiran
content: It is the height of absurdity of the President to claim that the Local Government election has not been officially declared after all legal steps have been taken and nominations filed for the March 9 elections, TNA MP M. A. Sumanthiran PC said today.

title: Sri Lanka again abstains from UN vote on Russian invasion
content: Sri Lanka has once again on Thursday abstained from voting on a resolution against Russia at the UN General Assembly, where the General Assembly voted overwhelmingly to call for a cessation of hostilities in Ukraine and for Russia to withdraw its forces immediately.

title: BoI to sign Mannar, Pooneryn Wind Projects with India’s Adani today
content: The Board of Investment (BOI) will issue a letter of approval to India’s Adani Group to construct a 250 Mega Watt and 100 Mega Watt wind projects in Mannar and Pooneryn today evening, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Parliament can be dissolved any time now
content: Sri Lanka can go for a general election anytime now as the present Parliament has completed two and a half years of its term as of midnight on Monday.

title: After electricity charges, water tariffs bound to rise: Minister
content: As the electricity charges have been increased, the water charges will have to be increased in accordance, a Minister said.

title: Three teens drown in sea off Matara
content: Three students who were bathing in the sea off Wellamadama in Matara this afternoon, had gone missing, police said.

title: Robbed millions from Russian tourists at Unawatuna tourist hotel: Police hunts for another suspect
content: The Unawatuna Tourist Police are still investigating to apprehend a suspect who is evading arrest over stealing foreign currency valued more than Rs. 6 million from a group of Russian tourists who were lodging at the Watergate Hotel in Unwatuna.

title: SLC election battle begins; announcement for nominations likely this week
content: Calling for nominations for the election of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) members for the 2023-2025 period may commence this week, it is learnt.

title: Suspect who stole magistrate’s car arrested
content: The suspect who stole the luxury car belonging to the Kuliyapitiya Additional District Judge Amila Sampath Ariyasena was arrested at Oliamulla in Wattala, police said.

title: Woman who was issued 46 warrants arrested in Kadawatha
content: A 39-year-old woman wanted over financial fraud of more than Rs. 20 million  had been arrested by the Mirihana Division Crimes Investigation Unit during a raid in Kadawatha today.

title: Contempt of Court application by HRCSL against CEB Chairman dismissed by SC
content: A contempt of court application filed by the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) against Chairman of the Ceylon Electricity Board, the Secretary to the Ministry of Power and Energy and the Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation for their failure to comply with the settlement to provide uninterrupted electricity for A/L students during the exam period was today dismissed by Supreme Court.

title: Intervene to lower price of wheat flour: Canteen Owners
content: The All Island Canteen Owners’ Association (AICOA) has placed a demand that the responsible authorities must intervene immediately to stop the flour mafia and lower the wheat flour price to the extent that the people could bear it.

title: ALFEASL says don’t fall prey to fake job scams and lose money
content: Referring to the recent incident of hundreds of people rushing to Colombo for a bogus foreign employment opportunity in Turkey, the Association of Licensed Foreign Employment Agencies Sri Lanka (ALFEASL) warned the public not to fall prey to such scams in the future.

title: Elections Chief requests Rs. 770 mn for basic activities of LG Polls
content: The Finance Ministry is yet to respond to the request by Chairman of the National Election Commission Nimal G. Punchihewa to provide an amount of Rs. 770 million for the activities related to the local government (LG) polls.

title: 41 taken in Panadura FB party; female partygoer claims she was sexually harassed
content: Some 41 persons including 10 women have been arrested during a raid on a party organised through Facebook at a hotel in Horetuduwa, Panadura yesterday

title: Biden wishes Sri Lanka for Independence
content: US President Joe Biden has conveyed his best wishes to President Ranil Wickremesinghe and the people of Sri Lanka for the 75th Anniversary of Independence, President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Two Ukrainian sailors die in SL waters
content: The Galle Police launched investigations after two Ukrainian sailors who were working on a cargo ship from Egypt to India had died in Sri Lankan waters.

title: 2022 (2023) O/L applications can be submitted online only from Feb. 1 to 28: Exam Dept.
content: The Examination Department announced today that it had decided to call applications for the 2022 (2023) GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) examination, which will be conducted only online.

title: Boy playing hide-and-seek found in another country six days later
content: A 15-year-old boy accidentally locked himself inside a shipping container in Bangladesh during a game of hide-and-seek — and was discovered a week later in another country.

title: 285 suspects nabbed with narcotics during special operation
content: Around 285 suspects including drug traffickers have been arrested during a special seven-hour joint operation carried out today.

title: Don’t remove forces from Buddhist religious places: Prelates tell Prez
content: The Mahanayake Theras of all three Chapters said they had requested President Ranil Wickremesinghe not to remove security personnel assigned for the development and security of Buddhist religious places with historical importance in the north, east and other areas in the country.

title: Court issues order preventing IRD collecting APIT from judges
content: The Court of Appeal has issued an interim order preventing the Inland Revenue Department from collecting Advance Personal Income Tax (APIT)  from judges.

title: Indian diamond heiress’ Eight-year-old daughter becomes a nun
content: Eight-year-old Devanshi Sanghvi, the daughter of a wealthy Indian diamond merchant renounced the world and became a nun, the BBC reported.

title: Air navigation fees for international flights to be revised from Feb.1
content: Cabinet of Ministers approved a proposal today to revise air navigation fees for international flights flying over the Colombo Flight Information Region, effective from February 1.

title: 81 bird species ’’threatened’’ in Sri Lanka due to human activities
content: A total of 81 bird species in the country had been listed as ‘threatened’ due to human activities, Environment Ministry’s Biodiversity Secretariat Director Mrs R.H.M.P. Abeykoon said.

title: SC will decide on conducting LG polls: Minister
content: Claiming that the Treasury Secretary submitted an affidavit to the Supreme Court detailing the cash flow management of the government, State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said yesterday it was up to the Supreme Court to take a decision on conducting the Local Government election.

title: Serious repercussions inevitable if LG polls put off: AKD
content: If the government attempts to postpone the Local Government election, it would stir serious repercussions just as what happened in the past, National People’s Power (NPP) MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Power cut schedule until Friday issued
content: The power cut schedule for tomorrow (19) and Wednesday (20) for two hour and twenty minutes was announced today, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) said.

title: Ministers in the dark over possible massage laws? Keheliya quick to blame media
content: A day after the Ayurveda Department said that new laws would soon be drafted and presented to cabinet to prevent men from massaging women and women from massaging men in spas, two Ministers reacted in Parliament today saying no such laws had been drafted.

title: Cabinet nod for President’s proposal to provide 10kg rice to 2mn low-income families
content: The Cabinet paper presented by President Ranil Wickremesinghe for the provision of 10kg of rice per month for two million low- income families, including Samurdhi beneficiaries for a period of two months, has been approved, the President Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Private sector credit crash continues to sixth straight month as economy teeters
content: Sri Lanka’s private credit fell again in November for the sixth consecutive month, reflecting the deepening contraction seen....

title: Lotus Tower defaced, several arrested
content: The management of the Lotus Tower urged the public to help preserve the iconic structure by treating it as a national treasure.

title: Adarsha Karandana granted bail for alleged sextortion charges
content: Adarsha Karandana arrested for allegedly blackmailing former Parliamentarian Prof. Ashu Marasinghe after threatening to post sexually-explicit videos on websites was ordered to be released on bail by Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: 42 train services cancelled from tomorrow until further notice
content: Due to the absence of train-running staff, the Railway Department has decided to cancel 42 train services, including office trains and passenger services from tomorrow until further notice.

title: Special laws to protect plantation workers’ rights
content: Labour and Foreign Employment Minister is planning to introduce special laws to protect plantation workers’ rights.

title: Deeply concerned about recent violence in Brasilia: Prez
content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe said he was deeply concerned about the recent violence that erupted in Brasilia.

title: Poultry farmers to supply eggs to LRH free of charge
content: Steps are being taken to supply eggs free of charge to Lady Ridgeway Children’s Hospital for 10 days, All Ceylon Egg Producers Association said.

title: Sri Lanka win thriller in Pune, level T20I series at 1-1
content: Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel’s valiant effort went in vain as Sri Lanka defeated India by 16 runs in the second T20I in Pune.

title: Sureties to be charged for failure to produce Kanjipani Imran in court
content: Three sureties who failed to produce alleged underworld kingpin Kanjipani Imran at court in respect of an ongoing magisterial inquiry were today noticed to appear before court by Colombo Chief Magistrate’s court.

title: Cabinet ministers give consent to import eggs
content: The cabinet ministers had agreed to import eggs to control the local market price.Trade Minister Nalin Fernando has submitted the proposal to the cabinet meeting this evening.

title: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI dies at age 95
content: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, a leading theologian of the 20th century and the first pope to resign from office in nearly 600 years, has died at the age of 95, the Vatican announced.

title: Over Rs.3.5bn paid during past three months: Minister
content: Over Rs. 3.5 billion have been paid as allowances and salaries for employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) during the past three months, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said today.

title: 151 rescued Lankan migrants return from Vietnam
content: At least 151 migrants among 300 Sri Lankans who were rescued on the high seas between the Philippines and Vietnam were brought into the country last night.

title: GR and wife leave for USA
content: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and four of his family members left for the United States this morning, airport sources said.

title: State agencies acting like Ukraine and Russia: Prez warns
content: Public service is not a tug of war, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said at the Nuwara Eliya District committee meeting where several government officials failed to reach an agreement on several key issues in the area.

title: No term tests for primary sections starting in March: Minister
content: The Education Ministry has decided not to have term tests for primary sections, which are scheduled to start their school year in March, Education Minister Susil Premajayantha said.

title: Grade 5 exam results will be released within next two months: Exam. Dept.
content: The results of the recently conducted the grade five scholorship examination for 2022 are to be released within the next two months, Examinations Department Commissioner General L.M.D. Dharmasena said.

title: Construction sector suffers worst  contraction in 3Q
content: The slump in construction sector activities deepened in the third quarter of 2022, declining for the fifth quarter in a row, according to the Gross....

title: Alleged kidney racket: Western Hospital files writ petition against health authorities
content: While denying any involvement with organ trafficking or the smuggling of organs, the Western Infirmary Hospital has filed a writ petition in Court of Appeal challenging the Health Ministry’s decision to temporarily suspend organ transplantation surgeries at the hospital.

title: Retirement age for medical officers revised; Gazette issued
content: The age limit of retirement for medical Consultants Doctors, Government Medical Officers, Dental Surgeons, and Registered Medical Officers have been revised through an extraordinary Gazette Notification.

title: Committee probing SLC affairs quiz Pastor Jerome Fernando
content: The committee appointed to investigate incidents involving the Sri Lankan cricket team during the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia has recorded a statement from controversial Sri Lankan preacher and self proclaimed Prophet, Pastor Jerome Fernando for more than two hours.

title: Dasun Shanaka fined USD 3,000 for showing dissent to on-field umpire
content: The captain of the Dambulla Aura, Dasun Shanaka, has been fined for showing dissent to the on-field umpire during a LPL game played between the Dambulla Aura and Colombo Stars on December 8 at MRICS, Hambantota.

title: Influence of 'Mandous' storm to gradually reduce: Met. Dept.
content: The influence of the Cyclonic Storm “Mandous” over the island and the sea areas around the island will be gradually reduced,’’ the Meteorology Department said.

title: ’Mandous’ likely to move towards North TN, Puducherry, South AP coast tonight
content: The cyclonic storm nicknamed ’Mandous’ is very likely to move west-northwestwards and cross the coasts of Northern Tamil Nadu (TN), Puducherry, and South Andhra Pradesh around mid-night today, and the naval and fishing communities are still advised not to venture into the deep sea areas until further notice, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Private hospital exposed over alleged kidney racket responds
content: Western Hospital, the private hospital at No. 218 Cotta Road, Borella which was exposed in connection with the alleged kidney racket has denied any involvement with organ trafficking or the smuggling of organs.

title: Soldier dies after army tank hits him during training
content: The Mankulam police launched an investigation after a soldier who was engaged in a training exercise in Kokavil in Mankulam had died after being hit by an army tank used for the training..

title: Lankan charged after mother-of-three stabbed to death in Melbourne
content: A Sri Lankan has been charged for stabbing his wife, a mother-of-three, to death in her home at Sandhurst in Melbourne’s south-east.

title: SJB MPs most undisciplined group in parliament: Speaker
content: Time management and discipline of MPs were questioned today by Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardene saying that Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MPs are the most undisciplined lot in the House.

title: Kelani Valley railway time table to be amended from Dec. 5
content: There will be an amendment to the train timetable of the Kelani Valley railway line as of December 5, Railways Deputy General Manager (DGM) Gamini Seneviratne said.

title: Third secretary of SL Embassy in Oman remanded over human trafficking case
content: The third secretary of Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, E. Kushan who was arrested this morning over the human trafficking of women to Oman, has been remanded until December 13 by Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Demerit point system for drivers from January next year: State Minister
content: Steps were being taken to implement the demerit point system for the driving license from January next year, State Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna said today.

title: World Cup hosts Qatar eliminated after defeat
content: Hosts Qatar have been eliminated just two games into the World Cup after a 3-1 defeat to Senegal at Al Thumama Stadium.

title: Bhanuka asks to be released from SL squad for Aghanistan ODIs
content: Batsman Bhanuka Rajapaksa has been released from Sri Lanka’s squad for the three-match ODI series against Afghanistan, upon a request made by the player.

title: Former CWC Leader Muthu Sivalingam no more
content: Former Leader of the Ceylon Workers’ Congress (CWC) Muthu Sivalingam passed away at the age of 79 today.

title: NASA’s Orion spacecraft flies by the moon, 81 miles above the surface
content: Five days after launching from the Kennedy Space Center, NASA’s Orion spacecraft reached the moon Monday, passing within 81 miles of the lunar surface and marking the completion of a key step in the space agency’s Artemis campaign to return astronauts there within a few years.

title: Tax experts say revenue estimates in Budget 2023 overly optimistic
content: Accounting and tax experts expressed skepticism over the overly optimistic tax revenue estimates in Budget 2023 amid a shrinking....

title: FIFA tickets in Qatar most expensive in history: Keller Sports
content: As football fans across the world are heading towards Doha, Qatar, for 2022 FIFA World Cup this weekend, they will be paying the highest price ever for the tickets, a study reveals.

title: Lawyer Nuwan Bopage granted bail in Galle Face protest case
content: Attorney-at-Law Nuwan Bopage who became an active participant in the “GotaGoGama” protest was today ordered to be released on bail after being surrendered before Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: October tea exports decline 22%
content: Ceylon Tea exports for the month of October totalled 19 MnKgs, a dip of 5.34 MnKgs when compared with the corresponding month of the previous year, which is a 22 percent year-on-year (YoY) decline.

title: President pledges to introduce new economic order to suit new world order
content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe today pledged to introduce a new economic order to suit the new world order and highlighted that Sri Lanka will embark on this new path through the 2023 budget.

title: Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara questioned by CID
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) today recorded a statement from Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera for nearly three hours, over the investigations into alleged mega financial fraud committed by Thilini Priyamali, police sources said.

title: Dollar- starved govt pays US $ 10mn demurrage for fuel shipments
content: The dollar-starved government paid as much as US $ 10 million as demurrage during the last six months for shipments of fuel, Daily Mirror learns .

title: CWIT construction project in Colombo Port kicked off today
content: The construction work of the newly built Colombo West International Terminal (CWIT) within the Colombo Port was initiated today.

title: Probe over police torturing school children in Hungamuwa: Susil
content: Investigations are underway following the incident where policemen are alleged to have used electricity on a group of school children in Hungamuwa after a wallet belonging to a teacher went missing, Minister of Education Susil Premajaynatha told Parliament today.

title: Danushka Gunathilaka scandal; Why did SLC keep such a player?
content: Sri Lankan citizens woke to shocking news last morning of a national cricketer facing allegations of sexual assault in Australia during the T20 World Cup.

title: Powercut for long weekend announced
content: The power cut schedule for the long week end was issued today, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) said.

title: Bangladesh accuse Kohli of ’fake fielding’ during tense India victory
content: Following Bangladesh’s five-run loss to India on Wednesday, Nurul Hasan has claimed that the on-field umpires had missed an incident of ’’fake fielding’’ from Virat Kohli, which could have resulted in five potentially crucial penalty runs for Bangladesh.

title: 12 top political parties, 20 leading TUs, over 150 organisations to participate
content: Twelve top political parties, 20 leading trade unions and over 150 organisations will join the peaceful protest march against what they call a state repression, which is scheduled to commence from the Elphinstone Theater in Maradana, at 2.00pm this afternoon.

title: Colombo inflation rate eases to 66% in October
content: Inflation in the Colombo district made an about turn in October, bringing an end to the current spell of runaway inflation, which set off more than a year ago when the global commodities prices started rising, caused by the surge in demand amid the supply chain bottlenecks and emergence of foreign currency shortages in the domestic market.

title: At least 149 killed in Seoul Halloween crowd surge
content: South Korea’s first big Halloween celebration since the end of Covid restrictions turned to tragedy on Saturday night, when at least 149 people, mostly teenagers and young adults, died as partygoers surged through a narrow alley in a popular nightlife district in Seoul, officials said.

title: New fraud hits Sri Lankans by storm, over 8,000 people lose billions
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) has launched an investigation into a new financial fraud which so far has involved Rs.14 billion with 8,000 people being victims in a fake crypto currency scheme.

title: Sri Lanka growing in belief despite defeat, says coach Silverwood
content: Sri Lanka coach Chris Silverwood says his team have what it takes to emerge from a tough group at the Twenty20 World Cup despite their loss to holders Australia.

title: Raids to detect low-weight bread will only yield futile results: Bakery Owners
content: Without providing solutions to the bakery industry, it is absurd conducting raids to detect low-weight bread, All Ceylon Bakery Owners’ Association (ACBOA) President N.K. Jayawardena said.

title: Water level of Gin Ganga rising: Possible floods in Galle
content: Galle district is facing a fresh flood threat as several areas in the district had received a rainfall more than 200mm, Department of Meteorology said.

title: Central Bank estimates further ease in imports as tighter policies take root
content: The Central Bank estimated a further decline in imports in September narrowing the trade deficit from the prior month in a clear sign that the policies instituted since April onwards are making the intended adjustments in the country’s external sector which fell into a deep crisis early this year pushing the entire economy off a cliff.

title: Govt. to reopen Paranthan chemical factory soon
content: The government is to commence operations at the chemical factory in Paranthan immediately, Plantation Industries and Industries Minister Ramesh Pathirana said.

title: Over 100mm rain forecast today: Met. Dept.
content: Heavy rains exceeding 100 mm could be expected today at some places in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Puttalam, Mannar, Kilinochchi and Jaffna districts, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Three die, two injured in car crash
content: At least three people were killed and two others injured when a car veered off the road and crashed into a tree at Ridibendiella on the Anuradhapura-Padeniya Road this morning, Police said.

title: 44 injured in bus, tipper collision on A9
content: At least 44 people were hospitalised after a private bus running from Kilinochchi to Jaffna collided with a tipper truck on the A-9 Road in Muhamalai, Palei today.

title: Do not wear excessive gold when arriving from overseas: Fin. Ministry
content: State Finance Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said that immediate action will be taken to enforce the law against people who come to Sri Lanka from abroad wearing gold jewellery for smuggling purpose, exceeding the limits.

title: Over 100mm rain forecast today: Met. Dept.
content: Heavy rains exceeding 100 mm could be expected today in Western, Central, North-Western, and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts, the Meteorology Department said.

title: “I received deaths threats for speaking for Wasantha Mudalige”: Vedda Chief
content: Vedda Chief Uruwarige Wannilaththo yesterday claimed that he had received death threats for speaking in support of detained IUSF Convener Wasantha Mudalige and said he had a right to speak for Mudalige as he was part of their community.

title: Economic crisis hits the sex industry - charges of women and men go up
content: Amidst a severe economic crunch which has left people across the country facing severe hardships, one of the sector’s which has also suffered a severe blow is prostitution.

title: Buwaneka Aluwihare takes oath as Acting CJ
content: Supreme Court Justice Buwaneka Pandukabaya Aluwihare PC took oath as the Acting Chief Justice before President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Condé Nast Traveller ranks SL in top 20 list of countries to travel in 2022
content: Sri Lanka has made it to the top 20 list of the Readers’ Choice Awards 2022 by Condé Nast Traveller.

title: Lanka poised to become winter escape for European tourists
content: With an increasing number of Europeans looking to avoid an expensive winter, due to the skyrocketing energy prices, Sri Lanka’s tourism industry is positioned to grow exponentially in the upcoming winter season, supported by the devalued rupee and recent relaxation of travel advisories, according to the latest report by First Capital Research (FCR).

title: Trio arrested over leaking naked video of school girl
content: Three young men who released naked video scenes of a 17-year-old schoolgirl on social media were arrested by the Monaragala police.

title: LITRO to lower prices of gas again after Oct.5
content: LITRO Gas Lanka Ltd has decided to reduce the selling price of the domestic gas cylinder from October 5, LITRO Lanka Chairman Muditha Peiris said.

title: Third coal power plant in Norochcholai fixed, operates in full capacity: Minister
content: The third coal power plant in Norochcholai has been fixed and connected back to the national grid, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.

title: Privately-owned renewable energy industry facing total collapse
content: Amid ill-slighted policy decisions, Sri Lanka’s privately-owned renewable energy Industry is seeing a total collapse within the next few months, as it is set to face increased losses from state-owned Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), clearing the way for another electricity tariff hike.

title: 2hr 30min power cut approved for tomorrow
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today approved the two hour and 20 minutes power cut for tomorrow (29).

title: FM to launch e-channeling appointment system
content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in collaboration with SLT Mobitel will launch an e-channeling appointment system with effect from 29 September, 2022.

title: President leaves for Japan and Philippines
content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe left the island early this morning on an official tour to Japan & Philippines, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Growing stock of decent jobs must be an important development priority for SL
content: One of Sri Lanka’s most important development priorities must be to grow its stock of decent jobs and ensure inclusive access to them, particularly by women and young people, the International Labour Organisation (ILO) said.

title: Report on student consuming coconut kernel for lunch unfounded-PMD
content: The reported incident of a student consuming coconut kernel for lunch due to poverty, was found to be unfounded, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Only three officials join President’s delegation to UK
content: Three officials, including the President’s doctor, joined the official delegation along with President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the funeral ceremony of Queen Elizabeth II held at Westminster Abbey in Britain, the President’s Media Division (PMD) clarified.

title: Prices of confectionary items to come down with immediate effect
content: After several weeks of paying exorbitant prices to procure what used to be affordable snacks, consumers will witness a drop in the prices of confectionary products across all product categories.

title: Tsunami alert issued after major quake strikes off Taiwan
content: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck Taiwan’s southeastern coast on Sunday prompting tsunami warnings, with at least one building collapse and train cars derailed.

title: More ministers to cabinet soon - Govt. aims to go back to jumbo cabinet
content: A few more Cabinet ministers are expected to be sworn in shortly, a Minister said.

title: RTI Commission warns to notice IGP if police fail to provide correct information
content: The Right to Information Commission (RTI), which heard an appeal made by journalists requesting information related to expiry dates of the tear gas canisters used by the police in recent protests, yesterday warned to notice Police Chief, if the latter does not provide correct data within ten days.

title: Decline in employment as firms cut staff, impose hiring freezes
content: Sri Lanka’s manufacturing and services sectors are already seeing widespread layoffs, non-renewal of employment contracts....

title: Cricket and Netball Asian Champs to be paraded from BIA to Colombo
content: The national cricket and netball teams who emerged Asian champions will be welcomed in a rousing reception at the Bandaranaike International Airport tomorrow morning, the President’s Media Division said.

title: 85 illegal migrants, trawler netted by Navy off Batticaloa
content: Sri Lanka Navy took into custody a local multiday fishing trawler carrying 85 individuals, suspected to be illegal migrants attempting to flee the country via sea, navy sources said.

title: Major tea export company in SL has been evading taxes: Govt. MP reveals
content: A major tea export company in Sri Lanka has been evading taxes worth US dollars 300 million every year, a government MP told Parliament yesterday.

title: Circular ready to allow checking school bags to prevent drugs brought to schools: Edu. Minister
content: A circular will be issued by next week to check the bags of schoolchildren in the morning to prevent drugs are brought into schools, Education Minister Susil Premajayantha said.

title: Govt. installs new system to identify those who deserve welfare benefits
content: The government has deployed a new welfare benefit information system from next year onwards to provide better targeted social welfare benefits by way of direct cash transfers to the vulnerable groups in society.

title: Selfie craze claims another life; youth falls from waterfall
content: A young man fell into a waterfall at Udaveriya Estate in ​​Haldummulla while taking a selfie yesterday.

title: No changes to fuel prices
content: There will be no changes to the fuel prices tonight, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera today said.

title: Rainfall in hydro catchment areas still inadequate: Irrigation Dept.
content: Although heavy rainfall has been experienced in the country since last evening, the hydro catchment areas have not received significant rainfall, Irrigation (Hydrology) Director S.P.C. Sugeeshwara said.

title: Price of bread could rise to Rs.300? - Assn.
content: The Price of a 450g loaf of bread has to be sold at Rs. 300 in the coming days, if the price of a bag of wheat flour does not come down and the shortage is not resolved, according to the All Ceylon Bakery Owners’ Association (ACBOA).

title: India responds to Chinese Ambassador’s remarks on SL
content: Responding to recent remarks of Chinese Ambassador on Sri Lanka, Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka said Sri Lanka needs support, not unwanted pressure or unnecessary controversies to serve another country’s agenda.

title: SJB ready to appoint Ranjan to Parliamemnt if vacancy exists in National List: Sajith
content: Samagi Jana Balawegaya is ready to appoint former MP Ranjan Ramanayake to Parliament in the first instance of a vacancy falls in the national list, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said.

title: Tourist arrivals top 30,000 in first three weeks of August
content: The tourist arrivals to the country for the first three weeks of August have crossed the 30,000 mark.

title: Four cops arrested for robbing youth
content: Four policemen attached to Malabe police post were arrested today by the Kottawa police on suspicion of their involvement in a robbery at Vidyala junction in Kottawa.

title: Central Bank recommends Finance Ministry to ban all open account imports
content: The Central Bank (CB) has requested the Finance Ministry to completely ban imports under open account payment terms while stressing that the banking sector has sufficient foreign exchange to finance essential imports.

title: Three-hour power cut during weekend
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has approved 3-hour power cuts for August 20 and 21.

title: Man with drugs, money worth Rs. 10Mn nabbed in Kotahena
content: The STF has arrested a suspect in possession of 670g of ice and more than Rs. 1.45 million in cash during a raid in Kotahena last night.

title: Authorities remain to be vigilant on delisted persons & entities - SL
content: While claiming that 316 individuals and 06 organizations have been delisted since they are no longer continue to fund terrorist activities, the government today said that relevant authorities remain to be vigilant on the activities of the delisted individuals and organizations.

title: Fuel price revision likely today
content: A fuel price revision for the second quarter of this month will be made today, the power and energy ministry announced earlier.

title: Those who  could not work in Y’palana Govt with Ranil as PM, now trying to secure positions - MP Dayasiri
content: Those who castigated Ranil Wickremesinghe and deserted the SLFP saying that they could not serve in the yahapalana government with Ranil as the Prime Minister now are in an intense battle to secure positions under President Wickre

title: Vehicle registrations, issuing revenue licence on weekdays
content: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has decided to provide their service during weekdays in the Western Province (WP) soon after restoring the fuel crisis to some extent.

title: Legal action against those who obtain fuel fraudulently using QR codes
content: Technical background to minimise incidents relating to fraudulently obtaining fuel under the quota system by stealing QR codes of other people is underway, Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) Director Dasun Hegoda said.

title: China asks India to ’’stop disturbing’’ its exchange with SL
content: Riled by Sri Lanka’s request to defer the planned docking of a high-tech Chinese research vessel at the strategic Hambantota Port, China on Monday took a dig at India, saying it was ’’senseless to pressure’’ Colombo by citing the issue of security concerns.

title: President amends emergency regulations
content: Through an extraordinary gazette, President Ranil Wickremesinghe has amended several emergency regulations.

title: Stolen number plates of motorbikes used in recent murders: Police
content: Police warned people not to park their motorbikes insecurely as there is a tendency of stealing number plates by the organised criminals.

title: Govt. told to use household electricity consumption to determine welfare eligibility
content: The leading economists of the Verite Research Sri Lanka Economic Policy Group (SLEPG) called on the relevant authorities to steer away from using Samurdhi as a determinant of eligibility for welfare benefits and instead, consider electricity consumption for targeting vulnerable groups, as it is a superior method.

title: Do not enter Expressway without sufficient fuel to reach destination
content: The Expressway Operation Maintenance and Management Division has issued a special notice for all motorists who use the expressway amid the ongoing fuel crisis.

title: YouTuber Ratta arrested
content: YouTuber and social media activist Rathindu Senaratne, also known as Ratta has been arrested by the Colombo South Divisional Crime Detective Bureau (DCDB) this evening, Police Spokesman SSP Nihal Thalduwa said.

title: Couple wanted over murder arrested while trying to flee to Dubai
content: A couple who wanted over a murder in the Mount Lavinia area had been arrested by the police at the Katunayake airport when they tried to flee to Dubai last night.

title: New Omicron sub-variant most contagious, immune-evasive: Medical expert warns
content: Medical expert warned people to obtain the booster dose of the Covid vaccine, mask up at least indoors and get tested if anyone is symptomatic as world is experiencing one of the largest COVID waves of the pandemic fueled by the Omicron BA.5 sub-variant.

title: COVID forces Ragama Railway station ticket counters shut
content: The ticket counters at the Ragama railway station were closed this morning after one of the station masters being infected with COVID after he was tested positive, the Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLRSMU) said.

title: Stop arrests, suppression of protesters: AKD urges Govt.
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today urged the government to stop arrests and suppression of Galle Face protesters.

title: Travel ban on Cabraal further extended till October 26
content: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s court today further extended its order preventing former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal from leaving the country until October 26.

title: CCC submits proposal to PUCSL for effective electricity tariff revision
content: In order to ensure the implementation of an effective tariff revision, which sustainably addresses Sri Lanka’s energy requirements, the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) submitted suggestions and recommendations on the proposed electricity tariffs to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) this week.

title: Previous cabinet to be sworn in tomorrow, Dinesh to be PM
content: The previous cabinet of ministers will be sworn in before President Ranil Wickremesinghe tomorrow morning and Dinesh Gunawardena will be sworn in as the new Prime Minister, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Gazette announcing election of eighth Executive President published
content: A gazette notification has been issued today (20) announcing Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe as the Eighth Executive President of the country.

title: Wimal, Gammanpila led group to vote for Dullas
content: MPs Wimal Weerawansa, Udaya Gammanpila and the independent group from the ruling party have decided to vote for MP Dullas Alahapperuma in the vote to  elect the President.

title: MPs receive threats ahead of Presidential vote
content: Many Parliamentarians, including those from the ruling parties, have complained they have received threats from individuals, saying they would face consequences if they vote for Ranil Wickremesinghe in Wednesday’s Presidential vote, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Possible recession in eurozone likely to worsen SL’s forex woes
content: Fitch Ratings this week warned that Sri Lanka’s export and tourism sectors are likely to take a hit from the possible recession in the eurozone and it could further exacerbate the country’s actuate foreign exchange shortage.

title: Armed forces empowered to use force to protect people, public property
content: The army said members of the Armed Forces and the Police have been empowered to enforce and maintain law and order of the country so as to protect the people, public property and the country at large at the expense of their own lives.

title: Party Leaders ask for RW to step down
content: Party leaders decided to request Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to resign forthwith and allow the Speaker to take charge of the country, PTA Leader Mano Ganesan said.

title: JVP urges PM to resign or Prez to remove him to avert his moves to become Act. Prez
content: Claiming that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was tactfully attempting to become the President going against the people’s demand, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today urged Prime Minister Wickremesibnghe to resign before President Gotabaya Rajapaksa submits his resignation, without putting the country into further unrest.

title: Fuel cargo scheduled to arrive on July 9 delayed; Minister
content: Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said payments were made to IOC for a Diesel Cargo to arrive 15-17 and a Petrol Cargo for 22-24.

title: EU calls on all parties to focus on a peaceful, democratic transition in SL
content: The European Union (EU) today called on all parties to cooperate and focus on a peaceful, democratic and orderly transition in Sri Lanka.

title: Who left on these two naval ships?
content: A video is being shared on social media showing a group of persons boarding into two naval ships of the Sri Lanka Navy anchored at the Colombo Port.

title: No pharmacies will function tomorrow: Pharmacy Owners’ Assn.
content: All the pharmacies across the country will be closed tomorrow, All-Island Private Pharmacy Owners’ Association (ACPPOA) said.

title: Boris Johnson resigns as British PM
content: Boris Johnson said on Thursday he was resigning as Britain’s prime minister, bowing to calls from ministerial colleagues and lawmakers in his Conservative Party.

title: Prices of medicines astronomically high; hard to find in local market: GMOA
content: The prices of medicine and medical equipment have increased three to four times in the local market, and it is very hard to find medicine and medical equipment due to the current economic crisis in the country, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Protest near PM's house demanding him to quit
content: A protest held this evening in front of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe’s Fifth Lane residence, demanding him to resign immediately if he cannot solve the country’s crisis.

title: Four fuel shipments to reach SL this month
content: Four fuel shipments including three diesel shipments are expected to arrive in Sri Lanka this month, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said.

title: Soldier mauled to death by wild elephant during training
content: A soldier was killed after being attacked by a wild elephant while an army team was engaged in a training exercise in Valamandiya forest area of ​​Aralagangwila yesterday.

title: Around 250 Kandakadu detainees arrested
content: Reports reached that 248 detainees at the Kandakadu Rehabilitation Centre  have been arrested, however search operations are underway to apprehend more than 200 more inmates who fled the Centre this morning, Police said.

title: CB to liquidate five failed finance companies
content: The Central Bank has decided to liquidate five failed finance companies including ETI Finance Limited, in accordance with applicable legal provisions, the bank announced today.

title: SL runs out of fuel and no new shipments ordered
content: Sri Lanka has run out of fuel as only 1,100 tonnes of petrol and 7,500 tonnes of diesel are remaining which is not even sufficient to last the country for a day, highly placed sources from the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) Trade Union told Daily Mirror last evening.

title: SriLankan Airlines airlifts critical medicine
content: SriLankan Cares, the corporate social responsibility arm of SriLankan Airlines took on the cause of airlifting internationally donated essential medicines and medical equipment to hospitals in Sri Lanka, free of freight charges.

title: Steve Hanke measures SL’ inflation at 130.14%/year
content: Economist Steve Hanke shared today that according to his accurate measure, Sri Lanka’s inflation stands at 130.14 percent.

title: Minimum monthly wage for private sector employees, estate workers to go up: Manusha
content: The minimum monthly wage of the employees of the private sector and estate workers would be increased, Labour and Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara said.

title: China-funded Lotus Tower stays idle in Colombo
content: The Colombo Lotus Tower, which was funded by China and was declared open in late 2019 by the then President Maithripala Sirisena, remains non-operational to-date in the heart of the Capital of Sri Lanka.

title: Pathum Nissanka century gives Sri Lanka 2-1 series lead vs Australia
content: Pathum Nissanka’s magnificent century powered Sri Lanka to a six-wicket win in the third ODI of the five-match series against Australia on Sunday at R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

title: COPA instructs to prepare 10-year Economic Development Plan
content: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has directed the Department of External Resources to prepare a specific 10-year Economic Development Plan aimed at the economic development of the country and to seek assistance from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for the same.

title: S. Korea to support SL to overcome current economic crisis
content: The South Korean Government will extend its fullest support to Sri Lanka in its efforts to overcome the current economic crisis, South Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka Jeong Woonjin has said.

title: CEB chairman drama will have dire consequences
content: The drama caused by the Former Chairman of Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) will result in dire consequences especially if the Indian Govt gets offended and refuses assistance to Sri Lanka, Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) Deputy Leader P. Digambaram said today.

title: US stands ready to work with Sri Lanka:  US Secretary of State
content: Secretary of State of the  United States Antony Blinken said the U.S. stands ready to work with Sri Lanka, in close coordination with the International Monetary Fund and the international community.

title: Daily Mirror journalist threatened at protest
content: Daily Mirror journalist Jamila Husain was threatened by a group of protestors at the protest in front of SLPP MP Dhammika Perera’s house today morning, obstructing the journalist from carrying out her duties.

title: PM’s speech referring BASL inaccurate: BASL
content: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) today announced that a statement made by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe in Parliament on Wednesday (8) referring to the BASL regarding a meeting with President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is inaccurate and not a true reflection of what took place.

title: Russia never offered to supply fuel at 35% discounted price: Minister
content: Russia has not made a proposal to provide fuel to Sri Lanka with a discount of 35% as claimed by opposition MPs, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said today.

title: CPC and LIOC deny rumours of another fuel price hike
content: LIOC and Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) denied last night the rumours that fuel prices were to be increased today.

title: Youth killed in shooting incident in Modara
content: A 25-year-old youth was killed in a shooting incident at Modara area this evening, Police said.

title: Power cut schedule from June 6 to 12 announced
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has approved the power cut schedule from June 6 to 12, PUCSL Chairman Janaka Rathnayake said.

title: Maintain adequate stocks of essential food: Prez instructs
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has instructed the relevant officials to take measures to maintain adequate stocks of all essential food items in order to ensure that there is no shortage of goods, President’s Media Division said.

title: Govt. relaxes import controls to support biz
content: The Finance Ministry yesterday implemented two key actions with regard to importation of goods, paving the way for businesses to have access to the required raw materials, so that operations can proceed with minimal hindrance.

title: Trinco Port to be devloped as industrial harbour
