content: Expressions of interest have been called from private investors to develop the Trincomalee Port as an industrial port, Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) Chairman Prasantha Jayamanne said today.

title: 10 including JVP former PS member arrested over May 9 violence
content: Ten persons including JVP former PS member Lakshman Palliyaguru have been arrested in connection with the violence on May 9.

title: New PM could bring about political stability in SL: U.S. Ambassador
content: The U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung expressed hope that the government, including the new Prime Minister, would be able to bring about political stability and overcome the current economic crisis.

title: Curtailing fuel distribution would lead to another hike, including kerosene: Ananda Palitha
content: While adopting limitation in issuing fuel continuously, there is room for suspicions that the government is making a clandestine attempt to increase the prices of fuel again within the next two weeks and to hike the price of kerosene to an unaffordable range, Samagi United Trade Union Force (SUTUF) convener and media spokesman Ananda Palitha said.

title: Over 50,000 litres of illegally hoarded fuel recovered
content: Police have arrested 137 individuals along with over 50,000 litres of illegally hoarded fuel including petrol during 429 raids carried out throughout the country recently.

title: WHO assures support to overcome medical crisis
content: World Health Organization (WHO) Representative to Sri Lanka, Dr. Alaka Singh called on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today (24) at the Prime Minister’s Office in Colombo and assured him of the organization’s full support to overcome Sri Lanka’s medical crisis.

title: IMF urged to bailout Sri Lanka
content: The President SAARC Chamber of Commerce and Industry Iftikhar Ali Malik on Sunday urged the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to work out on timely bail out package to put defaulting Sri Lanka, a financially crumbled country on track.

title: 10-hour water cut in Colombo today
content: A 10-hour water cut will be in place in several areas in Colombo today, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) said.

title: Don’t disconnect electricity supply during O/L exam: PUCSL chairman
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has taken steps not to disconnect electricity supply during the GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) examination is in progress and after 6.00 pm until the end of the exam.

title: ICUs, HDUs likely to close in hospitals: Health Professionals Fed.
content: Failure to receive essential blood gas analyzers required to maintain the Intensive Care Units (ICU) and High Dependency Units (HDU) in all hospitals, a severe crisis has arisen in which the units cannot be maintained, the Federation of Health Professionals (FHP) said.

title: SLPP MP Sanath Nishantha arrested
content: SLPP MP Sanath Nishanatha has been arrested by the CID over the attack on peaceful protesters at ’MainaGoGama’ outside Temple Trees and ’GotaGoGama’in Galle Face on May 9.

title: Ranil tries to woo MPs to his side: Rajitha
content: People will accept the cabinet if Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has an open discussion with political parties representing Parliament and forms it according to a proper agreement, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rajitha Senaratne said today.

title: Lets not fight over Deputy Speaker, elect a female MP - RW tells MPs
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has started discussions with political parties, requesting them not to fight over the Deputy Speaker position and to nominate a female MP whose selection will be unanimous to the post, the Prime Minister’s Office said.

title: We won’t lay our hands on ’GotaGoGama’: Ranil
content: Newly appointed Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said he had accepted his new post to save the nation from its present crisis.

title: Harin to sit independent and support new govt.
content: SJB MP, Harin Fernando has informed party leader Sajith Premadasa that he will sit independently in Parliament as Premadasa had failed to give a possible solution to solve the ongoing crisis in the country.

title: IMF says technical talks will continue as planned until new govt. is formed
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) today said it would continue technical level discussions with Sri Lanka to be prepared for policy discussions when a new government is formed.

title: GR accepts MR’s resignation, gazette notice issued
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has accepted the resignation of his brother Mahinda Rajapaksa as the Prime Minister and a gazette notification has been issued by the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa leaves the country
content: The second son and Chief of Staff of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his wife left the country in the early hours of today morning, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: SJB ready to support Interim Govt. based on proposals made by BASL
content: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya and Samagi Jana Sandanaya have drawn attention to the series of proposals put forward by the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) to resolve the current serious national crisis in the country and had decided to support an interim government based on the proposals made by Bar Association of Sri Lanka.

title: PMD refutes issuing statement on protesting public servants' salary cut
content: President’s Media Division today  refuted the notice circulating on Facebook that the May 2022 salaries of public servants participating in the Hartal campaign will be cut.

title: Suggestions by pharmacy owners to address drug scarcity
content: As a solution to the current medicine shortage in the country, the All-Island Private Pharmacy Owners’ Association (ACPPOA) has requested the government to implement three options, including recommending doctors and physicians to issue prescriptions only by generic name, but not trade name.

title: SLBG not to invite any politicians to TV programs if failed to find solution to economic crisis
content: Sri Lanka Broadcasters’ Guild (SLBG) today said that in order to solve the current economic crisis, a solution must be found through the Parliament system as soon as possible and if those politicians fail to find a solution, the Guild is to take a collective decision not to invite any politicians to their media channels for programs as a protest.

title: CB may relax forced Fx conversion rule as evidence shows opposite results
content: In a bid to restore normalcy in the domestic foreign exchange market and thereby enhance its liquidity, the Central Bank could relax the mandatory conversion requirement on foreign currency in place for merchandise exports and services.

title: CB to suspend forex payments outside banking system
content: The Central Bank yesterday announced a slew of measures in a bid to ride the current economic emergency, caused by the severe dearth in foreign currency in the domestic market, until any deal could be struck with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for a rescue package.

title: Five trains run during strike; evening trains doubtful: Railway Dept.
content: Five trains operated this morning during the ongoing 24-hour Railway Trade Union (TU) Action, Media Spokesman of Sri Lanka Railways A.D.G. Seneviratne said.

title: Don’t be deceived by political dramas: Sajith
content: One should not get deceived by the political dramas which aims to change Presidents and Prime Ministers, but should join the Samagi Jana Balawegaya’s (SJB) struggle to push the present government out of power, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Three youth arrested over sexually harassing German female Youtuber in Kandy
content: The Kandy Tourist Police have arrested three individuals for allegedly sexually harassing a popular German female Youtuber.

title: Police barricade several roads in Colombo due to protest march
content: Several roads towards the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo have been barricaded by the Police this morning due to a scheduled protest march by the Inter University Students Federation today.

title: Monk who launches fast unto to death at Galle Face Green admitted to CNH
content: Venerable Theripaha Siridhamma Thero who launched a fast unto death campaign at the Galle Face protest site was admitted to the Colombo National Hospital after falling ill, hospital sources said.

title: China providing emergency humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka
content: Xu Wei, spokesperson for the China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA), said yesterday that China has noted Sri Lanka’s economic difficulties and as a traditionally friendly and close neighbor, has decided to provide emergency humanitarian assistance to the country to help it cope with these difficulties.

title: GMOA advises people to adhere basic health guidelines to lower respiratory diseases
content: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) yesterday advised the public to continue with the practice of wearing face masks further, considering the deterioration of the health system and the unstable situation in the country.

title: 40 Independent MPs sit in opposition in Parliament
content: Forty MPs from SLFP and SLPP including former President Maithripala Sirisena, Wimal Weerawansa, Udaya Gammanpila and Vasudewa Nanayakkawa who have decided to function independently in Parliament today sat in the opposition.

title: Temporary stock market closure sparks debate
content: A debate has been sparked by the stock market watchdog Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) decision to close the market for five days starting from today at the request of the board of directors of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) and some stockbrokers.

title: Police Seargent who joined Galle Face Green protest granted bail
content: The Police officer who got vocal yesterday at the public protest at Galle Face Green, over the ongoing crisis, has been granted bail by the Fort Magistrate’s Court today.

title: 11 alliance members refuse to meet President today for interim govt.
content: The 11 alliance members who have sat independently in Parliament have refused to meet President Gotabaya Rajapaksa for discussions on an interim government, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Agitation site re-named as ’Gota Go Gama’ by protestors
content: The agitation site set up near the Presidential Secretariat has been re-named as the ’Gota Go Gama’ by the protestors who are demanding President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to step down amidst the spiraling crisis.

title: CB sends shockwaves with 700bps policy rate hike to arrest inflation
content: The Monetary Board of the Central Bank under the newly-appointed Governor Dr. Nanadalal Weerasinghe yesterday delivered a whopping 700 basis point policy rate hike, though many expected a milder hike in the range of 200 to 300 basis points.

title: UN suspends Russia from Human Rights Council: SL abstains from voting
content: The United Nations General Assembly voted Thursday to suspend Russia from the UN Human Rights Council after high-profile allegations of atrocities committed by Russian soldiers during the war in Ukraine.

title: Red alert for 19 districts on severe lightning: Met Dept.
content: A Red alert on thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning has been issued for 19 districts, the Department of Meteorology said today.

title: Parliament adjourned till tomorrow
content: Parliament was adjourned by Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena till 10 a.m tomorrow.

title: Tear gas and water cannons used to disperse protestors near MR's hometown in Tangalle
content: Police have fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse protesting individuals who had gathered outside Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa’s private residence, the Carlton House in Tangalle.

title: Social media ban to be lifted
content: The ban of social media platforms will be lifted at 3.30 today, the Ministry of Technology said.

title: PUCSL recommends early school closure due to lengthey power cuts
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today recommended the Education Ministry to declare the school holiday from Monday (4) for schools.

title: Extremist group behind Mirihana unrest: PMD
content: An extremist group was behind yesterday’s unrest near President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s residence in Mirihana, the Presidential Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Kandy requests Clifford Cup at Nittawela
content: Defending league champions and current Clifford Cup holders Kandy Sports Club have written to Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR) requesting for matches involving the club in the knock-out tournament to be played at the Nittawela Rugby Stadium.

title: ’’I will continue as PM, I have nothing to do with Ranil or Sajith: MR
content: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday evening denied reports that he will step down from his position and make way for UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe to be sworn in as the new Prime Minister of the country.

title: China tells India two countries should not constrain each other
content: Chinese State Councilor  and Foreign Minister WangYi met with Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar in New Delhi on Friday and said that the two countries should help each other rather than constraining each other , a tweet from the Chinese embassy in Colombo said .

title: Banking system is stable, assures CBSL
content: Responding to statements made by various parties with regard to the stability of the banking system, the Ministry of Finance and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka today assured the public and all other stake holders that the banking system was stable in the country.

title: GL reappointed as Minister of Foreign Affairs
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has reappointed Prof. G.L. Peiris as the Minister of Foreign Affairs with effect from today (23).

title: Group of Russian elite plans to assassinate Putin by poison, claims Ukraine intelligence
content: A group of influential people who oppose President Vladimir Putin and who plan to assassinate him, is forming among the Russian business and political elite, according to the Chief Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defence of Ukraine.

title: Sri Lanka ranks 127 in World Happiness Index
content: Sri Lanka has been ranked 127 in the UN’s 2022 World Happiness Report, while Finland has been named as the world’s happiest country.

title: Won’t remit Dollars to Sri Lanka: Expatriate organization
content: ’Sri Lankan Expatriates for Change’, an organization formed by the Sri Lankan expatriates based in Milan in Italy today said they have decided to refrain from remitting dollars to Sri Lanka as a protest against whom they call corrupt  politicians who had ruled the nation in the past and now.

title: No fuel distribution from tonight: SLPPTO
content: Attempts made by the Sri Lanka Petroleum Private Tanker Owners’ Association (SLPPTOA)  to reach the fuel transport formula revision has failed to fetch fruitful results, the  SLPPTOA has opted to refrain from distributing fuel from midnight today.

title: No long distance buses, if bus fare revision focused only on fuel price hike: IPPBOA
content: The Inter Provincial Private Bus Owners’ Association (IPPBOA) said they have decided to  hold operating bus service, if the bus fare revision is made focusing only on considering the diesel price hike.

title: People are preparing to revolt - Maithri
content: Former President Maithripala Sirisena said that the people are preparing to revolt as they cannot bear the burden of the cost of living.

title: RBI notifies $500 mn credit line for Sri Lanka to procure petroleum products
content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Thursday issued a notification to initiate the $500 million line of credit provided by India to Sri Lanka, which would enable it to buy petroleum products.

title: New Fortress Energy to continue with plans for Sri Lanka LNG project
content: New York-based gas-to-power developer New Fortress Energy will continue with the plans for the Sri Lanka LNG project after the country’s court discharged the opposing development.

title: School girl axed to death in Haliela
content: The Haliela Police launched investigations after  a school girl had been axed to death at Uduwara in Haliela this afternoon.

title: Cardinal urges UNHRC to ensure impartial probe into Easter Sunday attacks
content: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith today requested the UNHRC to support in ensuring an impartial investigation into the Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Protest held outside Hirunika’s house for protesting against GR
content: A group of people staged a protest outside the house of former parliamentarian Hirunika Premachandra in Malabe last night.

title: 11 constituent parties to decide whether to remain in govt. today
content: The eleven constituent parties of the government including Sri Lanka Freedom Party , National Freedom Front (NFF) and Pivithuru Hela Urumaya would decide whether to remain in the government or function independent in Parliament following a party leaders meeting today, MP Wimal Weerawansa said.

title: Udaya Gammanpila and Viyathmaga have failed - Dilan
content: While claiming that the main problem for the fuel shortage and prevailing crisis is the forex crisis, SLPP Parliamentarian Dilan Perera today said that as a Minister Udaya Gammanpila had failed and Viyathmaga also has failed.

title: UK stands by Ukraine:British High Commissioner to SL
content: The United Kingdom and the international partners would stand united in condemning Russia’s assault on Ukraine, which is an unprovoked, premeditated, and needless attack against a sovereign democratic state,British High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Sarah Hulton said.

title: Government to collect information on the community through youth volunteers
content: The government is in a move to collect information on the community through youth volunteers to keep a tab on political, criminal, and social activities in the country, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Take actions to eliminate discrepancies in purchasing liquid milk: Prez
content: While inspecting the Milco factory in Narahenpita this morning, the President advised the responsible ministers to take immediate action to eliminate the discrepancy in the purchase of liquid milk.

title: Russia announces special military operation in Donbas
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has launched a ’’special military operation’’ in Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region.

title: Amendment to EPF Act enables to withdraw 30% from fund: Minister
content: The Employees Provident Fund (EPF) Act will be amended allowing the owners to obtain 30% of their provident fund accumulation according to their needs, Labour Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said while addressing the monthly meeting of the Labour Advisory Council yesterday.

title: Ferry transport from Battaramulla Diyatha Uyana to Port City via Wellawatte: Madura Vithanage
content: It is intended to commence a passenger transport service by ferry from Battaramulla Diyatha Uyana to Port City via Wellawatte and the necessary preliminary work has already been underway, Colombo District Parliamentarian Madura Vithanage said.

title: Sri Lanka beat Australia by 5 wickets in 5th T20I
content: Sri Lanka defeated Australia by 5 wickets in the fifth and final T20I game between the sides at Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

title: 36-hour water cut in several areas in Colombo
content: The National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) said a 36-hour water cut would be imposed in several areas of Colombo this morning from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. tomorrow (19) due to a breakdown in the main pipeline supplying water to Colmbo.

title: PUCSL proposes blackout for bulk electricity users, large companies to be told to use generators
content: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has proposed enforcing power cuts for bulk electricity users, including media companies and other large businesses.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with FR petition against Sirisena’s Paget Road residence
content: The Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed with a Fundamental Rights petition filed challenging the decision of the Cabinet of Ministers to allow former President Maithripala Sirisena to continuous use of the residence currently used by him at Paget Road.

title: Constitutionality of PTA amendment bill challenged in SC
content: The Centre for Policy Alternative and its Executive Director, Dr. Paikiasothy Saravanamuttu have filed a Special Determination Petition in the Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of Prevention of Terrorism (Temporary Provisions) (Amendment) Bill.

title: IMF says Sri Lanka has not sought its financial assistance
content: Sri Lanka has not sought financial assistance from the International Monetary Fund, which stands ready to discuss options for the country to deal with its debt burden, IMF spokesman Gerry Rice said on Thursday.

title: New bill worked out envisaging fine, jail term for cruelty against animals
content: The government has worked out a new piece of legislation which, if enacted, provides for cruelty against animals a punishable offence warranting a fine or jail term, or both.

title: Pushpika’s ‘2021 Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. World’ title removed
content: Pushpika De Silva’s title as ‘2021 Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. World’ has been denounced, National Director, Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. World Chandimal Jayasinghe, announced.

title: Health workers to go on strike tomorrow
content: The Government health workers will resort to an indefinite trade union action starting from 7.00 am tomorrow (07) over government’s failure to address their grievances, despite recent token strikes.

title: U.S. announces killing of ISIS Leader in raid
content: U.S. President Biden said Thursday that a U.S. raid in northwestern Syria killed ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi.

title: All schools will be closed from Feb. 7
content: All government and semi-government schools will be closed from February 7, on account of the  commencement of the GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examination.

title: Basil acquitted, released  from almanac case
content: The Colombo High Court today acquitted and released  Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa and and former Director-General of Divi Neguma Department Kithsiri Ranawaka from the controversial almanac case.

title: CEB to purchase electricity from private power plants: Minister
content: The Ministry of Power has decided to purchase electricity from private power plants for a short period of time.

title: Afghanistan beat Sri Lanka in Under 19 World Cup Quarterfinal
content: Afghanistan beat Sri Lanka by 4 runs in the Super League Quarterfinal of the ongoing Under 19 World Cup at the Coolidge Cricket Ground in Antigua.

title: Stealing money from PM’s account proves escalation of thefts, frauds in SL :Vijitha
content: Stealing money from Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa’s account clearly show the escalation of thefts, frauds and corruption in the country, JVP MP Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Wildlife Minister orders probe into harassment of tusker
content: Minister of Wildlife and Forest Conservation C.B. Rathnayake has ordered an investigation into the harassment of a tusker at the Yala National park.

title: Powercuts highly likely from Tuesday: CEB
content: There will be no power cuts today, but power will be interrupted from Tuesday due to inadequate fuel supply, Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Acting General Superintendent Dr. Susantha Perera said.

title: Warnagala forest declared as a conservation zone: Env. ministry
content: The National Environment Council had decided to declare the Warnagala Reserve in Kuruwita  as a protected ecological zone, the Environment Ministry said.

title: Speaker urges all MPs to support rebuild Parliament’s lost image
content: Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardene today urged all MPs to support rebuild Parliament’s lost image and come for a dialogue on the same.

title: Power outage after 5 p.m.?
content: The Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) diesel and furnace oil stocks will be sufficient only until 5.00 p.m. this evening for electricity generation, Ceylon Petroleum Corporation’s (CPC) Jathika Sevaka Sangamaya wing (JSS) Secretary Ananda Palitha said.

title: Tax collectors to launch massive protest against special GST Act
content: In a move to express its displeasure over the new Special GST Act, the country’s top tax collectors of the Excise Department, Sri Lanka Customs and the Department of Inland Revenue will team up to launch a massive protest against the Ministry of Finance tomorrow.

title: Police never harass people in the church: Weerasekara
content: While saying it was a childish argument to make that police was harassing people in the church, Public Security Minister Sarath Weerasekara said today that there was clear evidence that the church employee who was arrested over the recovery of the hand grenade at the All Saints Church Borella, had placed the bomb there.

title: ’Meenagaya’ intercity express train attacked at Kekirawa station
content: The Meenagaya Intercity Express Train (6079) was pelted with stones at the Kekirawa Railway Station this morning, a railway senior official said.

title: Half of Europe on track to contract Omicron in next 2 months: WHO
content: More than half of people in Europe are projected to catch Omicron by March, the WHO said Tuesday, as the World Bank warned the contagious variant could hamper the global economic recovery.

title: RTI Commission to take up appeal filed by Sri Lanka Parliament
content: The Right to Information Commission (RTI) is to take up an appeal filed by Sri Lankan Parliament against the order give by the former to release information on MPs who have declared their assets to a journalist who had requested for them.

title: Chinese Ambassador asks SL Govt why talks halted on FTA
content: As Sri Lanka is facing an economic crisis mainly due to the Covid-19 pandemic, China has expressed its desire to resume the stalled Free Trade Agreement with Sri Lanka in order to boost exports, China’s Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong said yesterday.

title: Forex crisis triggers power outage
content: One hour power outage will be carried out in the country at selected places at any time between 5.30 pm and 9.30 pm primarily due to the lack of furnace oil for thermal power generation, a spokesman for the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) s

title: Welikada Prison Riot case judgment postponed for Jan. 12
content: The Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar today postponed for January 12 to deliver its judgment in respect of Welikada Prison Riot case filed against three accused including former Superintendent of Magazine Prison Lamahewage Emil Ranjan over the killing of eight inmates on November 09, 2012.

title: Labour Minister urges govt. to pay  Rs.240 per migrant worker dollar
content: As Sri Lankan migrant workers flock to informal remittance channels with the growing gap between the official exchange rate and black and grey market exchange rates, Labour Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva urged the government to offer Rs.240 per US dollar for their remittances.

title: Blindness among people on the rise: Optometric Association
content: The number of people who are visually impaired in the country is high when compared to other countries in the region, the Ceylon Eye Care Optometric Association (CECOA) said.

title: Special Commodity Levy on Potatoes, B’onions rescinded from midnight today
content: The Special Commodity Levy on Potatoes and Big onions would be rescinded with effect from midnight today, the Finance Ministry said.

title: Minimum bus fares increased to Rs.17: Dilum
content: The minimum bus fare will be increased by Rs. 3 from January 5, Transport State Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: Amidst severe economic, political crises, govt faces changes amongst big wigs
content: Secretary to the President P.B. Jayasundara who has tendered his resignation to President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is to be appointed as the President’s advisor once he steps down from his post and his position will be filled in by Gamini Senarath who is presently the Secretary to the Prime Minister, political sources said yesterday.

title: Four police officers who died in Thirukkovil shooting promoted posthumously
content: The four police officers attached to the Thirukkovil Police Station who were shot dead by a Police Sergeant, were promoted to their next rank by IGP Chandana Wickramaratne today.

title: Around 3,000 chicken perish when fire gutted Pannala poultry farm
content: Around 3,000 chicks died when a fire broke out at a poultry farm in Pallegama, Pannala early this morning, the Police said.

title: Fresh shipment of organic fertiliser meeting  Lankan standards expected
content: The government is expecting a fresh shipment of organic fertiliser that meets Sri Lankan standards, from China’s Qingdao Seawin Bio-tech Group after settling the US$ 6.7 million claim by the company.

title: If concessions not given, bus fare hike inevitable: Gemunu
content: The Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) said if the government does not consider allowing concessions, bus fare need to be increased to cover the loss.

title: 17 passengers injured after bus topples in Padiyathalawa
content: A bus carrying a group of pilgrims on the Mahaoya Padiyathalawa road has toppled injuring 17 passengers, police said.

title: Selling, displaying non-standard plugs in shops, online shops prohibited: PUCSL
content: The selling or displaying of non-standard plugs in shops and online shops is prohibited in the country, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) said

title: Booster doses available in all vaccination centers islandwide
content: Responding to false reports that the booster dose of COVID-19 should be obtained from where the previous shots were obtained, Chief Epidemiologist Dr. Samitha Ginige said the booster shots can be obtained from any centre set up island-wide.

title: Gas companies should pay compensation to all those affected by gas leaks: Minister
content: Gas companies should pay compensation to all those affected by gas-related explosions, Environment Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said.

title: Constitution bound to fulfil rights, duties, responsibilities: promises fulfilled by public service: NP Governor
content: The rights of citizens under the constitution of any state, duties and responsibilities are bound to be fulfilled, and those promises are fulfilled by the public service, Northern Province (NP) governor Jeevan Thiagarajah said.

title: Agreement signed with another Company violating Cabinet approval: Anura
content: The Government had signed the agreement with regard to the Yugadanavi Power Plant with a Company called “NFE Sri Lanka Power Holdings” a Holding Company affiliated to the New Fortress Energy, going against the Cabinet approval, National People’s Power MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake revealed today.

title: Chinese firm sues Sri Lanka in dispute over $49.7m fertilizer deal
content: A ship loaded with 20,000 tons of fertilizer from Shandong-based producer Seawin Biotech meant for export to Sri Lanka is on its way back after failing to reach any constructive agreement with Sri Lanka, despite relentless efforts to solve the dispute, sources close to the matter told the Chinese Global Times on Tuesday.

title: ⁩Transport service to be digitalised by next year: Minister
content: Steps will be taken to digitalise the transport services to provide an efficient and comfortable public transport service to commuters by 2022, Transport Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi said.

title: Four arrested over murder of ’Keselwatte Fawas’
content: Four suspects were arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division over the murder of Mohammed Kamil Mohammed Fawas alias ’Keselwatte Fawas’, police said.

title: EU court upholds LTTE sanctions listing
content: The EU General Court dismissed an application brought by the European Political Subdivision of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) to annul the 2019 and 2020 acts maintaining the inclusion of the LTTE on the EU’s terrorist sanctions list.

title: India reports first cases of new Covid variant
content: Two men in the southern Indian state of Karnataka have tested positive for the Omicron coronavirus variant after returning from overseas.

title: Lalith Warnakumara sworn in as MP
content: Lalith Warnakumara was sworn in as an MP for the Kalutara District before Deputy Speaker Ranjith Siyambalapitiya a short while ago.

title: Cabraal calls hoteliers to embrace present challenges
content: Central Bank (CB) Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal called the hoteliers to embrace the present challenges in repositioning their product and re-energising the tourism industry, instead of trying to return to the pre-pandemic business model.

title: UK, Germany and Italy detect Omicron variant cases, Israel closes borders
content: Britain, Germany and Italy detected cases of the new Omicron coronavirus variant on Saturday and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced new steps to contain the virus, while more nations imposed restrictions on travel from southern Africa.

title: COVID cases in rural areas on the rise: Health Ministry
content: The spread of coronavirus which was widely seen in urban areas, is now considerably visible in rural areas as well, the Health Ministry said.

title: Vulnerable people still refuse vaccines, leading to a sharp rise in deaths: Health Ministry
content: While saying that the demand for Pfizer vaccine has fairly gone down, the Health Ministry said the vulnerable people still forgo vaccine resulting in number of deaths going up at present.

title: Fuel Price Formula should be implemented immediately: Gammanpila
content: Energy Minister Udaya Gammanpila said today if the Fuel Price Stabilisation Fund is not implemented, at least the Fuel Price Formula should be implemented immediately.

title: SL continues to struggle with brand image, says tourism industry veteran
content: Although several plans have been conceptualised and rolled out for Sri Lanka’s tourism industry to move towards recovery, branding and positioning of the island nation is yet to be effectively executed, a tourism industry veteran highlighted.

title: COVID-19: ’’Ball is now in your court’’, Health Minister tells people
content: While saying that the Government has done its best having taken steps to combat COVID-19, Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said it is the people who should do the rest

title: Steps underway to avert rise in COVID cases due to protest in Colombo: Health Ministry
content: All necessary steps are being taken to prevent a possible surge in COVID cases that could be experienced consequent to the protest campaign by a political party in Colombo yesterday, the Health Ministry said.

title: Tution classes to resume today with 50% attendees: Health Ministry
content: The health ministry has issued the relevant health guidelines to resume private tuition classes from today.

title: Australia beat New Zealand to win T20 World Cup
content: Australia won their maiden T20 World Cup title as they defeated New Zealand in the final by 8 wickets.

title: Govt. targets large companies to raise Rs.254bn in tax revenue
content: Eyeing a Rs.254 billion boost in the tax income, the government yesterday proposed to levy a one-off 25 percent surcharge on large companies, 3 percent increment on VAT charged on banks and financial services providers and a new social security levy on companies with over Rs.120 million in turnover.

title: Incentive package for migrant workers to boost forex inflows
content: The Central Bank yesterday said that plans are afoot to incentivise the Sri Lankan expatriates who ensure their remittances enter the country through formal channels, so that both the migrant workers and national economy can reap the benefits of a win-win situation.

title: Over 9,000 foreign tourists visited Sri Lanka last week: Tourism Minister
content: Tourism Minister Prasanna Rantunga said 9,545 foreign tourists visited Sri Lanka last week.

title: President says ’no’ to letting go of Ali Sabry
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has rejected the resignation submitted by Justice Minister Ali Sabry after the latter expressed his disappointment at the gazette notice issued over the One County One Law concept and being left in the dark over the matter, the Daily Mirror reliably learns.

title: Move to deduct pension for insurance scheme ruthless: Dr. Harini
content: Claiming that it was the duty of the Government to look after the senior citizens, Parliamentarian Dr. Harini Amarasooriya said today that it was a ruthless move to deduct certain amount of money from the pension to cover an insurance scheme.

title: Intercity express trains back on track from Monday
content: Intercity express train services will commence from next Monday (8), Railways General Manager Dhammika Jayasundara said.

title: Agreement with NFE cannot be disclosed due to certain conditions: CEB Chairman
content: Claiming that the agreement pertaining to the Kerawalapitiya Power Plant was signed with the US-based New Fortress Energy (NFE) following the approval of the Attorney General, CEB Chairman M.M.C. Ferdinando said today that the content of the agreement could not be disclosed due to a condition in the agreement.

title: Sri Lanka-Seychelles flights from November
content: Special flights will operate to Seychelles from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) starting in November, airport senior official said.

title: Golden opportunity to make issues discussed by BBS a reality: Ven. Gnanasara Thera
content: The ’Presidential Task Force for One Country, One Law’ was a golden opportunity to make the social issues discussed by the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) organisation a reality, Head of the Task Force Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera said today.

title: Drug kingpin Dematagoda Ruwan smuggled over Rs.7Bn worth drugs into SL within 3 years
content: Large scale drugs trafficker Ruwan Chamila Prarasanna alias Dematagoda Ruwan, the elder brother of Dematagoda Chaminda, has smuggled over Rs. 7 billion worth of heroin to Sri Lanka by sea between 2017-2019, police said.

title: Payment to Chinese Company halted following court decision: People’s Bank
content: Responding to the moves taken by the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka to blacklist People’s Bank,the People’s Bank said the decision to halt the payment to the Chinese Company was taken following an interim injunction issued by the court.

title: Island wide sand distribution to be brought under BMC from next year: Amaraweera
content: While taking measures to stop the exploitation of sand by middlemen, the environment ministry has decided to carry out the island wide sand distribution under the Building Materials Corporation (BMC) from next year.

title: Edu. Minister approves proposal to obtain MBBS at the age of 22: GMOA
content: The Education Minister approved the proposal made by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) for the Optimization of Medical and Undergraduate Age and the Establishment of a ’’Clinical Travel Medicine’’ Post Graduate Medical Degree.

title: Billionaire Gautam Adani arrives; scheduled to meet President
content: Billionaire Indian industrialist Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group arrived in Sri Lanka last night, a senior official said.

title: Primary sections of all schools start on Monday
content: The primary sections of government and government approved private schools from Grades 1 to 5 will start on Monday (25), the Education Ministry said.

title: WHO warns Covid pandemic will drag on into 2022
content: The Covid pandemic will ’’go on for a year longer than it needs to’’ because poorer countries are not getting the vaccines they need, the World Health Organization (WHO) says.

title: Katina Perahera allowed, 50 participants at related religious observations
content: The Health Minisry has issued a circular while amending the maximum participation ceiling when conducting the Katina Perahera due to the ongoing the COVID pandemic.

title: CB to propose resumption of car imports paid via foreign currency
content: The Central Bank is expected soon forward a proposal to the government for consideration, urging to explore the possibility of resuming car imports paid via foreign exchange as vehicle imports remain suspended for 18 months, exerting pressure on the country’s foreign exchange since the onset of the pandemic last year.

title: Health guidelines to be followed from Oct. 16 -31 issued
content: The Health Ministry today issued a new set of guidelines to be followed by the public from October 16 to 31.

title: Legal approval received for number portability service: TRCSL
content: Legal approval has been received for the number portability facility, Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) Director General Oshada Senanayake said.

title: Bathiudeen brothers’ FR petitions fixed for further support
content: The Fundamental Rights petitions filed by Bathiudeen brothers seeking an order to release them forthwith from the custody of the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) were today fixed for further support by the Supreme Court.

title: Namal denies claims went to Kenya on charted flight
content: Minister Namal Rajapaksa has denied claims he travelled to Kenya on a chartered flight.

title: Deadly attack hits Kunduz mosque during Friday prayers
content: A suicide bomber has targeted a mosque in the northern Afghan city of Kunduz during Friday prayers, killing at least 50 people, local officials say.

title: US to support develop local transport sector
content: The Chief Political/Economic Officer of the US Embassy in Sri Lanka, Ms. Susan Walke, today said that the US government would extend all possible assistance to boost the transport industry in Sri Lanka.

title: World’s largest container ship ’Ever Ace’ arrives at Colombo Port
content: The world’s largest container ship ’Ever Ace’ arrived at the Port of Colombo last night on the return of her maiden voyage.

title: ’’No direct links between reopening of schools & vaccinating children’’
content: There is no direct link between the reopening of schools and vaccinating children, Deputy Director-General of Health Services Dr. Hemantha Herath said.

title: Shah Rukh Khan’s son detained over cruise drugs party
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) of India has detained Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan’’s son Aaryan Khan and seven others after it raided a cruise ship in India and busted a drugs party, the PTI reported.

title: Police OIC files FR challenging transfer at the behest of racketeers
content: Filing a Fundamental Rights petition in Supreme Court, the former OIC of Thelikada police station in Galle district alleged that he has been unreasonably transferred to the Tangalle police Division for normal duties at the behest of the racketeers involved in illegal activities in Gin Ganga and forests in Thelikada.

title: State services to resume from tomorrow: Janaka Bandara
content: While giving priority to essential services, the government has decided to resume state services from tomorrow, Public Services, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Janaka Bandara Thennakoon said.

title: Police have failed to arrest real culprits
content: Defence counsel appeared on behalf of two businessmen arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting to remove two containers with 54,000 kilograms of garlic belonging to Lanka Sathosa informed court that a false case had been filed against his clients aiming to protect the real culprits.

title: NIC to every child at birth to ensure child rights,  social security: GMOA
content: A proposal was handed over to the President for issuing a National Identity Card (NIC) number to every child at birth to ensure child rights and social security, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: A businessman remanded over Garlic Scam
content: A businessman arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting to remove two containers with 54,000 kilograms of garlic belonging to Lanka Sathosa was yesterday ordered to be remanded till September 28 by Welisara Magistrate’s Court.

title: Basil briefs party leaders about benefits of deal with New Fortress Energy
content: Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa is reported to have briefed the potential benefit of tying up with New Fortress Energy of the United States to develop the LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas) energy sector in Sri Lanka.

title: Probe launched on Ven. Gnanasara’s statement about imminent terror attack: Minister
content: Investigations are being conducted on the statements made by Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera that a second extremist attack is imminent, Minister of Public Security Sarath Weekeraserna told Parliament today.

title: STF done 158 raids, seized Rs. 90Mn worth Kerala cannabis this year
content: The STF has conducted 158 raids to seize Kerala cannabis so far this year and captured 696 kg of marijuana to the value of over Rs. 90 million with the latest arrest on Monday.

title: SLC to ‘seriously consider’ replacing New Zealand in Pakistan if invited
content: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) would ‘seriously consider’ replacing New Zealand in Pakistan should they receive an invitation from the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) according to SLC Secretary Mohan de Silva.

title: SL removed from UK’s red list
content: The United Kingdom has removed Sri Lanka from its red travel list with effect from 4 am on September 22, Sri Lankan High Commission in London announced.

title: Current daily COVID cases still unbearable to health system: Dr. Herath
content: The number of present daily COVID-19 cases which ranges around 2,300 is still unbearable to the health system, Deputy Director General of Health Services Dr. Hemantha Herath said today.

title: UPDATE - Lohan Ratwatta resigns from his portfolio
content: State Minister of Prisons Management and Prisoners’ rehabilitation, Lohan Ratwatte who has been caught in a controversy over allegedly threatening Tamil prisoners at the Anuradhapura Prison on Sunday, yesterday tendered his resignation to President Gotabaya Rajapaksa following instructions by Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Moneragala High Court disqualifies a candidate convicted of bribing voters at LG Polls
content: Moneragala High Court Judge Ranga Dissanayake delivered a landmark judgment on September 13, 2021 disqualifying a candidate convicted of bribing voters, a statement from People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections(PAFFREL) said.

title: New national education policy currently being formulated : Dinesh
content: Leader of the House, Minister of Education Dinesh Gunawardena said that a new national education policy that the country needed is being formulated. He was speaking at the Consultative Committee on Education held in Parliament recently.

title: FAU takes a hit at Kimarli over PPE issue
content: Criticizing the move taken by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) Head Kimarli Fernando to remove the PPE requirement for fully vaccinated flight crew, the Flight Attendant Union (FAU) today said the SLTDA was attempting to paint a false and misleading picture to the tourists.

title: Magisterial inquiry over last will of Miss Ceylon postponed due to COVID situation
content: The magisterial inquiry into the alleged questionable last will of late Miss Ceylon 1962 Jennifer Ingleton (nee Labrooy) was postponed for September 21 by Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court owing to the prevailing pandemic situation in the country.

title: Premier to brief Vatican on progress of action taken:cabinet Spokesman
content: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and Foreign Affairs Minister Prof. G.l.pieris will brief the Vatican on the progress made in connection with the legal action taken against the suspects involved in the Easter Sunday carnage, Cabinet spokesman, Plantation Minister Dr. Ramesh Pathirana said yesterday.

title: 180 more COVID-19 deaths reported: Death toll surges to 10,320
content: A total of 180 more COVID-19 related deaths that occurred yesterday (05) were confirmed by the Director-General of Health Services today pushing the death toll to 10,320.

title: SL receives 4mn Sinopharm Vaccine
content: A cargo containing the total volume of four million doses of Chinese Sinopharm COVID-19 Vaccine vials arrived at the Colombo airport this morning, the airport duty manager said.

title: Notorious drug trafficker ’’Sunshine Sudda’’ shot dead
content: Notorious drug trafficker Amila Prasanna Hettihewa alias ’’Sunshine Sudda’’ was shot dead at Warakapitiya, Weligama in Matara, police said.

title: Maximum retail price set for oximeter
content: A maximum retail price of Rs 3000 has been declared for a Pulse Oximeter, State Minister Prof. Channa Jayasumana said.

title: Priority for transport services generating revenue through 2022 budget: Minister
content: New revenue-generating programs should be formulated through transport services to rebuild the economy of the country, which has collapsed due to the COVID-19 epidemic, Transport Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi said.

title: 85% Covid deaths among those with chronic diseases: HPB Director
content: The Health Ministry said today that 85% of the 6,985 Covid-19 deaths that have been reported upto August 13, were among people who were suffering from chronic diseases and under medical treatment previously.

title: Over 700 quarantine law violators arrested within 24 hours
content: A total of 718 suspects have been arrested in connection with the violation of quarantine rules and regulations during the last 24-hours.

title: Islandwide lockdown extended till Sept. 6
content: The ongoing islandwide lockdown has been extended till September 6, 4 am, Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said.

title: Mangala’s demise was great loss to nation, UNP and me: Ranil
content: The late Mangala Samaraweera was an outstanding politician who always stood firm for his convictions, which involved a Sri Lanka where all were free and equal with human rights upheld, said former Prime Minister and UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe in his condolence message.

title: Travel restrictions should be further tightened to control the virus: GMOA
content: Travel restrictions should be further tightened up to 80 to 90 per cent and the imposed restrictions should be implemented perfectly, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Cabinet ministers to donate their August salary for COVID fund
content: The cabinet today approved the proposal submitted by Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa to donate the salaries of all Cabinet Ministers for the month of August to the Covid-19 fund.

title: Easter Sunday Attack: Perpetrators will suffer the same fate as the blast victims: Cardinal
content: Those who were behind the Easter Sunday mayhem will face a similar fate like that of blast victims, Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said over the weekend.

title: President to address nation at 8.30 pm tonight
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will address the nation at 8.30 pm tonight, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Close businesses as precaution to contain pandemic spread - Colombo Mayoress
content: Mayoress of Colombo Rosy Senanayake today requested for the closure of all business establishments in Colombo city as a precaution to contain  COVID 19 pandemic.

title: Booster doses halt or minimize spread, prevent mutant variant: GMOA
content: By administering a booster dose, it will halt or minimize the spread of the disease and prevent further mutation, thereby preventing a mutant variant, the Government Medical Officers’ Association today said.

title: Foreign Ministry to evacuate Lankans in Afghanistan
content: The Foreign Ministry said that it was currently in the process of working with international partners to facilitate the return of Sri Lankan nationals in Afghanistan, if they wish to return.

title: Ex- Airman arrested for alleged threat on a Colombo institution
content: An ex-Air Force personnel has been arrested for making alleged threats to attack an institution in Colombo, Police said.

title: Detained Sri Lankan ’treated like a dog in Japan,’ says family after seeing video
content: The family of a Sri Lankan woman who died in March following mistreatment at a Japanese immigration center said she was ’’treated like a dog’’ after the government disclosed Thursday security camera footage of her final days.

title: Immediate curfew will prevent 1,200 additional COVID deaths: Medical expert
content: The immediate imposition of curfew will prevent at least 1,200 additional deaths within the next 20 days, Professor of Community Medicine, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka, Professor Suneth Agampodi stressed.

title: Sharp spike in COVID cases, deaths toll could rise in coming weeks: PHI Head
content: No matter what could be done in the next two weeks, the number of COVID positive cases and COVID-related deaths will rise sharply, Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union President Upul Rohana said.

title: Religious gathering in Batti: All devotees to undergo 14 days quarantine
content: The Police are presently identifying all devotees who attended a Hindu religious gathering in Batticaloa yesterday, ignoring health guidelines amidst a deadly spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Man uploads over 500 child porn videos, images to cyberspace remanded, 10 others traced
content: Making the first such arrest after establishing of a new unit to trace the culprits who upload child pornographic videos and photographs to the internet or social media,  a 25-year old man who had uploaded more than 500 videos and photographs  was arrested, police said.

title: Ranjan tests COVID-19 positive
content: Imprisoned former MP Ranjan Ramanayake who is in remand at the Angunukolapelessa Prison tested positive with COVID-19.

title: 21,344 COVID cases, 591 deaths reported within 10 days: Pavithra
content: Some 21,344 COVID-19 cases and 591 COVID related deaths were reported during the last ten days, Minister of Health Pavithra Wanniarachchi informed Parliament today.

title: Most COVID victims died of comorbidity
content: Most coronavirus victims died as a result of comorbidity and not purely because of the virus, the Government said yesterday.

title: New jabs paused until second dose of AstraZeneca, Sinopharm completed: CMC
content: Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has decided not to administer the first dose of Sinopharm vaccine to city dwellers till the completion of administering second doses of AstraZeneca and Sinopharm, Mayor Rosy Senanayake said today.

title: Singer Umariya arrested over accident in Rajagiriya
content: Popular singer Umaria Sinhawansa has been arrested by the Welikada Police this evening following an accident near the Rajagiriya flyover.

title: Man dies while being treated at spa in Thalawathugoda
content: The Thalangama Police launched investigation after a 36-year-old man has died while being treated at a Spa at Thalawathugoda in Thalangama yesterday.

title: Harin challenges Sarath for public debate on Easter Sunday attacks
content: SJB MP Harin Fernando today challenged Minister of Public Security Sarath Weerasekera for a public debate on the Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: There is nexus between JVP and agrochemical companies
content: Agriculture Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage said the rice prices would be brought down drastically next week in accordance with the agreement to be signed with the mill owners.

title: Majority of infected & COVID deaths are of unvaccinated people
content: In the wake of an increase in COVID-19 cases in the country in recent days, Director General Health Services Dr Asela Gunawardena said the majority of people being hospitalized with COVID and dying from the disease haven’t been fully vaccinated.

title: SL in further trouble as more Delta variant cases reported from 14 areas
content: Sri Lanka has recorded 30 more fresh cases of the Delta variant in 14 areas in the country, the Health Ministry said.

title: Govt. will be compelled to increase fuel prices again : Ruwan
content: Government will be compelled to increase fuel prices once again to generate dollars to pay for imports, UNP Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene said today.

title: Over 95% individuals developed antibodies against Sinopharm vaccine: Prof. Jayasumana
content: The research group of Sri Jayawaradnapura University has found that the Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine produced antibodies in 95 percent of vaccinated people and was very effective against the delta variant, State Minister Prof. Channa Jayasumana said.

title: 46 more die of COVID-19: Death toll surges to 3,779
content: A total of 46 more COVID-19 related deaths that occurred yesterday (17) were confirmed by the Director-General of Health Services today increasing the death toll in Sri Lanka to 3,779.

title: Inter-provincial bus and train services suspended until Aug 1
content: The COVID committee has decided to suspend all inter-provincial bus and train services until August 1 from tomorrow, Transport State Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: SL to receive its largest vaccine donation from China this month
content: Sri Lanka will receive its largest donation of COVID-19 vaccines this month after China has decided to grant 1.6 million Sinopharm doses to Sri Lanka’s Health Ministry.

title: Three nabbed with handcuffs for robbing impersonating as cops
content: Three men impersonating themselves as policemen were arrested in Wattala in connection with abductions, robberies and snatch theft cases along with handcuffs.

title: Lankan deported from Qatar arrested for revamping LTTE
content: A 41-year old man who was deported from Doha, Qatar arrested by the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) yesterday on charges of revamping the LTTE, Police said.

title: Stresses need for recommencement of economic activities in full swing: Finance Minister
content: Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, who also spearheads the presidential task force for economic revival and poverty eradication, is reported to have stressed the need to reopen the country fully after an early conclusion of the inoculation drive to revive the economy.

title: COVID-19 cases force SLC to delay start of ODI series vs India
content: India’s limited overs series against Sri Lanka has been rescheduled owing to COVID-19 cases in home team camp.

title: 40 more die of COVID-19
content: A total of 40 more COVID-19 related deaths that occurred yesterday (07) were confirmed by the Director-General of Health Services today.

title: Five member panel to probe on suspended cricketers
content: A five member panel has been appointed by Sri Lanka Cricket to inquire into the alleged misconduct of cricketers Kusal Mendis, Dhanushka Gunathilake, and Niroshan Dickwella who were suspended for breaching the teams bio-bubble while touring in England.

title: Elections Commission informed of vacancy in Parliament
content: Secretary General of Parliament Dhammika Dasanayake has informed the Chairman of the Election Commission in writing that Parliamentarian Jayantha Ketagoda has resigned and thereby vacated his seat in Parliament with effect from today (6).

title: Won’t allow opposition to fish in troubled waters: Sagara Kariyawasam
content: Even though there was no change in the stance of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) on the recent fuel price hike, SLPP General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam said today they would not allow the opposition to fish in troubled waters by bringing in a no-confidence motion against Energy Minister Udaya Gammanpila.

title: PHIs also to begin TU action from Monday
content: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union has decided to resort to trade union action from Monday (05) in order to show displeasure over the Government’ decision to fulfil demands in favour of one trade union ignoring other affiliated trade unions.

title: Contact CMC to get their vaccine
content: The Colombo Municipal Council’s (CMC) Public Health Department today requested people above the age of 70 to contact the department to obtain their AstraZeneca Covishield vaccine.

title: Kanya D’Almeida wins 2021 Commonwealth Short Story Prize
content: A short while ago in an online ceremony the Commonwealth Foundation announced Sri Lankan author Kanya D’Almeida as the overall winner of the 2021 Commonwealth Short Story Prize.

title: Kusal Mendis, Dickwella & Danushka Gunathilaka arrive in Sri Lanka
content: Cricketers Kusal Mendis, Niroshan Dickwella & Danushka Gunathilaka who faced suspension and were recalled for breaching the bio-bubble during England tour arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago.

title: COVID vaccine for those who embark on foreign employment: SLBFE
content: The Government had decided to administer Covid-19 vaccines for all those who will be leaving Sri Lanka to take up foreign employment from next week, Foreign Employment Bureau (FEB) media spokesman and Deputy Manager Mangala Randeniya said.

title: Over 17Mn doses of vaccine to arrive in SL by September
content: An excess of 17 million doses of vaccines, including Sinopharm, Sinovac and Sputnik V are expected to arrive in the country from July to September, the President’s Media Division said.

title: No police bail for those arrested today
content: Police bail will not be granted to any person who is arrested for any illegal act today, Police Spokesman SDIG Ajith Rohana said.

title: Fuel Price Stabilisation Fund not meant to stabilise fuel prices: Gammanpila
content: Energy Minister Udaya Gammanpila said today Fuel Price Stabilisation Fund was not really meant to be used to stabilize fuel prices, but to pay off loans of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: Construction of 4th car park commences in Colombo
content: The construction of the fourth car park has commenced at Abdul Kader Mawatha in Colombo 11 as part of a programme to construct 12 new car parks to ease traffic congestion in Colombo, Ministry of Urban Development and Housing said.

title: 2,134 more COVID-19 patients discharged from hospitals
content: A total of 2,134 more COVID-19 patients recovered and were discharged from hospitals increasing the total number of recoveries in Sri Lanka to 199,393, the Health Ministry said.

title: India denies reports that Indian Navy physically attacked SL fishermen
content: The Indian High Commission in Colombo today denied media reports that a group of Sri Lankan fishermen were attacked physically by the Indian Navy, stating that it was blatantly false.

title: 264, 000 doses of AstraZeneca to arrive in SL early July through Covax
content: Sri Lanka will re­ceive 264, 000 doses of the much needed As­tra Zeneca vac­cines by early next month through the WHO’S Co­vax fa­cil­ity, the Daily Mir­ror learns.

title: Govt could have purchased 400 ambulances from SUV cash
content: The government would have been able to purchase 400 ambulances from the money it was going to utilize to purchase the luxury SUVs, an SJB MP said today.

title: If Basil was around, he wouldn’t have let fuel price hike: Lanza
content: State Minister Nimal Lanza said if Basil Rajapaksa was there in the country, he would not have allowed to increase the fuel prices.

title: 'Thel Bala's’ daughter nabbed with heroin in Grandpass
content: The daughter of notorious drug trafficker and underworld gangster Muniyandi Vappu Balan popularly known as “Thel Bala’’, has been arrested with heroin in Grandpass area.

title: US provides $100,000 in support in response to cargo ship fire
content: The United States, through the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), is providing $100,000 in immediate assistance to support response efforts to the devastating Sri Lanka cargo ship fire.

title: US to donate 500 mn doses of Pfizer vaccine to the world
content: Amid intensifying calls for wealthy nations to share their COVID vaccine surplus with the rest of the world, the U.S. is poised to step up big time.

title: NPP calls for criminal investigation into deletion of e-mails
content: Charging that the government had failed to reveal the local shipping agent of the X-press Pearl vessel, National Peoples’ Power (NPP) MP Vijitha Herath yesterday called for an investigation into the deletion of e-mails by the Sri Lankan agent of the shipping Company, that are vital to the investigations.

title: Two more dolphins, leatherback sea turtle found dead today after MV X-Press Pearl tragedy
content: The carcases of two dolphins and a Leatherback sea turtle washed ashore today after the burnt down MV X-Press Pearl in Sri Lankan waters, wildlife sources said.

title: Health Ministry revises vaccination priority list
content: The vaccination priority list is to be subject to several changes with the arrival of COVID-19 vaccines in future, the Health Ministry said.

title: Four missing, one dead due to earth slips: DMC
content: Four persons went missing and one died due to earth slips at the Devanagala area in Mawanella and Warakapola, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: US picks Sri Lanka to share Covid vaccines
content: The United States has picked Sri Lanka, among other countries, to share 25 million coronavirus vaccines.

title: Sooka questions appointment of former IGP to OMP
content: A former member of a UN expert panel on Sri Lanka, Yasmin Sooka, has questioned the appointment of former Inspector General of Police (IGP), Jayantha Wickremaratne to the Office on Missing Persons (OMP).

title: Govt. expedites COVID-19 vaccination program to make SL COVID free
content: The Government has expedited the COVID19 vaccination program with an aim to make Sri Lanka COVID19 free, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP S. B. Dissanayake said.

title: Police to file case against management of Shangri-La Hotel
content: The Fort Police will take legal action against the management of the Shangri-La Hotel in Colombo for allowing to host a birthday party on Sunday night when islandwide restrictions are presently in place, the Dailymirror learns.

title: Police to quiz Captain and crew of MV X-Press Pearl vessel
content: A special police team will be deployed to record statements from the crew members including the captain of the ’’MV X-Press Pearl’ tomorrow in connection with the complaint lodged by the Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) over the environmental damage caused by the fire that erupted in the vessel

title: Don’t panic to consume fish: Govt.
content: While saying that the fishing activities in the adjoining sea areas where the X-Press Pearl vessel caught fire had been suspended since last Sunday (23), Kanchana Wijesekara, State Minister of Ornamental Fish, Inland Fish & Prawn Farming, Fishery Harbour Development, Multiday Fishing Activities and Fish Exports said there is no fear in consuming fish from the market.

title: Ex-female councillor arrested with illegally assembled car in Colombo
content: The Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested a former female councillor of the Colombo Municipal Council in Colombo 13 with a car assembled in Sri Lanka in violation of customs and related laws.

title: Second batch of Sinopharm vaccines arrive
content: A total number of 500,000 doses of Chinese-made Sinopharm vaccines were brought to the Katunayake International Airport by a special SriLankan Airlines aircraft this morning.

title: Medical union members seen at vaccination centre with family members: GMOA
content: While claiming that they did send a letter in March requesting the Health authorities to provide their family members with the COVID-19 vaccine, the Government Medical Officers’ Association said the so-called members of the medical unions, who had requested and insisted that their family members should also be vaccinated were seen yesterday at the National Hospital along with their family members to receive the vaccine.

title: 37 trainees at Kalutara Police College contract COVID-19
content: A total number of 37 trainees at the Sri Lanka Police College in Kalutara tested positive for COVID-19, health officials said.

title: Govt. seeks help from NGOS, INGOS
content: The government has sought the assistance of the NGOS and INGOS to obtain high flow oxygen therapy machines to meet the increasing demand for them to treat COVID-19 patients, an official said.

title: No services available on May 24, 25 at Narahenpita, Werahera Offices: DMT
content: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) today announced that  no service could be availed from the Narahenpita and Werahera Offices on May 24 and 25.

title: Lawyers claim Sri Lanka’s Sherlock Holmes a victim of conspiracy
content: Lawyers have told court that former Criminal Investigation Department (CID) Director Shani Abeysekara, who they identified as Sri Lanka’s Sherlock Holmes, was a victim of a conspiracy.

title: Spike in COVID positive cases, hospitals reach spillover situation: GMOA
content: With the vast escalation of COVID positive cases in the country, the capacity to accommodate the patients is reaching beyond maximum level, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) General Committee Member Dr. Prasad Colambage said.

title: CAA to take legal action against Litro Gas for misleading consumers
content: A test carried out by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has revealed that the new premium hybrid 18 litre gas cylinder introduced by the Litro Gas Lanka Ltd contains the same chemical properties of the old cylinder whereas the Company claimed that the newly-introduced cylinder was more efficient, CAA Executive Director Thushan Jayawardane said.

title: Prioritize vaccinating Buddhist clergy: Ven. Dhammananda Thera
content: Chief Lekakadikari of the Asgiri Chapter, Ven. Dr. Medagama Dhammananda Thera today requested to provide COVID vaccine under special priority for Buddhist monks as they regularly engage in social and religious matters.

title: China lands its Zhurong rover on Mars
content: China has successfully landed a spacecraft on Mars, state media announced early on Saturday. The six-wheeled Zhurong robot was targeting Utopia Planitia, a vast terrain in the planet’s northern hemisphere.

title: Fmr Additional AG Lalith Ambanwala passes away
content: Former Additional Auditor General Lalith Ambanwala has passed away at his residence in Kandy today.

title: Last digit ID system introduced for non-essential movements
content: The public can travel for non-essential purposes from tomorrow (Friday) till 31st May based only on the approved last digits of the ID numbers of the day, the Police said.  The ID system will not apply when a travel ban is in place.

title: SLTB opted to limit service from last night: Chairman
content: Following the announcement by the Government to impose Inter-provincial travel restrictions, the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) opted to limit its services from midnight yesterday, SLTB Chairman Kingsley Ranawaka said.

title: DMT waive penalties due to closure of its offices
content: The Motor Traffic Department (DMT) has proposed to waive off all penalties for delays caused due to the closure of the department’s offices with immediate effect, (DMT) Commissioner-General Sumith Alahakoon said.

title: Nine Deputy Health Services DGs to monitor COVID prevention in each province
content: Nine Deputy Director Generals of Health Services have been appointed to all provinces to coordinate and monitor the COVID prevention programme.

title: Lawyers of DIG Bimshani write to IGP to reinstate her back immediately
content: Lawyers of DIG Bimshani Jasin-Arachchi, who was removed from her duties as the DIG in charge of the Police Ombudsman Range, has written to IGP C.D. Wickramaratne urging him to immediately reinstate her back to her assigned duties or allocate other suitable duties, a statement from her lawyers said.

title: 20 trains cancelled due to drop in commuters
content: Twenty trains including night mail trains have been cancelled following the sharp drop in the number of commuters due to the recent spike in COVID-19 cases, the Railways Department said.

title: 11 more die of COVID-19: Death toll climbs to 720
content: Eleven more COVID-19 related deaths were reported today bringing the death toll in Sri Lanka to 720, the Health Ministry said.

title: Decision to impose travel restrictions could be taken anytime: Keheliya
content: Imposing travel restrictions could be taken even this evening or tomorrow, Cabinet spokesman Keheliya Rambukwella said today.

title: Sajith requests Russian Govt.’s assistance to arrest pandemic situation
content: The leader of the Opposition met the Russian Ambassador in Sri Lanka Yury B.Materiy and requested the Russian government to assist Sri Lanka to help arrest the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

title: T20 match between Sri Lanka Greats and National team postponed
content: The ‘Charity Match’ scheduled to be played on Tuesday (4) at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, between the Sri Lanka Greats XI and Team Sri Lanka, will not go ahead as planned due to the prevailing health situation in the country, the Sri Lanka Cricket said.

title: Schools reopening postponed to May 10: Minister
content: Considering the current pandemic situation in the country, the Education Ministry has decided to extend the closure of schools until May 7, Education Minister G.L. Peiris said.

title: Police to conduct night search operations at restaurants, pubs, clubs
content: Special search operation would be conducted at restaurants, pubs, clubs and other social centres situated in the Western Province, especially at nights to monitor whether they are being operated adhering to health guidelines.

title: Daily COVID-19 cases exceed 1,000 for second consecutive day
content: The number of daily COVID-19 cases surpassed the 1,000 mark today for the second consecutive day.

title: Eight individuals succumb to COVID-19
content: A total of eight COVID-19 related deaths were reported yesterday climbing the death toll to 655, the Government Information Department said.

title: Roy-Tho postponed after some players test positive
content: The Royal-Thomian cricket matches scheduled to be held next month have been postponed until further notice after some players tested positive with the COVID-19, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Task force to look into the unusual algae growth in the Diyawanna Oya
content: The Environment Ministry said that a task force would be appointed to look into the unusual algae growth in the Diyawanna Oya.

title: A/L results before April end: Commissioner
content: The results of the GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examination will be released before the end of April, Commissioner General of the Department of Examinations Sanath B. Pujitha said.

title: Moves to regulate Sri Lanka beauty pageants
content: The government is considering regulating Sri Lanka beauty pageants following the recent incident at the Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. World finals held in Colombo.

title: Govt. Whip urges SJB MPs to furnish info to CID
content: Chief Government Whip Johnston Fernando today urged SJB MPs Harin Fernando and Manusha Nanayakara to furnish information they disclosed in Parliament about Easter Sunday attacks to the CID and support the government’s endeavour to find out the culprits behind the deadly attacks.

title: Ministry decides to limit August school holidays for one week: Minister
content: Education Minister Professor G.L Peiris today said that the Ministry had decided to limit the school holidays in August to one week this year.

title: School second-term commences tomorrow
content: The second term of all Government schools will commence from tomorrow (April 19) in accordance with the circulars issued by the Ministry of Education in compliance with the instructions given by the Health authorities, the Education Ministry said.

title: Three farmers die of lightning bolt at Mullaithivu
content: Three farmers in Thannimurippu in Mullaithivu had died when they were struck by lightning on Thursday evening (15).

title: Overspeeding, carefree driving caused E’way mishap: Police
content: The cause for the accident which had taken place on the Southern Expressway this morning resulted in excessive speed and lack of attention by the driver on to the road ahead, the police said.

title: COVID-19: Harsh post-New year consequence if health guidelines ignored
content: The people themselves will inevitably experience the consequences of irresponsible public activities in the coming days for not following or adhering to COVID-19 guidelines during the festival season, Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union Head Upul Rohana said.

title: SLCP wants its nominee re-appointed to NMRA
content: The Sri Lanka College of Paediatricians (SLCP) requested the Health Minister to revoke her decision to terminate the services of Dr. LakKumar Fernando and take immediate steps to re-appoint him to the Board of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA).

title: Two more die of COVID-19: Death toll climbs to 593
content: Two more COVID-19 related deaths were reported today taking the death toll in the country to 593, the Government Information Department said.

title: Special permit to import refined palm oil for bakery industry: Bandula
content: While claiming that banning of palm oil import would not affect the manufacture of bakery products and biscuits in the country as reported, Trade Minister Bandula Gunawardane said today industrialists would be allowed to import refined palm oil as raw material required for their industries.

title: Caroline Jurie arrives at Police to give statement
content: Reigning Mrs. World Caroline Jurie, uncrowned Mrs. Sri Lanka Pushpika De Silva and National Director of Mrs. Sri Lanka for Mrs. World pageant, Chandimal Jayasingha all arrived at the Cinnamon Gardens Police a short while ago to give a statement after Pushpika lodged a complaint yesterday over the incident on Sunday.

title: Inoculation of second dose with AstraZeneca to begin from April 19: Sudarshani
content: While claiming that there will be no issue with inoculation of the second dose with AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, Minister Sudarshani Fernandopulle said today that the inoculation of the second dose would commence from April 19.

title: No plans to appoint a new coroner (Muslim): Justice Ministry
content: There are no plans to create a new post of coroner (Muslim), the Ministry of Justice said today.

title: Sri Lanka, India, Bhutan & Bangladesh to hold joint military exercise
content: Sri Lanka will take part in a joint military exercise along with India, Bangladesh and Bhutan from April 4 to 12, in the first such multi-nation venture with neighbouring countries.

title: Oxford scientists release cheap, quick COVID-19 antibody test; Prof Malavige among researchers
content: An international research team led by Oxford University scientists has developed a portable test for antibodies that fight the novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19, University of Oxford said.

title: Police officer swallows money to save skin
content: A Chief Inspector attached to the Weliweriya Police Minor Offences branch swallowed two Rs. 5000 notes which he had accepted as a bribe when he was confronted by bribery officials yesterday, the police said.

title: 75% of coconut oil sold in market contain some form of contaminants: GMOA
