content: About 75% of the coconut oil sold in the country contain various forms of contaminants other than coconut oil and buying coconut oil from the local markets is not safe for health, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: PHIs to monitor schools from tomorrow
content: The Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union today said that they have informed its members to visit all schools including the ones in the Western Province (WP) from tomorrow and monitor to ensure the schools are adhering to health guidelines issued by the Director General of  Health Services.

title: Two Madrasa teachers arrested for giving arms training to children
content: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested two Madrasa School teachers on charges of giving arms training to school children in Puttlam.

title: All Madrasas will not be banned: Sarath Weerasekara
content: While claiming that all the Madrasas will not be banned, Public Security Minister Sarath Weerasekara today reiterated that Madrasas that taught only religion and Arabic for children between the ages of five and 16 should be banned as they were against the National Education Policy.

title: Shortage of doctors in rural hospitals; extend doctors’ retirement age to 63: GMOA
content: To overcome the shortage of doctors in the health sector, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA)  requested the  Government to extend the doctors’ retirement age to 63.

title: State revenue reduced by Rs. 15.9 Bn due to tax reduction on sugar: Cabraal
content: While claiming that there has been no fraud in the sugar import as alleged by the opposition, State Minister Ajith Nivard Cabraal today admitted that the state revenue had reduced by Rs. 15.9 billion due to the reduction of tax on sugar imports.

title: MP Rajitha, his son Chathura arrive at CCD
content: MP Rajitha Senaratne and his son Chathura Senaratne arrived at the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) to give statements over a false complaint made by a journalist that he was abducted on March 10.

title: Truck driver arrested over deadly bus accident
content: The driver of a tipper-truck has been arrested over the deadly bus accident in Passara.

title: 16-year-old boy gone missing since yesterday
content: A police complaint was lodged at the Mount Lavinia police division over a disappearance of a 16-year-old boy yesterday, police said.

title: No LP gas shortage, no decision to up price: PM
content: There is no shortage of domestic cooking gas in the local market and no decision to increase the price of LP gas in the local market during the upcoming festive season, Prime Minister and Finance Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa said.

title: Russian billionaire Andrey Melnichenko in town
content: Russian billionaire Andrey Melnichenko is currently in Colombo and is expected to hold talks with the top level of the Sri Lankan government, including Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Building day/night stadia help curb drug abuse, prevent juvenile diabetes: Power Minister
content: Construction of day/night stadia will be an ideal alternative for the youth who are at risk of becoming drug addicts and it will provide a perfect solution to prevent juvenile diabetes, Power Minister Dullas Alahapperuma said.

title: Schools in WP to commence tomorrow for grades 5, 11 and 13
content: The schools in the Western Province (WP) will reopen tomorrow for Grades five, eleven and thirteen, Education Ministry Secretary Prof. Kapila Perera said

title: COVID-19: Home quarantine likely for expats returning to Sri Lanka from the UAE
content: The government of Sri Lanka is looking to amend the quarantine rules for its citizens entering the country from the UAE.

title: Rauff Hakeem & Bathiudeen associated with Easter Sunday attackers: Aluthgamage
content: SLMC Leader Rauff Hakeem and ACMC Leader Rishad Bathiudeen have been associated with the Easter Sunday attackers, Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage told Parliament yesterday.

title: Immune system takes 21 days to respond to vaccine: Expert
content: It will take at least 14 to 21 days for the immune system to respond to the COVID-19 vaccine, Prof. Neelika Malavige of the Department of Immunology and Molecular Medicine at the University of Sri Jayewardenepura said.

title: CID issues notice on MP Ashok Abeysinghe over his Easter Sunday attack speech
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) today issued notice on former State Minister and SJB MP Ashok Abeysinghe to appear before CID tomorrow to record a statement over the speech he made on Easter Sunday attacks, Police Spokesman DIG Ajith Rohana said.

title: Govt. not keen to hide PCoI report on Easter attack: Prez
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa stressed today that the government did not want to hide the report of the Presidential Commission that probed the Easter Sunday attack.

title: VIP among local guests asked to vacate newly certified Level 1 hotels in SL
content: A VIP is among long-staying local guests asked to vacate newly certified Level 1 hotels in and around Colombo, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Epidemiology Unit begins probe on two deaths following vaccination
content: Two individuals from the Gampaha District have died two days after being vaccinated and the Epidemiology Unit is to investigate as to whether it could be attributed to the vaccine, Deputy Director General of Health Services Dr. Hemantha Herath said.

title: PCoI report on fraud and corruption in state institutions to be presented in Parliament
content: The Cabinet approval has been granted to present the final report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) appointed to probe the alleged fraud and corruption in the government institutions within the period from 14th January 2015 to 31st December 2018.

title: Sri Lanka ready to consider single-shot vaccine
content: Sri Lanka is ready to consider a singleshot vaccine which has been given approval in the US.

title: Chris Gayle returns to WI squad for T20I series vs Sri Lanka
content: Chris Gayle is set to play for West Indies for the first time after March 2019 after being named in the national squad for 3-match T20I series against Sri Lanka.

title: Senior citizens in CMC territory to be vaccinated from Saturday
content: All senior citizens above 60 years of age in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) territory would be vaccinated  with Oxford-AstraZeneca within 14 days from Saturday (27), Colombo Mayoress Rosy Senanayake said.

title: Presidential Commission appointed to streamline Customs
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a Presidential Commission to increase the productivity of the Sri Lanka Customs Department and to study its current situation, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Pakistan Prime Minister arrives
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan arrived in the country a short while ago on a two day-visit.

title: Vaas pulls out of Windies tour
content: Former Sri Lanka fast bowler Chaminda Vaas has resigned from his post as Consultant bowling coach and will not be a part of the support staff for Sri Lanka’s tour of West Indies.

title: 15 women attended Zahran’s zealotry lessons; five killed: Police
content: A total number of 15 women have been attending lessons on extremism conducted by Easter Sunday suicide attack linchpin Zahran Hashim in 2018 and that five of them had been killed and the remaining women were either remanded or detained at the moment, police revealed.

title: ‘Influenced by BJP, several countries including SL will accept BJP ideals’: Tripura minister
content: Tripura law minister Ratan Lal Nath on Thursday claimed that several countries including the United States and Sri Lanka were influenced by Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) ideals and were thinking of accepting them.

title: RAT tests are continuing but the PCR is also being conducted to cross check results
content: Controversy over Rapid Antigen testing continues with health officials claiming that despite the RAT kits being used for random checks for the COVID19, a PCR was necessary due to inaccurate results at times being displayed by the RAT kits.

title: Sri Lankan student in Singapore repeatedly breaches quarantine
content: An incoming Singapore Management University (SMU) student from Sri Lanka who was serving his 14-day stay-home notice (SHN) at Hotel Grand Pacific repeatedly breached his quarantine by leaving his room, foreign media reported.

title: AG requests Chief Justice to appoint another Trial-at-Bar over bond scam
content: Attorney General Dappula de Livera has requested the Chief Justice to appoint another Trial-at-Bar for the Central Bank bond scam that took place during the third bond auction on March 31, 2016, to try former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayaka, former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran, Arjun Aloysious and seven others, said the AG’s Coordinating Officer.

title: Eight Peradeniya Uni. undergrads test COVID-19 positive
content: Eight more final year students of the Peradeniya University’s Engineering Faculty have been infected with COVID-19, the Provincial Health Department said.

title: Cardinal confronts unethical conversions
content: Colombo’s Archbishop His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith yesterday asked for a probe into those individuals who identify themselves as Christin pastors and indulge in unethical conversions targeting celebrities such as artistes, sportsmen, accomplished women and businessmen.

title: 955 more Covid-19 cases reported
content: A total of 955 new Covid-19 patients were reported today bringing the total number of cases in the country to 72,166, the Government Information Department said.

title: No law prevents from commenting on other parties: Wimal replies to SLPP
content: Referring to his comments on Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) leadership, National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader, Minister Wimal Weerawansa said there is no existing law in the country that prevents anyone from making any comment on other political parties.

title: Harin baffled as Sanga, Mahela back Namal
content: Former Sports Minister Harin Fernando said that he was baffled after former cricketers Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene decided to support current Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa.

title: GCE O/L practical exam suspended due to COVID-19 threat: Commissioner
content: The Examinations Department today said the Department had decided to suspend the GCE O/L, 2020 practical exams due to the prevailing COVID-19 threat in the country.

title: Total Covid-19 cases surpass 67,000
content: A total of 704 new COVID-19 patients were reported within today bringing the total number of cases in the country to 67,113, the Government Information Department said.

title: COVID situation not yet gone out of hand: Health Ministry
content: The COVID-19 situation in the country has not yet gone out of hand, despite an average of 800 cases being reported every day, Deputy Director General of Health Services Dr. Hemantha Herath said today.

title: SP Governor tests COVID-19 positive
content: Southern Province Governor Willy Gamage said he was today confirmed to have been infected with COVID-19 virus.

title: Schools in Gampaha, Kalutara to reopen Feb. 15
content: It has been recommended to reopen 589 schools out of 590 in the Gampaha District and 442 out of 446 schools in the Kalutara District on February 15, Education Ministry said.

title: Daily COVID cases exceed 800 for the third consecutive day
content: The total number of COVID-19 cases in the country exceeded 800 mark for the third consecutive day.

title: US to provide health rooms to 120 schools
content: The United States have initiated a project to set up health rooms at 120 schools around the country to ensure basic precautionary measures against COVID-19, the US Embassy said.

title: Ashantha de Mel resigns
content: The Chairman of the national cricket Selection Committee Ashantha de Mel has resigned from the post, for ’’personal reasons’’.

title: SL to receive over 500,000 AstraZeneca vaccines from India on Thursday, says Govt.
content: The Government of India has decided to grant over 500,000 vaccines manufactured in India to Sri Lanka and the consignment is scheduled to arrive on Thursday (28), the Government said today.

title: Isolation orders lifted in 10 GN Divisions in Kalmunai
content: The isolation order in several Grama Niladari Divisions in Kalmunai has been lifted from 6 a.m. today, head of the National Operation Centre for Prevention of COVID-19 Outbreak Army Commander General Shavendra Silva said.

title: Prison Supdt. caught while giving mobile phone to prisoner
content: A superintendent attached to a Colombo Remand Prison was suspended for handing a mobile phone to a remand prisoner.

title: Sooriyawewa farmers’ hunger strike: Two hospitalised
content: Two farmers among those on hunger strike at Valsapugala in Sooriyawewa have been admitted to the hospital as their health conditions deteriorate.

title: President congratulates Joe Biden and kamala Harris
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has congratulated President Joe Biden, who assumed duties as the 46th President of the United States.

title: Sri Lanka in talks with major airlines: Minister
content: Sri Lanka is in talks with major airlines to resume passenger flights to the country.

title: Covid-19 spread in Dalada Maligawa: SJB asks Health Minister to resign
content: The main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) today called for the resignation of Health Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi saying she should take the blame for failure to contain the COVID-19 pandemic in Sri Lanka which had now affected the historical Dalada Maligawa in Kandy.

title: Several GN divisions in Minuwangoda, Matale isolated
content: Two Grama Niladhari Divisions in Minuwangoda Police and three Grama Niladhari Divisions in Matale police area have been declared as isolated areas with immediate effect, Army Commander Shavendra Silva said.

title: Four more COVID-19 deaths reported
content: Four more persons succumbed to COVID-19 increasing the death toll to 255, the Government Information Department said.

title: Japan temporarily bans entry from all visitors including Sri Lanka
content: The Japanese Government has tightened its border restrictions by temporarily banning the entry of visitors from all countries including Sri Lanka due to the coronavirus pandemic, effective today.

title: 22kg of rare crystal gem found in Avissawella
content: A rare crystal gem stone weighing around 22kg has been found in a mine in Dehiyagala in Avissawella, the National Gem and Jewellery Authority said.

title: Reopening of schools: No one can run away from responsibility: Health Ministry
content: While saying that it was unfair to say that health authorities alone should take the responsibility for any possible spike of Covid cases with reopening of schools, Deputy Director-General of Public Health Services, Dr. Hemantha Herath today said it was a responsibility of all citizens.

title: Rauff Hakeem tests COVID-19 positive
content: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Leader and MP Rauff Hakeem has been tested positive for COVID-19 today.

title: Fmr. Directors of Swarnamahal Jewellers Ltd re-arrested
content: The Criminal Investigation Department re-arrested Jeewaka Edirisinghe, Anjalee Edirisinghe and Asanka Edirisinghe, the former directors of ETI Finance Limited a short while ago on charges of Criminal Misappropriation, Cheating, Money Laundering & other offences, Police Spokesman DIG Ajith Rohana said.

title: SL Army establishes Agriculture and Livestock Corps Unit
content: The Sri Lanka Army today established the Agriculture and Livestock Corps Unit under the directive of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Army Commander General Shavendra Silva said.

title: Nalaka Edirisinghe surrenders to CID
content: Nalaka Edirisinghe, the 4th suspect in ETI Finance Limited and  Swarnamahal Jewellers Ltd case surrendered to the Criminal Investigation Department this morning, Police Spokesman DIG Ajith Rohana said.

title: Moeen Ali tests positive for COVID-19 ahead of England’s tour of Sri Lanka
content: England all-rounder Moeen Ali has tested positive for COVID-19 upon arriving in Sri Lanka and will self-isolate for 10 days, as will fast bowler Chris Woakes who was deemed a possible close contact, England’s cricket board said on Monday.

title: More trains to operate from tomorrow: SLSMU
content: The Railways Department has decided to increase the number of train services operating on all lines with effect from tomorrow, the Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLSMU) said.

title: Covid-19 cases reported today surge to 555
content: The total number of Covid-19 cases reported today increased to 555 with 235 more cases being reported today, the Government Information Department said.

title: Police locate one of five escaped inmates in Madampe
content: An inmate among the five who escaped while receiving treatment at the Gallella Covid Treatment Centre in Polonnaruwa, had been arrested in the Madampe area, Police Spokesman DIG Ajith Rohana said.

title: 'Do not panic. We are ready for this': Health Ministry
content: Three tourists who arrived from Ukraine and tested positive for the COVID-19 have been placed under treatment at a center set up at the hotel they have been housed in, and their first contacts have also been identified, an official from the Health Ministry told Daily Mirror.

title: Traditional medicinal products enhances immunity
content: Traditional medicinal products which enhance immunity have been able to contain the COVID- 19 pandemic in Sri Lanka to some extent, an official said over the weekend.

title: Health Ministry urges not to create fake news on COVID-19 deaths
content: The Health Ministry today urged people to refrain from creating fake news in connection with deaths occur due to COVID-19.

title: CID to probe persons involved in corruption at DMT: Dilum Amunugama
content: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) has launched an investigation on those who have  involved in corrupt activities at the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), Transport State Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: Singapore confirms first case of new coronavirus variant found in UK
content: Singapore has confirmed its first case of the new coronavirus variant found in the United Kingdom, the city-state said, while 11 others who were already in quarantine had returned preliminarily positive results for the new strain.

title: SC rejects FR petition on Z-score
content: The Supreme Court today rejected a Fundamental Rights Petition filed by a group of students seeking an interim injunction suspending admission of students to engineering and physics faculties based on Z-score.

title: 364 Covid-19 cases reported today
content: A total of 364 individuals tested positive for Covid-19 within today raising the total number of cases in the country to 37,631, the Government Information Department said.

title: CNSA handed over 1,731 grams of moon samples to CAS
content: China’s National Space Administration (CNSA) on Saturday handed over the 1,731 grams of lunar samples brought back by the Chang’e-5 probe to the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) at a ceremony held in Beijing, initiating relevant work on storage, analysis, and research of the samples.

title: Over 600 DMT staffers to be transferred
content: More than 600 employees serving at the Motor Traffic Department (DMT) to receive transfer orders considering the general complaints received about the staff members, DMT Commissioner-General Sumith Alahakoon said.

title: Sri Lanka not expecting vaccine soon
content: Sri Lanka is not expecting a coronavirus vaccine anytime soon from any country as not a single vaccine has been approved by the World Health Organisation (WHO).

title: No damage to documents in Supreme Court fire; CID to probe incident
content: While saying that the Criminal Investigations Department has launched an investigation into the fire that erupted at the Supreme Court complex today, Police Spokesman Ajith Rohana said neither documents nor any registry had been damaged in the fire.

title: Google suffers massive outage taking YouTube, Gmail, Docs & more offline
content: Google is currently facing an outage In Sri Lanka and several other countries such as India. Google search, Docs, Drive, Gmail and YouTube, among others were reported to be not working, prompting messages of error.

title: Three arrested with links to drugs trafficking network in Dubai
content: Three suspects, including a woman have been arrested in connection with their involvement with drug trafficking network being operated from Dubai, UAE.

title: UNP has mature leaders who can lead a grand alliance
content: It is the UNP which should lead a grand opposition alliance if such a political force is to be established to take on the government, UNP Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene said yesterday.

title: I revived fishing industry by eating raw fish: Wedaarachchi
content: Justifying his act of publicly eating a raw fish, SJB MP Dilip Wedaarachchi yesterday told Parliament that he was happy about his act.

title: All members of PUCSL step down
content: All members of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) have stepped down from their posts, PUCSL sources confirmed.

title: Two more Covid-19 patients pass away
content: Two more Covid-19 related deaths were reported today (07) rising  the death toll to 142, the Department of Government Information said.

title: Park & Ride, E-ticketing system from Jan 1, Transport State Minister
content: While implementing the ‘Park & Ride’ system, the Transport Ministry is to introduce the ‘E-ticketing’ system for buses from January 1, Transport State Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: Closure of schools in Kandy extended by another week
content: Central Province Governor Lalith U Gamage today decided to extend the closure of schools within the Kandy city limits by another week (December 11).

title: Covid patient spits at PHI officer
content: A Covid-19 infected person from Atulugama, Bandaragama has spat on the face of a PHI who attempted to transfer the patient for medical treatment, police said.

title: Police force will be increased to 100,000: Rear Admiral Sarath Weerasekara
content: The Police Force that remains currently at 80,000 personnel will be increased to 100,000 to fight crimes in a more successful and vigorous manner, Minister of Public Security Rear Admiral Sarath Weerasekara said.

title: Sudarshani sworn in as State Minister of Covid-19 Prevention
content: Dr. Sudarshani Fernandopulle was sworn in as the State Minister for Primary Health Services, Infectious Diseases and Covid-19 Prevention before President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the President’s Media Division said.

title: 274 more Covid-19 patients detected
content: A total of 274 more individuals have tested positive for Covid-19 surging the total positive cases in Sri Lanka to 22,775, the Health Ministry said.

title: No risk of emerging new Covid clusters: Army Chief
content: Army Commander Shavendra Silva yesterday said that there is no risk of emerging new Covid19 clusters across the country except the remaining clusters despite several cases identified in several areas.

title: Ministry calls for teachers' feedback on O/L syllabus coverage
content: The Education Ministry has called for feedback from teachers on the extent to which the G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) syllabus had been covered in classroom for students.

title: 131 more Covid-19 cases reported; 335 cases today
content: A total of 131 fresh Covid-19 patients were identified rising the total Covid-19 cases in the country to 20,506, the Government Information Department said.

title: SLC and ICC Anti-Corruption units to monitor LPL
content: The Lanka Premier League 2020 will have all the necessary measures in place to protect the absolute integrity of the tournament and will adopt a zero-tolerance policy against any wrongdoing, the Sri Laka Cricket (SLC) said.

title: CA issues writ order quashing indictments against Janaka Bandara tennakoon
content: The Court of Appeal today issued a writ order quashing the indictments served against Minister Janaka Bandara Tennakoon in connection with a murder in 1999, ruling that it was illegal.

title: 233 more fresh Covid-19 cases reported
content: A total of 233 Covid-19 patients were detected today increasing the total positive cases in the county to 18,308, Army Commander Shavendra Silva said.

title: Talaimannar proposed to bury Muslim COVID-19 victims
content: Talaimannar has been proposed to bury Muslim coronavirus victims, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Joe Biden likely to break barriers, pick woman to lead Pentagon
content: President-elect Joe Biden is expected to take a historic step and select a woman to head the Pentagon for the first time, shattering one of the few remaining barriers to women in the department and the presidential Cabinet.

title: Will not internationalise Sri Lanka’s internal issues: SJB
content: Samagi Jana Balawegaya does not practice ‘tale carrying politics’ but will only voice the issues only internally, Leader of Opposition Sajith Premadasa told Parliament yesterday.

title: 30 per cent of Colombo’s high-risk areas test COVID positive
content: At least 30 people out of 100 people who are randomly tested in high-risk areas within the Colombo city detected as COVID positive, forcing the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) to increase the number of PCR tests by five fold, Chief Medical Officer Dr Ruwan Wijayamuni said today.

title: Red alert for 16 districts over severe lightning: Met Dept.
content: A Red alert on thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning was issued for 16 districts, the Department of Meteorology said today.

title: 90 Sri Lankans have died abroad due to COVID-19 so far
content: The number of Sri Lankan nationals, died abroad from COVID-19 has increased to 90, Foreign Affairs Ministry (FAM) told Daily Mirror today.

title: LPL gets government green-light
content: The Health Ministry has finally given the permission to play the Lanka Premier League despite the worsening COVID 19 situation in the country.

title: Indian Air Chief assures continued support to new SL Air Chief
content: The Indian Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh Bhadauria has assured newly appointed Sri Lanka Air Force Commander Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana of India’s continuing support in further cementing the strong defence co-operation between India and Sri Lanka towards greater security in the region.

title: 34 employees at Horana Bodyline, test positive for Covid-19; Management
content: Thirty-four (34) employees of Horana Bodyline apparel factory tested positive for Covid-19 on Sunday, the MAS holdings said.

title: New Chinese Ambassador arrives
content: New Ambassador-designate of China to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong arrived on Friday evening and he is to undergo self-quarantine for two weeks, the Chinese Embassy in Colombo announced.

title: Speaker signs 20A making it effective from today
content: Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardene placed his signature on 20th Amendment to the Constitution a short while ago making it effective from today.

title: Probe spread of COVID-19 from Brandix: AG to police
content: Attorney General Dappula De Livera today directed the Acting IGP to submit a report within two weeks, after investigating the COVID-19 spread from Brandix.

title: SLMC MPs reached agreement with MR
content: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Parliamentarians who voted in support of the 20th Amendment to the Constitution last week, had reached an understanding with Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa before the vote.

title: Over 40,000 currently under quarantine
content: Over 40,000 individuals are currently under quarantine process across the country of which nearly 33,000 individuals are observed and monitored by PHIs while 7,128 persons are quarantined in 73 quarantine centres operated by the Army in the aftermath of the Minuwangoda cluster.

title: SJB owner justifies decision to vote in favour
content: SJB MP Diana Gamage who is the owner of ’Ape Jathika Peramuna,’ which later converted into Samagi Jana Balawegaya and had voted in favour of the 20th Amendment yesterday said she did not expect anything in return for voting with the government.

title: Sub-clusters emerged from Minuwangoda cluster: Epidemiology Chief
content: There is always a possibility of sub-clusters emerging from the Minuwangoda main cluster and one has already been created from a private apparel factory in Katunayake, Chief Epidemiologist Dr Sudath Samaraweera said today.

title: Govt. to ban certain plastic and polythene products from January
content: The Cabinet has approved to ban on several one-time -use plastic and polythene products from January 1 next year, Cabinet Co-spokesman Udaya Gammanpila said.

title: Bathiudeen remanded till October 27
content: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rishad Bathiudeen was remanded till October 27 by the Colombo Fort Magistrates’ Court today.

title: Rosy tested negative for COVID-19
content: Colombo Mayor Rosy Senanayake has been tested negative for COVID19 ,CMC Chief Medical officer Dr.ruwan Wijayamuni said yesterday.

title: Over 7,000 PCR test results still awaited in Gampaha district
content: More than 18,000 PCR tests have been conducted in the Gampaha District till now and results of 7,020 persons are yet to be released, Regional Medical Health Officer Dr. Migara Epa said.

title: 113 more test positive for COVID-19
content: A total of 113 more people from Minuwangoda cluster tested positive for Covid-19, Army Commander Shavendra Silva said.

title: Riyaj Bathiudeen files writ petition to prevent re-arrest
content: Former Minister Rishad Bathiudeen’s brother Riyaj Bathiudeen filed a writ petition in the Court of Appeal today seeking an order to prevent his re-arrest.

title: Notices issued to Ravi & Arjun to appear in Court
content: Colombo High Court Judge Adithya Patabandi issued notices on former finance minister Ravi Karunanayake and Perpetual Treasuries Limited Director Arjun Aloysius to appear in Court on November 18 over Mr. Karunanayake and family acquiring a housing unit at Monarch Apartments.

title: Three wards, operation theatre at National Hospital closed
content: Three Wards and an operation theatre at the National Hospital, Colombo has been temporarily closed after three minor staff members of the hospital tested positive for Covid-19.

title: India has no moral right to ask for implementation of 13A: Weerasekera
content: India has no moral right to ask for the fully implementation of the 13th amendment to the Constitution, Local Government and Provincial Councils Minister Sarath Weerasekera told Parliament yesterday.

title: Transmission of virus from recent Covid-19 patients to others extremely high
content: Transmission of the virus from recent Minuwangoda Covid-19 patients to others is extremely high, as the virus is highly infectious than in previous cases, Chief Epidemiologist Dr Sudath Samaraweera said.

title: Students found with COVID-19 symptoms will get special centres: Ministry
content: If students found with COVID-19 symptoms or respiratory difficulties, arrangements will be made for them to sit for exams at special examinations centres, Education Ministry Secretary Senior Professor Kapila C.K. Perera said.

title: Present cluster most challenging to be tackled- Dr. Samaraweera
content: The newest COVID-19 cluster reported from the Minuwangoda area is the most difficult one to be tackled in the country since the point of origin of its first infection is not yet established, Chief Epidemiologist of the Academy of Epidemic Disease Unit Dr. Sudath Samaraweera yesterday said

title: 16-year-old daughter of Divulapitiya patient tests positive for COVID-19
content: The 16-year-old daughter of the COVID-19 patient detected from Divulapitiya earlier today also tested positive for the Coronavirus, Army Commander Shavendra Silva said.

title: Approval granted to tow MT New Diamond away from Sri Lankan waters
content: Maritime Rescue Co-ordination Centre (MRCC) has permitted the owner of the ’MT New Diamond to tow the vessel away from the Sri Lankan waters on condition that the ship owner pays the relevant compensation, Navy Spokesman Captain Indika De Silva said.

title: Four arrested with two Conch Shells in Imaduwa
content: Four persons were arrested by the STF personnel in Imaduwa, Galle for attempting to sell two Conch Shells.

title: PCoI on Easter Sunday Attacks - Yahapalana Govt. didn’t pay attention: Wijeyadasa
content: If the former yahapalana government had paid attention to the statements made in the Parliament regarding the involvement of Sri Lankans in the Islamic State (IS) organization, the coordinated terror attacks on April 21 and the destruction of the UNP could have been prevented, MP Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe told the PCoI on the Easter Sunday attacks.

title: No risk of contracting Coronavirus via imported food
content: Clarifying on a fear prevailing in society that the Coronavirus could be transmitted via food imported from foreign countries, Chief Epidemiologist of the Epidemiology Unit, Dr Sudath Samaraweera said there was no risk of the virus spreading via imported food items.

title: Russian tests negative for COVID-19 in final PCR test
content: The Russian crew member who earlier tested positive for Covid-19 in Matara, has been tested negative in the final PCR test conducted on him, Army Commander Shavendra Silva said today (25).

title: Epidemiology chief concerned over double standards of some media institutions
content: Chief Epidemiologist of the Epidemiology Unit, Dr. Sudath Samaraweera raised concerns regarding the double standards of some media institutions over adhering to COVID-19 guidelines.

title: SL Embassy in Qatar closed after staffer tests positive for Covid-19
content: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Qatar has been closed from September 22 until October 5, after a staff member of the Embassy tested positive for COVID-19.

title: MR, Modi to hold bilateral talks this month
content: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and his Indian counterpart, Narendra Modi will hold bilateral discussions on September 26 to further strengthen ties between the two governments, as well as discuss possible development projects between India and Sri Lanka, sources from the Prime Minister’s office told Daily Mirror yesterday.

title: Former CNI failed to fulfill responsibilities: Former Def.Sec.
content: Former Chief of National Intelligence (CNI) Sisira Mendis had failed to fulfil the responsibility assigned to him during the period of the former ’Yahapalana’ government, a former Defence Secretary, Karunasena Hettiarachchi informed the PCoI probing the Easter Sunday attacks, on Thursday.

title: Ex-CID Director Shani Abeysekara further remanded
content: Former Criminal Investigation Department (CID) Director Shani Abeysekara and two others were further remanded till October 02 by Gampaha Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Complete 100,000 kms of road development project by 2024: President tells officials
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has instructed the officials to complete the national programme to develop 100,000 kilometres of roads by 2024, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Will compete for party leadership too: Ruwan
content: Former State Minister of Defence Ruwan Wijewardene who was elected as the new Deputy Leader of the UNP said he will compete for the party leadership as well in the future.

title: Sri Lankan maid tortured to death in Kuwait
content: A Kuwaiti couple are being investigated for torturing a 46-year-old Sri Lankan maid to death, local media reported.

title: Proposed 20A open to changes before being passed
content: The proposed 20th Amendment to the Constitution could be drastically changed from the draft that has been gazetted now after incorporating suitable and agreeable proposals and changes by the public, intelligentsia, clergy and any other section of the society before it is passed in Parliament, Co-Cabinet spokesman Udaya Gammanpila said today.

title: Reignited fire on oil tanker controlled: Navy
content: The disaster management teams deployed to control the fire onboard the MT New Diamond crude oil tanker, were able to successfully control the fire by this morning, the Navy said. The fire reignited on Monday due to bad weather and continued until this morning.

title: 1.2mn youths & adults in SL illiterate: Education Minister
content: At least 1.2 million youths and adults from the country’s population is still illiterate, Education Minister Prof. G.L. Pieris said.

title: Experts arrive to join efforts to salvage burning tanker off Sri Lanka
content: A team of British experts had arrived at the Mattala Airport on a special flight this morning to investigate the incident of the New Diamond ship which caught fire in the East Coast of Sri Lanka.

title: UNP Youth wing wants Ruwan as new leader
content: The youth wing of the UNP Jathika Yovun Peramuna has passed a resolution calling for the appointment of former State Minister Ruwan Wijewardene as the new party leader, its office bearers said today.

title: PCoI on Easter Sunday Attacks informs Hakeem to appear at Police Unit
content: The Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) probing the Easter Sunday Attacks today informed former minister Ruaff Hakeem to appear in the Police Unit at the PCoI to give a statement on Friday (4).

title: Recruitment of under-aged persons is illegal: Fisheries Minister
content: Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda said yesterday it is illegal to recruit or take away from his place of residence, any individual under 18 years of age to work under the International Law and Sri Lankan operational law, and therefore requested fishermen to refrain from using such under-aged persons in fisheries activities.

title: 287 migrant workers return from Maldives
content: A SriLankan Airlines flight carrying  287 Sri Lankan migrant workers who were stranded in the Maldives arrived at the Mattala Airport this afternoon.

title: 4 DIGs among 21 senior police officers transferred
content: Twenty-one senior police officers including four Deputy Inspector Generals of Police (DIGs) have been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Parliament debates VOA today
content: Parliament will take up the two day debate on Rs.1.6 trillion Vote On Account (VOA) today, which is expected to go on from 9.30a.m. to 6.30p.m. sans a lunch break on both days.

title: Will preserve 19A’s progressive features: Gammanpila
content: The progressive features of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution will be preserved when abolishing it, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya Leader, Minister Udaya Gammanpila said yesterday.

title: Karu says willing to accept UNP leadership
content: Former Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has informed the United National Party (UNP) today that he is ready to accept the leadership of the UNP.

title: Government’s Policy Statement passed without a vote
content: The Government’s Policy Statement which was presented in Parliament yesterday by President Gotabhaya Rajapaksa was passed without a vote today.

title: Ranjith Siyambalapitiya selected as Dy. Speaker
content: Kegalle District MP Ranjith Siyambalapitiya was selected as the Deputy Speaker of the ninth Parliament while Jaffna district MP Angajan Ramanathan as the Deputy Chairman of Committees.

title: Mauritius arrests captain of Japan-owned ship that leaked oil along coast
content: Mauritian authorities arrested Tuesday the Indian captain of a Japanese-owned ship that ran aground off the island nation’s coast, spewing tonnes of oil into pristine waters, police said.

title: 50% of power supply restored: CEB Chairman
content: The disrupted power supply was restored up to fifty per cent after six hours, Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Chairman Vijitha Herath said.

title: Over 182,600 PCR tests conducted in Sri Lanka
content: Nearly 182,681 Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests have been carried out in Sri Lanka as of today with 2,732 tests carried out yesterday, the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) said.

title: 7 Lankans found with tonnes of shark, remanded in Seychelles
content: Seven crew members of a Sri Lankan-flagged fishing vessel have been remanded for 14 days by the Seychelles’ Supreme Court on suspicion of illegal fishing.

title: PM gets Finance, Buddha Sasana & Urban Development Ministries
content: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa was appointed as the Minister Finance, Buddha Sasana & Religious and Cultural Affairs and the Minister of Urban Development and Housing.

title: I am willing to lead UNP if party members want me to: Ruwan
content: UNP will decide on the best option with regard to the new leader of the party and on the national list slot, Party’s Deputy General Secretary Ruwan Wijewardene said yesterday.

title: Increasing suppression of dissent in Sri Lanka- HRW
content: The Sri Lankan government of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is waging a campaign of fear and intimidation against human rights activists, journalists, lawyers, and others challenging government policy, Human Rights Watch said today.

title: Ratnapura District: SLPP secures 8 seats, SJB 3
content: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has secured 8 seats in the Ratnapura District obtaining a total of 446,668 votes while the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has secured three seats with a total of 155,759 votes and Jathika Jana Balawegaya has obtained 17,611 votes.

title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected at some places
content: Heavy showers above 100 mm were expected at some places in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle, Matara and Kaluthara districts, Department of Meteorology said today.

title: Don’t fear, polling stations are safe: Health authorities
content: Health authorities today asked voters not to be frightened about coming to the polling stations and said the applying of ink on the fingers would be carried out in a safe manner.

title: Woman shot dead in Beliatta
content: A 52-year-old woman was killed when she was shot at near a house at Dammulla in Beliatta this morning.

title: Fmr CID Director Shani arrested
content: Former Director of the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) SSP Shani Abeysekara has been arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division this morning, Police Spokesman Jaliya Senaratne said.

title: All schools to start from August 10 under several stages: Edu. Ministry
content: The Education Ministry had decided to restart all Government and Government approved private schools from August 10 under several stages following recommendations of the health officials.

title: Notices issued to 14 VIPs including Maithri & RW
content: Notices were issued to 14 VIPs including former President Maithripala Sirisena and former Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to present a legal representation to the PCoI probing the Easter Sunday attacks, during the testimony of current SDIG and former Director of State Intelligence Service (SIS) Nilantha Jayawardena yesterday.

title: 39 street racers arrested for unauthorized racing in Piliyandala
content: At least 39 alleged street racers were arrested along with 27 motorcycles for unauthorized racing along the Piliyandala-Kesbewa bypass road last night.

title: Decide if you will destroy UNP or not: RW to traditional UNPers
content: Those who traditionally voted for the UNP should decide whether they are going to destroy the party or not at this election, UNP Leader and former Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: Final decision on PHIs’ TU action tomorrow
content: The final decision on the ongoing trade union action carried out by the Public Health Inspectors is to be taken tomorrow , PHIs’ Union President Upul Rohana said today.

title: STF recover a cache of military-ware
content: A cache of military items containing military uniforms, weapons and live ammunition, was found from a house in Bowala, Walasmulla by Special Task Force yesterday, police said.

title: COVID-19: WHO reports record single-day global increase in cases
content: The number of new cases of coronavirus rose by almost 260,000 in 24 hours - the largest single-day increase since the pandemic began, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Saturday.

title: SL joins int’l community in calling Israel to abandon planned annexation
content: Sri Lanka joined the international community in its call on the Israel Government to comply with international law and abandon the planned annexation and urges all parties to continue the dialogue towards peace.

title: Patients with burn injuries at CNH up again after COVID-19
content: Colombo National Hospital’s (CNH) Burns and Reconstructive Surgical Unit, which was empty during the COVID-19 pandemic, has filled with patients again, the Head of the Surgical Unit Consultant Surgeon Dr. Dulip Perera said.

title: 647 people in Polonnaruwa sent for quarantine
content: At least 647 people who had contacts with COVID-19 patients in Polonnaruwa District had been sent to quarantine, Regional Health Services Office said.

title: Increase island-wide PCR tests to 5,000 per day: GMOA
content: In the wake of new Covid-19 cases being reported from the Kandakadu Treatment and Rehabilitation Centre, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) reiterated the health authorities to increase the number of PCR tests in the country.

title: 87 more COVID-19 infected patients reported from Kandakadu
content: Eighty seven more COVID-19 infected patients were reported from the Kandakadu Rehabilitation Centre increasing total cases at the Centre to 340, Government Information Department said.

title: Cabinet nod to destroy confiscated Beedi Leaves
content: Taking into consideration the adverse impact on the health of those who consume the Beedi leaves, the Cabinet of Ministers today decided to destroy stocks of Beedi Leaves that are confiscated in future.

title: PCoI on Easter attacks: ISIS threats were a new situation we faced: Witness
content: Concept paper on countering potential threats of ISIS, which was prepared by the officers attached to Chief of National Intelligence (CNI) in 2016, was submitted to then Law and Order Minister Sagala Ratnayaka, it was informed at the PCoI probing the Easter Sunday attacks yesterday.

title: Weddings can now host upto 300 persons
content: The Health Ministry said today that guests at a wedding should be limited to 50 per cent of the seating capacity of the size of the reception hall or up to a maximum of 300 persons. Earlier, only 100 persons were allowed at a wedding.

title: Malaka Silva assault case: Scottish Engineer’s name cleared
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court on Friday concluded the counter case filed by Malaka Silva, son of former Minister Mervyn Sliva, against Scottish Engineer James Cassserly who was allegedly involved in a brawl with Malaka Silva at a nightclub in 2014.

title: SL returnee from India test positive during quarantine at home
content: A Sri Lankan man arrived from India was diagnosed as a Covid-19 patient today at a PCR test conducted while he was in self-quarantine at his home in Jinthupitiya, the Government said in a statement.

title: Defence Secretary assures to complete reconstruction work of St. Anthony’s Shrine soon
content: Defence Secretary Maj.Gen. (Retd) Kamal Gunaratne, who visited the St. Anthony’s Shrine, Kochchikade, yesterday (July 1), has taken swift measures to strengthen security and also assured to complete the balance reconstruction work of the Shrine, which was badly damaged due to the Easter Sunday bomb attack, soon.

title: Displaying of political adverts during film screenings prohibited: EC
content: The National Elections Commission has informed the National Film Corporation not to display advertisements for the promotion of a candidate or a political party during film screenings, police said.

title: Pompeo reaffirms support to SL’s development & sovereignty
content: US Secretary of State Michael R. Pompeo today spoke to Foreign Relations Minister Dinesh Gunawardena to reaffirm the US partnership with the people of Sri Lanka and its commitment to supporting the country’s development and sovereignty, a spokesperson said.

title: CC accepts resignation of Prof. Dhanapala
content: The Constitutional Council (CC) has accepted the resignation letter sent by its member Prof. Jayantha Dhanapala, Parliament sources said yesterday.

title: Two cops arrested for possession of illicit cigarettes
content: Two Police constables have been arrested by the STF for possession of 42 cartons of illicit cigarettes, which have a street value of over half a million of rupees, in Colombo Fort yesterday.

title: Election Complaints Center established
content: A National Election Complaints Center has been established to receive complaints regarding promotions or demotions of any party/ group/ candidate or any action causing hindrance to the conduct of free and fair election during the election period, the National Election Commission said.

title: 243 Indian workers, tourists fly home
content: A total of 243 Indians including workers and tourists who were stranded in Sri Lanka due to COVID-19 pandemic departed to India this morning, the Katunayake airport Duty Manager said.

title: Charred human remains found at Dambulla
content: The charred remains of an unidentified person were discovered yesterday at Gonawewa in Dambulla, Police said.

title: Ravi K. vindicates President’s criticism on CB officials
content: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is correct in blaming the Central Bank officials, UNP Assistant Leader Ravi Karunanayake said today.

title: Arrest warrants issued on ETI directors
content: The Colombo Additional Magistrate today issued arrest warrants on four directors of the Edirisinghe Trust Investments (ETI) holdings for not appearing in court.

title: Two men die after drowning in Walawe river
content: Two males aged 22 and 20 died, after drowning in the Walawe river in Welipotha Yaya, Balangoda today, police said.

title: 15-hour water cut in Colombo this Sunday
content: The water supply will be interrupted for 15 hours from 9 a.m. to 12 midnight in Colombo 02, 03, 07, 08 and 10 this Sunday (14), the National Water Supply and Distribution Board said today.

title: Gazette issued declaring General Elections
content: The Gazette notification announcing the General Elections on August 5, 2020 was published a short while ago.

title: Preferential numbers of candidates gazetted
content: The extraordinary gazette with preferential numbers of candidates contesting the General Elections 2020 was published by the Government Printing Department a short while ago.

title: Shooting at Wasgamuwa National Park kills one
content: A 26-year old had been killed when his firearm accidentally discharged at the Wasgamuwa National Park last night, the Police said.

title: A Penumbral Lunar Eclipse tomorrow night
content: The second penumbral lunar eclipse of 2020 will begin on June 5th night at 11.15 p.m. Sri Lanka Standard Time, when the shadow of the Earth falls on the Moon said Prof. Chandana Jayaratne, the Director of Astronomy and Space Science Unit, Department of Physics, Colombo University.

title: Woman dies in wasp attack, seven injured
content: A 55-year-old woman died and seven others were injured in a wasp attack while they were plucking tea leaves at an estate in Lindula this evening, police said.

title: Consideration of FR petitions resumes
content: The consideration of the Fundamental Right petitions filed challenging the General Elections date commenced before the Supreme Court for the 10th day today.

title: COVID-19 recoveries increase to 754
content: The number of COVID-19 recoveries increased to 754 today as nine patients were discharged from the hospitals after being recovered, the Health Ministry said.

title: Covid-19 cases in Sri Lanka surge to 1469
content: Covid-19 cases in Sri Lanka have surged to 1469 after the country witnessed highest single-day rise on Wednesday (27). A total of 150 patients were detected with Covid-19 during the day.

title: Bandula still hopeful of building cricket stadium in Homagama
content: Higher Education Minister Bandula Gunawardana said today that he is still hopeful of building the Homagama International Cricket Stadium.

title: Nearly 2,000 PCR tests within yesterday
content: A total of 1,998 Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests were carried out yesterday, Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) said.

title: Prof. Hoole need not go under quarantine: EC Chairman
content: Election Commission (EC) Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya told the Daily Mirror that EC member Prof. Rathnajeewan Hoole does not have to undergo quarantine and that he could come to the election office from Jaffna at any time he wants.

title: I’m a member of SLPP now: Mahinda Samarasinghe
content: While saying that the decision to remove his Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) membership was a laughing matter, former MP Mahinda Samarasinghe said his SLFP membership was automatically cancelled when he joined the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) in March.

title: I do not expect State bodies to do politics; President
content: While urging state institutions not to engage in politics, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said that state entities should earn enough income for their maintenance and the well-being of the employees.

title: Nineteen trains to operate from Monday
content: Nineteen trains are scheduled to be operated to Colombo from Monday (May 18), the Railways Department said.

title: Global coronavirus death toll exceeds 300,000
content: Global coronavirus deaths have passed 300,000 as infections approached 4.5 million, according to a Reuters tally, with the United States responsible for more than a quarter of all fatalities.

title: Fire at Deiyandara Magistrate’s Court record room
content: A fire has broken out in the record room of the Deiyandara Magistrate’s Court this morning, the Police said.

title: Iranian navy ship ’sunk by friendly fire
content: An Iranian navy ’’friendly fire’’ incident in which a ship was sunk has killed dozens of sailors, unofficial reports say.

title: Objectively assess circumstances before requesting to return to SL: Foreign Secretary
content: Foreign Relations Ministry Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha requested the Sri Lankans abroad to make an objective assessment of their circumstances before requesting to return to Sri Lanka.

title: 197 stranded Sri Lankans return from Dubai
content: A total of 197 Sri Lankans who were stranded in Dubai due to the COVID-19 pandemic has arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: 23-year-old soldier found dead at Dambulla Bus Terminal
content: A 23-year-old soldier from Pallepola was found dead outside the public toilet of the Dambulla Bus Terminal today, the Army said.

title: Conduct dengue eradication programmes before reopening academic institutions: Ministry
content: The Education Ministry has instructed the relevant officials to conduct a countrywide dengue prevention campaign at all academic institutions, which were closed due to COVID-19 pandemic, before reopening.

title: AG approves imposition of curfew
content: On the advise sought by the Acting IGP, the Attorney General has approved the imposition of curfew and other measures taken to curb the spread of Covid-19 by the Police, AG’s Coordination Officer State Counsel Nishara Jayaratne said.

title: Covid-19 brews trouble for tea amid disrupted supply
content: The coronavirus outbreak is causing a rare stir in the usually staid global tea market, with labour lockdowns stifling supplies just as millions in lockdown drive up demand for the beverage known for its immunity-boosting properties.

title: Ranjan gets credit pass for O/L English
content: Former MP Ranjan Ramanayake, who sat for the 2019 GCE Ordinary Level examination, has got a ’C’ for English.

title: 460 Covid-19 cases in Sri Lanka
content: A total number of 460 Covid-19 infected patients have been identified in Sri Lanka, the health ministry said.

title: New building for IDH from Moratuwa uni graduates
content: The Infectious Disease Hospital (IDH) would receive a building worth of Rs. 30 million from the Engineering Association of 92/93 of University of Moratuwa to house the new CT scan machine.

title: Two more COVID-19 patients recover
content: Two more COVID-19 infected patients have recovered and discharged from the hospital increasing the total number of recovered cases to 102, the Health Ministry said.

title: State bodies instructed how to resume work once curfew lifted
content: The Government has issued guidelines to heads of state entities especially in the district of Colombo as how to resume work after the curfew is lifted on Wednesday, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Another woman arrested over false info on COVID-19
content: A 50-year old woman has been arrested by the CID on charges of posting false and misleading content about COVID-19 on social media.

title: Ward of Kalubowila Hospital reopened after two weeks
content: The ward of the Teaching Hospital in Kalubowila, which was closed after a COVID-19 patient was identified, has been reopened after two weeks, Hospital Director Dr. Asela Gunewardena said today.

title: Covid-19 : UK death toll passes 10,000
content: The UK has recorded 710 new coronavirus deaths, taking the total number of people who have died in hospital with the virus past 10,000.

title: British visitors in SL advised to return
content: In an urgent message to British nationals and British tourists currently in Sri Lanka, British High Commissioner Sarah Hulton said they should immediately return to their country when flights are still available.

title: Send request letter before April 30: CBSL
content: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) said banks and financial institutions should be informed before April 30 to obtain deferment credit facilities.

title: Jayantha Ratnayake passes away
content: Popular musician Jayantha Ratnayake, the elder son of musician Victor Ratnayake, has passed away at the age of 51 at the Apeksha Hospital, Maharagama today.

title: HC, Magistrates bailed remand prisoners over 1500 cases on April 3, 4
content: Remand prisoners in more than 500 cases were granted bail by High Courts around the country while Magistrates have bailed prisoners in over 1000 cases on April 3 and 4, judicial sources revealed.

title: Do not sell death: Dr Anil Jasinghe
content: Director General of Health Services Dr Anil Jasinghe has made a statement urging shop owners to refrain from selling cigarette likening it to selling “death”.

title: Navy seizes over Rs.12.5 bn worth heroin and ICE
content: The navy has seized a haul of narcotic substances suspected to be of Crystal methamphetamine (ICE) and over 500kg of Cocaine worth over Rs. 12.5 billion during an operation conducted in high seas, Navy Spokesmen Isuru Sooriyabandara said.

title: Japan, China donates drug for COVID-19
content: Sri Lanka is to use anti-influenza drug ‘AVIGAN’ on COVID-19 patients on an experimental basis from next week, a senior Public official said today.

title: Govt. urges SL expats to safely remain in respective countries
content: The Government today urged Sri Lankan expatriates who wish to return, to safely remain where they are now until the risk of COVID-19 virus minimized.

title: Four more COVID-19 patients discharged from IDH
content: Four more Sri Lankan patients who were infected with COVID-19 were completely recovered and discharged from the Infectious Disease Hospital (IDH) today, Hospital sources said.

title: Colombo, Gampaha, Kalutara identified as high risk zones for COVID-19
content: Curfew in the Colombo Gampaha and Kalutara districts will continue until further notice as these have been identified as high risk zone for COVID-19, the Presidential Media Division said.

title: SL to contribute to SAARC emergency fund on COVID-19
content: Sri Lanka will contribute to the SAARC emergency fund proposed by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to combat the outbreak of COVID-19, a minister said.

title: COVID19; Jack Ma donates medical supplies to SL & 9 nations
content: The Jack Ma Foundation and Alibaba Foundation today announced plans to donate much-needed medical supplies to 10 more countries in Asia including Sri Lanka to help the global fight against COVID-19, Business Wire reported.

title: Cancer hospital urges visitors to stay away
content: Senior doctors at the Maharagama Cancer Hospital have urged visitors to refrain from visiting warded patients, warning that there would be a disaster if a COVID-19 infected individual visits the hospital.

title: CAA closes all entry points till March 25
content: “All international airports in the country will be closed for passenger arrivals from 0400 today to midnight 2359, March 25,” the Civil Aviation Authority source said.

title: Fixed price for dhal and canned fish
content: The prices of dhal and canned fish had been fixed with effect from midnight today as a concession to the public due to the prevailing situation in the country following the COVID-19 outbreak, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said.

title: Electricity supply to several areas disrupted
content: The Electricity supply to several areas of the country has been disrupted this evening due to lightning strike, Director of Development at the Ministry of Power and Energy Sulakshana Jayawardena told Daily Mirror.

title: Election will be held as planned: President
content: General Elections will be held as planned on April 25, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa today said speaking at SAARC leaders’ video conference on COVID-19.

title: Can easily defeat Opposition if it stays united: MR
content: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa said they can easily defeat the main opposition if they stick together instead of contesting the general election separately.

title: Govt. to seek EC advise on delaying polls
content: A senior minister yesterday told Daily Mirror the government would seek advise of the Election Commission (EC) whether the upcoming general election could be postponed in the event a coronavirus outbreak is reported in the country.

title: Army requests arrivals to comply with quarantine
content: While asserting that all facilities had been provided to the passengers who are being sent directly to quarantine centres as they arrive in the country, the army yesterday said, those who refuse to undergo the 14-day quarantine have the option of returning to the country they came from and if not, facing legal action which will be taken against them.

title: AG says PCoI has no authority to question AG’s functions
content: Attorney General Dappula De Livera has responded in writing to Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) Probing into Incidents of Political Victimization that it has no judicial power or authority to question the Attorney General’s functions before the Trial-at-Bar, the AG’s Coordinating Officer State Counsel Nishara Jayaratne said.

title: Talks with UNP collapse; SJB to contest under telephone
content: As talks between the United National Party (UNP) and Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) collapsed yesterday, the latter decided to contest the April 25 general election under the telephone symbol.

title: No Lankans or foreigners infected by coronovirus
content: None of the Sri Lankans or foreigners who had arrived in Sri Lanka from coronavirus-affected countries such as Korea, Italy or China were found to have been infected by the deadly virus though 14 Sri Lankans and two foreigners were under medical observation at several hospitals, Chief Epidemiologist Dr. Sudath Samaraweera said yesterday.

title: Govt. to discuss with EC
content: The government will speak to Elections Commission chairman Mahinda Deshapriya about his ruling that the government must not proceed with issuing appointment letters to unemployed graduates for job training, now that an election has been declared, cabinet spokesman and Minister Bandula Gunawardana said today.

title: I will contest from UNP: Mervyn
content: Former Minister Mervyn Silva said yesterday that he would contest the General Elections under United National Party (UNP) and its elephant symbol.

title: Passengers arriving from Italy to undergo 14-day quarantine
content: Weeks after the Health Ministry ordered all passengers arriving from China and South Korea to undergo a 14-day quarantine period following the outbreak of COVID-19, passengers arriving from Italy will also undergo 14-day isolation, officials from the Health Ministry told Daily Mirror yesterday.

title: 22 undergrads remanded till tomorrow
content: Twenty-two university students including the convenor of the Inter-University Students’ Federation (IUSF) Ven. Rathkarawwe Jinarathana Thera, who were arrested for protesting outside the University Grants Commission (UGC), were remanded till tomorrow by Colombo Additional Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today.

title: 25 students of Kelaniya Uni. suspended for removing CCTV cameras
content: The 25 undergraduates who were involved in the removal of newly installed CCTV cameras at the Kelaniya University premises were suspended for two years with effect from today, the Communication and Media Unit of the University said.

title: Travel ban on Namal lifted
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today lifted the overseas travel ban imposed on MP Namal Rajapaksa till July 23, 2020.

title: LCPP resumes power generation
content: The Lakvijaya Coal Power plant (LCPP) at Norochcholai has resumed power generation from today, a Power and Energy Ministry spokesman said.

title: I wanted Sainthamaruthu Gazette cancelled: Karuna
content: Former Deputy Minister and LTTE’s special commander for Ampara and Batticaloa Districts Vinaygamurthy Muralitharan alias Karuna Amman said on Saturday that it was he who persuaded President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa not to go ahead with the carving out of an Urban Council for the Sainthamaruthu region.

title: Southern Expressway up to H’tota: Opening tomorrow
content: The Godagama-Barawakumbuka stretch of the Southern Expressway (E-01) will be opened for public use tomorrow by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa at the Godagama interchange at 3.00 p.m, E-01 Deputy Director R.A.D. Kahatapitiya said.

title: CA orders not to arrest Gihan Pilapitiya without a warrant by Magistrate
content: The Court of Appeal today issued order that interdicted High Court Judge Gihan Pilapitya shall not be arrested without an order of a Competent Court.

title: Programme to develop 100,000 kms of roads to commence today
content: The National programme to develop 100,000 kilometres of roads would commence under the patronage of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa in Deltota today.

title: Govt. medical centres to go online soon: Dilum Amunugama
content: State Minister of Transport, Dilum Amunugama said today that instructions had been given to integrating all government medical centres into an online system for people to get their medical reports.

title: Fuel - Price reduction if world market trends continue
content: If the fuel price in the global market continues to drop, the government will consider a price reduction in the domestic market, Power, Energy, and Commuter Transport Management Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said yesterday.

title: Probe purchase of 78 vehicles during Yahapalanaya: JVP to CID
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today requested the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to launch an investigation into the purchase of 78 vehicles at a tune of Rs.1.6 billion during the previous government.

title: Drivers License medical tests to be done at 150 Hospitals: Minister
content: Medical tests for issuing driving licences for dual-purpose vehicles and light vehicles could be obtained at State hospitals in two weeks’ time, Transport State Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: Chief Epidemiologist dismisses media reports
content: Flatly dismissing certain media reports that Sri Lanka has detected a second patient infected with 2019 n-COV, Chief Epidemiologist of the Health Ministry, Dr. Sudath Samarajeewa said.

title: AG considers indicting Ranjan and judge Pilapitiya
content: The Attorney General considers indicting MP Ranjan Ramanayake and former high court Judge Gihan Pilapitiya in the High Court based on the matters that transpired in a leaked phone conversation between them.

title: Body of sergeant found with injuries
content: The body of a police sergeant attached to the Valachchenai was recovered with injuries at Mullamunai in Vavunathivu this morning, Police Media Division said.

title: Speaker to announce COPE names tomorrow
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya is expected to announce the names of new members, who would be included in the Parliamentary Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) and Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) tomorrow, Parliamentary sources said today.

title: Arrest ex- SriLankan CEO Kapila Chandrasena, wife over Air Bus deal: AG
content: Attorney General Dappula De Livera has directed the CID Director to obtain a warrant, arrest and produce former CEO of SriLankan Airlines Kapila Chandrasena and his wife Priyanka Niyomali Wijenayaka in the court.

title: Another Easter Sunday attack victim dies
content: The Easter Sunday carnage has claimed yet another life with one of the victims who was injured in the explosion succumbing to her injuries at the Ragama Hospital.

title: UNP Working Committee decides to continue with RW as leader
content: The Working Committee of the UNP today decided to continue with Ranil Wickremesinghe as the UNP leader, the party said.

title: Govt. announces MRP for face-masks
content: The Health Ministry said today a maximum retail price (MRP) for face-masks had been stipulated after traders were found selling them for exorbitant prices owing to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: SL stops On-arrival-visas for Chinese travellers
content: Issuing of ‘On arrival visas’ for tourists from China has been suspended with immediate effect, due to the current coronavirus situation, Health Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi said.

title: Another two passengers suspicious of coronavirus detected at BIA: BIA medical Unit
content: Another two more passengers, suspected to be infected with corona-virus, was detected yesterday evening at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), BIA medical unit Dr. Chandika Bandara Wickramasuriya said.

title: Preventive action by SriLankan on Corona-virus outbreak
content: SriLankan Airlines has implemented a series of precautionary measures to mitigate the risks from the current corona-virus epidemic in the Far East, with the safety and well-being of its valued passengers and staff being of paramount importance, the airline said.

title: Three nabbed with gold biscuits worth Rs.50 mn
content: Three suspects including a 16-year-old boy was arrested by the Police Narcotic Bureau officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with gold biscuits worth more than Rs.50 million this morning, airport senior official said.

title: Judge Pilapitiya interdicted
content: Embiliptiya High Court Judge Gihan Pipalitiya has been interdicted by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the Judicial Service Commission (JSC) said today.

title: Pujith, Hemasiri further remanded
content: Former IGP Pujith Jayasundera and former Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando were further remanded until February 3 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage today.

title: CID requests Court to order Dr. Shafi to return CCTV camera recordings
content: Officials of the Criminal Investigation Department yesterday requested the Kurunegala Magistrates’ Court to order Doctor Shafi Shihabdeen to return the recordings of the CCTV camera found at his house which should be a special court production under the CID since it had already been handed over to the suspect by some of the former officials of the CID.

title: UK Labour Party Chief concerned SL not implementing UN resolution
content: Leader of the UK’s Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said he was deeply concerned that the new government of Sri Lanka has said it would not implement the ‘vital’ UN resolution on accountability, justice and reconciliation.

title: IP dies after shooting himself
content: An Inspector of Police (IP) attached to the Mirihana Police had died after shooting himself this morning, Police Spokesman said.

title: Committee to probe controversial Ranjan-judiciary confabs
content: The government is planning to appoint a special committee to probe controversial telephone calls between UNP MP Ranjan Ramanayake and those in the judiciary and law enforcement authorities during the tenure of the former regime, Daily Mirror learns.

title: British ambassador to Iran arrested at protest in Tehran
content: The UK ambassador to Iran was arrested during anti-government protests in Tehran after officials admitted shooting down a passenger plane.

title: Implement RFID project immediately: Amaraweera
content: Transport Minister Mahinda Amaraweera, yesterday instructed the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) to commence the Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) project which had not been implemented during the last two years.

title: Trump announces ’powerful’ sanctions but not military retaliation after Iran missile strikes
content: President Donald Trump addressed the nation Wednesday morning from the White House. de-escalating a crisis with Iran following its missile strikes overnight on two bases in Iraq where U.S. troops are stationed.

title: Dozens killed in stampede at funeral for slain general: Iran TV
content: Dozens of people have been killed in a stampede in the south-eastern Iranian city of Kerman, where hundreds of thousands of mourners have gathered for the burial of the military commander Qassem Suleimani, according to state media.

title: Arresting MP Ramanayke violate norms: Mujibur
content: Arresting MP Ranjan Ramanayke without proper charges is a dangerous trend which could even affect media, UNP MP Mujibur Rahman said yesterday.

title: MP who fills Ranjith Soysa’s seat sits in opposition
content: Priyantha Liyanage, who was sworn in as new MP for Ratnapura District before Speaker Karu Jayasuriya sat in the opposition in Parliament today.

title: Man shot dead in Ragama
content: A man was shot dead by an unidentified gunman at Kandaliyadda Paluwa in Ragama last night, police said.

title: Special Unit to curb criminal activities
content: The Police have set up a Special Operations Unit, under the supervision of a Deputy Inspector General (DIG) to curb the unlawful activities of organized criminal groups, the Defence Ministry said today.

title: CDS to retire tomorrow
content: Admiral Ravindra C. Wijegunaratne is to retire from the post of Chief of Defence Staff tomorrow (December 31).

title: Russian foreign minister to visit Sri Lanka next month
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov will visit Sri Lanka and India on January 14-15, Russian Foreign Ministry Spokeswoman Maria Zakharova stated during Thursday’s briefing.

title: No provision to arrest anyone over media conference statements: UNP MP
content: There is no provisions in the Code of Criminal Procedure to arrest a person over statements made at a media conference, a UNP MP said today.

title: Arrest of Champika violated parliamentary traditions: Speaker’s office
content: Representatives of all parties at yesterday’s party leaders meeting were of the view that the arrest of former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka had violated parliamentary tradition so far followed, sources from the speaker’s office said.

title: Committee Report on Batticaloa Uni to be submitted to President: Ashu
content: The report prepared by the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Education and Human Resources regarding the Batticaloa Campus (Pvt) Ltd. would be presented to President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and the Cabinet of the new government, Committee Chairman Prof. Ashu Marasinghe said during the committee meeting held yesterday at the parliament complex.

title: No politics involved in ex-Minister’s arrest: Bandula
content: There is no politics involved in the arrest and detention of former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka and legal action against him is based purely on hard evidence available to the law enforcement authorities, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Bandula Gunawardana said yesterday.

title: Work with unity to put party on right track: Ranil
content: Those who are waiting to take over the leadership of the UNP should be prepared to work in unity, Party Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: Death row prisoner shot at when trying to escape
content: A prisoner on death row identified as Kusitha Namal was injured after prison officers opened fire at him when he was trying to escape from the premises of the Homagama Court today.   The injured prisoner was rushed to the Homagama Hospital.

title: 2016 accident: I’ve not been found guilty: Champika
content: In connection to the vehicle mishap that occurred in 2016 which left the victim bedridden, former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said he had not been found guilty of the accident and added that he had only been asked to give support to the ongoing investigations.

title: Singapore to inform legal standing in 2 weeks: Govt.
content: The Singaporean Government will inform the legal position on the extradition of the prime suspect in the Central Bank bond scam to Sri Lanka in a fortnight and if all chips fall into place, the alleged fugitive Arjuna Mahendran could be produced in a Sri Lankan court soon, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Ramesh Pathirana said today.

title: EC recommends introducing e-voting to improve efficiency
content: Chairman, Elections Commission (EC) Mahinda Deshapriya strictly recommends introducing an ‘electronic voting system’ (EVS) sooner rather than later to save the time and labour of officials, minimise the waste of public money and improve efficiency in elections.

title: 32 new State Ministry Secretaries appointed
content: Thirty-two new State Ministry secretaries received their letter of appointments from the Secretary to the President Dr. P.B.Jaysundara at the President Secretariate this evening.

title: Govt. to appoint committee to streamline drafting of new laws
content: The government will appoint a committee to streamline the process of drafting a new set of laws to govern the affairs of the landmass reclaimed from the sea under the Colombo Port City project, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Petition requests UNP not to nominate MPs who insulted Buddhist monks
content: The Tri Nikayika Tharuna Bikkhu Sangamaya - an organisation of young Buddhist monks representing the three chapters - yesterday handed over a petition to the UNP leadership requesting the party not to give nominations to those MPs who had insulted Buddhist monks.

title: Colombo roads flooded
content: Many roads in Colombo including Horton Place, Wijerama Road, Bauddhaloka Mawatha and Srimath Anagarika Dharmapala Mawatha were flooded during the torrential rains causing heavy traffic.

title: Ajith Prasanna calls off his protest in front of Swiss Embassy
content: Major (Rtd) Ajith Prasanna called off a protest today in front of the Swiss Embassy following the request of Ven. Athureliye Rathana Thera and  Rear Admiral (Rtd) Sarath Weerasekara.

title: Based on ’equal footed consultation and win-win spirit’ - China
