content: Days after Sri Lanka’s new President Gotabaya Rajapaksa called the Hambantota Port lease agreement signed between the previous government and China, a ’mistake’ and called for it to be re-negotiated, China has responded saying that the cooperation between Sri Lanka and China, including in the project of Hambantota Port, was based on ’equal-footed consultation and win-win spirit’.

title: Distributing vouchers is more practical than providing school uniforms: Edu. Minister
content: Distributing vouchers instead of providing school uniforms would be the most practical and efficient method, said Education Minister Dullas Alahapperuma addressing a ceremony at Dharmapala Vidyalaya at Pannipitiya today.

title: MCC Compact to be launched in SL soon: State Dept. official
content: The controversial Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) Compact, which caused a huge uproar particularly prior to the recently concluded presidential election, would be soon launched in Sri Lanka, according a top US State Department official.

title: Lankan husband jailed for attempting to murder wife
content: Limassol criminal court in Cyprus sentenced a 47-year-old Sri Lankan national to six and a half years in jail on Monday after finding him guilty of attempting to murder his estranged 50-year-old wife.

title: No Buddhist monk should be allowed in Parliament: Prelate
content: No Buddhist monk should be given nomination for the upcoming general election or any other election in the future, Mihintale Rajamaha Viharaya Chief Incumbent Walawahengunawewe Dhammaratana Thera said yesterday.

title: New governors appointed
content: New governors appointed for six provinces took their oaths before President Gotabaya Rajapaksa this morning.

title: BBS to be dissolved after general elections: Gnanasara Thera
content: A decision has been taken to dissolve the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) organisation after the general election, BBS General Secretary the Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera said.

title: Gotabaya sworn-in as 7th Executive President
content: President-elect Gotabaya Rajapaksa was sworn in as the 7th Executive President of Sri Lanka at the Maha Maluwa of the Ruwanweliseya in Anuradhapura a short while ago.

title: Kilo of wheat flour to go up by Rs.8 from midnight today
content: The price of a kilogramme of wheat flour would be increased by Rs.8 with effect from midnight today, the Serendib Flour Mills (SFML) (Pvt.) Ltd said.

title: Letter on presidential election survey false: Police
content: The letter circulating on social media, which is alleged to have been issued by the State Intelligence Services and addressed to the President, about a survey carried out by intelligence services on the presidential election is false, the police said today.

title: I was born in Palatuwa, not in US: Gota
content: Responding to reports querying his citizenship, SLPP presidential candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa said yesterday he was born at Palatuwa in Matara and not in the US. He expressed these views while addressing a rally held yesterday in Matara.

title: Not our business to ask for renunciation documents: EC Chairman
content: It is none of the business of the Election Commission to inquire about candidates’ citizenship and as such the EC had not asked them to furnish any documents pertaining to their citizenship, EC Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya said.

title: KCCI invited to send business delegation to Sri Lanka
content: Consul General of Sri Lanka, G. L. Gnanatheva, while suggesting numerous measures for enhancing trade and investment ties between Pakistan and Sri Lanka, has invited Karachi Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) to send a delegation to Sri Lanka to explore trade and investment opportunities, and to discuss ways with the Lankan business community for strengthening economic ties.

title: Eran’s complaint baseless: SLPP
content: The SLPP yesterday rejected the complaint made by State Minister Eran Wickramaratne based on a tweet that SLPP was planning a bomb attack in the coming week.

title: Remove face cover when entering polling centres: EC
content: Muslim women can wear either the burqa or niqab when they come for voting but should remove their face cover at the entrance to the polling centre, Election Commission (EC) Director-General Saman Sri Ratnayake said.

title: Vehicle price to increase due to luxury tax: Vehicle importers
content: The prices of vehicles presently valued around Rs. 3.5 million will be doubled effective from November 1 because of the luxury tax imposed, Sri Lanka Motor Vehicles importers’ Association said.

title: Veteran actress Chandra Kaluarachchi passes away
content: Veteran actress Chandra Kaluarachchi has passed away at the age of 76 at her residence this evening, Sri Lanka Singers Association (SLASA) President Janaka Wickramasinghe said.

title: Beware of social media loan scammers: CERT warns
content: People should be aware of scammers who use social media, impersonating a loan company who is looking to empty your bank account once you share your financial data, the Computer Emergency Readiness Team/Co-ordination Centre (CERT|CC) warned.

title: Cabinet approves MCC Grant of USD 480mn
content: The Cabinet today approved the implementation of a US$ 480 million MCC Grant on a proposal made by Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera.

title: CV: Support depends on reposnse
content: The former Chief Minister of the Northern Province, C. V. Wigneswaran, said that their future course of action would be decided according to the response to the 13 proposals put forward to the presidential candidates by the Tamil parties in the North.

title: Deepavali festival: All Tamil medium schools granted holiday on Monday
content: The Education Ministry had decided to grant a holiday for all Tamil medium schools on Monday (28) due to the Deepavali festival falling on Sunday (27).

title: Trial against ex-DIG Anura Senanayake fixed for Nov. 7
content: Colombo High Court today postponed the hearing of the case against Senior DIG Anura Senanayake for screening evidence of the murder of Havelock Sports Club rugby player Wasim Thajudeen for November 7.

title: Case filed in US against Gota dismissed
content: The California District Court has said it lacks jurisdiction to maintain the case filed against former defence secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa, on the basis that he is immune from the law suit under the doctrine of ‘common law foreign immunity’, which includes the acts performed in his official capacity as Sri Lanka’s Defence Secretary.

title: Elections Law violation cases exceed 1,000: EC
content: A total of 1,034 complaints of election law violations and violence had been reported between October 8 to 19, the Elections Commission said today.

title: SLPP says not aware of advertisement
content: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) today said it was not aware of the recent newspaper advertisement which said several army officers had pledged their support to SLPP candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa at this year’s presidential election.

title: A factory for every divisional secy area: Sajith
content: New Democratic Front (NDF) candidate Sajith Premadasa today pledged to introduce an expanded version of his later father Ranasinghe Premadasa’s industrialization concept and set up a factory in every divisional secretariat area if elected.

title: It was presentation to demonstrate concept only: Champika
content: In response to the information technology professionals’ lashing out at UNP presidential candidate Sajith Premadasa for misleading the public, the Megapolis and Western Development Ministry said the objective of the presentation was to demonstrate the concept of scientific governance to the public.

title: SC extends stay order on special HC
content: The Supreme Court today extended the order staying the Special High Court Trial-at-Bar from hearing the D.A. Rajapaksa Museum Case till December 20.

title: Gota to get all military men charged on false accusations freed
content: Kicking off his political campaign in Anuradhapura today, a fired-up SLPP presidential candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa made pledges to deliver upon winning the election, one of which was to free all military men who had been sent to jail after being charged with false accusations.

title: Mother, daughter arrested with ice worth Rs.25.5 mn
content: A mother and daughter were arrested by Customs officers early morning, with more than one-kilogramme narcotic drug methamphetamine (ice) worth Rs.25.5 million, Customs Director and Acting Spokesman Lal Weerakoon said.

title: SLFP conducts vote after 18 years
content: The SLFP conducted a vote among district and electoral organisers after 18 years on five points when they had a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat last morning, General Secretary of the SLFP, Dayasiri Jayasekara said.

title: Prez exercised repository executive power: Counsel for Gota
content: Appearing for the respondent- Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Romesh de Silva PC, addressed the issue in regards to the then-president having repository executive powers to exercise all executive powers in the absence of a cabinet.

title: Deaths of seven elephants - Cause not yet ascertained: Minister
content: The exact cause of death has not been confirmed yet and investigations were being carried out regarding the sudden deaths of seven female elephants that died in the Hiriwadunna Thunbakulam Reserve in Habarana, Tourism Development, Wildlife and Christian Religious Affairs Minister John Amaratunga said yesterday

title: Deadline for postal votes extended
content: The closing date to submit postal voting applications for the forthcoming presidential election has been extended till October 4, the Elections Commission (EC) said. The previous deadline was today.

title: Probe launched into suspicious death of four elephants
content: Wildlife officials of Sigiriya had launched an investigation into the suspicious death of four elephants at Hiriwadunna in Habarana.

title: Ending war with LTTE greatest relief for soldiers: MR
content: The greatest relief for our brave soldiers was ending the three-decade-long fierce war against the LTTE, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said yesterday.

title: Supreme Court: Suspending parliament was unlawful, judges rule
content: Boris Johnson’s decision to suspend parliament was unlawful, the Supreme Court has ruled, BBC reported.

title: Stay order on Prelate’s cremation at the temple premises
content: Mulaitivu Additional Magistrate N. Sudaharan yesterday issued an interim order staying the cremation ceremony of the Nayaru Gurukanda Rajamaha Vihara Chief Incumbent Ven. Kolamba Medhalankarakitthi Thera at the temple premises.

title: Signal failure at Fort Station delay all trains
content: A major signal failure that occurred this morning at the Colombo Fort Railway Station had caused a delay of all trains coming in and going out of the Fort Railway Station, the Railway Control Room said.

title: Presidential poll on Nov. 16
content: Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya said today the presidential election would be conducted on November 16, 2019. He said the nominations for the elections would be called for on October 7.

title: Eight police officers interdicted
content: Eight police personnel including the OIC of the anti-vice squad attached to the Chilaw police have been interdicted due to alleged malpractice, police said.

title: Showery condition to continue
content: The prevailing showery condition would continue over the island during the next few days, the Meteorology Department said.

title: UNF to name Prez candidate next week
content: The UNF will announce its presidential candidate next week, Public Administration and Management Minister Ranjith Madduma Bandara said today.

title: 11 JMI activists handed over to TID
content: Eleven activists of the Jamathei Millathu Ibrahim (JMI), who were detained for questioning had been handed over to the Terrorist Investigation Division (TID) yesterday for further investigations, police said.

title: Ten senior cricketers pull out of Pakistan series
content: Lahiru Thirimanne and Dasun Shanaka will lead ODI and T20 teams to Pakistan after several senior players including ODI skipper Dimuth Karunaratne and T20 skipper Lasith Malinga pulled out of the tour citing security reasons.

title: Future presidents as powerful as present President: Gammanpila
content: Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) Leader Udaya Gammanpila reiterated that future presidents were as powerful as the present President.

title: Prez consents to appear before PSC: Amaraweera
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has consented to appear before the Parliamentary Select Committee (PSC) appointed to probe the Easter Sunday attacks, MP Mahinda Amaraweera said today.

title: Int’l conference on Buddhism and Int’l Humanitarian Law in Dambulla
content: Starting today in Dambulla, Sri Lanka is hosting the first international conference on Buddhism and International Humanitarian Law (IHL).

title: If assumed presidency, Sajith should have a free hand: Ajith
content: UNP Deputy Leader Sajith Premadasa should have a free hand in working for the nation if elected as president, Non-Cabinet Minister Ajith P. Perera told a press conference today.

title: UNP will ultimately field the most popular candidate - MP Rajakaruna
content: UNP will ultimately field the candidate who is wanted by everyone and who could win the presidential elections, the party’s Gampaha District MP Harshana Rajakaruna said yesterday.

title: Bond Scam: Court tells Ravi K to report to CID
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today directed Minister Ravi Karunanayake to report to the CID within the next two weeks to provide further statements regarding the inquiry being conducted in connection with the giving of false evidence at the Bond Commission on August 2, 2015.

title: Tense in Kalladi; Police use tear gas to disperse protesters
content: The police used tear gas to disperse a group of protestors, who were protesting near the Kalladi Bridge in Batticaloa against the burial of Zion church suicide bomber’s head at the Kalliyankadu Cemetery.

title: Removal of emergency regulations will not affect the investigations
content: The removal of emergency regulations will not hinder the investigations against the suspects of Easter Sunday attack, said Police Media Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekera.

title: Central Bank reduces two policy rates
content: The Monetary Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, at its meeting held on Thursday, had decided to reduce two of its policy rates.

title: US warns SL on investment, military ties after army chief promotion
content: A senior U.S. State Department official warned on Tuesday that Sri Lanka’s appointment of a war veteran accused of serious human rights violations as head of its army could affect U.S. military cooperation and investment in the island nation.

title: Federal Register could be behind schedule-US envoy
content: In response to comments about the name of SLPP Presidential Candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s name not being in the Federal Register, US Ambassador Alaina B.Teplitz said on Monday that the Federal Register could often be months behind the recording of one’s renunciation of citizenship.

title: Gota has certificate to prove he has renounced US citizenship: Gammanpila
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa has sufficient evidence to prove that he had renounced the US citizenship while the omission of his name in the list published as at June 30, 2019, is of no importance as per the law of that country, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya Leader and MP Udaya Gammanpila said yesterday.

title: Gota not in second quarterly list of those renounced US citizenship
content: The name of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) presidential candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa is not in the list of those renounced US citizenship as at June 30 this year, a document issued by the US Internal Revenue Service showed.

title: Nine S14 Chinese power-sets for hill country
content: One of nine Chinese-made S14 power-sets which were specially designed to operate in the hill country arrived from China last morning, the Transport Ministry said today.

title: 22 dead and a million evacuated in China
content: At least 22 people have been killed and more than a million forced from their homes as Typhoon Lekima hit China, according to state media.

title: Speaker expresses concern over Wijeyadasa’s remarks
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya today said he was saddened by MP Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe’s remarks that parliament was the most corrupt institution in the country.

title: Entire Govt. responsible for mistakes and lapses: PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday said that the entire government and cabinet of ministers are responsible for the mistakes and lapses which led the terror group to launch successful attacks on Easter Sunday.

title: AG says bill to abolish Death Penalty illegal: Prez
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said today that the Attorney General had informed him that the private member bill presented in parliament to abolish the death penalty was illegal.

title: Central Province Governor resigns
content: Central Province Governor Maithri Gunaratne has tendered his resignation to the Presidential Secretariat today.

title: Will reconsider supporting extension: Opposition
content: The Opposition said today it would have to reconsider supporting extension of the emergency regulations the next time it comes up for voting because emergency regulations were being misused to curtail the rights of workers and to suppress anti-government protests.

title: Assets of Batticaloa Campus cannot be taken over under any law: Hisbullah
content: Former Eastern Province Governor M.L.A.M. Hisbullah said yesterday there was no legal provision to take over the assets of the Batticaloa Campus (Pvt) Ltd to the government as suggested by certain people.

title: Mathematics tutor, 7 others further remanded
content: Eight suspects, including mathematics tutor Dinesh Nuwan Amaratunga were further remanded till August 5 by the Attanagalle Magistrate’s Court today.

title: New Constitution impossible under this Govt: MR
content: While claiming that participating in constitutional reform under this government was not a feasible option, Opposition Leader Mahinda Rajapaksa said today they would put forward a set of proposals to reform the constitution at the forthcoming presidential elections.

title: TID inspector blames AG for delay in arresting Zahran
content: Terrorist Investigation Division (TID) Inspector T. R. K. R. Pathirana yesterday blamed the delay on the part of Attorney General’s Department to answer a query made to him by his institution with regards to National Thowheed Jamath (NTJ) leader Zahran Hashim from arresting the individual that is now known to have been the main culprit responsible for the April 21 attacks.

title: Boris Johnson elected new leader of Conservative party
content: Boris Johnson will become Britain’s next prime minister after being elected leader of the Conservative party, defeating Jeremy Hunt in the party’s leadership contest, the Guardian reported a short while ago.

title: Easter Sunday attack: 90 percent of allegations baseless
content: Senior police officers have expressed that 85 to 90 per cent of the information received about the Easter Sunday attacks and about the incidents following are baseless and framed on suspicion.

title: Arjun Aloysius and others granted bail by special high court
content: The special Trial-at-Bar today served indictments against Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) owner Arjun Aloysius and several others and granted bail in connection with the Treasury bond scam.

title: Postal strike continues as talks fail
content: Following the failure of discussions with Minister Abdul Haleem last evening, the Joint Postal Trade Union (JPTU) has decided to continue its strike indefinitely.

title: Four youths fall to sea while taking selfie at Rumassala
content: Four youths aged 20 and 21 fell to the sea while they were attempting to take a selfie at Rumassala, Unawatuna today, Police Spokesman Ruwan Gunasekara said.

title: Death threats: Police launches probe over MP Roshan’s complaint
content: The Senior DIG of the North Central Province had been instructed to launch a probe into the complaint made by UPFA MP Roshan Ranasinghe that he was threatened by President Maithripala Sirisena’s brother Dudley, police said today.

title: SLPP requests parties working under JO banner to participate
content: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) extended a formal request to the parties working under the banner of the Joint Opposition to participate in its maiden convention to be conducted on August 11, a party leader said yesterday.

title: Foreign forces behind Easter Sunday attacks, not ISIS: Dayasiri
content: UPFA MP and SLFP General Secretary Dayasiri Jayasekera who testified before the parliamentary select committee probing the Easter Sunday attacks said an international force is behind the Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Security Advisory Board headed by Amunugama appointed
content: A National Security Advisory Board headed by Dr. Sarath Amunugama has been set up by President Maithripala Sirisena to look into the matters related to national security.

title: Some ministers in powwow with Prez. - PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is reported to have told the Cabinet Ministers that some of the ministers were in powwow with President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: NTJ member arrested while trying to leave the country
content: Sein Anzar Mohamed Rinaz, a member of the National Thowheed Jamath (NTJ) has been arrested by the Terrorist Investigation Division (TID) when he attempted to leave the country, Police Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekera said.

title: Train strike from midnight today
content: All railways trade unions have decided to launch a strike from midnight today over the Transport Ministry’s failure to sign a letter suspending a shunting driver who was caught under the influence of liquor while on duty, one trade union said.

title: Two robbers fleeing with cash worth Rs. 2.9mn arrested
content: Two suspects who robbed Rs. 2.9 million from a financial institution in Akuressa Town today were arrested along with a locally made firearm as they were fleeing, police said.

title: I had never known suicide bomber related to my party official: Rishad
content: Former Minister Rishad Bathiudeen who today testified before the Parliamentary Select Committee looking into the Easter Sunday carnage said one of the suicide bombers who blew himself up in one of the attacks had been his party’s assistant Treasurer Alawdeen’s son in law. However the MP said he had not associated with this terror group member at any time.

title: Governors using funds allocated to PCs: Dinesh
content: The opposition today brought to the notice of the government about delays in holding the Provincial Council elections claiming that the chairman of the elections commission had said the PC polls could be held.

title: Lift operator complaints against IGP Pujith
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake ordered the CID yesterday to conduct an investigation over the incident where it has been alleged that IGP Pujith Jayasundera had arrived at the CID without prior notice and abused the police officers who were at the reception counter and had used criminal force on the lift operator.

title: Presidential candidate is Gotabaya: Basil
content: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) front liner Basil Rajapaksa said at a meeting of its parliamentarians that Opposition Leader Mahinda Rajapaksa would declare on August 11 the presidential candidate of his party.

title: UNP to launch election campaign on July 1: Akila
content: The United National Party (UNP) will launch its election campaign from July 1, General Secretary and Minister, Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said today.

title: ISIS shift in strategy may threaten India, Sri Lanka, warns intel
content: India and Sri Lanka are likely to be under threat with terror group ISIS turning its attention to the Indian Ocean Region in the wake of losses across Syria and Iraq, intelligence reports have warned, NDTV reported.

title: Zahran was not in Katankudi when I took over in 2017: OIC
content: The Katankudi Police OIC Nishantha Kathuriarachchi yesterday said he stopped the motorcyclists from going without helmets when he took over in 2017. He said young people were defying the law and were going without helmets at that time.

title: Sajith calls on Kabir to rejoin Cabinet
content: UNP Deputy Leader, Housing and Construction, Minister Sajith Premadasa called on MP Kabir Hashim to re-join the Cabinet as soon as possible and take his place in the journey to chart a new political future for all Sri Lankans.

title: Australia lowers travel advisory for Sri Lanka
content: The Australian Government yesterday reviewed its travel advisory for Sri Lanka and lowered it to ‘exercise a high degree of caution’.

title: Documents related to Arabic school found at Kingsbury bomber’s home: CID tells court
content: Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today informed the Fort Magistrate Court that several documents including an application form to open an Arabic school in Sri Lanka were found from the Kolonnawa house of Azzam Mohammed Mubharak alias Abdullah, who blew himself at the Kingsbury Hotel in Colombo.

title: Bribery Charges - CIABOC to indict two top ex-Govt. officials
content: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today informed Court that it would indict the former chief of staff of President Maithripala Sirisena and another state official on charges of accepting a bribe of Rs.20 million from an Indian businessman.

title: Chancellor of Ruhuna University passes away
content: Chancellor of Ruhuna University and Chief Sanghanayaka of Southern Sri Lanka, Most Venerable Aggamaha Panditha Pallaththara Sri Sumanajothi Thero passed away this morning at the age of 95.

title: SriLankan Airlines world’s most punctual airline
content: The SriLankan Airlines has been named as the world’s most punctual airline with 90.75 per cent of its flights in May 2019 being ‘on-time’ throughout its route network, SriLankan Airlines said.

title: No politician, priest or social media can decide who is guilty: Mangala
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera today said the Constitution does not give power to any politicians, priests or social media platforms to decide who is guilty or innocent of any crime, including terrorism.

title: Loss from VAT, NBT to reach Rs.26bn by year end: CBSL
content: In an assessment of the damage caused to the economy as a result of the Easter Sunday attacks, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) put the revenue loss from VAT and NBT alone at approximately Rs.26 billion for the remaining period of the year. The CBSL said pending economic activities would slacken thereby affecting revenue collection.

title: President says undecided whether to run in upcoming poll
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said today that he had not decided on seeking another term in an election that is due by year-end, Reuters reported.

title: CEJ perturbed over non delivery of Wilpattu judgement
content: The Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ), which filed the petition against deforestation and illegal construction in the Northern sector of the Wilpattu National Park yesterday said that they were perturbed over the judge recusing himself from delivering the judgement.

title: Switzerland relaxes advisory on SL, highlights personal security
content: The Ambassador of Switzerland to Sri Lanka, Hanspeter Mock today said that Switzerland no longer advised to avoid unnecessary travel to Sri Lanka.

title: Horrowpothana NTJ group leader has fled the country: Police
content: The person called ’Abu Bakkar’ who is believed to be the Horrowpothana and Kebethigollewa coordinator of the National Thowheed Jamaath (NTJ) Organisation, had fled to a Middle Eastern country, the police said.

title: State of Emergency passed in parliament
content: State of Emergency passed in parliament with 22 MPs voting for it and eight TNA MPs voting against it.

title: NCM against Bathiudeen: Party leaders’ meeting ends with no decision
content: The party leaders’ meeting held at the Parliamentary Complex today, ended without any agreement over a debate date on the no-confidence motion against Minister Rishad Bathiudeen.

title: Don’t make irresponsible statements: Speaker tells MPs
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya today requested MPs to desist from making irresponsible statements and passing false information to the media.

title: UNP Muslim MPs to vote against NCM
content: UNP Muslim MPs have decided to vote against the no confidence motion that have been brought against Minister Rishad Bathiudeen.

title: US reiterates strong support for SL in its fight against terrorism
content: US State Secretary Michael Pompeo who met with Foreign Affairs Minister Tilak Marapana, has reiterated strong US support for Sri Lanka in its fight against terrorism, a statement said.

title: No police curfew today
content: Police curfew will not be imposed today except for the North Western Province and Gampaha Police Division, Police said.

title: Nine suspects remanded over Minuwangoda violence
content: Thirteen suspects were arrested in Minuwangoda on charges of inciting violence and nine of them were remanded after being produced in the Minuwangoda Magistrate’s Court, police said.

title: Woman arrested with suspected map
content: A woman allegedly involved in extremist activities was arrested by the STF at Madatugama in Kekirawa yesterday.

title: Hartal against Hizbullah in Trinco
content: Several hartals were staged in Trincomalee and its suburbs today demanding the removal of Eastern Province Governor M. L. A. M. Hizbullah.

title: Police to obtain detention orders on Pelwatte Sugar factory COO
content: The police are hoping to obtain detention orders from the courts on Chief Operating Officer (COO) of the Pelwatte Sugar factory Asminath Surakman Deen and two other employees who were arrested with VIP security uniforms and several other equipment on Tuesday (7), a senior police officer told Daily Mirror.

title: Court permits Gota to travel to Singapore for treatment
content: The Special High Court today permitted former defence secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa to travel to Singapore for medical reasons from May 15 to 19.

title: Sri Lanka bombings up tourism in south India
content: The Easter bombings in Sri Lanka and consequent cancellation of inbound tourist arrivals has made south India an alternative destination for tourists. Tour operators are getting enquiries for Tamil Nadu and Kerala from inbound travellers from Europe and the US, after their countries have issued travel advisories.

title: Defamatory letters: Suspects handed over to CCD
content: The three suspects who were arrested yesterday along with 600 letters containing defamatory remarks against the President at the Central Mail Exchange (CME) in Pettah, were handed over to the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today for further investigations, Police Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekera said.

title: Special US economic corridor from Trinco to Colombo: Wimal
content: National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader Wimal Weerawansa yesterday said the government was making arrangements to allow the US to operate a special economic corridor stretching from Trincomalee to Colombo.

title: President instructs TRC to lift ban on social media
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) Director General to lift the social media ban with immediate effect, the Government Information Department said today.

title: Man arrested with six homemade bombs in Daulagala
content: A 57-year old man was arrested with six homemade bombs from a mosque that comes under the purview of the National Thowheed Jamaath at Wahunkowa in Daulagala last night.

title: Zahran, one of the Shangri-La suicide bombers: DMI
content: Head of the Directorate of Military Intelligence (DMI), Brigadier Chula Kodituwakku said today the suspected mastermind behind the Easter Sunday suicide attacks, Zahran Hashim, was one of the two suicide bombers who exploded themselves at the Shangri-La hotel.

title: BIA entrance road re-opened
content: The entrance road to the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) which was previously closed following the tensions that erupted after a suspicious vehicle was found near the entrance check point to the airport this morning , had been re-opened for public.

title: Bomb attacks - Govt. to set up security committees
content: The government is reported to have re-introduced another wartime measure such as the setting up of security committees at district levels in the aftermath of the series of bombings that killed 321 people and wounded some 500.

title: Suicide bomber previously arrested for vandalism: Kabir
content: One of the suicide bombers who blew himself up in an attack last Sunday had been a suspect who was arrested a few months ago in connection with an incident in Mawanella in which Buddha statues were damaged, Highways Minister Kabir Hashim said at a press conference held today.

title: Minute’s silence at the Santiago Bernabéu
content: The Santiago Bernabéu held a minute’s silence before the LaLiga match week 33 fixture between Real Madrid and Athletic Bilbao, for the victims of the attacks in Sri Lanka and in memory of Agustín Herrerín, who was Real Madrid’s pitch delegate for more than 18 seasons and who died last Thursday.

title: Youth hacked to death in Horana
content: A 20-year-old youth was hacked to death by four men at Horana Town this morning, police said.

title: Canadian SC revives case of deported Sri Lankan accused of killing wife
content: Despite no longer being in Canada, a Sri Lankan national who had his murder charge stayed because of unreasonable delays in his trial isn’t done with the Quebec justice system just yet.

title: Lasantha’s murder: Civil lawsuit unsealed in US against Gota
content: A civil lawsuit has been unsealed by a US federal judge on Monday against former defense secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa seeking damages for his alleged involvement in the killing of Lasantha Wickramatunga, the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) reported on Monday.

title: Gota returns
content: Former defense secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa returned to the country this morning after a private visit to the USA.

title: SME interest rates reduced: PM
content: The special committee appointed to look into interest rate issues has recommended the reduction of interest rates granted to small and medium-sized enterprises (SME) by two percent, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam not compulsory anymore: Education Minister
content: The Grade 5 Scholarship Examination would not be compulsory anymore and the relevant circular had been issued, Education Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said.

title: Grama Sevaka protest blocks Parliament Road
content: The parliament entry road has been obstructed due to a protest carried out by the Grama Sevaka officers based on several demands, police said.

title: ICC, Interpol to work together to fight corruption
content: In a bid to combat corruption in the game of cricket, the International Cricket Council (ICC) has met with Interpol, the organisation that facilitates worldwide police cooperation, to discuss closer working relations.

title: Dimuth’s driving license suspended
content: Sri Lanka Test Cricket Captain Dimuth Karunaratne, who was charged of driving under the influence of liquor, was released on bail after he was produced before the Colombo Fort Magistrate Court this morning.

title: Navy recovers 1456 Kg of beedi leaves floating in the sea
content: A stock of beedi leaves found floating in the sea were recovered today by crew members of a SL Navy fast attack craft and a coastal patrol vessel during a patrol carried out in the seas of Mannar South.

title: Mother found hanged with son in Balangoda
content: The bodies of a mother aged 26 and her five-year-old son were found hanging at their residence in Balangoda this afternoon, police said.

title: Namal-Nalin in verbal clash over H’tota oil refinery
content: A heated argument erupted in Parliament yesterday between Hambantota District UPFA Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa and Deputy Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade Nalin Bandara over the Hambantota-Oman Oil Refinery.

title: Songs aired on TV and Radio - Cabinet nod for royalty to singers & song writers
content: The Cabinet on Tuesday gave its approval to make it mandatory for all TV, Radio and FM stations to pay royalties to singers and musicians and other artistes involved in creating songs and musical programmes every time they are aired.

title: Wind Power in islands around the country: Minister
content: Stand-alone Wind Energy Systems would be established on islands and islets around the coast of Sri Lanka following the successful pilot project at the Delft Island, Power and Energy Minister Ravi Karunanayake said.

title: Govt. and Opp. MPs pressure Excise Dept. to issue licenses to Aloysius’ distillery
content: JVP MP Nalinda Jayatissa said today that some government and opposition MPs were pressuring Excise Department officials to grant licenses to a distillery owned by Arjuna Aloysius to extract toddy from 38,000 coconut trees in Beruwala.

title: SLPP not prepared to vote Maithri into presidency again: Prasanna
content: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna is not prepared to vote President Maithripala Sirisean into presidency for another term, in spite of the party being prepared to coalesce with the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) led by the President in order to topple the government led by the United National Party (UNP), Gampaha District leader of the SLPP, Prasanna Ranatunga said.

title: SL integrating to renewable energy to minimise oil and coal - Prez
content: Sri Lanka is rapidly moving to integrate renewable energy such as solar, wind, wave and biogas to our energy mix to minimise oil and coal use, President Maithripala Sirisena said.

title: Prez, PM, MR must jointly resolve national question: Sampanthan
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Opposition Leader Mahinda Rajapaksa should get together to resolve the national issue, TNA Leader and MP R. Sampanthan told Parliament today.

title: Damaging railway property -- Matale Mayor released on bail
content: Mayor of Matale Duljith Aluvihare who was produced before the Matale Magistrate on the charge of entering the Matale Railway Station premises by force, damaging the fences and constructing a road on the land belonging to the railway, was released on personal bail of Rs.100,000.

title: UL has no manual on obtaining foreign, financial loans
content: SriLankan Airlines does not have an instruction manual or guidebook when it comes to obtaining foreign loans and other financial services, Company Head of Finance Yasantha Dissanyake informed the PCoI into irregularities at SriLankan Airlines, SriLankan Catering and Mihin Lanka yesterday.

title: Heavy traffic in Town Hall due to IUSF protest
content: Heavy traffic was reported in and around Town Hall due to a protest march carried out by the Inter University Students’ Federation (IUSF).

title: Highway linking Bingiriya-Katunayake expressway soon: PM
content: A connecting highway will be constructed linking Bingiriya towards the Colombo Katunayake expressway, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: Lalkantha arrested for drunk driving
content: JVP politbureau member K.D. Lalkantha was arrested this afternoon on charges of driving under the influence of liquor after his vehicle had met with an accident injuring two women in Anuradhapura, Police Spokesman Ruwan Gunasekara said.

title: PC commits suicide in Maharagama
content: A 29-year-old police constable attached to the Maharagama Police Traffic Unit has committed suicide by shooting himself this morning.

title: Cabinet committee to examine LNG deal
content: The Cabinet is reported to have decided yesterday to appoint a committee comprising ministers and officials to look into allegations about irregularities in the award of the contract to a Chinese consortium to execute the LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas) power project.

title: Olivia, Rami & Green Book win Oscars
content: British Olivia Colman won the Oscar for the best actress, while Rami Malek won the Oscar for the best actor at the 91st Academy Awards held at Los Angeles in California, US.

title: Road closure in Colombo for So Sri Lanka Ironman 70.3
content: Several roads in Colombo would be closed temporarily on Sunday to make way for the So Sri Lanka - Ironman 70.3 Colombo International Triathlon which begins from Galle Face Green, the organisers said.

title: Fire at Dhaka chemical warehouse Kills 56
content: At least 56 people have died in a huge fire that tore through apartment buildings also used as chemical warehouses in an old part of the Bangladeshi capital, a fire official said Thursday.

title: CMC to move distracting digital advertisements
content: Digital advertisements in Colombo that cause distractions to motorists will be moved to alternative locations, Western Province Governor Azath Salley said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka plugs 'Buddhist tourist trail' site
content: The Sri Lankan Tourism Promotion Bureau has introduced a "Buddhist Tourism Trail", a Sri Lankan promotional website aiming to attract Thai and other travellers from Theravada Buddhism countries, the Bangkok Post reported.

title: PM suggests flats for Muslim IDPs in North
content: It has been decided to construct flats for Muslims who were displaced after they were chased out of Jaffna during the war. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe came out with this idea after Trade and Commerce Minister Rishath Bathiudeen brought up the issue of Muslim IDPs at a meeting held in the

title: PM moots Truth and Reconciliation Commission
content: Ahead of the UNHRC session in March, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday presented a Cabinet memorandum seeking approval to establish a Truth and Reconciliation Commission, similar to what was established in post-apartheid South Africa.

title: Senior Sri Lanka players sort-out differences
content: In a bid to sort-out the differences among the players, Minister of Sports Harin Fernando summoned three Sri Lankan players, Lasith Malinga, Angelo Mathews and Thisara Perera at the Ministry Office in Colombo on Saturday (9).

title: SLPP has Rs.21 million in savings: Basil
content: Thanks to the contribution made by the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna's (SLPP) local government representatives and other party members, the party has Rs.21 million in its savings advised National Organiser Basil Rajapaksa to a group of SLPP local government members at the party office in Battaramulla today.

title: Probe on animal oil mixed milk power: Opposition
content: The opposition today urged the government to launch an investigation into the revelation made by the Deputy Minister, Buddika Pathirana that some companies were selling animal oil mixed milk powder in the market.

title: 27 released prisoners go back to prisons
content: Out of the 545 inmates who were released on the Independence Day under the Presidential Pardon, 27 inmates were sent back to their prisons, Prions Department said.

title: Bringing down SL UN Peacekeepers' remains delayed
content: The remains of the two Sri Lankan Peacekeepers, Major H.W.D Jayawickrama and Sergeant S.S Wijekumara, who were killed in Mali, would not be flown down to Sri Lanka on Saturday as earlier scheduled, the Army announced yesterday.

title: Await eIDs and ePassports this year: State minister
content: Under the universal identity card scheme, an electronic Identity Card (eID) and an electronic passport (ePassport) will be introduced this year, State Minister of Home Affairs J.C. Alawathuwala said.

title: UNPers commended my criticism of Rohitha's wedding attendees: Ranjan
content: State Minister Ranjan Ramanayake yesterday said some prominent members of the UNP had informed that they will back him in the event disciplinary action is taken against him for criticizing the UNPers for attending former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s son Rohitha’s wedding.

title: Ranjan disapproves UNPers attending Rohitha's wedding
content: State Minister Ranjan Ramanayake today found fault with UNPers who attended the wedding of former President’s son Rohitha Rajapaksa last week.

title: No quorum, PC polls debate put off
content: The adjournment debate on the provincial council elections ended abruptly in parliament today in the absence of quorum. It ended two and a half hours earlier than the scheduled time of 7.30 pm because there were

title: Heavy fines on drivers causing fatal accidents
content: Fines imposed on errant drivers who cause fatal road accidents would rise appreciably in order to dissuade motorists from driving recklessly, Transport and Civil Aviation Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said yesterday.

title: Sunil Handunneththi appointed COPE Chairman
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) MP Sunil Handunneththi has been re-appointed as the Chairman of the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) in Parliament today

title: Mark Samson passes away
content: Veteran film actor Mark Samson passed away yesterday at the age of 63. Thelge Samson Marcus Peiris who was born on February 29, 1956 had acted in a large number of films.

title: Carbon tax is a burden on motorists: Bandula
content: A future UPFA government would amend the recently introduced carbon tax and implement a single tax for all motor cars, buses, vans, motor cycles and trishaws in a manner that will not be a burden to the tax payers, UPFA MP Bandula Gunawardana said today.

title: Bank of China offers Sri Lanka US$300m loan
content: Sri Lanka is considering an offer from Bank of China for a loan of US$300 million, which could be raised to US$1 billion, to help it meet repayments during coming months, two sources in Colombo with knowledge of the offer told Reuters on Tuesday.

title: IGP arrives at GA’s Dept.
content: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Pujith Jayasundara has arrived at the Government Analyst's Department to give a voice sample with regard to the investigation into the alleged VIP assassination plot.

title: Reports say LTTE also committed war crimes: Sumanthiran
content: The reports coming from all over the world reveal that both the LTTE and the government forces had committed war crimes, TNA MP M.A. Sumanthiran said today.

title: Dudley Sirisena to launch anti-corruption movement
content: The brother of President Maithripala Sirisena and Araliya Group of Companies Chairman Dudley Sirisena yesterday announced his plans to launch an anti-corruption organisation by joining hands with scholars, professionals, media and business community aiming to put a stop to corrupt activities carried out by politicians and officials and to direct the government on the path of good governance to accelerate the development work in the country.

title: Shantha Bandara appointed as MP from today
content: SLFP Youth League Head Shantha Bandara has been appointed as a Member of Parliament under Article 99A of the Constitution from today, filling the vacancy created by UPFA MP M. L. A. M. Hizbullah who resigned from Parliament after being appointed as the Eastern Province Governor.

title: Youth with Rs.1.6Mn worth of fags nabbed at BIA
content: A Sri Lankan youth who attempted to smuggle illicit cigarettes worth over Rs.1.6 million into the country from Dubai was arrested by the Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) yesterday.

title: Four SLFPers of Moratuwa MC join SLPP
content: Four Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) members of the Moratuwa Municipal Council have today joined the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), which has majority support in the council.

title: Some ex-SLFP ministers to urge MS to let them join UNF
content: A group of former SLFP ministers are expected to meet party leader and President Maithripala Sirisena on Friday to discuss their future in politics, one of them said today.

title: Vandalizing Buddha statues in Mawanella: Ministry committee to probe
content: Minister of Housing, Construction and Cultural Affairs Sajith Premadasa has appointed a committee to investigate into the incidents of vandalizing Buddha statues in Mawanella area.

title: ICAO compliance vital for NIC photos from Jan.1
content: It will be compulsory for all studios countrywide, from January 1, to use the special  software provided by the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) to take photos for the National Identity Cards, the Department for Registration of Persons (DRP) said today.

title: New Zealand all out for 178 against Sri Lanka
content: Suranga Lakmal took a career best five for 54 as Sri Lanka dismissed New Zealand for 178 in their first innings of the series-deciding second Test in Christchurch on Wednesday.

title: Clash at a construction site in Colombo: 11 Chinese workers arrested
content: Eleven Chinese nationals, working at a construction site at Chatham Street, Colombo, were arrested following a clash with a group of Sri Lankan Security Personnel at the site on Saturday.

title: Dispute over ministerial appointment of SF
content: Home Affairs Minister Vajira Abeywardene said yesterday that a dispute arose as to how Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka, as a retired military officer, could work with President Maithripala Sirisena as the Commander in Chief of the Armed Forces.

title: Prez to swear in new Cabinet tomorrow: Gamini Lokuge
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has informed UPFA MP’s that the new Cabinet would be sworn in tomorrow morning, UPFA MP Gamini Lokuge said today.

title: Aloysius, Palisena further remanded
content: Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) Owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena, who were arrested by the CID over the Central Bank bond scam, were further remanded till January 1 by the Fort Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Ranil to be sworn-in as PM today
content: UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe would be sworn in as the Prime Minister at the Presidential Secretariat at11.16 a.m today, UNP General Secretary, MP Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said.

title: Not ready to work with Ranil at any cost: Prez
content: In the wake of the Supreme Court ruling today, President Maithripala Sirisena is reported to have told the parliamentary group of the UPFA that he is not ready to work with UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe at any cost.?

title: Confidence motion presented in support of Ranil
content: UNP MP Sajith Premadasa today presented a motion expressing confidence in the United National Party (UNP) Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe to function as the Prime Minister.

title: Prez will request CJ to deliver order soon: Wimal
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will request Chief Justice Nalin Perera through the Attorney General to deliver the order on the dissolution of parliament without delay, MP Wimal Weerawansa said today.

title: Case against Ranjan to be taken up on February 26
content: The Supreme Court today ordered to take up the case filed against UNP Parliamentarian Ranjan Ramanayake on contempt of court charges on February 26.

title: Piyasena machang, waren Chandeta: Geetha
content: Former MP Geetha Kumarasinghe yesterday accused MP Piyasena Gamage, who has sworn in to fill the vacant position left by her in Parliament, of not allowing her to work at least a month in her constituency.

title: SC resumes hearing of FR petitions on dissolution of Parliament
content: The hearing into the Fundamental Right petitions filed in the Supreme Court challenging the dissolution of Parliament resumed a short while ago.

title: President and UNF meeting today
content: President Maithripala Sirisena and members of the United National Front (UNF) would have a special discussion this evening, sources said.

title: SL signs two multi-million dollar port deals with China
content: Sri Lanka signed two multi-million dollar contracts with Chinese firms for a port upgrade project on Thursday in the middle of a political hiatus that has raised doubts over the legitimacy of the government and the legality of the deals, the Reuters reported yesterday.

title: ‘Purported Government’ spent Rs.840 mn on helicopter rides: Ravi
content: ‘The purported Government’ had spent Rs.840 million on the helicopter rides for the last 21 days without considering the expenses, United national Party (UNP) MP Ravi Karunanayake said in parliament.

title: Cabinet approves Vote on Account to draw money to run Govt
content: The Cabinet today approved a ‘Vote on Account’ (VoA) for the government to cover State expenses for the time being and it would be presented in Parliament shortly for approval, Government Spokesman and Ports and Shipping Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe said today.

title: Matara student stabbing: main suspect, another surrender
content: The main suspect student (17) over the stabbing of a 19-year-old student at Elawaylla in Matara on Saturday surrendered to the Court and was remanded till December 3 by Matara Magistrate today.

title: Speaker asks CID to probe fake letter
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya said today he had asked the CID to carry out an investigation on the fake letters that have been put out with his signature.

title: Akurana town flooded
content: Akurana Town in the Kandy district is flooded due to inclement weather condition, Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said today.

title: IMF delays Sri Lanka's loan discussion on political crisis
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Tuesday it had delayed discussions on Sri Lanka’s next loan tranche due to the country’s political crisis.

title: Woman, husband found dead at Akmeemana
content: A 55-year-old woman and her 61-year-old husband were found dead in the garden behind their house at Akmeemana last night, police said.

title: Darkest day in Parliamentary history: Dayasiri
content: The government blamed Speaker Karu Jayasuriya for the ugly and shameful actions by a some government MPs yesterday and said it was a conspiracy hatched by him.

title: Govt. ready to defeat NCM if UNF-led alliance adheres to protocols: SB
content: If the UNF-led political alliance follows proper Parliamentary procedures and Standing Orders when bringing in a no-confidence motion (NCM) against the government and Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, the government is ready to face it and defeat it, Chief Whip and Highways Minister S.B. Dissanayake said today

title: Dilshan joins SLPP
content: Former Sri Lankan Cricket captain T.M. Dilshan has obtained the membership of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) at the party headquarters a short while ago.

title: This is not the Court's final decision: Namal
content: UPFA MP Namal Rajapaksa said the Supreme Court’s interim order on the dissolution of parliament was not the Court's final decision. In a tweet he said he had never seen politicians get ‘so excited’ over postponing of elections.

title: EC member also files petition against dissolution
content: Professor S. Ratnajeevan H. Hoole, a member of the Election Commission (EC) has also filed a Fundamental Rights petition against the gazette issued by President Maithripala Sirisena dissolving parliament.

title: Section of Colombo-Katunayake Expressway temporarily closed
content: A section of the Colombo-Katunayake Expressway between Peliyagoda Interchange and the Kelani Bridge is temporarily closed from today because of the construction work on the proposed Kelani Bridge, the Road development authority (RDA) said.

title: Prez can dissolve P'ment under 33 (2) C of 19 A: Fmr. CJ
content: Former Chief Justice Sarath N Silva said yesterday the President had been vested with powers to dissolve Parliament under 33 (2) C of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.

title: Allocating seats according to the gazette and Speaker's instructions:  Sergeant-at-arms
content: The allocation of seats for the new Prime Minister and the Cabinet would take place on Monday (12), Sergeant-at-arms Narendra Fernando said.

title: Thewarapperuma, Hesha Vithana released on bail
content: UNP MPs Palitha Thewarapperuma and Hesha Vithana, who were arrested over an alleged attack on Major (Rtd) Ajith Prasanna during a protest at Temple Trees, were released on bail by Colombo Fort Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake today.

title: We've the numbers: Prez
content: President Maithripala Sirisena is reported to have told the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Central Committee that he had the required number of MPs to form a stable government.

title: Several initiatives to revive economy: Finance Ministry
content: Prime Minister and Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs Mahinda Rajapaksa has given direction to implement several initiatives to revive the economy as the consumers are saddled with high cost of living, Finance ministry said today.

title: Tension at Temple Trees
content: The Official Residence of the Prime Minister Temple Trees went into few minutes of tension today, when two men claimed to be from the office of newly appointed Prime Minister, came claiming to get an inventory of the items that were in the premises.

title: B’gamuwa tragedy: Lady doctor granted bail
content: The lady doctor -- who was involved in the Boralesgamuwa tragedy where a Police Inspector was killed and his wife and two children badly injured -- was granted bail by the Gangodawila Magistrate today.

title: Arjuna Ranatunga arrested
content: Former Petroleum Minister Arjuna Ranatunga was arrested by the Colombo Crime Division (CCD) a short while ago over allegedly trespassing into the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) premises in Dematagoda yesterday.

title: Hope democratic values would be respected in SL: India
content: India Sunday said it was closely following the political developments in Sri Lanka and hoped that democratic values and constitutional process would be respected in the island nation.

title: Rupavahini goes off air
content: The Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation transmission was taken off air, it was reported.

title: Grade-5 scholarship exam not compulsory anymore: Akila
content: Education Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said yesterday he had instructed his Ministry Secretary to rescind the circular which made the Grade 5 scholarship examination compulsory for schoolchildren .

title: Govt. must do its best to have UNHRC resolution withdrawn
content: Megapolis and Western Development Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka told the Cabinet yesterday that the government should launch diplomatic efforts to withdraw its co-sponsorship of the UNHRC resolution on Sri Lanka.

title: If govt. decisions made without UNP, it is unacceptable: SF
content: Minister Sarath Fonseka said on Sunday that it was unacceptable, if decisions with regard to government matters were taken disregarding the UNP which contributed a lot to form this government.

title: Stray cats take over President’s House
content: The Presidential Secretariat has reportedly informed the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) to take immediate steps to remove the stray cats which had invaded the President’s House.

title: China says its loans only 10% of SL’s foreign debts
content: While reiterating that China was not dragging Sri Lanka into a debt trap, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Lu Kang said Chinese loans only accounted for around 10% of Sri Lanka's foreign debts by 2017.

title: President Sirisena alleges that RAW is plotting his assassination
content: In a move that might seriously impair Indo-Lanka relations, Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Tuesday accused India’s Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) of plotting his assassination.

title: Gamini Senarath and 3 others: Case on Oct. 23
content: The case against former president’s chief of staff, Gamini Senarath and three others was fixed for October 23 by the special Trial-at-Bar today.On this date the Court will also check whether the prosecution had handed over the

title: FCID returns Ford Mustang imported by Namal to owner
content: The controversial Ford Mustang which was reportedly imported by MP Namal Rajapaksa, was today returned to its current owner by the FCID.

title: CA dismisses bail application of Aloysius and Palisena
content: The Court of Appeal today dismissed the revision bail application of Aloysius and Palisena stating that petitioners had failed satisfy the Court to invoke revisionary powers of the Court under the Criminal Code Procedure.

title: Nikki Haley resigns as U.S. Ambassador to UN
content: President Trump’s ambassador to the United Nations, Nikki R. Haley, has resigned, ahead of what Mr. Trump promised on Twitter on Tuesday was a “big announcement” with Ms. Haley at the White House.

title: Stay order on CID probe on Ravi K dismissed
content: The Colombo Chief Magistrate today dissolved the stay order issued on the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) investigation of MP Ravi Karunanayake over allegedly providing false evidence to the Bond Commission.

title: Lion cub nursed by female Labrador
content: An incident that had occurred for the first time in Sri Lanka in 2014 was revealed today, where a Lion cub from the Dehiwela Zoological Gardens was taken care of at a private home in Moratuwa and fed by the owner's female Labrador after the lioness had disowned this cub.

title: Public misled about train fare hike: GMR
content: The General Manager Railways (GMR) yesterday said the public had been misled by the announcement made at a recent Cabinet meeting which had only referred to the increase of 15 per cent in train fares without explaining how it was calculated.

title: President to leave for Seychelles next week
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will be arriving in Seychelles next week (8th to 10th October) on his first state visit, the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Seychelles said in a statement.

title: Over 700 families affected by minor floods: DMC
content: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said today some 700 families were affected by minor floods in the Galle District.

title: Govt. will ensure war heroes’ honour and dignity: Prez
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said the government was fully committed to safeguarding the honour, dignity and respect of war heroes from the highest ranked generals to the ordinary soldier and they would be provided with all privileges.

title: MR asks whether Mangala’s statement reflects Govt’s opinion
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday denounced Minister Mangala Samaraweera’s response to Archbishop Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith and asked whether the response was the government’s opinion.

title: Thunder showers expected in Western, six other provinces
content: Afternoon thunder showers can be expected during the next few days over the country particularly in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern, Uva, North-Central, Central and Southern Provinces, the Meteorology Department said today.

title: Will support if resolution brought against IGP: MR
content: If a resolution was brought in Parliament to remove IGP Pujith Jayasundara, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said they would support such a resolution.

title: Lankan arrested in Milan was an SLBFE official: Bureau
content: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) yesterday said the former diplomat who had been recently arrested in Milan was an SLBFE official, and accordingly they had decided to interdict him from the service.

title: Bus fare increased again by 4%
content: The Cabinet has approved a 4 per cent fare increase to bus tickets with effect from midnight tomorrow, the Transport and Civil Aviation Ministry said.

title: Archaeological monument demolished in Kilinochchi
content: An archaeological monument in Kilinochchi is reported to have been demolished by officials of the local authority in the area on a request made by Tamil National Alliance (TNA) MP S. Sritharan.

title: Constitutional Council: Mahinda Samarasinghe replaces Champika
content: Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe has been appointed as the President’s representative to the Constitutional Council (CC) by President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Not even President knows how pricing formula worked: JO
content: The Joint Opposition yesterday urged the Government to introduce a formula to increase the salaries of public and private sector employees as they did fuel price revisions every month.

title: 54 pilgrims killed in bus accident in India
content: At least 54 people died and several others were injured as a passenger bus fell from a narrow road into a gorge in Hyderabad, India, the Times of India reported.

title: Plenty to take over UNP: Dy. Minister Ranjan
content: There are plenty of people to take over the leadership of UNP at the right time, Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake said over the weekend.

title: Was Jana Balaya Kolambata successful?
content: Was ‘Jana Balaya Kolambata’ protest organised by the Joint Opposition in Colombo on Wednesday successful? Let us know your views by taking the poll on our Facebook page.

title: I have no connection with Mahendran :PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today rejected claims that he met with former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran in Singapore.

title: One killed, one injured while de-mining
content: A 25-year-old worker was killed and another was injured after an antipersonnel mine exploded while demining activities at Thekkawatte along the Mallavi Road in Mankulam yesterday.

title: Seven arrested over clash at Galaha Hospital
content: Seven persons had been arrested by the Police last night in connection with the recent unrest situation at the Galaha hospital where an infant child had died.

title: Prez meets Modi in Nepal, discusses bilateral cooperation
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today held a bilateral meeting with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC Summit to discuss ways to boost cooperation.

title: SF devoid of STF security
content: Sustainable Development, Wildlife and Regional Development Minister Sarath Fonseka is reported to have been denied security by the Special Task Force (STF) triggering concerns whether it was linked to his criticism of the elite police force in Parliament last Friday.

title: AL results could be delayed due to teacher shortage: ACUTU
content: The results of 2018 Advanced Level Examination could be delayed due to a shortage of teachers to serve at answer script evaluation supervisory board, the Chairman of the All Ceylon United Teachers Union (ACUTU) Ven. Yalwela Pagnasekera Thera said.

title: Water pipe bursts at Castle Street
content: Police advised motorists to use alternative routes due to a burst of an underground water pipe at Castle Street in Borella this morning.

title: Japan wants H’tota to be free of military activities
content: Japan wants Hambantota port to be "free of military activities", the visiting Japanese Defence Minister Itsunori Onedera has said amid concerns in the region over the leasing of the facility to China, the PTI reported on Wednesday.

title: Prison riot: 11 injured, 52 inmates transferred
content: A tense situation was reported from the Welikada Prison this evening after clashes erupted between Prison officials and a group of female inmates, during a roof-top protest by the female inmates, injuring at least eight prison officials and three inmates, officials said.

title: Landslide warning issued for three districts
content: National Building Research Organization (NBRO) today warned of possible landslides, rock falls, slope failures, cutting failures and cutting subsidence in three districts.

title: Door still open for Malinga, insists Hathurusingha
content: Sri Lanka’s National Coach Chandika Hathurusingha yesterday reiterated that there was still a place in the National Team for Lasith Malinga, if the fast bowler did his part and met selection criteria

title: Being independent in Parliament: JO appoints committee
content: The party leaders of the Joint Opposition (JO) today appointed a committee of experts led by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Chairman Professor G.L. Peiris to study the matter of becoming independent in Parliament.

title: Buying expensive chairs 'simple' for cash rich WPC: Chief Minister
content: Chief Minister Isura Devapriya said it was nothing out of the ordinary for a rich governing body like the Western Provincial Council to import chairs for the use of provincial legislators at a cost of Rs. 640,000 each.

title: Extracts of inquiry into Vijayakala's speech sent to AG
content: The Organised Crime Prevention Division (OCPD) today informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate that the extracts of the magisterial inquiry conducted into the alleged speech made by former Child Affairs State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaren, has been sent to the Attorney General for his opinion.

title: Desperate Govt. tapping phones: JO
content: In a last minute attempt of survival, the Government had started listening in to phone conversations of, not only its political opponents but also Ministers, who were criticising the Government, the Joint Opposition (JO) charged today.

title: Unhealthy for SL to raise funds through 'Panda bonds' : JO
content: The Central Bank’s move to raise US$250 million through China’s ‘Panda bonds’ is not healthy and clearly shows that the CB’s authority to obtain loans has been handed over to the People's Bank of China, the joint opposition (JO) said today.

title: KDU has no scholarship scheme: Wijeyadasa
content: Although the SAITM institute had awarded scholarships to its students they would not be entitled financial scholarships at the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU), Minister of Higher Education Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said today.

title: Indian man nabbed with 'Ice' worth Rs.10mn
content: A 30-year-old Indian national was arrested by the Police Narcotic Bureau (PNB) and Crime Investigation Division (CID) officers for possessing Methempitamin (Ice) worth more than Rs.10 million in Colombo last evening, Police said.

title: On arrival visa facility for Lankans in Laos
content: Sri Lankan citizens holding valid travel documents could apply for visa on arrival at the international border check points of the Lao People’s Democratic Republic with effect from August 1, Ministry of Foreign Affairs said today.

title: Those flying kites near airports warned
content: Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Limited today said flying kites within a radius of five kilometres from any airport was illegal and a punishable offence and  requested people to refrain from such acts.

title: Trilingual proficiency vital for reconciliation: PM
content: People in Sri Lanka, especially children, should learn Sinhala, Tamil and English languages in order to bring about reconciliation, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Thursday.

title: London-bound Dhammaloka Thera asked to disembark flight
content: Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera, who was to leave for England, has been asked to disembark the flight this morning over an issue in the travel ban date on the court order.

title: Vijayakala quizzed over statement on LTTE
content: Police Organized Crimes Division has recorded a statement from former state minister Vijayakala Maheswaran this evening over a speech made by her calling for the resurgence of the LTTE.

title: UNP needs a new face as Prez Candidate: Wasantha
content: State Minister of Foreign Affairs Wasantha Senanayake was of the opinion that the time was ripe for the UNP to introduce a new face to be its presidential candidate if it intends to taste success at the next Presidential Poll.

title: Vandersay gets one-year suspended sentence
content: Cricketer Jeffrey Vandersay was given a one-year suspension from all forms of international cricket, which will stand suspended for one year, for misconduct reported against him during the concluded West Indies Tour, the Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) announced today.

title: "Army to be restructured, not downsizing"
content: The Government informed Parliament yesterday that the Army would be restructured as per the time demands but it would not result in a downsizing.

title: Underworld protecting senior minister: PM instructs officials to submit more info.
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today informed parliament that he instructed the relevant authorities to look into the media report that some underworld figures were protected by a senior minister and assured to submit in parliament about the incident.

title: Money circulation down: PM
content: The demand for consumer goods had gone down as a result of money circulation decline in the country, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: 5.5 kgs of heroin detected in Sampur
content: Some 5.5 kgs of heroin worth Rs. 66 million was found abandoned at the Ilakkanda Beach in Sampur today, Police said.

title: 9.9 kg of heroin worth Rs. 118 mn detected in Seruwawila
content: Two suspects were arrested by the CID with 9.9 kg of heroin worth Rs. 118 million in Mawadichchena in Seruwawila this afternoon, Police said.

title: Thai PM to visit SL, talks on FTA to be held
content: Prime Minister of Thailand, General Prayut Chan-o-cha would arrive in Sri Lanka on a two-day official visit on Thursday and negotiations for a possible future Free Trade Agreement (FTA) would be launched during the visit, the Foreign Affairs Ministry said today.

title: Songstress Priyani hacked to death
content: Songstress Priyani Jayasinghe (51) was hacked to death at her residence in Alubomulla, Panadura a short while ago, Police said.

title: Appoint PCoI to probe NYT allegations: UNP
content: UNP backbench MPs today called for the setting up of a Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) to probe the allegations which had been made in the news report published by the New York Times.

title: Speaker on Vijayakala: Opp. MPs tarnished the image of House
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya today said he had done his utmost in taking action against State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran.

title: MR can contact editors if takes issue with our reporting: NY Times
content:
The New York Times newspaper today said it has encouraged former president Mahinda Rajapaksa to contact senior editors at New York Times if he takes issue with Times reporting.

“If Mr. Rajapaksa takes issue with Times reporting, we have encouraged him to contact senior editors at The New York Times rather than intimidating Sri Lankan journalists,” Times International Editor Michael Slackman said in a statement.

title: Ranjan is spinning what I told him on the phone- NY Times journo
content: South Asia correspondent at The New York Times, Maria Abi-Habib, who had written a controversial article titled ‘How China Got Sri Lanka to Cough Up a Port,’ has rejected claims by Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake and also said the deputy minister is spinning what she told him on the phone.

title: ‘Group of 16’ tag-line no more: WDJ
content: Former United Freedom Peoples Alliance (UPFA) Minister W. D. J. Seneviratne, who defected the government along with 15 other UPFA members, yesterday said they should no longer be addressed as the 'group of 16’ because they have decided to work together with the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP).

title: Ready to accept any MP who quits government: Wimal
content: We are ready to accept any MP who would leave the Government, National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader and MP Wimal Weerawansa said today.

title: University Education in imminent jeopardy- CaFFE
content: There would be a negative impact on the University Education in the long-run because of the Rs. 1 billion worth of funds of the University Grants Commission (UGC) that had been invested in the controversial bond transaction, Campaign for Free and Fair Elections (CaFFE) said.

title: Nansen Research vessel in SL to conduct surveys on marine resources
content: The most advanced research vessel in the world, the Dr Fridtjof Nansen, arrived in Colombo to conduct surveys on fisheries resources and the marine ecosystem, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) said on Friday.

title: SLC to contest ICC charge over inconsistent application of rules
content: An interesting legal battle is on the cards between the lawyers of Sri Lanka Cricket and International Cricket Council after the former reported to have decided to contest the ICC sanctions issued on Thursday, the Cricbuzz reported.

title: Agriculture ministry will be shifted to Govijana Mandiraya: Minister
content: Agriculture Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said today he would, within three months shift the Agriculture Ministry to a State-owned building from the high profile DPJ towers at Battaramulla and that a six-member committee had been appointed to make recommendations.

title: Angoda Lokka’s associate ‘Solta’ arrested over two murders
content: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today arrested Muniwarage Asitha Premathilaka alias Solta -- an accomplice of underworld criminal ‘Angoda Lokka' -- in connection with two recent killings at Kottawa and Malabe, Police Spokesman Ruwan Gunasekara said

title: One Indian, 2 locals nabbed: PNB seizes Rs.24 mn worth Kerala Ganja in Welisara
content: An attempt to transport a large stock of Kerala Ganja worth over Rs.24 million from Mannar to Colombo was thwarted by Police Narcotic Bureau (PNB) sleuths in Welisara this evening.

title: Sarath N. Silva’s FR petition dismissed
content: The Fundamental Rights petition filed by former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva against Provincial Council Elections (Amendment) Bill before Supreme Court was rejected by the majority of a 3-member bench today.

title: Presidency -- Easier for UNP if Gota contests: Harin
content: It will be easier for the UNP if former defense secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa contested the 2020 presidential election, UNP Propaganda Unit Chief and Minister, Harin Fernando said today.

title: Attempts to bring underworld under control: Minister
content: All the necessary information about the accomplices of underworld leaders now living in foreign counties have been collected, Minister of Law and Order Ranjith Maddumabandra said.

title: Penalize MPs who took money from Aloysius: JO
content: Joint Opposition MP Shehan Semasinghe yesterday requested Speaker Karu Jayasuriya to take some action to prevent the MPs who had admitted that they have taken money from Perceptual Treasuries Limited (PTL) Owner Arjun Aloysius, from humiliating other MPs.

title: TNL hadn't paid licence fee so station closed: TRC
content: The TNL's Polgahawela transmission station was shut down because it had not paid the licence fee to use VHF CH 11 or VHF CH 3 frequencies, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) said.

title: IP Rangajeewa and Lamahewa re-remanded
content: Police Narcotic Bureau Inspector Neomal Rangajeewa and Prisons Department Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa, who were in remand custody over the Welikada Prison riots in 2012, were further remanded till June 19 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage today.

title: Priority to development; not to other issues- PM
