content: It was essential to focus on country’s development at this moment instead of talking about other issues, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: President himself admits that country is unstable: JO
content: Referring to the speech delivered by President Maithripala Sirisena at the 76th Birth Anniversary of the Late Ven. Sobitha Thera yesterday, Joint Opposition said today the essence of the speech of the President was that he himself admitted the country was not stable.

title: Muslims grossly misled during Rajapaksa regime: Gota
content: Former defense secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa said the Muslims were grossly misled during the Rajapaksa regime by various elements who aspired to drive a wedge between the Muslims and the Rajapaksas.

title: What purpose if citizens do not have protection: MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa questioned the country’s law and order stating that there is no purpose if it doesn’t protect the people.

title: I received Rs. 1 mn cheque: Dayasiri
content: While admitting that he did receive a Rs. 1 million cheque from Walt and Row Associates for election campaign in 2015, former Minister SLFP MP Dayasiri Jayasekara today said he was neither an MP nor a member of the COPE, when he received it for election funding.

title: China to invest USD 700 mn in LNG power plant
content: Development Strategies and International Trade Minister Malik Samarawickrama said yesterday the government had cleared a proposal for Chinese investment worth 700 million US dollars to build an LNG power plant in Hambantota.

title: Mangala invites MR for public debate on national debt
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera said today that he would like to invite former President Mahinda Rajapaksa for a public debate on national debt stock and debt servicing as the former Finance Minister.

title: Six PT-6 aircraft ready to join SLAF fleet
content: Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) to receive six brand new PT-6 Aircraft from the China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Corporation (CATIC) for primary training of the SLAF.

title: COPE, PAC, Public Finance: Former members re-appointed
content: Party leaders, who convened at the Parliamentary complex yesterday decided to reappoint the former members who served in the parliamentary bodies Committee on Public Enterprises(COPE), Public Accounts Committee (PAC) and the Public Finance Committee.

title: ‘Sri Lanka is the only country that has eradicated terrorism’: Army Chief
content: Army Commander Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake said during an interview with the Hindu News paper that Sri Lanka was the one and only country on the world map that had eradicated terrorism from its soil.

title: New state media heads appointed
content: Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera today appointed four Chairmen to state media institutions with immediate effect.

title: Ousted PM Razak banned from leaving Malaysia
content: Ousted Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak was banned from leaving Malaysia on Saturday, suggesting the new government under Mahathir Mohamad will move swiftly to investigate Mr Najib’s links to the country’s largest-ever corruption scandal, Financial Times reported.

title: Rajitha says SF apologized
content: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senaratne today confirmed that Minister Sarath Fonseka had expressed his regrets and apologised to President Maithripala Sirisena following the Cabinet meeting, over the critical comments he made against the President recently.

title: Rajitha becomes speechless…
content: Cabinet spokesman and Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, Rajitha Senaratne became speechless during a news briefing held yesterday when a journalist asked about the appointment of Anuruddha Polgampola as the new Chairman of State Timber Corporation who had been arrested over two alleged major financial frauds during the past.

title: LG bodies: Govt. needs Rs.135 mn monthly to upkeep 8689 members
content: According to local government ministry sources, Rs.135 million needs to be set aside monthly to pay the salaries of 8689 members elected to the local government bodies.

title: Don't abolish executive presidency: Maha Sangha
content: The Jathika Vidwath Sangha Sabh said the proposed 20th Amendment to the Constitution on abolishing the executive presidency was a move to divide the country and urged the President and the Prime Minister not to go ahead with this amendment.

title: Corruption qualification to get best of ministerial portfolios: Ranjan
content: One wonders whether the main qualification needed to get a cabinet portfolios is engaging in corruption, Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake said yesterday.

title: Allegations against Judiciary:  Sugandika given two weeks to submit evidence
content: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) today said that it had given two weeks to Attorney-at-Law Sugandhika Fernando to produce the evidence to prove her allegations against the Judiciary.

title: Attack on villagers: IGP instructs disciplinary action on policemen
content: IGP Pujith Jayasundara had instructed the North Central Province Senior DIG to take disciplinary action against the police officers who reported to have assaulted villagers including several women at a temple in Eppawala.

title: Horowpathana PS Chairman, five others remanded
content: Horowpathana Padeshiya Sabha Chairman and five others who were arrested over allegedly assaulting and robbing a manager of a private company, were ordered to be remanded till May 8 by Kebithigollewa Magistrate's Court today.

title: Avant Garde case: Rtd. Navy officer arrested
content: Retired Navy Lieutenant Millaniyage Samudra Nilupul De Kostha was arrested this morning by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the investigation of the floating armoury of Avant Garde Maritime Services Ltd, Police said.

title: Scarcity of funds: Bond market likely to collapse, says Bandula
content: While claiming that the Central Bank of Sri Lanka lacked sufficient funds to pay back the Treasury bonds and bills before their date of expiry, MP Bandula Gunawardana said the bond market could collapse due to the prevailing situation.

title: Committee appointed to look into Edu. Sector political victimisation
content: A three-member investigation committee had been appointed by the Ministry of Public Administration and Management to look into the possibilities of providing relief to about 1, 000 education sector employees, who faced political victimisation during the recent past.

title: Issuance of taxi bills a law in two months: NCRS
content: Meters with the facility to issue a printed bill has been made compulsory for three-wheeler taxis from today and it will be legalised in two months, the National Council for Road Safety (NCRS) said.

title: TUs to hold joint May Day rally on May 1: JTU
content: Trade unions will hold their joint May Day rally as usual on May 1, the Joint Trade Union (JTU) said condemning the government’s decision to reschedule the rally to May 7.

title: PC Delimitation Report -- Party leaders undecided on date for debate: Mustapha
content: Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Faizer Mustapha said the government would never hold elections to the provincial councils under the old system or the much criticized PR system, but was ready to introduce amendments to the Provincial Councils Elections Act of 1988.

title: Aluthgamage arrives at FCID
content: United People's Freedom Alliance (UPFA) MP Mahindananda Aluthgamage arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) a short while ago to give a statement in connection with misappropriating government funds worth Rs.39 million.

title: 10,147 drivers fined over traffic violations
content: A total of 10,147 drivers had been fined island-wide for traffic violations during the last 24 hours ended from 6am today, police said.

title: UNP leadership urged to include politburo in party Constitution
content: The UNP leadership was requested to incorporate the newly established politburo in the party constitution to function as a body above the Working Committee, a Minister said yesterday.

title: UNP backbenchers urge Navin to accept post of Secretary
content: Backbenchers of the UNP are urging Minister Navin Dissanayake to step down from his ministerial portfolio and accept the post of party General Secretary.

title: Heavy rainfalls expected at Western, Sabaragamuwa and Uva provinces: Met
content: Heavy showers above 75mm could be expected in some places, particularly in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Uva provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts, Meteorology Department said today.

title: MONLAR alleges Knuckles land given to associates of ministers
content: The Movement for Land and Agriculture Reform (MONLAR) claimed that 21 000 acres of land belonging to the Knuckles Mountain or ‘Dumbara Range’ had been given to several close associates of some government ministers in order to carry out various projects and added that immediate steps should be taken to stop these proceedings.

title: UNP to form a new unity Govt. by Monday
content: The UNP would form a new unity Government by Monday (9) with SLFP and other constituent partners who would not support the No Confidence Motion (NCM) against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Cabinet Spokesman Health Minister Dr Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Trade Union action closes roads to BIA
content: The tense situation reported at the Banadaranaike International Airport (BIA) has escalated with employees reportedly blocking all entrances to the premises, leaving hundreds of travelers stranded, reporters said.

title: Six women arrested in Mt. Lavinia brothel raid
content: Six women were arrested by the Police yesterday on charges of having run a brothel under the guise of a massage parlour in Mount Lavinia.

title: Action on Ravi put off
content: The UNP working committee had decided to put off taking action against Former Minister Ravi Karunanayake till it gets the opinion from the Attorney General on the recommendations made on the former Minister over the bond commission report, party sources said yesterday.

title: President takes away CB from PM and gazettes under FM
content: In an Extraordinary Gazette issued today, President Maithripala Sirisena moved two key institutions; the Central Bank and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC); which were under the National Policies and Economic Affairs Ministry headed by the Prime Minister, back to the Finance Ministry.

title: UN introduces new rules for SL peace keeping troops: Army awaits HRC clearance
content: The Sri Lanka Army has sought clearance from the SL Human Rights Commission to dispatch a contingent of troops to Lebanon, following new procedures set up by the UN relating to local troops sent for Peace Keeping assignments.

title: Batti airport opens for service
content: More domestic airports in the country would be developed to accommodate 60-seater aircraft, Civil Aviation and Transport Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said while commencing civil aviation at the Batticaloa Domestic Airport today.

title: Saudi to repatriate SL housemaid’s body following postmortem report
content: The body of a Sri Lankan woman, who had worked as a housemaid in Saudi Arabia, will be repatriated within two weeks following the issuance of the postmortem report, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said yesterday.

title: IAEA continues to support SL to achieve development goals
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) recently said that it would continue to support Sri Lanka to achieve development goals including the areas of nuclear medicine, non-destructive testing in industry and assistance in introducing nuclear energy.

title: PM asked to name a successor
content: The committee appointed to look into the reorganization of the United National Party (UNP) in its report had recommended that Party Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe should name a person who would take over the party leadership as and when he steps down from the leadership.

title: Man kills paramour in Welipenna, commits suicide
content: A 34-year- old father of four had killed his 38-year- old paramour, who is a mother of two, in Welipenna on Saturday and had committed suicide afterwards, Police said.

title: Gazette naming LG members published
content: The gazette notification naming the elected members of Local Government bodies has been published, Government Printer’s Department said.

title: Japanese PM assures to provide grants not loans
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe stated that he would work towards providing grants not loans anytime possible while giving assistance to the development progammes of Sri Lanka.

title: I am even suitable for premiership: John
content: Minister John Amaratunga said yesterday he was even suitable for the post of prime minister as he was the second longest serving member in Parliament after Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Environmental protection: President seeks Solheim's help
content: President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday requested for assistance from Eric Solheim, the Executive Director of the UN Environment Programme, to introduce alternate technologies for Sri Lanka to eliminate the negative impact of excessive soil and sand mining in the construction industry.

title: I am ashamed to be in Govt: Mujibar
content: UNP MP Mujibur Rahman said yesterday he was ashamed to remain in the government as it had been unable to take any action to stem racism during the past two and half years.

title: One dead and two injured in shoot out in Kotahena
content: One individual was killed and two others were injured in a shooting incident in Kotahena a short while ago, Police said.

title: Stand together, be wise: Cricket legends request
content: Cricket legends Sanath Jayasuriya and Kumar Sangakkara today condemned the recent acts of violence reported in the country and requested the people to stay together and to stand strong at tough times.

title: Govt. to declare State of Emergency for 10 days
content: President Maithripala Sirisena and the Cabinet had decided to declare a State of Emergency for 10 days following the violence prevailed in some parts of the country, Minister S.B. Dissanayake said.

title: CMC staff to protest against Commissioner's removal
content: The staff of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) including the engineers are to stage a protest in front of the Colombo Town Hall tomorrow against the removal of Commissioner V. K. Anura by the Western Province Governor.

title: UK assures trade agreement with SL post-Brexit
content: The UK Government said it intends to provide continuity and stability to Sri Lanka’s current trade agreements with the EU, even after the Brexit comes into affect.

title: SF will be Law and Order Minister in fortnight
content: Cabinet Spokesman Rajitha Senaratne confirmed yesterday that Regional Development Minister, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka would be appointed the Minister of Law and Order in less than two weeks.

title: 42 injured as bus topples in Walapane
content: At least 42 passengers had sustained injuries following a bus plying from Theripaha towards Nildandhahinna toppled at Walapane this morning, the Police said.

title: Uma Oya Project: SC permits Bar Association to Intervene
content: Supreme Court permitted the Bar Association of Sri Lanka to be an intervenient petitioner in the FR petition with regard to the Uma Oya Project.

title: SL backslides in pursuing UN commitments: AI
content: Though Sri Lanka continued to pursue commitments made in 2015 to the UNHRC, progress of implementing them has been slowed and there was evidence of backsliding, the Amnesty International (AI) said on Thursday.

title: Diyatalawa explosion: Not terrorism: Army
content: Military Spokesman Brigadier Sumith Atapattu today categorically dismissed today’s explosion in a private bus in Diyatalawa as an act of terrorism.

title: SLMC to support a stable Govt.
content: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) said today it would only support a stable government which commanded a comfortable majority in Parliament.

title: Met Dept forecast mist in several provinces
content: The Department of Meteorology yesterday forecast mist in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Central provinces during the next few days and that fairly strong winds of up to 40 kmph are expected in the Uva and North-Western Provinces and in the Hambantota and Ampara districts.

title: Sagala hints at resigning as Law and Order Minister
content: Minister Sagala Ratnayake today said he had informed his party’s Parliamentary Group that he was not hoping to continue as the Minister of Law and Order.

title: UPFA refuses to be in a Govt. under Ranil: Dilan
content: State Minister Dilan Perera said the United Peoples Freedom Alliance (UPFA) had informed President Maithripala Sirisena that they refused to remain in a government led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: SLPP wins 239 LG bodies, UNP 41
content: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has secured 239 Local Government (LG) bodies including Municipals Councils, Urban Councils and Pradeshiya Sabhas.

title: Children seen carrying ballot boxes in Polonnaruwa
content: A child was seen carrying ballot boxes from the polling centre situated at Pulathisipura National College of Education to another polling centre in Polonnaruwa today.

title: Attempt to alienate Udawattakele land
content: Officials of the Forest Conservation Department are perturbed by the decision of a senior forest conservator to alienate a 90 perch block of land of the Udawattakele forest reserve to a leading hotel in Kandy.

title: License of Aloysius owned Mendis brewery cancelled
content: The licence of arrack distillery W.M. Mendis & Co. Ltd has been cancelled by the Excise Department for non-payment of taxes, the Excise Department confirmed.

title: Independence incomplete sans economic, cultural freedom: Prez
content: In his Independence Day Message, President Maithripala Sirisena today said our independence is not complete until economic and cultural freedom is achieved.

title: Too late for Ravi to resign; damage already done: Ranjan
content: Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake, the film-star-turned politician, said today it was too late for UNP assistant leader Ravi Karunanayake to step down because the damage had already been done to the party.

title: GMOA now lauds Health Minister
content: In a new twist the GMOA which had been previously highly critical of Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne, yesterday lauded him saying the minister had committed himself towards granting their demands.

title: 12 TN fishermen arrested for poaching in SL waters
content: Twelve Tamil Nadu fishermen were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy for poaching in the Sri Lankan waters in the seas off Talaimannar today.

title: Ex Additional Secy and Accountant of Presidential Secretariat arrested
content: The Police Special Investigation Unit (SIU) today arrested a former Additional Secretary and an Accountant of the Presidential Secretariat in connection with allegedly misappropriating state funds amounting to Rs. 17.9 million in 2010.

title: Seven trains canceled due to strike
content: Seven train services have been canceled this morning due to an ongoing strike launched by the Locomotive Engineering Operators' Union (LEOU), the Railway Control Room said.

title: Action will be taken against Uva CM if guilty: SLFP
content: Minister Susil Premajayantha today condemned the incident where Uva Chief Minister Chamara Dassanayaka is alleged to have asked the Principal of a Tamil Girls School to kneel down in his presence and said the SLFP would take action after an inquiry before the LG polls.

title: EC says no power to unseat elected candidates
content: Elections Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya said on Thursday he could do nothing about unseating a field officers or any other candidate if he had been found to have illegally contested the Local Government election and was elected.

title: Ranjith Soysa no longer SLFP organizer for Rakwana
content: UPFA MP Ranjith Soysa was today removed from his post of SLFP organizer for the Rakwana electorate, the presidential media unit said.

title: Attempts to alter PCoI report before debate: NFF claims
content: Attempts were made before the parliamentary debate to change the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) report in a way that it would not convey the real essence of the report, National Freedom Front (NFF) MP Jayantha Samaraweera claimed today.

title: Song was played since Tamil leadership continues to deceive us
content: We aired the Tamil song “Niththiraya Thamila Nee Nimirnthu Parada” as the Tamil leadership continued to deceive the Tamil people, Jaffna District Parliamentarian Angajan Ramanathan said.

title: Ex-navy spokesman, five others released on bail
content: Former navy spokesman D.K.P. Dassanayake and five others were released on bail by Colombo Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today.

title: Rapid bus service within Colombo city limits in the offing
content: The Megapolis and Western Development Ministry is planning to introduce a rapid bus service within the Colombo city limits in line with its new initiative the light railway service.

title: Murder suspect shot dead in Pannala
content: A 35-year-old man was shot dead by an unidentified gunman at Pallama in Pannala on the Kurunegala-Negombo Main Road this afternoon.

title: Fertilizer ship to arrive on Monday: CFC
content: The ship carrying 50,000 metric tonnes of fertilizer from Pakistan is to arrive at the Colombo Port on Monday, Ceylon Fertilizer Company Chairman Roshana Waduge said today.

title: One dies after being knocked down by a lorry
content: One person died while another sustained injuries after being knocked down by a lorry at the D. R. Wijewardena Mawatha, Colombo this morning, the Police said.

title: Rs. 14.5 mn robbed in N' Eliya
content: Rs. 14.5 million was robbed from a private cigarette agency in Nuwera Eliya this morning.

title: 625 Qurans seized; later released
content: The Kalpitiya Police today seized 625 Qurans on that suspicion that they were meant to be distributed among the mosques in the area during the election period.

title: Won't hesitate to use sword: President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said today he would not hesitate to use the ‘sword’ on his relatives, friends or party supporters in his journey to create a clean, unstained and a people-friendly political culture.

title: Hathurusingha can’t give any extra advantage to SL: Soumya Sarkar
content: Bangladesh batsman Soumya Sarkar thinks that Sri Lanka Cricket new Head Coach Chandika Hathurusingha can’t give any extra advantage to the Sri Lankan team.

title: SLPP to form a new alliance
content: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) would form a new alliance with twenty political and civil organisations, including all the parties of the Joint Opposition (JO), SLPP Spokesman Sanjeewa Edirimanna said.

title: 8 suspects who had links with 'Makandure Madush' arrested
content: Eight suspects who had connections with the underworld figure known as Madush Lakshitha alias Makandure Madush were arrested by the Organised Crime Investigation Division (OCID) officers last afternoon, police said.

title: Asbestos issue: 12-member delegation to visit Russia
content: A 12-member delegation was scheduled to visit Russia on December 24 to discuss the quality of asbestos imported to Sri Lanka from Russia, Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia Dr. Saman Weerasinghe said today.

title: There are times I am not convinced with CC decisions: President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that there were times when he was not convinced with some decisions taken by the Constitutional Council regarding names sent for the appointments of top posts.

title: Interim order for Gota extended
content: The interim order, preventing FCID from taking action against Gotabaya Rajapaksa under the Public Property Act, was extended till December 25 by the Court of Appeal today.

title: Karunatilaka Amunugama passes away
content: Former Foreign Ministry Secretary Karunatilaka Amunugama passed away at the age of 63, the Foreign Affairs Ministry said today.

title: SL team stranded in Dharamsala due to rain
content: Two days ahead of the second One-day International against India, the Sri Lankan cricket team was left stranded in the hill town that has been lashed by heavy rain.

title: Railway strike continues
content: The work stoppage by the Railway Trade Union Alliance (RTUA) is continuing in the absence of any signs of this matter being resolved.

title: Favourable turn in adverse weather conditions: Met
content: As the low pressure area South-West of the Bay of Bengal is moving further away from Sri Lanka, the Meteorology Department today said it was expecting the effect on the country to lessen gradually.

title: PM questions if media firms are really for media rights
content: Highlighting the poor turnout of heads of Sri Lankan media organizations at today's UNESCO Regional Conference to End Impunity of Crimes against Journalists in Colombo, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe questioned whether the media organizations are really interested in media rights.

title: New low-pressure area spotted
content: The Meteorology Department said today it was tracking a low-pressure area developing over Andaman Island, situated in the east of Sri Lanka which was likely to turn into a tropical depression affecting the Eastern and Northern regions of the country next week.

title: Delay in taking action against corruption
content: Government and Opposition MPs yesterday complained about the delay in taking action against corruption by the Bribery Commission.

title: Country needs rulers with backbones: CBK
content: While claiming that there should be a philosophy for the rulers to develop the country in addition to a clear proramme to implement it, former President Chandrika Kumaratunga on Sunday said 'there should be leaders who should have a backbone to implement the programmes at a time when the challenges exist in the society.'

title: Smart condom vending machine in Colombo
content: The Family Planning Association of Sri Lanka (FPASL) has introduced a Smart Condom Vending Machine after considering the difficulties faced by the public when purchasing condoms.

title: 10 women arrested in two separate brothel raids
content: Ten women suspects were arrested yesterday for allegedly operating a prostitution ring  and a brothel under the guise of an Ayurvedic massage parlour at Mount Lavinia and Bambalapitiya, the Police said.

title: Counsel Sumanthiran objects to AG's Dept leading evidence
content: At the begining of yesterday’s proceedings, President’s Counsel M.A. Sumanthiran raising an objection on behalf of his client Sangaparapillai Pathmanapanan, an official of the Central Bank's Public Debt Department, said no official of the Attorney General’s Department, coming under Section 23 of the Commission of Inquiries Act, could lead evidence.

title: SL won’t condone any form of torture: Foreign Affairs Secy.
content: The Sri Lankan government does not condone any form of torture, Foreign Affairs Ministry Secretary Prasad Kariyawasam told the third Universal Periodic Review (UPR) of Sri Lanka in Geneva on Wednesday.

title: LCs opened prior to Budget: Vehicles can be cleared under previous duty rates
content: Those who have already opened Letters of Credit (LC) in their names to import vehicles prior to the Budget proposals announced on November 9 will be allowed to clear those vehicles at the duty rates that prevailed before the Budget, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Assistance to Sri Lanka - No strings attached: China
content: China will not attach any strings when extending financial assistance to Sri Lanka and will not use an investigation into alleged human rights violations or war crimes during the armed conflict as a precondition, Chinese Foreign Affairs Ministry said yesterday.

title: Gamage could get back Sevenagala Sugar
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera had proposed to rescind the Expropriation Act introduced by the previous government to take over some private ventures, including the Sevanagala Sugar Factory that belonged to Minister of Primary Industries Daya Gamage. The then government acquired the properties of 36 companies categorized as underutilized assets in terms of this Act.

title: UNP back-benchers to ask Prez who criticised him
content: The United National Party ( UNP) back-benchers have decided to meet President Maithripala Sirisena to find out who had criticized him for appointing the commission to probe the CB bond issue .

title: Ravi urges action against ASG Kodagoda, media
content: UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake today requested Speaker Karu Jayasuriya to take action against Additional Solicitor General Yasantha Kodagoda and the media for making false allegations against him and thus violating his parliamentary privileges.

title: 25 injured in Hatton bus accident
content: Around 25 people have been injured when a SLTB bus plying between Dayagama and Hatton veered off the road at Ensiwatte area in Hatton this evening.

title: Ex-Dy. Minister Shantha Premarathne sentenced to 4 years RI
content: Former Deputy Minister Shantha Premarathne, who was found guilty of accepting a bribe of Rs.50, 000 from a woman after promising to get her a government job, was sentenced to four years rigorous imprisonment and told to pay a fine of Rs.10,000 by Colombo High Court Judge Piyasena Ranasinghe yesterday.

title: LG polling date between Jan 25 and 31
content: The Elections Commission today decided to conduct the polls to elect members to the local authorities on a date between January 25 and 31, it is learnt.

title: Asylum seekers defy deadline for closure of PNG detention center
content: Hundreds of refugees and asylum seekers were barricading themselves inside a detention center in Papua New Guinea (PNG) on Tuesday, defying attempts by Australia and PNG authorities to close the facility.

title: Bond Commission: Justice Jayawardane recuses from hearing FR
content: Justice Priyantha Jayawardane recused himself from hearing the fundamental rights petition filed by a Central Bank official against the officers of the Attorney General’s Department on the basis that two respondents were his close friends.

title: Pricing formula for fuel by March next year; electricity by September
content: The government is committed to introduce a cost-reflective pricing formula for fuel and electricity by next year, Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy said.

title: BASL worried Unitary character of State could convert to Federal
content: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) yesterday expressed its grave concern about the proposed amendments to Articles 1 and 2 of the present Constitution stating that the proposed amendments in the Interim Report of the Constitutional Assembly had the effect of converting the Unitary character of the State to a Federal structure.

title: Two labourers killed in car crash on E03
content: Two labourers involved in road clearing activities along the Colombo-Katunayake Expressway (E03), were killed when a car skidded off the road and crashed into them, Police said.

title: President will reveal govt. stance on SAITM on Mon. - Kiriella
content: Higher Education Minster Lakshman Kiriella told Parliament today that President Maithripala Sirisena will reveal the government stance on SAITM on Monday.

title: Bond Commission’s ongoing proceedings come to an end
content: The Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) concluded its recording of Evidence today stating that it had forwarded a list of questions to the Prime Minister and if necessary would request him to attend a hearing to seek further clarifications.

title: Water levels of Kalu, Nilwala, Gin rivers increase
content: Water levels of  the Kalu, Nilwala and Gin rivers and Attanagalu Oya are increasing due to the heavy rains experienced, the Disaster Management Centre said (DMC) today.

title: Train strike called off
content: The Locomotive Operating Engineers Union has decided to call off their strike temporarily following discussions with the President’s Secretary Secretary Austin Fernando this evening.

title: 44 police officers transferred
content: Two HQIs and 42 OICs have been transferred with immediate effect due to service requirements, Police said today.

title: SL fast becoming centre of gravity in world affairs: Ruwan
content: Maritime stakeholders should focus their attention on a greater maritime visibility for enhanced maritime security cooperation with friendly nations, said State Minister of Defence, Ruwan Wijewardene who was the Chief Guest at today's 8th Galle Dialogue.

title: EC to train 15,000 senior presiding officers
content: The Elections Commission has taken steps to train 15,000 Senior Presiding Officers and Assistant Election Commissioners in view of the upcoming local government elections.

title: Dinuka Krishan highest scorer at Grade 5 scholarship exam
content: Dinuka Krishan of Harischandra Maha Vidyalaya in Negombo secured a grand total of 198 marks at this year’s Grade 5 Scholarship Examination thereby becoming the highest scorer islandwide, the Examinations Department announced today.

title: Won't remain silent if SL interests are at stake: Prelate
content: Malwatte Chapter Mahanayake the Most Ven. Thibbatuwave Siddartha Sri Sumangala Thera said he and the Mahasanga would not remain silent if anything inimical to the interest of the country took place.

title: WP councillor Amal Silva arrested
content: Western Provincial Councillor (UPFA) Amal Pushpakumara Silva was arrested yesterday by the officials of the Mount Lavinia Division Crimes Prevention Unit for allegedly possessing live ammunition.

title: Fmr. CJ Silva files a petition in SC
content: Former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva today filed fundamental rights violation petition challenging the enactment of Provincial Council Elections Amendment Bill.

title: Price of lunch packets will increase: Canteen owners
content: The price of lunch packets will be increased in the wake of the price of a domestic LP gas cylinder going up by Rs.110, All Island Canteen Owners Association Chairman Asela Sampath said today.

title: New Constitution to please separatists: Wimal
content: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa said today that the government was trying to bring in the new Constitution on the requirement of the Western forces and Tamil Diaspora to please Tamil separatists.

title: Constitutional Assembly: focus on aspirations of all people
content: The Constitutional Assembly and the steering committee should focus on the aspirations of all people when it comes to compiling a new Constitution instead of taking into account the ideologies of a few, joint opposition parliamentary group leader Dinesh Gunawardene said today.

title: LG polls only after Jan: PM
content: The Local Government elections could only be held in January next year while the party leaders could decide on the Provincial Council polls later, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe informed Parliament today.

title: Assaulting Police: 18 arrested
content: Weli Oya Police today arrested 18 suspects including three women in connection with assaulting the police officers and aiding to flee a suspect who was held in custody by the police.

title: Power disruption in several areas due to sabotage: CEB
content: Electricity supply to several areas in the Southern Province, Mount Lavinia and Piliyandala was interrupted due to acts of sabotage by CEB employees and also due to the heavy rains, Power and Renewable Energy Ministry Media Spokesman Sulakshana Jayawardane said today.

title: Train service between Pengiriwatta-Nugegoda obstructed
content: The train service operations between Pengiriwatte and Nugegoda on the Kelani Valley Railway line obstructed due to fallen of trees on to the railway line, the Railway Control Room said.

title: Lankan sentenced for smuggling migrants to Canada
content: A Sri Lankan man found guilty of smuggling Tamil migrants to Canada won't serve any more time in prison, despite being handed a four-sentence on Monday.

title: Aloysius arrives at Commission again
content: The owner of the Perpetual Treasuries Ltd, Arjun Aloysius arrived at the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) for the fourth day, this morning.

title: Amend IR Bill: Dayasiri tells Govt.
content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) today called for amendments to the Inland Revenue (Amendment) Bill.

title: No whereabouts of Arjun Aloysius: CID
content: In the wake of the breakthrough made by Attorney General’s Department against Arjun Aloysius that he had received inside information with regard to the price sensitive details in bond trading, the PCoI had summoned him on September 5 to record a statement with CID officials.

title: WPC postpones debate on draft 20A
content: The Western Provincial Council (WPC) today postponed the debate and the vote on the draft bill on the 20th Amendment to the Constitution till next Monday.

title: I am ready to give evidence against Gen. Jayasuriya: SF
content: Minister and Field Marshal, Sarath Fonseka said yesterday he had information on the crimes committed by former army commander Jagath Jayasuriya, the then Vanni commander and that he was ready to give evidence if proper legal action was instituted against him.

title: Anti-SAITM group hold protest vigils country wide
content: An organisation calling itself Anti-SAITM people’s Front launched protest vigil last night demanding the immediate closure of the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM).

title: Shooting in Maradana injures two
content: Two individuals were critically injured when they were shot at by two suspects travelling on a bike in Maradana a short while ago, police said.

title: JO wins all four coop polls of Godakawela MPCS
content: The Joint Opposition today charged that a group of UNP members had disrupted the elections held for the Godakawela Cooperative Society in the Ratnapura District and assaulted officials and Opposition members yesterday.

title: GL goes to SC over draft 20A
content: Joint Opposition stalwart Prof. G. L. Peiris today filed a petition at the Supreme Court against the draft 20th Amendment to the Constitution.

title: Rs. 58 bn sought for road development
content: The Higher Education and Highways Ministry today sought Parliamentary approval for Rs.53,000 million to fund six projects including the extension of the Southern Expressway, construction of the third phase of the Colombo Outer Circular Road and the construction of a new bridge across the Kelani River.

title: 20,000 graduates to get jobs soon: PM
content: The reconciliation process would have to move on a slow pace as it would have to look at many aspects, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said at the opening ceremony of the new Municipal Council Building in Eravur today.

title: Van hits pedestrians in Barcelona ‘terror attack’
content: A van has ploughed into crowds in Barcelona's famous Las Ramblas tourist area, the BBC reported a short while ago.

title: Emirates A380 lands at BIA: Proves resurfaced runway fit for any aircraft: Minister
content: The landing of the Emirates A380 aircraft at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) proves that the newly resurfaced runway is suitable for the landing of any aircraft, Civil Aviation Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said.

title: Sri Lanka all out for 135
content: India dismissed Sri Lanka for 135 runs and enforced the follow on, with Kuldeep Yadav taking 4 wickets, Indian media reported. Earlier, Hardik Pandya scored a century to power India to 487.

title: 43 completed files gathering dust for 2 yrs: Rajitha
content: Some 43 files on which investigations had been completed by the FCID, the Bribery Commission and the CID on various crimes have been forwarded to the AG’s Department some two years ago and they are gathering dust.,Cabinet spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senaratne said today.

title: Powerful earthquake kills at least 13 in China, 175 injured
content: At least 13 people were killed and 175 more injured late Tuesday after a powerful earthquake struck a popular tourist area in southwest China, according to state media.

title: EC not in favour of postponing polls: Chairman
content: Against the backdrop of the government drafting two Bills which, if enacted, would make way for the postponement of the Provincial Council Elections due this year, the Election Commission said it was not in favour of withholding elections even through a parliamentary process.

title: Ex-bosses of Rakna Lanka and Avant Garde indicted in HC
content: Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited's former chairman (Rtd) Major General Palitha Fernando and Avant Garde's former chairman (Rtd) Major Nissanka Senadhipathy were indicted on 47 counts by the Bribery Commission in the Colombo High Court today.

title: Govt. to introduce e-passport for Lankan citizens
content: The government had approved the proposal which had made by the Department of Immigration and Emigration. The department has made initial arrangements to issue e-passport with an electronic chip that includes bio data of the owner.

title: Resign without waiting for no-faith motion: JO to Ravi
content: Foreign Affairs Minister Ravi Karunanayake should resign without waiting for the No-Confidence Motion which would be brought against him for allegedly indulging the funds obtained from the Central Bank (CB) Bond Scam, the Joint Opposition said today.

title: CEB to further restrict electricity supply to consumers
content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) yesterday warned of a further restriction in the supply of electricity due to the reduction of hydro-power electricity generation as the water levels in the reservoirs had dropped drastically to 36 per cent of capacity.

title: SI assaulted by four member gang in Jaffna
content: A police sub inspector was admitted to hospital after an unidentified motor-cycle gang attacked him on Wednesday (26) night at Wallimadam, Thunnalai in Jaffna, Nelliadi police said.

title: Army takes over operations of petroleum refineries
content: Control of fuel distribution from the Kolonnawa and Muthurajawela refineries was taken over by the Army at midnight in order to restore fuel supply in the country, Army Spokesman Roshan Seneviratne said.

title: Aloysius told to handover mobile phones to CID
content: The Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) on the CB bond issue today ordered Perpetual Treasuries Ltd owner Arjun Aloysius to hand over to the CID his mobile phones and other communication equipment used in 2015 and 2016.

title: Sugar container with undetected cocaine: Three Customs officers transferred
content: Three Customs officers, said to have been in charge of examining the controversial sugar container with 219 kilos of cocaine worth more than Rs.3.2 billion were transferred from their posts with immediate effect.

title: Constitution-making: Sampanthan urges UNP-SLFP consensus
content: Opposition Leader R. Sampanthan, who is also the leader of the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) said the UNP and the SLFP must put aside their petty political agendas join together to ensure the success of the constitutional-making process.

title: IMF completes second review of the extended arrangement
content: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) completed the second review of Sri Lanka’s economic performance under the program supported by a three-year extended arrangement under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement.

title: New mosquito species spreading dengue
content: A new species of mosquito, ‘Aedes Aegypti Type-2' which has developed resistance to fogging, BTI and other dengue control methods was the reason for the most number of dengue cases this year, Government Epidemiology Unit's Dengue Control Unit Director Dr. Hasitha Tissera said.

title: President leaves for Bangladesh on three day visit
content: President Maithripala Sirisena left for Bangladesh on a three day state visit this morning, President’s Media Division said.

title: Burning of tyres continue in Pt. Pedro
content: Burning of tyres on the road and pelting stones at the Special Task Force (STF) were reported for the second day in the Point-Pedro area in Jaffna yesterday, in connection with an incident in which an individual was killed when an illegal sand transporting vehicle was shot at by the Police.

title: Thajudeen's missing body parts: SLMC holds ex-JMO accountable: AG
content: The Attorney General yesterday informed the Colombo High Court that Colombo's former Chief JMO Ananda Samarasekera was found accountable in the investigations carried out by the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC) into the misplacing of Wasim Thajudeen's body parts.

title: Enforced disappearance bill not taken up in Parliament
content: The International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance Bill which was to be taken up in Parliament yesterday was not taken up as scheduled.

title: Elephants pose threat to Sri Lanka-Zimbabwe ODI
content: Sri Lanka is to deploy game wardens to stop wild elephants straying onto the pitch when the country hosts Zimbabwe for a series of ODI at the Hambantota stadium.

title: Japan gives Rs. 3.4bn aid to setup Doppler Weather Radar
content: Following the flood disaster Japan had has decided to provide a grant aid worth Rs. 3.4 billion to improve short- range weather forecast, through the establishment of a Doppler Weather Radar Network, the Japanese Embassy.

title: Amending PTA, not repealing it: Wijeyadasa
content: Introducing amendments to the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), does not mean that the Act will be repealed or replaced by a new Act and there will be nor room left for the country’s security to be jeopardized, Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said.

title: LG elections before year end
content: The Elections Commission yesterday said the Local Government elections can be held before the year end if technical issues pertaining to the Local Government Election Law are resolved by July this year.

title: Govt. to shut diplomatic missions
content: Several Sri Lankan Missions abroad including some of those in Europe would be closed down soon, Minister of Foreign Affairs Ravi Karunanayake said yesterday.

title: Time to rethink liquor sale on Poya Days: Mangala
content: The time has come for the country to rethink banning of liquor sales on Poya Days, Finance and Mass Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera told Parliament yesterday.Speaking during a debate on the notifications made under Excise Ordinance in the House, the Minister said liquor sales were higher on Poya Days tha

title: Arresting Buddhist monk not easy: DIG Jayakody
content: Police spokesman Priyantha Jayakody today admitted that the Police had failed to arrest Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Galagodaatte Gnanasara Thera until he surrendered to Court.

title: Parliament suspended for few minutes
content: Parliament sessions were suspended for a brief period due to a tense situation which arose when parliamentarian Dinesh Gunawardane raised a question on the dengue menace.

title: Special Govt. group meeting today: Gayantha
content: A special meeting of the Government Parliamentary Group, comprising Ministers and MPs of both United National Party (UNP), Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) would be held at Temple Trees today (June 19), Cabinet Co Spokesman Gayantha Karunathilaka said yesterday.

title: Kelaniya Uni. temporarily closed
content: The University of Kelaniya was temporarily closed after about 900 students have been affected by viral flu and diarrhea, Deputy Vice chancellor Prof. Lakshman Seneviratne said today.

title: Vigneswaran takes over NPC temporarily
content: Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Vigneswaran today temporarily took over all four ministerial portfolios of the council under his purview after informing two of the ministers to resign and the other two to go on a month's-leave, due to charges of corruption.

title: UN Rapporteur’s report hammers SL judiciary
content: The report by former UN Special Rapporteur on the independence of judges and lawyers, Mónica Pinto based on her mission to Sri Lanka last year, was tabled to the UN Human Rights Council yesterday and the report highly criticized Sri Lanka’s justice system.

title: Lane law to be strictly implemented in Colombo
content: Police said it would launch a special traffic operation from tomorrow to arrest the drivers who violate lane rules in Colombo and its suburbs.

title: Wijerama shops set ablaze: police arrest suspect
content: Police Intelligence officers have arrested a suspect in connection with the incident where several Muslim owned shops were set ablaze in Wijerama, Maharagama, Police Headquaters said.

title: Myanmar military plane carrying 116 missing
content: A Myanmar military plane carrying 116 people went missing on Wednesday between the southern city of Myeik and Yangon, according to the office of the army chief and an airport source.

title: Sea waves encroaching Kalutara
content: Saltwater intrusion is common occurrence along the Kalutara lagoon boundaries now following the deepening of lagoon estuary.

title: SA beat SL in Champions Trophy
content: Leg-spinner Imran Tahir and former captain Hashim Amla excelled in South Africa's 96 run win over Sri Lanka in their Champions Trophy opener at The Oval on Saturday.

title: Court dismisses petition filed by Perpetual Treasuries
content: The Court of Appeal dismissed with costs the writ petition filed by Perpetual Treasuries Ltd seeking the cancellation of the Monetary Board directive limiting the transactions carried out by the company and its two subsidiaries.

title: JO wants circular ensuring safety of public servant
content: The joint opposition (JO) today requested President Maithripala Sirisena to issue a circular ensuring the safety of government servants who are providing relief to flood and landslide-affected people disregarding standard protocols and circulars.

title: China donates relief items worth of US $ 2.2 million
content: China responded to flood disaster in Sri Lanka by committing to donate relief items worth of US 2.2 million, a statement said today.

title: Airman and 2 others injured during rescue operations
content: An airman and two individuals, who were being rescued, were injured when they fell from a Mi17 helicopter in Neluwa, Galle this morning.

title: Duterte declares martial rule in south Philippines
content: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte Wednesday enforced martial law in his country’s south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages, Washington Post posted on Tuesday.

title: Why replace the Best Finance Minister? Asks JO
content: The government should reveal the reason for replacing its Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake who was not long ago awarded the title of ‘Finance Minister of the Year for Asia-Pacific-2016’ by The Banker magazine, the joint opposition said today.

title: President pays glowing tribute to fallen war heroes
content: The motherland was saved from separatist terrorism by non other than our own war heroes as even foreign armies failed to do that in the 30-year civil war in Sri Lanka, President Maithripala Sirisena said yesterday.

title: Potta Naufer’s second wife, son arrested
content: The second wife and son of notorious underworld gangster M.N. Naufer alias Potta Naufer, were among five people arrested by the Special Task Force (STF) today while attempting to smuggle 609 grams of gold to India.

title: CEB to introduce new payment system
content: The Power and Renewable Energy Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya today said that Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) had introduced a new payment system for consumers to pay their electricity bill according to their daily usage but will not affect the ongoing bill.

title: Govt. asks SAITM to stop recruitment pending policy changes
content: Higher Education and Highways Minister Lakshman Kiriella said the government had requested the South Asia Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) to stop the admissions of fresh batches of students until the policy decisions regarding it and private medical education were implemented

title: Buddha Dhamma provides solutions to our problems: President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena today stressed the need to build a stronger economy, a balanced legal system and restore peace among the various communities living in Sri Lanka and resolve global issues through the Buddha Dhamma.

title: Modi here today for UN Vesak festival
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will arrive in Sri Lanka this afternoon to attend the 14th UN Vesak Day celebrations to be held in Colombo and Kandy.

title: Lankan guilty of second-degree murder in Canada
content: A jury in Canada that had been deliberating since last week found Amalan Thandapanithesigar, who came to Canada as Sri Lankan refugee, guilty of second-degree murder for having stabbed his neighbour in Côte-des-Neiges, Montreal in Canada, Montreal Gazette reported.

title: False rumors: CID to probe social media
content: The Ministry of Health lodge a complaint with the CID against the social media websites which are publishing false information that H.I.V. AIDS is being spread by the health officials who visit homes to test blood samples for filariasis during night.

title: Contracts of locomotive drivers and guards to be terminated
content: All contract-based locomotive drivers and railway guards who would fail to report to work today will be considered as having vacated their posts, Railways Superintendent Wijaya Samarasinghe said today.

title: Hanuman Bridge: SL could hold different view- PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday that he had informed Indian Minister of Road Transport Nitin Gadkari that Sri Lanka could hold a different view about the ‘Hanuman Bridge, proposed to be built between Sri Lanka and India and this would be discussed after the construction of the proposed Northern Highway.

title: SLTB also to strike over SAITM
content: Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has threatened to stop work on Friday (5) over what it claims as a move to privatize higher education system by recognizing SAITM as a degree awarding medical institution, the SLTB Joint Trade Union Alliance said.

title: Will return to politics in a big way: Tissa
content: UNP's former general secretary Tissa Attanayake said yesterday the UNP is not looking after the elephants which laboured for the party, but only serving the elephants which adorn the perahera.

title: Govt. confident of regaining GSP+ by defeating EU Parliament motion
content: Sri Lanka will regain the GSP+ concession by defeating the resolution submitted by a group in the European Parliament saying that the GSP+ should not be granted to Sri Lanka, Deputy Foreign Affairs Minister Harsha De Silva said today.

title: Missing Persons: TPC to launch hartal in NE
content: The Tamil People’s Council (TPC) led by Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran has decided to stage a hartal in the Northern and the Eastern Provinces to compel the government to resolve the concerns raised by the relatives of those gone missing during the armed conflict.

title: Fourth round of talks between India and SL on ETCA today
content: The fourth round of official talks between India and Sri Lanka regarding the Economic and Technology Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) will take place today (24) in New Delhi, officials said yesterday.

title: Truck ploughs through shops killing 20 in Andhra
content: At least 20 people died and 10 others were injured after a truck ploughed through commercial roadside shops at Yerpedu village in Chittoor district in Andhra Pradesh today, the Times of India reported.

title: No cigarette sales near schools
content: The government will prohibit cigarette sales within a periphery of 500 metres from schools, Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday.

title: Govt. agrees to release more military-occupied land: TNA
content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) said yesterday the Government had assured it would release several more blocks lands occupied by the security forces in the North and East.

title: Death toll climbs to 19
content: Two more bodies were recovered from the debris of the Meethotamulla garbage dump that collapsed on hundreds of houses, taking the overall death toll to 19, officials confirmed a short while ago.

title: Two civilians, five cops injured in clash
content: Two civilians and five policemen were admitted to the Maha Oya Hospital after a clash that broke out at Samagipura in Maha Oya on Tuesday night.

title: China, SL good traditional neighbours:  Chinese top advisor
content: China and Sri Lanka are traditional good neighbours and their people have enjoyed long history of exchanges, Chinese top political advisor Yu Zhengsheng has said.

title: SC interim order stays cutting down Pannipitiya Bo-tree
content: A Supreme Court Bench comprising Justices Eva Wanasundera and Anil Gooneratne has issued an interim order, effective till May 9, restraining the Road Development Authority from cutting down the Bo-tree in Pannipitiya on the border of the Colombo-Avissawella Road.

title: Duminda Silva fined Rs. 3,000
content: Colombo Additional Magistrate Aruni Artigala today ordered former MP Duminda Silva to pay a fine of Rs.3,000 after he pleaded guilty for not declaring his assets and liabilities from 2011 to 2013.

title: Qatar urges nationals not to travel to Sri Lanka
content: Qatar Foreign Ministry has urged nationals not to travel to Sri Lanka due to health concern. They have put out a travel warning on their official Twitter page urging people not to visit Sri Lanka as H1N1 is reportedly spreading throughout the Central province, which includes Kandy, a favourite tourist spot.

title: Motorist involved in hit-n-run nabbed
content: A motorist who had allegedly hit and ran a homeless man in the Horton Place with his Porsche sports coupe last Sunday had been nabbed by the Cinnamon Gardens Police yesterday following a thorough operation, the Police said

title: India could develop Colombo, Trinco, KKS ports: Arjuna
content: Though China is deeply rooted in Hambantota port, Sri Lanka has three other major ports in Colombo, Trincomalee and Kankesanthurai where India could collaborate for development, Ports and Shipping Minister Arjuna Ranatunga has said.

title: Fort Railway Station bomb: Convict sentenced 20 years RI
content: High Court today sentenced Kanakasabai Devadasan alias Nadan to a 20-year rigorous imprisonment over the charges of aiding, abetting and conspiring the 2008 Fort Railway Station suicide bombing, in which 12 people were killed and more than 100 people injured.

title: Won't open road opposite Dalada Maligawa: Kiriella
content: Highways and Higher Education Minister Lakshman Kiriella today confirmed on behalf of the government yesterday that the road opposite the Sri Dalada Maligawa would not be reopened for vehicular traffic despite the demands by some.

title: Rajinikanth cancels Sri Lanka visit
content: Actor Rajinikanth has pulled out of the event of handing over the keys of 150 homes to Tamils in Jaffna on April 9.

title: President to take crucial decisions soon: Yapa
content: President Maithripala Sirisena is to take several crucial politically and economically important decisions over the next few weeks, State Minister of Finance Lakshman Yapa Abeywardane revealed yesterday.

title: JO questions PM’s honesty
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe’s assurance that the Government would only allow the participation of foreign observers and not foreign judges in an accountability mechanism to look into war crime charges was untrue and dishonest, the Joint Opposition said today.

title: Russian couple arrested for overstaying
content: A Russian couple was arrested in Pelena, Weligama for overstaying their visa and violating immigration laws, Police said.

title: Dual citizenship: Samarasinghe denies Geetha’s claims
content: Denying parliamentarian Geetha Kumarasinghe’s allegations made to the media that he was a dual citizenship holder, Skills Development Minister Samarasinghe said he did not hold dual citizenship either in Switzerland or in any other country except that of being a citizen of Sri Lanka.

title: Mahendran transferred 500 CB staff in 2015
content: When Arjuna Mahendran was the Governor of the Central Bank, he had transferred 500 members of the bank's staff, including some senior officers and heads of departments, in year 2015 alone, an official said.

title: PRECIFAC summons MR
content: The PRECIFAC summoned former President Mahinda Rajapaksa tomorrow to record a statement in connection with alleged financial misappropriation.

title: SAITM: COPE summons committee members appointed by former regime
content: As a means of facilitating its inquiry into the SAITM issue the parliamentary Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) has decided to summon on March 20, all those who served in the various committees appointed by the previous government.

title: No Indian devotees at Kachchathivu Feat
content: Though more than 5,000 pilgrims from India had been scheduled to attend St. Anthony’s Feast of Kachchathivu islet this year, none attended it, the Navy said today.

title: Three Ministers oppose SAITM
content: The authorities running the South Asian Institute of Technology and Management (SAITM) in Malabe behave more or less like underworld figures rather than administrators of an institution, Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka told Parliament yesterday.

title: Speaker removes MP Dinesh from House
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya ordered MP Dinesh Gunawardana to leave the House due to his unruly behavior. Parliament was suspended twice today.

title: FUTA threaten token strike; uncertainty over uni students' exams
content: The Federation of University Teachers’ Associations (FUTA) today threatened to go ahead with its planned trade union action on March 8 and 9 even though it might jeopardize the exams of undergraduates.

title: Pakistani arrested at BIA with heroin worth Rs.50 mn
content: A 25-year-old Pakistani national was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for possessing 5.5 Kg of heroin worth Rs. 50 million early this morning.

title: Thajudeen killing: Suspicious number used by ex-DIG detected
content: Deputy Solicitor General Dilan Ratnayake yesterday informed court that another suspicious phone number used by former DIG Anura Senanayake to contact the Presidential Secretariat at the time that Wasim Thajudeen died was detected by the CID recently.

title: Gurusinha appointed Manager for National Team
content: Former Sri Lankan batsman Asanka Gurusinha has been appointed as the Manager Cricket for the National Team of Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. will go on till 2021: Amunugama
content: Minister Sarath Amunugama said yesterday the government would go on till 2021, when the next presidential election is scheduled to be held, though some opposition politicians say otherwise to please their supporters.

title: Sigiriya toilets out of order; tourists asked to go to jungle
content: Tourists have been forced to use the jungle to answer calls of nature as the washrooms at Sigiriya heritage site are have been closed for repair.

title: Australia beat Sri Lanka to avoid T20 series whitewash
content: Australia beat Sri Lanka by 41 runs in their final Twenty20 game today, avoiding a whitewash in the three-match series and salvaging some pride.

title: Melbourne plane crash: Five killed as aircraft hits shopping centre
content: Five people have died after a light plane crashed into a shopping centre in Melbourne, Australia.

title: Lankan woman nabbed with 11Kgs of pangolin scales
content: A Sri Lankan woman was arrested with 11 kilograms of pangolin scales by the airport customs officers last night while she was trying to smuggle them to Chennai.

title: New Constitution: JO MPs step down from sub-committees
content: Joint opposition members including MPs Bandula Gunawardane, Keheliya Rambukwella and Tharaka Balasuriya today resigned from the Sub Committees attached to the Constitutional Assembly.

title: Enrolment of students to SAITM will continue
content: The chairman of SAITM, Dr Neville Fernando said that a decision would be taken on whether to suspend the enrolment of students at SAITM for six months after discussing this matter with the Higher Education Ministry. Till then more students would be taken in, he said.

title: EU Ambassador to meet CV
content: EU Ambassador to Sri Lanka and the Maldives Tung-Laï Margue would meet Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran during his visit to the Northern Province from February 15 to 17, the EU Embassy in Colombo said today.

title: SL jumps to 3rd place on Global RTI ratings
content: Sri Lanka has achieved the third best strongest legal framework for the Right to Information (RTI) in the Global RTI ratings, the Canadian based RTI watch-dog Centre for Law and Democracy (CLD) announced.

title: Two wrongs do not make a right: VAC
content: The financial misappropriation allegedly committed by former Central Bank (CB) governor Arjun Mahendran could not be swept under the carpet just because he alleged that his predecessor was also involved in such misappropriations, Voice Against Corruption (VAC) today charged.

title: I had death threats from Feb.1: SAITM CEO
content: SAITM's Chief Executive Officer Dr. Sameera Senaratne whose car came under gunfire on Monday night said today he had received death threats on three consecutive days and that he had complained to the IGP, DIG and the Mulleriyawa Police about these threats.

title: Ranjan complains to BC against Div. Sec.
content: Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake has complained to the Bribery Commission (BC) against the Divulapitiya Divisional Secretary with whom he was at loggerheads recently.

title: Queen Elizabeth extends wishes on Independence Day
content: Queen Elizabeth II in a message on Sri Lanka’s Independence Day has extended her best wishes for the good fortune and happiness of the people of Sri Lanka in the coming year.

title: If allegations proved/Minister Harrison offers to resign
content: Rural Economic Affairs Minister P. Harrison said yesterday that he would resign from his ministerial portfolio and quit parliament if it was proved that the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) had swindled even five cents.

title: Two Lankans nabbed with gold nuggets hidden under tongues
content: Two Sri Lankan men were arrested with 180gramms of gold nuggets worth Rs.1 million hidden under their tongues at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning while trying to smuggle them out to Trivandrum, India.

title: Sajin Vass to be tried on May 3
content: The trial against Sajin Vass Gunawardena, who was charged with entering into an illegal contract worth Rs.883 million with a Singaporean company to purchase ground handling equipment for Mihin Lanka while functioning as its CEO was fixed for May 3.

title: Automobile market collapses by over 40%
content: Automobile trade in Sri Lanka is facing extreme difficulties due to the recent regulations introduced by the government, the former chairman of the Ceylon Motor Traders Association (CMTA) Gihan Pilapitiya said yesterday.

title: Tharanga to Captain ODI against South Africa
content: Upul Tharanga has been chosen to Captain Sri Lanka’s five ODI matches against South Africa starting in Port Elizabeth this Saturday, the SLC said today.

title: Two killed, 33 injured in head-on collision in Nittambuwa
content: Two passengers were killed and another thirty-three were injured when a container and a bus collided head-on at Bataliya in Nittambuwa on the Colombo-Kandy Main Road this morning.

title: NZ , SL to open diplomatic posts
content: New Zealand and Sri Lanka will open diplomatic posts in each other's nations and are considering a free trade agreement, the New Zealand's trade minister said on Friday.

title: Unitary character and devolution: Decision upto Parliament: Kiriella
content: While stating that no decision had been made in the constitutional process regarding the unitary character or devolution of power, Leader of the House and the member of the Constitution Steering Committee Lakshman Kiriella said today the final decision on these matters will be made by Parliament.

title: Last man to walk on Moon, dies aged 82
content: US astronaut Gene Cernan - the last man to walk on the Moon - has died aged 82. America's space agency Nasa said it was "saddened by the loss" of the retired spaceman.

title: Drone camera falls on the Ruwanweli Mahaseya; man arrested
content: A videographer attached to a private TV station was arrested following his drone camera fell on the sacred Ruwanweli Mahaseya's base in Anuradhapura yesterday during the Kapruka Pooja, the Police Said.

title: Misuse of state vehicles: Marasinghe must be arrested first: NFF
content: United National Party (UNP) MP Ashu Marasinghe, a former chairman of the State Engineering Corporation, should have been arrested first if the alleged misuse of 40 state vehicles by opposition MP Wimal Weerawansa is true, National Freedom Front (NFF) said today.

title: Maithri next Presidential candidate: SB
content: SLFP Chairman President Maithripala Sirisena would be the next Presidential candidate of the SLFP, Social Empowerment and Welfare Minister S.B. Dissanayake said yesterday.

title: Italian anti-submarine warship to visit SL
content: The Italian Navy FREMM (European Multi-Mission Frigate) Carabiniere is scheduled to arrive in Colombo for a four-day visit from January 11 to 14.

title: Court order banning protests in H’tota
content: The Hambantota Magistrate has issued a court order banning all protests in the Hambantota area within the course of the day.

title: Stand firm against injustice by UNP members: President
content: President Maitripala Sirisena is reported to have instructed the State Ministers and the Deputy Ministers representing his Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) to stand firm against injustice by the United National Party (UNP) in running the government.

title: Foundation stone laid for vehicle assembly plant in Kuliyapitiya
content: The foundation stone was laid for a motor car assembly plant “Western Automobile Assembly Factory” in Mahanugalanda estate, Labuyaya, Kuliyapitiya with the participation of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today.

title: Unlucky strike
content: Lottery ticket sales agents in many parts of the country boycotted sales yesterday protesting against the price increase of tickets to Rs. 30.

title: North East monsoon setting in: Met Dep.
content: North-East monsoonal conditions are gradually setting in over the country, the Department of Meteorology said today.

title: NWPC rejects Dev. Draft Bill
content: The controversial development (special provisions) Draft Bill was rejected by a majority of 20 members in the North Western Provincial Council (NWPC) today.

title: Police News: Police says IGP did not issue such order
content: The Police Department today announced that IGP Pujith Jayasundara had not issued an order to restrict sending daily Police news to private media institutions.

title: Development Bill to engage PCs in national development: PM
content: The main objective of the Development (Special Provision) Bill is to engage the Provincial Councils in national development, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: Herath named in ICC Test team of the year
content: Spin-wizard Rangana Herath was named in the ICC Test team of the year 2016 captained by Englishman Alastair Cook. He is the only Sri Lankan to be named in either Test or ODI team announced by the International Cricket Council today as no other Sri Lanka had impressed the selection panel.

title: Close down SAITM: JVP
content: In fresh disclosures on the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM), the JVP today alleged that the private medical college had bribed some of the members of the sub-committee appointed by the oversight committee which recommended that it should be converted into a public-private partnership.

title: Chavakachcheri  accident victims’ bodies airlifted to Ratmalana
content: Bodies of 11 victims of the accident  that occurred in Chavakachcheri Jaffna were airlifted to the Ratmalana Airport today.

title: Deputy Media Minister condemns attack on journalist
content: While condemning the conduct of the Navy Commander who attacked a journalist covering a protest at the Hambantota Port last Saturday, Deputy Mass Media Minister Karunarathna Paranavithana said yesterday that the navy commander should have kept in mind the people’s mandate given to the government.

title: Court order on protesting employees at H’tota port
content: The Hambantota Magistrate’s Court today issued an order containing seven conditions to stop the protest and Satayagraha by the Hambantota Port employees as it hampered the activities of the Port.

title: 1,725 AWOL members of tri-forces seek legal discharge
content: A total of 1,725 tri-forces personnel including four officers, who are considered as Absent Without Official Leave (AWOL) have reported to their respective service centres seeking legal discharge as of December 10, the Defence Ministry said.

title: PM, Sampanthan discuss constitutional reforms with MR
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, joined by Opposition Leader R. Sampanthan, met a joint opposition’s delegation led by former president Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday and discussed constitutional reforms.

title: Colombo Port canteen fire kills one
content: A 38-year-old person had been killed and another was injured due to a fire that broke out at a cafeteria in the premises of Colombo Harbour early today.

title: Mafia inside Prison, influential inmates given facilities: Hirunika
content: Government MP Hirunika Premachandra dropped a bombshell in Parliament  today by claiming that there was a Mafia in the Prison and influential inmates were given all facilities.

title: SLMC gets ultimatum
content: The Elections Commission has issued a deadline on Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) to settle its internal dispute with regard to the post of Party Secretary who would deal with matters concerning elections with the Commission.

title: Kumar Gunaratnam released
content: Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) politburo member Kumar Gunaratnam was released from the Anuradhapura Prison today. He was sentenced to one year imprisonment for violating visa regulations by the Kegalle Magistrate on March 31, 2016.

title: Passports of six MPs impounded: JO
content: The Joint Opposition today brought the attention of the government on the impounding of passport of six members of Parliament.

title: Cambodian PM cancels visit to SL
content: Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen has canceled his tentative plan to visit Sri Lanka and other three countries including Pakistan, Australia and New Zealand, the Cambodian Prime Minister’s office announced yesterday.

title: Still no trace on Lasantha’s assailant
content: The Police today released a sketch of a suspect in connection with the murder of former Sunday Leader Editor Lasantha Wickremetunga, for the third time seeking public help.

title: System failure causes 2-1/2 hour delay at counters at BIA
content: The computer system of the Immigration and Emigration Department at the Bandaranaike International Airport- Katunayake had crashed this afternoon.

title: Misusing STF vehicle: Ex-STF Commandant remanded
content: Security Director of Sri Lanka Cricket and Former Special Task Force (STF) Commandant DIG K. L. M. Sarathchandra was today remanded till December 6, by the Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya on charges of misusing a vehicle attached to the STF.

title: 1050 buried IDs found
content: About 1050 national and company Identity cards were recovered from Beminiyanwala in Ambalantota this evening while digging the ground in an irrigation reserve with a backhoe, police said.

title: Chinese national drowns in Weligama
content: A 29-year-old Chinese national drowned in the sea off Udupila, Weligama yesterday while he was sea bathing with a group of foreigners, Police said.

title: Heavy traffic along Lotus Road
content: Heavy traffic is reported along Lotus Road in Fort because of a protest by some of those who lost their houses in the Salawa fire.

title: Mobile brothel raided in Bambalapitiya: four arrested
content: Four persons including three women were arrested for operating a mobile brothel in Bambalapitiya early this morning.

title: Mother and children hacked to death; Husband arrested
content: A mother and two children aged 10 and 08, had been hacked to death at Kanniya in Uppuveli today, the Police said.

title: Five escaped Indian kidney transplant racketeers arrested
content: Five out of seven Indian nationals who were allegedly involved in the kidney transplant racket were arrested by the Pesalai police yesterday, police said.

title: JO lodges complaint against Ravi
content: The joint opposition yesterday lodged a complaint against Finance Minster Ravi Karunanayake at the Bribery Commission over three cases of financial misappropriation during the ‘Yahapalana’ government.

title: Wimal at FICD
content: National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader, MP Wimal Weerawansa arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning to give a statement over alleged financial irregularities, police said.

title: Suspect jumps from 5th floor of Gampaha Hospital, dies
content: A 35-year-old suspect who was severely injured when he is alleged to have jumped from the fifth floor of the Gampaha Hospital is reported to have died after he was admitted to the Colombo National Hospital today.

title: Monetary Board will probe Greek Bond issue: PM
content: Asserting that the COPE report was a victory for the Yahapalana Government, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said today he would call for a meeting of the Monetary Board of the Central Bank next week and take steps for probing the Greek Bond.

title: Mihin Lanka bids adios
content: Budget airline Mihin Lanka will cease operations from today in line with the current Government's policy to amalgamate the airline with the national carrier Srilankan.

title: SL ranks 31st in Global Youth Development Index
content: Sri Lanka ranked 31st in the Global Youth Development Index (YDI) 2016 which was compiled by the Commonwealth Secretariat based on a country’s condition for the youth in terms of employment, education, health, civic and political spheres.

title: Inappropriately dressed MP leaves chambers
content: Badulla District MP Aravindh Kumar who was wearing a dark orange shirt in Parliament was cautioned about his attire by the employees who were on duty inside the chambers yesterday.

title: Crack the whip, not jokes: JO to govt.
content: The Government should comprehend the gravity of the recent violent incidents taking place in the North and act accordingly, without cracking jokes like Aava- Giya in the name of reconciliation, the Joint Opposition said today.

title: Founding UN values must be upheld to overcome problems: Mangala
