content: The founding principles of the United Nations such as pluralism, human rights, respect for diversity and the principle of working together should be upheld in order to overcome the problems faced by the world at present, Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera said today.

title: Cigarette price to increase up to Rs. 55
content: The price of a cigarette is expected to be increased up to Rs.55 with the enactment of the 15 per cent VAT, according to the Minister of Health Rajitha Senaratne.

title: GSP+ by March, a possibility: PM
content: Sri Lanka will regain the GSP plus facility by March next year, if the government goes ahead with its economic plans without making changes, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday.

title: Light turns red for beggars at traffic lights
content: The Police today launched an operation to arrest beggars frequenting traffic lights in a move to prevent traffic congestion and possible road accidents.

title: President' statement twisted by trouble makers: Minister
content: President Maithripala Sirisena has no intention of abolishing or disrupting the investigations being carried out by the independent commissions, Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe said yesterday.

title: Airman shoots himself in Katunayake
content: A 22-year-old airman attached to the Katunayake Air Force camp shot himself on the chest while on duty last night, Police said.

title: SAARC has not lived up to its potential: US
content: SAARC has not lived up to its potential, a top White House official has said adding that they regretted that the regional summit has to be postponed after most of the member countries pulled out of it.

title: Water cuts likely if drought continues
content: The Water Resources and Drainage Board said yesterday it might be compelled to restrict the supply of water in the event that the drought continues.

title: High-level delegation led by Speaker visiting China
content: A top level parliamentary delegation led by Speaker Karu Jayasuriya is reported to have travelled to China on Sunday as part of the initiatives to strengthen relations between the two countries.

title: Bus crashes into bus halt: woman killed
content: A 23-year-old woman was killed when she was knocked down by a private bus at Waturegama on the Galle-Colombo Road early this morning while she was waiting at a bus halt to take a bus to Colombo, Police said.

title: Nimal Lewke President's Security Adviser
content: Retired senior DIG Nimal Lewke has been appointed as the Adviser to Presidential Security, President’s Media Unit said.

title: Minister verbally confronted when he objected to an oral question
content: A heated argument was witnessed in Parliament yesterday when a government minister was verbally confronted by the government ally United National Party ( UNP), Joint Opposition and the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna ( JVP) after he objected to an oral question.

title: 'Pakistani' pigeon carrying threat message for Modi in Indian custody
content: The Punjab Police have said they have "taken into custody" a pigeon that was found near the state's border with Pakistan, carrying a note with a threat message for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: CV’s actions not beneficial but detrimental to Tamils: SF
content: Minister Sarath Fonseka said today the actions of Northern Province Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran would not yield any benefit to the Tamil people but would cause them more problems.

title: Chinese woman nabbed with gems worth Rs.1.1mn
content: A 30-year-old Chinese woman had been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), when she was trying to smuggle out uncut gems to Hong Kong last night, Airport Deputy Customs Director Parakrama Basnayake said.

title: Foreign visits by PC members: Follow prescribed guidelines: MS
content: In the wake of 29 Central Provincial Councillors travelling to Russia yesterday using public funds, the Presidential Secretariat directed the nine Provincial Councils to adhere to the guidelines issued by President Maithripala Sirisena when undertaking foreign trips by public officials and PC members.

title: No new party on Oct. 8: MR
content: While ruling out plans of the Joint Opposition to form a new political party, former President and Kurunegala District MP Mahinda Rajapaksa today said that it is the people who should decide on the establishment of a new party.

title: Techno City will spearhead huge increase in GDP: Ranawaka
content: Innovative technology was the only way to increase GDP, and the Techno City, which was to be built soon at a cost of nearly Rs. 20 billion, would play a major role in achieving this goal, Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka emphasized.

title: Even students who fail O/L can sit A/L from 2018
content: From 2018 onwards, even students who fail the GCE O/L examination will be given an opportunity to sit the GCE A/L, Education Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said today.

title: DIG Vass, wife, son, 5 others indicted in SLIIT abduction case
content: Colombo High Court served indictments on former DIG Vass Gunawardena, his wife Shamalie Priyadarshani Perera, son Ravindu and five other Police officers of the CCD, who had been named by the Attorney General as accused in the Nipuna Ramanayake assault case.

title: Lost and found youth has no signs of assault: Matara JMO
content: The youth from Bandagiriya, who went missing while in the custody of the Hambantota Police and found later in a temple, has not been psychically harmed, a Judicial Medical Officer (JMO) said after examining him.

title: ‘Facebook IGP’ re-remanded
content: A man, who was arrested by the CID over impersonating the IGP on Facebook deceiving women to obtain various unlawful advantages, was re-remanded till September 19 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Nishantha Peiris.

title: Don’t unnecessarily alarm people on Constitution: Malwatu Mahanayake tells Wimal
content: Causing unnecessary fear among the people on the Constitutional proposals and then saying tall tales is unacceptable and unhealthy, the Siyam Nikaye Malwatta Chapter Mahanayake Thibbatuwawe Sri Siddhartha Sumangala Thera told MP Wimal Weerawansa today.

title: New legislation to restructure State Ventures: PM
content: The government will introduce legislation to deal with the process of converting loss making state ventures into viable entities under a new formula, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in Parliament last week.

title: Northern resettlement to finish by next year
content: Resettlement of over 3,000 people displaced in the northern Jaffna will be completed by mid next year, an official has said, days after UN chief Ban Ki-Moon called for expediting reconciliation efforts with the minority Tamils.

title: Govt. agreed with foreign company to outsource tax collection: JVP
content: Government has already signed an agreement with Hong Kong McKenzie Company Ltd. to outsource tax collection, Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) MP Vijitha Herath charged yesterday.

title: Five arrested over assault on Lankan HC in Malaysia
content: Five people have been arrested over the assault on Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to Malaysia Ibrahim Ansar at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA), Star Online reported on Monday.

title: JO to boycott SLFP’s 65th anniversary
content: The joint opposition said today it had unanimously decided to boycott the 65th anniversary celebrations of Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) to be held in Kurunegala on September 04.

title: Unregistered motorcycles - Four months grace period for registration
content: To prevent unregistered motorcycles being used for illegal purposes such as highway robberies, snatching of gold chains, hit and run accidents and in an effort to collect a large amount of unpaid registration fees, the Cabinet on Tuesday approved a grace period of four months for their registration.

title: Hackers remanded
content: The two suspects who were arrested on charges of hacking President Maithripala Sirisena’s official website were remanded till September 2 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya today.

title: Indian Minister skips meeting with Malik
content: Indian Minister of State for Commerce, Nirmala Sitharaman, who was to visit Sri Lanka on August 25 for a short visit at the invitation of the Sri Lankan Minister of International Trade, Malik Samarawickrama, cancelled her visit on account of pressing engagements in New Delhi, reliable sources told Indian Express on Saturday.

title: Gammanpila case: Extracts sent to AG
content: The FCID today told Court that extracts of its investigations into allegations that Udaya Gammanpila and the second suspect Sidney Jayasinghe had defrauded Australian citizen Brain Shaddik of Rs.110 million using a fraudulent Power of Attorney in 1995.

title: Kiriella leaking news: JVP
content: COPE Chairman JVP MP Sunil Handunnetti charged in Parliament yesterday that Leader of the House Lakshman Kiriella had leaked information to the media about contradiction of evidence by the officials of the Central Bank regarding the bond scam, and it amounted to influencing ongoing investigations.

title: Fmr. JMO’s anticipatory bail application: Court notices respondents
content: Considering the anticipatory bail application filed by Former Colombo Chief Judicial Medical Officer Dr. Ananda Samarasekera, requesting bail anticipating arrest over the missing body parts of late Wasim Thajudeen, Colombo Additional Magistrate Aruni Attygalle noticed the OIC of the CID Homicide Division to respond on August 30.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam - Results before Oct. 15
content: Marks of the competitive Grade Five Scholarship Examination which was held yesterday with 350,701 students at 2,959 centres island-wide will be issued before October 15, the Commissioner General of Examinations said.

title: Court orders report on Sujani Bogollagama’s admission to paying ward
content: The Colombo Additional Magistrate Nishantha Peiris ordered Chief JMO of the Colombo National Hospital to submit a comprehensive report over Sujani Bogollagama, who is another suspect a suspect in the inquiry conducted under the Money Laundering Act for purchasing Rs. 100 mn worth shares of a company called Hellocorp, using allegedly ill-gotten funds by the Gowers Corporation headed by Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Aussies thumped
content: Sri Lanka for the first time in its cricketing history made a clean sweep against Australia, the number 1 ranked test  side in the world, beating them by 163 runs in the third and final test match played at the Sinhalese Sports Club grounds, a short while ago.

title: Allegation on poisoning ex-LTTErs: Gammanpila wants Wickramabahu arrested
content: Nava Sama Samaja Party General Secretary Dr. Wickramabahu Karunaratne should be arrested for making false allegations on Sri Lankan tri-forces that ex-LTTE cadres in detention had been allegedly injected with poisonous drugs, if he did not have evidence to prove the allegations, Opposition MP Udaya Gammanpila said today.

title: Businessman shot dead in Balapitiya
content: A 53-year-old businessman of Ambalangoda, who was driving on his way home, had been shot dead by unidentified gunmen near his residence in Balapitiya a short while ago, Police said.

title: Veteran Journalist Elmo Fernando passes away
content: Veteran Journalist Elmo Fernando passed away at the age of 75 at his residence, early this morning.

title: Nishantha Ranatunga seeks court permission to travel to UAE
content: Former Secretary of the Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), Nishantha Ranathunga, who is the second suspect on the inquiry conducted at the Kaduwela Magistrate's Court over alleged financial misappropriation at the Carlton Sports Network (CSN) and the SLC, today sought Colombo High Court permission to travel abroad for a special conference in the United Arab Emirates.

title: 20 day old Infant found abandoned in cardboard box in Jaffna
content: An infant aged 20 days was found alive in a cardboard box outside the Wadaliyappu Hindu Kovil in Ilawali, Jaffna today.

title: JO wanted to form a separate govt. with UNP: Amaraweera
content: UPFA General Secretary and Minister Mahinda Amaraweera yesterday said five senior members of the Joint Opposition requested Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to sever ties with the SLFP, offer them six ministerial portfolios, three state ministerial and two deputy ministerial posts to support the President to form a separate government.

title: Tamil for pre-interns hits snag as Ministries squabble
content: Tamil language training programme for pre-intern medical officers was halted this year as a result of a tug-of-war between the Health Ministry and Ministry of National Languages and Social Integration, the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) said yesterday.

title: Minister alleged to have 45 advisers should explain: Ranjan
content: The ministers do not need to have 45 advisers and if any minister who is alleged to have appointed such a large number should clarify the matter, Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake said on Monday.

title: No need to walk if they had done their duty: MS
content: If the former leaders had performed their duties and governed properly, there would not be a need for them to undertake long marches for political purposes, hurting their feet, President Maithripala Sirisena said yesterday

title: America will finally catch up with 1960 Sri Lanka: Stephen Colbert
content: Hillary Clinton could be the first female president and America will finally catch up with 1960 Sri Lanka, said “Late Show” host Stephen Colbert.

title: France church attack: Priest killed in hostage-taking
content: A priest has been killed in an attack by two armed men at his church near Rouen in northern France, police and French media have said.

title: US, Japanese and Oman Naval ships in Colombo
content: Four naval vessels, two Japanese ships, ‘Inazuma’ and ‘Suzutsuki’, the US ‘New Orleans’ and the Royal Omani ‘Khassab’ arrived at the Colombo Port on goodwill visit yesterday.

title: Social Welfare Register to streamline handouts
content: The National Policies and Economic Affairs Ministry has prepared an Integrated Social Welfare Register based on the recipient’s NIC for all handouts from Ministries, Provincial Councils and Local Authorities.

title: SL will play constructive role in Asia’s peaceful development: Mangala
content: Sri Lanka will play a constructive role in promoting dialogue and cooperation for peaceful development in the region, Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera said.

title: Signing ETCA may even lead to bloodshed: JO
content: The joint opposition today said that there could even be ‘bloodshed’ in the country if the government signed the Indo-Sri Lanka Economic and Technology Cooperative Agreement (ETCA) disregarding the objections raised by the people.

title: VAT Bill: UPFA says won't support if proposals ignored
content: UPFA General Secretary Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said  today  that they will not support the proposed VAT amendments unless their proposals were accepted.

title: Part of Meethotamulla garbage dump collapses
content: A part of the Meethotamulla garbage mountain had collapsed this morning. Residents at 101 Watta said the garbage mountain had collapsed on a part of a drain dug around the mountain by authorities.

title: Ministers making a mockery of the law: MR
content: Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa today claimed that it was a mockery of the law for the ministers to have predicted Namal Rajapaksa's arrest by the Financial Crime Investigation Division (FCID) 24 hours before the arrest.

title: Heavy traffic in Colombo Fort
content: Heavy traffic congestion was reported in Colombo Fort due to a protest carried out by the Railway Gate Keepers Union demanding a pay hike, police said.

title: Lankan held for drugs in Kuwait airport
content: A young Sri Lankan male was arrested at Kuwait International Airport for attempting to smuggle a piece of opium and three polythene bags containing a powder suspected to be drugs, into the country, Kuwait Al-Rai daily reported.

title: Removal of natural reef after submission of EFR
content: An Environmental Feasibility Report (EFR) is being drafted by the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development requesting the removal of the natural reef which claims to hinder the Dehiwela coastal line and to build a breakwater. Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Mahinda Amaraweera has requested for this report and after inspection, the Minister has suggested removing the reef and building a breakwater.

title: Lionel Messi given 21-month jail term
content: Argentina and Barcelona footballer Lionel Messi has been sentenced to 21 months in prison for tax fraud, Spanish media reported.

title: Police shoot at vehicle in Pannipitiya
content: Police opened fire at a speeding vehicle, which was believed to be smuggling drugs, at Pannipitiya this morning.

title: 18 injured as lorry skids off road
content: Eighteen passengers, including six children, had been hospitalised in an accident when the lorry they were travelling in, skidded off the road in Thispanepura, Kala Oya.

title: Gammanpila released on bail
content: UPFA MP Udaya Gammanpila, who was arrested on charges of using a fraudulent power-of-attorney to sell shares of an Australian company, was released on bail by Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today.

title: Arjuna Mahendran summoned before COPE on July 7
content: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) today unanimously decided to accept the Auditor General’s report on the Treasury bond transactions between February 2015 and May 2016 and to convene the committee on July 5 to study the report, COPE Chairman Sunil Handunnetti said.

title: UNHR Chief to give update on progress made by SL on UNHRC resolution
content: UN Human Rights High Commissioner Zeid Ra’ad Al Hussein will update the UNHRC tomorrow on the progress made by the Sri Lankan Government in implementing the resolution adopted by the Council

title: JVP members ready to quit COPE at anytime: Anura
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) leader and Chief opposition whip Anura Kumara Dissanayke told Parliament yesterday that JVP members representing the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) are ready to resign from it if anyone thinks the stand taken by his party on certain issues affect the investigations carried out by the said committee.

title: FCID to check bank accounts of two companies
content: Colombo Additional Magistrate Nishantha Peiris today permitted the FCID to check the bank accounts of two private companies, Nimbus and Steel Impex.

title: Elderly woman’s body found in Rajagiriya canal
content: The body of an 83-year-old woman had been recovered from a canal at Buthgamuwa in Rajagiriya today, the Police said.

title: Police regret STF Commandant's outburst; disciplinary action to be taken
content: While expressing regrets to the media over the threats made by the Special Task Force (STF) Commandant, DIG Ranjith Perera, SSP Ajith Rohana yesterday said disciplinary action would be taken against DIG Perera.

title: Filipino Prez-elect to replace ministers’ luxury cars with Toyota Avanzas
content: As part of his austere style of governance, incoming Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte plans to replace luxury sedans with cheaper cars for cabinet members.

title: Kithuruwan, Ramith in trouble after night brawl
content: The careers of promising cricketers Kithuruwan Vithanage and Ramith Rambukwella are in jeopardy with Sri Lanka Cricket pursuing disciplinary action against the duo over a breach of discipline.

title: ISIS claims responsibility for Orlando nightclub shooting
content: Islamic State's Amaq news agency said on Sunday that the Islamist militant group was responsible for the shooting that killed at least 50 people in a massacre at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida.

title: No-faith motion against Ravi K defeated
content: The no-confidence motion against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake was defeated by a majority of 94 votes, with 51 parliamentarians voting for and 145 voting against.

title: Hillary Clinton clinches Democratic presidential nomination
content: Hillary Clinton has reached the number of delegates needed to clinch the Democratic U.S. presidential nomination, according to tallies on Monday by two U.S. media outlets, the day before six states were set to vote in nominating contests.

title: Explosion at camp reducing – Army officials
content: The major fire broke out at Salawa Army Camp's ammunition depot and the sounds of explosions have reduced, army officials said.

title: Lankan refugees on journey to Australia caught in Chennai
content: Sri Lankan refugees who were risking their lives to go to Australia — a country that has already shut its door on asylum seekers -— were intercepted in a joint-operation involving the Q-Branch, Coastal Security Group (CSG), and Tiruvallur police, in the small hours of Thursday near Chennai.

title: Unseen hand preventing FCID arresting 6 suspects: JVP
content: An unseen hand appears to have prevented the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) from arresting six people including an additional secretary attached to the Prime Minister’s office on charges of violating the Public Properties Act, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) claimed today.

title: GMOA seeks urgent meeting with President
content: The Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) has today written to President Maithripala Sirisena requesting him for an immediate meeting to discuss several issues including their trade union action and their request for the Health Ministry to be placed under his purview.

title: PM discuss EP CM issue with military
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today met the military hierarchies and discussed the about recent incident where the Eastern Chief Minister Nazer Ahamed rebuked a Navy officer at an event in Sampur, Trincomalee.

title: Helicopter damaged during take off
content: A Bell 206 helicopter was damaged during takeoff in Hingurakgoda SLAF Camp, Air Force Spokesman Group Captain Chandima Alwis said.

title: Kusal Perera called up to Sri Lanka Test squad
content: Kusal Janith Perera is set to join the Sri Lankan Test squad as a replacement for the injured Dhammika Prasad, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) announced.

title: Rising water levels may shut down Ambatale
content: Rising sea levels will cause an increase in the water levels in the Kelani Ganga resulting in the shutting down of the new Ambatale water intake, Town Planning and Water Management Minister Rauff Hakeem told Parliament today.

title: Penal Code on criminal responsibility changed
content: A proposal made by Justice Minister Wijayadasa Rajapakshe to amend the Penal Code to change the minimum age for criminal responsibility to 12 was approved by the Cabinet of Ministers today.

title: RTI will make Sri Lanka a better place: US
content: US Ambassador Atul Keshap said yesterday that enshrining citizens’ Right to Information (RTI) will give Sri Lankans the tools to make their country a better place and prevent any return to an era of secrecy and a lack of accountability.

title: Minor flood situation- DMC
content: A depression in the South East of Sri Lanka has resulted in torrential rains creating a minor flood situation in the country, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) said.

title: Container of dried chillies worth Rs.10 m seized by Customs
content: Three containers with dried chillies, valued at about Rs.10 million, imported from China, had been seized at the Orugodawatte Container yard this evening, Deputy Customs Director Parakrama Basnayake said.

title: MR to leave for Uganda tomorrow
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will leave for Uganda tomorrow on an official invitation received by Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, Mr. Rajapaksa’s Media Unit said.

title: SC orders AG to look at possibility of recruiting SAITM graduates
content: The Supreme Court yesterday directed the Attorney General to look into the possibility of recruiting medical graduates passed out from the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) in Malabe as government doctors.

title: Video: Thewarapperuma, Ranaweera suspended for one week
content: The Parliament today approved a proposal to suspend Deputy Minister Palitha Thewarapperuma and UPFA MP Prasanna Ranaweera for a week from Parliament.

title: 84 illegal firearms handed over within a week
content: At least 84 illegal firearms have been handed over to the government so far during the amnesty period declared by the Defence Ministry on April 25

title: Another Pakistani arrested at BIA with heroin
content: A 53-year-old Pakistani national was arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau with pellets of heroin in his stomach at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last evening, Police said.

title: CID concludes probe into Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera
content: The CID today informed court that investigation into the alleged illegal possession of an elephant by Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera at Alan Mathiniyaramaya temple in Kirulapone had been concluded and the extracts sent to the Attorney General’s Department.

title: Univ. of Kelaniya closed for week
content: The faculties of the Kelaniya University, except the medical faculty, were closed today until May 4 due to an infection that has been spread all over the university, an official said.

title: Body of missing youth found after 4 days
content: The body of the youth who was missing since Wednesday (20) was discovered in a river in Maskeliya last evening.

title: Liberal atmosphere a must for stopping ragging at universities: PM
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today stressed the need to have a liberal atmosphere within universities as a basis for stopping the incidence of ragging.

title: Govt. decides to enact new security laws to replace PTA
content: The Government has decided to enact three new laws relating to national security and law and order, Minister of Law and Order Sagala Ratnayake had informed the UN Counter Terrorism Committee Executive Directorate (CTED).

title: Dematagoda abduction: CCD awaits AG's opinion
content: Colombo additional Magistrate Mohammad Mihar today postponed the inquiry relating to the incident of abducting a 34-year-old man in Dematagoda, where MP Hirunika Premachandra and eight others were found suspects, for August 8 since the Attorney General’s opinion was pending on the matter.

title: Jayalalitha vows to retrieve Katchatheevu
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and AIADMK General Secretary J.Jayalalitha today vowed to "retrieve Katchatheevu island ceded to Sri Lanka and restore the traditional fishing rights of Tamil Nadu fishermen in Palk Bay, if elected to power."

title: Sri Lanka also interested in Sea Bridge: Gadkari
content: Sri Lanka is also "interested" in the project to build a bridge connecting both the countries, Indian Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Monday.

title: 96 Indian and 9 SL fishermen repatriated
content: Sri Lanka Navy today assisted the repatriation of 96 Indian fishermen, released from Sri Lankan custody.

title: Sicille remanded over Ceylinco Shriram case
content: Former Ceylinco Chairman Lalith Kotelawala's wife Sicille Kotelawala was ordered to be further reprimanded till April 19th over the alleged misappropriation of funds in Ceylinco Shriram Company, by the Colombo Forth Magistrate today.

title: Why no autopsy held on Ven. Sobitha Thera?
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya yesterday ordered National Hospital Director Dr. Anil Jasinghe to conduct a full inquiry comprising a group of eminent medical experts on the failure to conduct a proper autopsy into the death of late Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera and to submit a comprehensive report to court soon.

title: Snr. UNP ministers to meet MS over Dilan's slur at PM
content: Several senior UNP ministers are to meet President Maithripala Sirisena regarding the Highways State Minister Dilan Perera’s recent speech comparing Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to a Maradana Rowdy.

title: Explosive detection; GL must be quizzed over his statement-Govt
content: Cabinet spokesman and Minister Gayantha Karunatilaka today said Prof. G.L Peiris must be questioned over the utterances he had made to the media about alleged plans to bring the suicide jacket and explosives detected from a house at Chavakachcheri to Wellawatte.

title: John Amaratunga must be arrested: Dullas
content: The joint opposition today called for the arrest of Tourism Development, Christian Religious Affairs and Lands Minister John Amaratunga saying he was responsible for the removal of the walking path at Mabola in Wattala.

title: Met. Dept. expects slight change
content: A slight change in the prevailing hot and dry weather could be expected in the next few days, the Meteorology Department said today.

title: Questions over NWP Question papers
content: One of the questions in the multiple choice question paper (MCP) for the Buddhism subject set by the North Western Province Education Department for the first term test in schools have been criticized by the public and education sector trade unions for its incongruous answers

title: IGP on leave before retirement
content: Police Chief N. K. Illangakoon who has announced his retirement from the service next month went on one week’s leave from yesterday, police sources said.

title: Bread price rises to Rs.59
content: The price of a 450g loaf of bread was increased by Rs 4 with effect from effect from midnight. Accordingly the new price of a loaf would be about Rs 59.

title: Airliner crashes in Russia: 55 aboard reported dead
content: A Boeing 737 passenger jet crashed as it was landing at the Rostov-on-Don airport in southern Russia, the country's Southern Regional Emergency Center said today.

title: Herd of deer roaming at MRIA chased out
content: The Wild Life Conservation Department and the Army today chased out a herd of deer numbering fifteen at the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) runways, a Wildlife sanctuary office of Hambantota.

title: Woman hotelier abducted
content: A 49-year-old woman hotelier had been abducted at Kapparathota in Weligama by three unidentified men today, the Police said.

title: Lotus Tower construction to be completed by Sep.: TRCSL
content: Despite disruptions, the construction work of the Lotus Tower is scheduled to be completed by September 2017, the Telecommunication Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) said yesterday.

title: Basil granted bail
content: Following the indictments served by the Attorney General against former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and former Divi Neguma Department Director General R.R.K. Ranawaka over the alleged misuse of Divi Neguma Department funds, the Colombo High Court today granted bail on them under strict bail conditions.

title: Nelum Pokuna looks like a commode: CBK
content: Former President Chandrika Kumaratunga today said that the Nelum Pokuna performance theatre, in Colombo was an ‘eyesore’ that looks like a ‘commode’ (Kakkussi Pochchiya) and blamed the former Rajapaksa government of changing the initial concept she had of creating a public cultural centre.

title: ‘Occupy the Square’ against removal of couple
content: A large gathering today staged a protest at the Independence Square in Colombo, against firm action taken by two security guards to evacuate a couple from the premises.

title: India, SL to hold meeting on fishermen issue in May: Swaraj
content: Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Thursday said that she held consultations with the top Sri Lankan leadership to resolve the issue of fishermen from Tamil Nadu, DNA reported.

title: Vass Gunawardena’s wife remanded
content: Former DIG Vass Gunawardena’s wife Shamali Priyadarshani Perera, was today remanded till March 16 by Colombo additional Magistrate Nishantha Peiris over the case filed against her and six others for allegedly possessing and transporting illegal firearms from Mr. Gunawardana’s residence to a hide out at Kalagedihena, Gampaha.

title: Kiriella’s letter to Uni; Ministry justifies
content: The Higher Education and Highways Ministry yesterday justified Minister Lakshman Kiriella’s letter to the Kelaniya University requesting to appoint an individual as a Temporary Lecturer.

title: Ajantha Ranasinghe passes away
content: Veteran journalist and lyricist Dr. Ajantha Ranasinghe passed away this morning at the age of 75 while undergoing treatment at the Colombo National Hospital after a brief illness.

title: Road opening: I get death threats: Asgiriya Mahanayake
content: Asgiriya Chapter Mahanayake Ven. Galagama Sri Atthadassi Thera said yesterday he was intimidated with death threats from various factions as he objected to the reopening of the road opposite the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy.

title: GMOA sceptical about India-aided ambulance service
content: The government’s decision to set up an Indian run ambulance service was heavily criticized by the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) today (23).

title: China wants 1,000 acres in H’tota
content: China had requested for a 1000 acre block of land in Hambantota to set up an investment zone, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Over to you Minister
content: Although efforts are being made to woo more tourists to Sri Lanka by both the Government and the private sector still bitter experiences were being reported sporadically by some foreign tourists travelling in Sri Lanka.

title: Traffic congestion at Grandpass due to protest
content: Traffic congestion was reported at Grandpass in Colombo because of a protest carried out by a group of people on the Victoria Bridge against the removal of unauthorized structures, police said.

title: AG directs to arrest Uduwe Thera
content: The Attorney General has directed to arrest Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera and produced before the Court for illegally keeping a baby elephant at the Alan Mathiniyaramaya Temple, Polhengoda, the Criminal Investigation Department (CID has informed Colombo Chief Magistrate Nishantha Peiris.

title: MR opens new political office
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa's new political and public relations office was opened at Nelum Mawatha, Battaramulla this morning.

title: Gnanasara Thera re-remanded till Feb.16
content: Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera was today further remanded till February 16 by the Homagama Magistrate Ranga Dissanayaka for allegedly threatening Sandhya Eknaligoda, the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Ekneligoda.

title: UNP nominates Fonseka to Parliament
content: The UNP Working Committee has today endorsed the appointment of Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka to Parliament through the United National Front (UNF) National List to fill the post of MP which fell vacant with the death of former minister M.K.A.D.S. Gunawardane, UNP Assistant General Secretary and Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said.

title: Sri Lanka to rewamp bilateral ties with China
content: In a bid to revamp bilateral ties with China, two ministers will visit that country during the end of this month to hold talks with the Chinese leaders on all aspects of bilateral relations including matters pertaining to the presently stalled Colombo Port City Project, it is learnt.

title: Many close relatives of ministers are at SAITM: SAITM Chairman
content: The Chairman of the South Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) in Malabe Dr. Neville Fernando yesterday said not only Minister Senaratne’s daughter-in-law, but also the daughters and daughters-in-law of other ministers in the current government are also studying at the SAITM.

title: Refer Yoshitha's case to Court without delay: Nimal Siripala
content: While emphasizing the necessity to have a speedier judicial system to hear sensitive and public interest cases, SLFP ministers today urged the government to refer the charges against Yoshitha Rajapaksa to Court and to let it decide his innocence or guilt.

title: Joint opposition visits Yoshitha and four others at Welikada
content: At least fifteen members of the joint opposition including Dinesh Gunawardena, Wimal Weerawansa, Gamini Lokuge, Bandula Gunawardana, Dallas Allahapperuma and Johnston Fernando visited Yoshitha Rajapaksa and the four others remanded at the Welikada prison.

title: JKH to delay Cinnamon Life project
content: Sri Lanka’s premier blue chip John Keells Holdings PLC (JKH) said the completion of the Cinnamon Life project, previously Waterfront, would be delayed till 2019.

title: PM to make statement on overseas accounts
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will make a statement in Parliament with regard to the revelations made by Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Rajitha Senaratne on bank accounts in Dubai belonging to a former VVIP family, an MP and a head of a government institution, which exceeded USD 3 billion.

title: Russian drowns in Trincomalee
content: A 39-year-old Russian man has died after drowning while bathing in the seas off Sagarapura, Trincomalee.

title: Exams Timetable for 2016
content: The timetable for key examinations to be held during 2016 was announced by the Examinations Department today.

title: Will go ahead with Port City project: Ranil
content: The government has decided to go ahead with several Chinese funded infrastructural projects, including the Port City Project, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told foreign journalists in Davos today.

title: Mathews arrives at FCID
content: Cricket Captain Angelo Mathews arrived at the FCID a short while ago to give a statement in connection with a probe carrying out into alleged match-fixing approaches.He was accompanied by Counsel Nishan Premathiratne.

title: 15 year old crashes into mother and child
content: A 10-year-old girl and her 47-year-old mother were killed on the pavement in Dematagoda along Baseline Road, when a car driven by a 15 year old boy crashed into them last night.

title: No Lankan casualties in Jakarta blasts: FM
content: The Foreign Affairs Ministry confirmed that there were no Sri Lankans among the injured in this morning's series of blasts and gunfire reported in Indonesian Capital, Jakarta.

title: Bread up by one rupee
content: The price of a 450 g of loaf of bread will be increased by Re.1.00 with effect from midnight tomorrow, the All Ceylon Bakery Owners’ Association Chairman N.K.Jayawardana said.

title: Reckless riding; Two drunken women arrested
content: In a very rare occurrence two drunken young women riding on a motorcycle were nabbed by the police well past midnight at Wadiyamankada junction by the Kaluthara North Police.

title: ​Gunaratnam further remanded
content: Senior member of Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) Kumar Gunaratnam was further remanded till January 22, by the Kegalle Magistrate’s Court today.

title: 1,501 'statutory rapes' in 2015
content: A rundown of the causes of death and crimes statistics provided by the Police Department today showed that while the number of reported rape, suicides and murders in the country had decreased slightly, the number of accidents had increased marginally when compared to 2014.

title: Put it to the people prior to referendum: JVP
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) said yesterday a draft constitution prepared by the Constitutional Assembly should be first placed before the people so that they could comment on the proposals before proceeding with a referendum.

title: A/L best results in Island
content: Dasun Jayasingha of Colombo Royal College and Umesha Karunawellada of Ratnawali Balika Vidyalaya, Gampaha have topped the island rankings at the GCE Advanced Level Examination in 2015, Maths and Bio-Science streams respectively.

title: 1,000 bikers killed in 2015
content: A total of 1,000 motorbike riders and passengers had been killed in fatal accidents this year, the Police said today.They said a majority of deaths had been reported in accidents which had occurred when motorbikes had collided with other vehicles.

title: 2015 marked significant democratic gains in SL: Kerry
content: The year-2015 marked important democratic gains in countries such as Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Burma and Venezuela, US State Secretary John Kerry has said.

title: Wigneswaran-Sampanthan talks fail to end crisis in TNA
content: The three-hour one-to-one meeting between the Northern Province Chief  Minister C.V.Wigneswaran, and the leader of the Tamil National Alliance (TNA), R.Sampanthan, held on Friday, had failed to resolve the crisis in the TNA.

title: Saudi fire: No Lankan casualties
content: The Sri Lankan Mission in Saudi Arabia has not informed the Foreign Ministry about any Sri Lankans being injured in the fire which erupted at a hospital in Southern Saudi Arabia in the early hours of today, Ministry Spokesperson Mahishini Collonne said.

title: CMC cries foul over Enrique’s “Sex and Love” show
content: The Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) today alleged that a 'huge tax fraud' had been committed on the income earned from the Latin Musical Idol Enrique Iglesias’s “Sex and Love Tour” live concert held last Sunday at the CR&FC Grounds

title: Bishwal in Sri Lanka
content: The United States Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Nisha Biswal arrived in Sri Lanka this morning.

title: Yes, my daughter-in-law is studying at SAITM: Rajitha
content: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senaratne today admitted that his daughter-in-law was studying at SAITM and added that not only her but that many of his relatives were studying there.

title: President returns from Rome
content: President Maithripala Sirisena who was in Rome for a two-day official visit arrived in the country a short while ago.During the visit, the President met Pope Francis and a host of other leaders.

title: Port City, Colombo's hub in the next decade
content: The Colombo Port City would become the business district of Colombo, the down-town in the next decade or so, said Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.

title: FCID quizzes Johnston, Cabraal
content: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal were summoned to the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning to record statements on two different cases.

title: Nimal, Welgama clash over SLTB EPF
content: The Minister of Transport Nimal Siripala De Silva and his predecessor Kumara Welgama had a showdown over the payment of EPF to Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) employees in Parliament today.

title: SF at Bribery Commission
content: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka arrived at the Bribery Commission a short while ago to lodge a complaint against the Avant Garde Maritime Security Company.

title: Bread prices may rise
content: Prices of bread and other bakery products could be increased in the near future, the All Ceylon Bakery Owners’ Association warned today.

title: DNA test confirms its Thajudeen’s body
content:
The Genetech Laboratory at Kitulwatte in Borella has confirmed that the DNA samples removed from the remains exhumed from a grave sited at the Dehiwala Jumma Mosque Burial Grounds were those of murdered rugby player Mohamed Waseem Thajudeen.
.

title: Two traffic cops assaulted
content: Two Traffic Policemen attached to the Athurugiriya Police were hospitalised after being assaulted this evening by four men in a trishaw when they ordered the trishaw to stop.

title: Special Excise Unit robs Rs.2.5mn from suspect?
content: Controversy surrounds a shocking incident relating to the Colombo Excise Department where members of its special branch had allegedly assaulted and threatened a businessman in Mannar at gunpoint and robbed his cash amounting to Rs.2.5 million, informed sources disclosed.

title: Re-think on certain tax proposals
content: In the wake of widespread protests over some of the budgetary proposals such as the increase in the fees for vehicle emission tests, the government is contemplating amending the charges during the Budget debate, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sharma lauds President Sirisena
content: Secretary General of Commonwealth Kamlesh Sharma today said the Chair in Office President Maithripala Sirisena has done a wonderful job to promote Commonwealth ideals.

title: Actress Rithu Akarsha released on bail
content: Teledrama actress Rithu Akarsha, who was arrested by the Thalangama Police for allegedly driving her vehicle in a reckless manner and crashing onto a barrier at a check point on the entrance road to Parliament and damaging it, was released on bail when she was produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate's Court on Tuesday.

title: Missing novice monks found
content: The four novice monks who had lost their way while inside the Maduru Oya Forest were found this morning by the Police and the Army during a search operation launched by them.

title: Grand Hyatt board remains unchanged-official
content: The board of directors of Canwill Holdings (Pvt) Ltd, the state-owned entity which owns Grand Hyatt Colombo, has not changed as the Public Enterprise Development Ministry stated, and is still working efficiently towards the completion of the project, a top official affirmed.

title: Nose wheel of Colombo-Madurai aircraft comes off
content: One of the two nose wheels of a Spicejet aircraft, flying from Colombo to Madurai flight, came off while taxing down the Mudarai Airport yesterday afternoon, the Hindu reported.

title: Reports on missing persons submitted to UN group
content: The Dead and Missing Persons Parents Front (DMPPF) yesterday handed over a report to the visiting members of the United Nations Working Group on Enforced or Involuntary Disappearances (WGEID) at the UN Compound in Colombo.

title: Met Dept issues warning
content: The Meteorology Department has issued a warning to the naval and fishing communities in the South, East, Northwest and the Northern coast of the country as strong winds, showers and thunder showers were expected due to a low pressure belt in the Northeast of Sri Lanka.

title: 60-year-old found dead with stab injuries
content: A 60-year-old security guard of a pre-school in Padukka Road, Horana was found dead this evening with stab injuries around his neck, Police said.

title: Video: Ms. Ekneligoda declines to reveal outcome of meeting with UN
content: Missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda's wife Sandya on Tuesday declined to reveal the outcome of the meeting with the United Nations Working Group on Enforced or Involuntary Disappearances saying that the UN official asked her not to reveal anything to the media.

title: SL to release 126 Indian fishermen on Monday
content: All the 126 Indian fishermen in Sri Lankan custody will be released by courts in the island nation on Monday. The Sri Lankan government has already issued release orders to the fisheries department.

title: UN Group to assist probes into disappearances in SL
content: A team from the UN Working Group on Enforced or Involuntary Disappearances (WGEID) headed by its Vice President, Bernard Duhaime, will arrive in the Island next Monday (9) for a 10-day-visit to facilitate investigations into issues related to disappearances, the Foreign Ministry said.

title: South African arrested in Tangalle
content: A 37-year old South African national has been arrested in Tangalle on charges of staying in Sri Lanka without a visa or passport.

title: Maldivian suspect arrested in SL over alleged bomb blast
content: A Maldive national who was suspected in connection with an alleged plot to assassinate Maldivian president Abdulla Yameen was arrested last night in Nedimala area by the Emigration and Immigration Department along with Boralesgamuwa police.

title: No difference between MR and MS: IUSF
content: The Inter University Students Federation (IUSF) today condemned the manner in which the police handled the demonstration by students of the Higher National Diploma in Accountancy (HNDA) where several students were injured.

title: Video: MR, Keheliya at PRECIFAC
content: Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella arrived at the Presidential Commission of Inquiry to Investigate and Inquire into Serious Acts of Fraud, Corruption and Abuse of Power, State Resources and Privileges (PRECIFAC) with regard to the non-payment of bills owed to state owned ITN .

title: Lionel Fernando resigns from HRCSL
content: Former Civil Servant and diplomat Lionel Fernando has resigned from the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) citing personal reasons.

title: Video: Nightclub owner in A’pura murdered
content: An owner of a nightclub in Anuradhapura, Wasantha Soyza was stabbed to death by an unidentified gang, who stormed the nightclub last night, police said.

title: Video: Kodikara released on bail
content: UPFA Western Provincial Councillor Upali Kodikara, who was arrested and remanded under charges of obstructing a police officer from performing duties, was released on bail by the Colombo Chief Magistrate today.

title: Nine-year-old boy missing since Saturday
content: A mentally-challenged nine-year-old boy living in Gonagan Aara in Buttala is reported to be missing from last Saturday, Police said.

title: Arm of the Law loses ear
content: In a curious turn of events, an alleged sex offender whom the police had tried to arrest had bitten off a police sergeant's ear and managed to flee the scene in Thirukkovil yesterday evening.

title: Jamaican Court restores Sri Lankan’s bail
content: The Supreme Court of Jamaica has restored the bail of a Sri Lankan man and criticised senior magistrate Judith Pusey for revoking it.

title: DNA matches that of Kondaya’s brother
content: Minuwangoda Magistrate D.A. Ruwanpathirana said the DNA samples obtained from Saman Jayalath, the brother of Dunesh Priyashantha alias ‘Kondaya’, has matched the DNA obtained from the two strands of hair recovered from the body of Seya Sadewmi.

title: Abandoned infant: Police to obtain court order for foster parents
content: The Peradeniya Police said they were hoping to obtain a court order to find suitable foster parents who wish to adopt the now 22-day-old infant girl, who was abandoned by a roadside near the Dangolla Junction, until such time a permanent arrangement could be made.

title: Some media attempting to make me disappear politically: MS
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said today some media institutions were attempting to make him disappear politically even though the new government had ensured media freedom by putting an end to the disappearances of journalists.

title: Video: Lalith Weeratunga and Palpita released on bail
content: Former presidential secretary Lalith Weeratunga and former Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) director general Anusha Palpita, produced in the Colombo High Court on charges of misappropriating Rs.620 million were released on bail today.

title: Video: Kondaya’s brother confesses to killing Seya: CID
content: Samantha Jayalath, the elder brother of Dunesh Priyashantha alias ‘Kondaya’ has confessed to abducting, sexual abusing and killing five-year-old Seya Sadewmi, the CID informed the Minuwangoda Magistrate today.

title: Govt: to start dialogue on lifestyle change
content: The government will soon start a dialogue to change people's lifestyles which might include changing school hours, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Thursday.

title: Video: We must deal honestly with the past: MS at UN
content: President Maithripala Sirisena addressing the 70th Session of the United Nations General Assembly in New York today, said that a fundamental requirement to achieve his government's main vision -- sustainable development and reconciliation -- was to deal with the past honestly and build a modern nation: and that in dealing with the past, Sri Lanka would use a process of truth seeking, justice, reparation and non-recurrence.

title: Drop in demand likely cause of power outage: CEB
content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said today the power outage experienced countrywide on Sunday night was caused by an increase in the power supply amid a major drop in the demand

title: UK welcomes SL stand on UNHRC draft resolution
content: The UK government has welcomed the stand taken by Sri Lanka on the draft resolution submitted to the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in Geneva.

title: Ravi reveals names of illegal ethanol importers
content: Two people, including a brother of a former Sri Lankan cricketer, had been importing ethanol illegally, after buying over politicians, Minister Ravi Karunanayake said in Parliament.

title: Hundreds arrested in TN during SL protests
content: The Indian police today arrested hundreds of cadre of Tamilaga Valvurimai Katchi (TVK) when they attempted to picket the trains in Salem city, Tamil Nadu demanding international probe into the alleged massacre of innocent Tamils during the military offensive by the Sri Lankan Government in 2009, The Hindu reported.

title: UNHRC report Milder  than expected- President
content: President Maithripala Sirisena said yesterday the report on Sri Lanka presented at the ongoing UNHRC sessions in Geneva was 100 or even 1,000 times less harmful than the report that would have been presented at the UNHRC if not for the change that took place on January 8.

title: Arjuna slams Sanga and Mahela
content: Sri Lanka’s world cup winning cricket captain Arjuna Ranatunga who is presently the country’s Minister of Ports and Shipping, took a dig at two recently-retired cricket greats Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene at a public ceremony in Nittambuwa yesterday.

title: SL would achieve genuine reconciliation- Modi
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi yesterday extended India's support for reforms, reconciliation and progress in Sri Lanka when he met visiting Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in New Delhi.

title: ​Govt receives UN probe report
content: The UN probe report on alleged war crimes committed during the final phase of war in the north, has been handed over to the Sri Lankan government, PTI news agency said quoting Sri Lanka's foreign Ministry sources.

title: MR hits out at CBK
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, in a statement posted on his website for the consumption of voters, took a swipe at his erstwhile colleague former President Chandrika Bandaranaiake Kumaratunga saying her recent remarks to the foreign media was detrimental to the interests of SLFP as a whole.

title: NHRC issues notice to TN govt. over SL refugee's death
content: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) in India has issued a notice to Tamil Nadu government over the alleged custodial death of a Sri Lankan refugee in Chennai.

title: Challenges lie ahead for National Govt-MS
content: The national unity government formed by the United National Party (UNP) and the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) may face lot of challenges that have to be overcome with diligence, President Maithripala Sirisena said today.

title: Court allows Tiran to leave country
content: Colombo Fort Magistrate today permitted former MP Tiran Alles to leave the country for a period of one month from September 10 to October 10.

title: Sharma, three SL players charged for misconduct
content: India paceman Ishant Sharma and three Sri Lankan players have been charged for misconduct during the ongoing third test between the neighbours, the International Cricket Council (ICC) said on Tuesday.

title: JVP’s Mayadunne to resign?
content: Authoritative sources confirm that JVP National List MP Sarathchandra Mayadunne is due to resign from his position as MP after swearing-in when Parliament convenes.

title: Prof Warnapala is UPFA’s new Gen. Secy.
content: Professor Vishwa Warnapala today assumed duties as the United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) General Secretary after yesterday’s resignation of former general secretary Susil Prmajayantha.

title: Wrong Scholarship paper: Inquiry initiated
content: An inquiry would be carried out into an incident at the Presbyterian Girls’ National School, Dehiwela, in which an invigilator of the Examination Department had distributed the 2nd paper of the Grade Five Scholarship Examination instead of the 1st paper, the Examinations Department said today.

title: New US Ambassador to SL presents credentials
content: New U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka and Maldives Atul Keshap presented his credentials to President Maithripala Sirisena in a ceremony at the Presidential Secretariat today.

title: National govt. need of the hour: Sobitha Thera
content: The leader of the National Movement for Social Justice (NMSJ) Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera, who pioneered the campaign for the election of candidates with better qualities, today said that a national government should be formed even for a brief period to make political reforms and stable national policies.

title: UPFA tops Ratnapura postal votes
content: United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) topped the postal votes in the Ratnapura district with 11,368 votes (49.46%) while the United National Party (UNP) obtained 9,673 votes (42.09%). The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) obtained 1808 votes (7.87%).

title: Free access on Expressways on Election Day
content: Motorists will be allowed to use all Expressways free-of-charge on Monday, August 17 to facilitate people who leave for their villages to cast their votes, the Highways and Investment Promotion Ministry said today.

title: Police looking for ‘Sudu’
content: Police are seeking people’s assistance to locate the suspect wanted in connection with the Bloemendhal shooting which killed two people and injured eleven others, Police Spokesman Ruwan Gunasekara said.

title: Manusha’s driver arrested
content: The driver of UPFA Galle District candidate Manusha Nanayakkara’s jeep was arrested in connection with an accident in Wawulagala on Deniyaya-Colombo Road where a motor cyclist was killed yesterday, police said.

title: Differently abled to contest in two districts
content: The biggest minority comprising of people with restricted ability, who would be re-writing political history in Sri Lanka by becoming the first such persons to contest a Parliamentary Election, yesterday slammed all political parties for neglecting them and for their failure to give them their due place in the society.

title: Drink poison on Aug.18: Harin tells Dilan
content: Badulla District UNP candidate Harin Fernando told UPFA candidate Dilan Perera that he himself would have to consume poison when the UPFA was defeated at the parliamentary election on August 18.

title: Thajudeen's killing: CID seeks AG's advice
content: The CID which is investigating the death of former Havelocks Sports Club Rugby Captain and Sri Lanka Ruggerite Wasim Thajudeen has sought the Attorney General’s advice to exhume his body in connection with the magisterial inquiry, police sources said.

title: Underworld factions clashed in Kotahena: UPFA
content: While condemning the Kotahena shooting which killed a woman, the UPFA today said the shooting seems to be a result of a clash between two groups of underworld figures.

title: Rajiv Gandhi killers will not be hanged, confirms SC
content: The Supreme Court dismissed on Wednesday the centre’s curative petition against its 2014 judgment commuting the death sentence of three convicts to life term in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, upholding a verdict that brought into focus the inordinate delays in executions in India

title: SL student missing from coastal Karnataka
content: A Sri Lankan student, who was studying hotel management course at a renowned college in Moodbidri town in coastal Karnataka was reported missing from her hostel.

title: NCPA task force arrests blackmailer
content: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) Task Force has arrested a 27-year-old man on charges of distributing obscene pictures of a 16-year-old girl using his mobile phone.

title: Assassination attempt on Gota; suspect sentenced
content: A man, who was found guilty of having concealed information of an attempt to assassinate former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa by the LTTE, was sentenced to six months imprisonment by Colombo High Court Judge Lalith Jayasuriya today.

title: Will seize the mace if MR not made PM: Salinda
content: UPFA Kurunegala District candidate Salinda Dissanayake today said their team would run around Parliament carrying the Mace if the UPFA won the Parliamentary elections but former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was not appointed Prime Minister.

title: Politicians should retire when their time is up: Mahanayaka Thera
content: Malwatta Chapter Mahanayaka, Most Ven. Thibbatuwawe Sri Sumangala Thera said politicians should think of retiring at the correct time as politics is not a profession one does for a lifetime.

title: SLFP to suspend defectors
content: The membership of SLFP defectors, including Ministers Rajitha Senaratne, M.K.D.S. Gunawardane and Hirunika Premachandra, contesting for general election from the UNP would be suspended today, SLFP Media Coordinator Thilanga Sumathipala said.

title: Duminda contemplates independent list
content: Former UPFA MP Duminda Silva, who is unlikely to get nomination, is contemplating the possibility of fielding an independent list. Yet, the UPFA has come under pressure from his supporters in Kolonnawa urging that he be given nominations.

title: Prasanna, wife summoned on July 14
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate had issued a notice on the Western Provincial Council Chief Minister Prasanna Ranatunga and his wife Morin Ranatunga to appear in court on July 14 for not appearing before the FCID, Police Spokesman Ruwan Gunasekara said today.

title: No sign of missing Indian aircraft in SL waters
content: The Sri Lankan Navy has informed India that there was no sign of the missing Indian military surveillance aircraft in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Maj. Gen. Wijeyathilake passes away
content: Rehabilitation Commissioner General - Major General Jagath Wijeyathilake has passed away on Saturday, following a sudden illness.

title: Ceypetco suspends millions worth oil contracts
content: State-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has suspended oil contracts worth millions of dollars signed last year for fuel deliveries, the CPC Chairman told Reuters today.

title: Indonesian military plane with 113 aboard crashes into city
content: An Indonesian military aircraft with 113 people aboard crashed into a neighborhood in the city of Medan on Tuesday, according to the head of the country’s air force. Forty-nine people were confirmed to have been killed, but the toll appeared certain to rise.

title: Commercial High Courts in disarray
content: The Commercial High Court, the only court which has jurisdiction into specialized areas of Law in the island, is in complete disarray, following the shuffling of judges at least 5 times during the past six months.

title: 8 Indians, Lankan arrested with gold worth Rs.4.5mn
content: Eight Indians and a Sri Lankan were arrested this morning by the Sri Lankan Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle out more than Rs.4.5 million worth of gold to Chennai, Customs said.

title: Video: BBS meets CB Governor over Islamic Banking
content: The Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) organisation today met Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran to discuss the recent move to offer financial services under Islamic principles by private banks.

title: Navy arrests 26 Indian fishermen
content: The Sri Lanka Navy arrested 26 Indian fishermen for allegedly poaching in Sri Lankan waters in Northern Point Pedro last night.

title: Traffic in Maradana
content: Heavy traffic was reported at Technical Junction in Maradana due to a protest by the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) urging the government to deliver the promises given during the presidential election campaign.

title: Video: Obama to visit SL by year end
content: US President Barak Obama had assured that he would visit Sri Lanka at the end of this year, Leader of the House and Plantation Industries Minister Lakshman Kiriella told a news briefing today.

title: Man nabbed at BIA with gold worth over Rs.3 mn
content: A 33-year-old Sri Lankan was arrested by the Customs officials early this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle three gold chains worth more than Rs. 3 million from Abudhabi.

title: Australia denies officials paid refugee smugglers
content: Australian Foreign Minister Julie Bishop has denied claims by Indonesian police that Australian Customs officials paid thousands of dollars to people smugglers to take asylum seekers back to Indonesia, ABC News reported.

title: Cadres demand Prabhakaran statue reinstallation
content: Urging the district administration to reinstall the statue of LTTE leader Velupillai Prabhakaran in a temple near Nagapattinam from where it was removed under mysterious circumstances on Saturday, cadre belonging to Hindu Makkal Katchi submitted a petition to the Collector in Nagapattinam on Monday.

title: ​Jayalalithaa files nomination for RK Nagar bypoll
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa on Friday filed her papers for the R K Nagar byelection to be held on June 27, the Times of India said.

title: Video: Shashi Weerawansa at FCID
content: Shashi Weerawansa, the wife of MP Wimal Weerawansa arrived at the Financial Crime Investigation Division (FCID) a short while ago.

title: Australia turned back 54 SL asylum seekers
content: Australian customs turned back 65 people, including a pregnant woman, after their boat reached Australian waters last Tuesday, according to an Indonesian police chief.

title: Policeman killed in ‘Suicide’ blast near Gaddafi Stadium
content: A suicide blast last night near the Gaddafi stadium where an ODI between Pakistan and Zimbabwe was being played claimed the life of a policeman who stopped the bomber from targeting the cricketing venue.

title: No dissolution till 20A enacted-Rathana Thera
content: Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) chairman and Pivithuru Hetak convenor, the Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thera said yesterday that they would not allow parliament to be dissolved without the 20th Amendment to the Constitution first being enacted.

title: Film on slain Lankan TV journalist banned
content: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) in India has refused to certify ‘Porkalathil Oru Poo,’ a film based on real life story of television journalist, Isaipriya, who was allegedly killed in captivity by the Sri Lankan armed forces in the final stages of the civil war in 2009, on the grounds that the film could strain “friendly relations with foreign States.”

title: I won’t give up- Hirunika
content: Provincial Councillor Hirunika Premachandra who attended the hearing of the murder of Bharatha Lakshman Premachandra case said filing the case in the High Court was a great achievement.

title: SC and AC judges must resign: Purawesi Balaya
content: The Purawesi Balaya Organisation which played the major role in bringing the present government to office today urged the judges of the Supreme Court and the Appeal Court to resign so that new judges could be appointed under the 19th Amendment.

title: Lankan kidnapped in Nigeria, police escort killed
content: A Sri Lankan expatriate has been kidnapped by unknown gunmen in Ondo State in Nigeria, international media reported.

title: ​Bribery Commissioner Wimalachandra resigns
content: Former Court of Appeal Justice Keerthi Wimalachandra has resigned from his post as a Commissioner of the Bribery Commissioner.

title: MR demands Rs.1 bn from Mangala
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa had sent a letter of demand to Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera demanding Rs.1 billion as compensations over a statement alleged to have made by the minister during a news conference.

title: I never quoted Lee Kwan Yew: Gota
content: Former Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa referring to a photograph of his that went viral on social media with a quote from Lee Kwan Yew said he was unaware of such an incident and that anybody can do such mischievous things on social media.

title: Unpleasant experience with UK Immi. officer-Sanga
content: Former Sri Lanka Cricket captain Kumar Sangakkara has undergone an unpleasant experience with a UK Immigration officer last night when he arrived in London.

title: Mahela 'very happy' at Sussex
content: Former Sri Lanka batsman Mahela Jayawardene is "very happy" with the "great opportunity" to play for Sussex in the T20 Blast.

title: Johnston further remanded
content: Former minister and UPFA MP Johnston Fernando and former Lak Sathosa Chairman K.M.R. Fernando were further remanded until May 11 after being produced before Kurunegala Chief Magistrate Ravindra Premaratne this morning.

title: 19A still inoperative,will take a few more days-Minister
content: Justice Minister Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said yesterday it would take a few days for the 19th Amendment to the Constitution to come into force though it was initially set to be operative from April 30 onwards.

title: IBUF protest: Emergency surgery on injured SI
content: The Sub Inspector who was admitted to the Colombo National Hospital after being injured during yesterday’s protest rally outside the University Grants Commission (UGC) has undergone emergency surgery this morning, police said.

title: 19A: Debate extended by an hour
content: The parliamentary debate on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution was extended by one hour allowing political party leaders to meet for a discussion.

title: Disaster Management Centre collects relief assistance
content: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has set up a special coordinating centre to collect relief assistance to be dispatched to earthquake-hit Nepal, officials said today.

title: Motion to remove CB Governor: Bandula
content: UPFA MP Bandula Gunawardena said today a motion signed by opposition members would be handed over to the Speaker calling for the removal of Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.

title: Special statement by President tomorrow
content: President Maithripala Sirisena will make a special statement on the 100-day programme over the electronic media tomorrow at 9.00 p.m., the presidential media unit said.

title: Landslide warning for six districts
content: A landslide warning has been issued by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) this afternoon for six districts for the next 24 hours due to heavy rains.

title: ​17 soldiers injured
content: At least 17 soldiers were injured following a collision of their truck with a tractor in Riditenna, Batticaloa today, police said.

title: Arson accused SL maid pleads not guilty
content: A Sri Lankan housemaid accused of setting her Bahraini employer's home on fire before fleeing has appeared in court for the first time to plead not guilty.

title: ​A six year-old elephant calf donated to New Zealand
content: A female elephant calf named Anjalee – a resident of the Pinnawala elephant orphanage has been given to new Zealand’s Auckland zoo in honor of an exchange agreement made between the two countries.

title: Pushpa Rajapaksa foundation under probe
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate today ordered the managers of two state banks and a private bank that the bank account details pertaining to the Pushpa Rajapaksa Foundation named after former Minister Basil Rajapaksa’s wife be handed over to the Police Financial Fraud Investigations Unit in connection with a financial fraud investigation.

title: Video: Maithri behind attempts against 19A:  Anura
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake today charged that President Maithripala Sirisena was behind the statements made by Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka and MPs Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and Nimal Siripala de Silva against the 19th Amendment.

title: Suspect commits suicide inside prison
content: A suspect who had been remanded for peddling Heroin has committed suicide inside the Kalutara North Prison this afternoon.

title: Bribery Comm. DG denies receiving two salaries
content: Categorically denying the allegations that she received two salaries Bribery Commission Director General Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe yesterday requested the Commission’s Chairman to conduct a full-scale probe into her actions.

title: Donald Perera quizzed by FCID
content: Former Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Commander Air Chief Marshal Donald Perera is being questioned by the police Financial Crime Investigation Division (FCID) over the MIG deal, the Police said.

title: Tharindu tops O/L rankings
content: Tharindu Nirmal of Nalanda College, Colombo topped the island rankings at the GCE O/L examinations held last year while Sandini Nawanjana of Holy Cross College, Gampaha clinched the second place, the Education Department announced today.

title: 'Evidence of mental illness' in Germanwings Co-pilot's house
content: The Germanwings co-pilot who crashed his plane into a mountain killing himself and 149 people on board was receiving psychiatric counselling right up until the time of the crash, it emerged today.

title: Rajitha’s statements keep changing constantly: Tilvin
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) General Secretary Tilvin Silva said today Cabinet Spokesman Rajitha Senaratne was constantly changing his statements.

title: Ratgama PS Chairman shot dead
content: Ratgama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Manoj Mendis is reported to have been shot dead by some yet unidentified assailants at a tourist hotel in Wewala at Hikkaduwa on last night.

title: Lankans slam bid to invite Dalai Lama
content: The reported bid by a leading Sri Lankan Buddhist monk to invite the Dalai Lama to the island nation, has received flak from official as well as non-official quarters in Sri Lanka.

title: Buddhist monks from India, SL hold dialogue
content: Buddhist monks from India and Sri Lanka started a two-day dialogue in New Delhi beginning on Wednesday to discuss their respective spiritual traditions, values.

title: CB Governor will go on leave- Ranil
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe making a special statement in the Parliament a short while ago said Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran will go on leave, until the investigation into the Treasury Bond issue is completed.

title: Two drown in Kurunegala
content: A seven year-old girl and a 31 year old man died and another person was hospitalized when they drowned while bathing in Kanapaddan Wewa, Polpithigama yesterday evening, Police said.

title: Skeletons of two women recovered
content: Skeletons of two women were recovered today from the ground floor of a two storied house at Uyankele in Panadura, the Police said.

title: This Govt. no second to former: Anti Corruption Front
content: The Anti Corruption Front (ACF) today charged that the present government was no second to the former government considering the frauds and corruption that had occurred during the first 59 days of 100 days programme.

title: Modi tweets about his SL visit
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted about his visit to Sri Lanka just a few minutes ago, expressing his enthusiasm about the trip.

title: Harrison Ford injured in plane crash
content: Film star Harrison Ford was injured on Thursday when the "Star Wars" actor crashed his vintage plane on a Los Angeles golf course shortly after taking off from a nearby airport, his publicist said.

title: SLFP people’s reps. barred from attending others’ rallies
content: The Central Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has ruled that its people’s representatives should not attend any rallies organised by other political parties without the approval of the SLFP -- as it was the responsibility of the party members to rally round the party.

title: MS to meet EC
content: President Maithripala Sirisena hopes to meet Elections Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya soon to discuss the proposed electoral reforms, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senaratne said yesterday.

title: 148 Kg of explosives found in Chavakachcheri
content: Five parcels of explosives weighing 148 kilograms were found buried on a block of land in Chavakachcheri, Police said.

title: SF files case to regain parliamentary membership
content: General Sarath Fonseka filed a Writ application in the Court of Appeal seeking a Court Order to enable him to sit and vote in Parliament and exercise his powers, privileges and immunities as a Parliamentarian.

title: Accident kills three in Kuruwita
content: At least three persons were killed and five others injured when a moving lorry collided with a parked lorry at Kuruwita on the Colombo-Ratnapura road, this morning, police said.

title: Daya Ratnayake promoted to rank of General
content: The outgoing Commander of the Army Lieutenant General Daya Ratnayake has been promoted to the rank of four star General effective from today by President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Azath Salley’s claim proven wrong: BBS
content: The Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) said today provincial councillor Azath Salley should leave politics like a gentleman because his claim that not even 5,000 people would participate at the Nugegoda rally was proven wrong by the participation of a massive crowd.

title: Appachchi will never leave the party even if expelled
content: My father was the former Secretary of the UNP, and no sooner the UNP won the election my father was taken into custody and jailed. I have a great respect for the Judiciary and hope that justice would prevail. After protecting the party leader over a long period this had been a great humiliation for him.

title: Video: IPL auction: Mathews sold for Rs.160 mn
content: Delhi Daredevils, who have the largest purse of Rs 39.75 crore among all the eight franchises taking part in the auction, bought Sri Lankan captain and all-rounder Angelo Mathews for Indian Rs 7.5 crore, the third highest price in the first two rounds of IPL 8 players' auction.

title: China eager to preserve economic ties with Lanka-Jiarui
content: China considers it important to preserve and further develop the traditional economic cooperation which it has had with the Sri Lankan government, a top Chinese official said today.

title: New DIG for PM security division
content: Deputy Inspector General (DIG) Jayantha Wickramasinghe has been appointed as DIG of the Prime Minister's Security Division (PMSD) with immediate effect, the Police Department announced today.

title: Video: Mahinda Kahandagamage arrested
content: Chairman of the Federation of Self Employed (FOSE) in Pettah Mahinda Kahandagamage was arrested by the Colombo Fraud Investigation Bureau (CFIB) this afternoon for allegedly misappropriating funds collected from the members of his Federation.

title: New EP Chief Minister takes oaths
content: SLMC Provincial Councillor Ahamed Nazeer Zainulabdeen took oaths as the Eastern Province Chief Minister before Governor Austin Fernando this evening

title: Lot of work to be done for SL-Biswal
content: U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Nisha Biswal, who just concluded her two-day visit to Sri Lanka, said there was a lot of work to be done for Sri Lanka to pursue a future that is peaceful, inclusive, and prosperous.

title: Video: Tissa remanded till Feb. 11
content: Former UNP General Secretary and former Health Minister Tissa Attanayake was today remanded til February 11, by the Colombo Fort Acting Magistrate Jayantha Dias Nanayakkara on charges of producing fraudulent documents.

title: Grade 5 scholarship cut off marks released
