content: The cut off marks for the grade 5 scholarship examination were released a short while ago by the education ministry.

title: Peshala sworn in as NCP Chief Minister
content: North Central Provincial Council UPFA member Peshala Jayaratne was sworn in as the new Chief Minister of the Province, a short while ago.

title: Aluthgamage’s passport impounded
content: The Bribery Commission has ordered the Immigration Department to impound the passport of former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage for three months.

title: Seychelles to assist SL’s probe on Rajapaksa
content: The government of Seychelles has said it will assist with all formal requests for an investigation into the assets of Sri Lanka’s former president Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: SF to be reinstated as General
content: President Maithripala Sirisena had instructed the authorities to drop all the charges levelled against former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka and to reinstate him as a General, Captain Senaka Haripriya de Silva, the personal assistant to Fonseka said.

title: Navin also Sports Minister
content: Cabinet Minister of Tourism of the new government, Navin Dissanayake had also been appointed as the Sports Minister today.

title: SriLankan cancels flights to Mattala airport
content: SriLankan Airlines has decided to cancel its flights to and via Mahinda Rajapaksa International Airport, Mattala from February 9, onwards.

title: Pope Francis leaves for Philippines
content: His Holiness Pope Francis left for Manila, Philippines in a Sri Lankan flight concluding a successful two-day official visit to Sri Lanka a short while ago.

title: Wimal’s brother-in-law arrested
content: Former minister Wimal Weerawansa’s brother-in-law was arrested at Nattarampotha in Kundasale for spreading false news to embarrass and inconvenience the Government, Police Spokesman Ajith Rohana said.

title: Police officer in EC convoy dies
content: One police officer of the Elections Commissioner’s convoy was killed and another injured when their motorbike collided with a school van on the Maharagama-Kottawa Road this morning, the Police said.

title: ​Cabraal should respond to allegations: Harsha
content: Commenting on Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal’s decision to resign from his post, UNP Parliamentarian Dr. Harsha De Silva today said that Mr. Cabraal should answer to the financial allegations during his tenure before resigning.

title: Police stern on spurious vehicles
content: Vehicles not possessing proper registration would be taken into custody on sight and action would be taken against the driver of the vehicle, the Police said today.

title: Court bars President’s TV show
content: The District Court of Kaduwela issued an enjoining order against four television stations from broadcasting a programme titled “Janapathi Janahamuwa” or a programme of similar nature featuring President Mahinda Rajapakse.

title: SL displeased with EU statement
content: The Government of Sri Lanka today expressed its displeasure over the statement made by the EU Heads of Mission in Colombo on how the presidential election should be held.

title: UPFA PC member arrested for assaulting MS artistes
content: UPFA North Western Provincial Council member Don Kamal Indika was arrested this morning after he surrendered to the Gokarella police over the alleged attack on a group of artistes at Kumbukgate in Kurunegala on Monday.

title: Maithri’s Mahiyangana office attacked
content: Common opposition candidate Maithripala Sirisena’s election office at Mahiyanganaya has been attacked last night, the Police media unit said.

title: Up Country train service disrupted
content: Train services on the main line were disrupted since last night due to the earth slips and rock falling, the Railway Control Room said. The train services on the Batticaloa-Trincomalee line terminated at Polonnaruwa  because of the  railway line submerged at several locations.

title: Video: Ranil complains to police over fraudulent document
content: United National Party (UNP) National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said he had complained to the Police Chief today with regard to a fraudulent document on which his signature and that of common opposition candidate Maithripala Sirisena had been forged.

title: Six alleged Lankan sex workers detained in Malaysia
content: The Johor police in Malaysia have conducted 10,300 raids to tackle prostitution in the state and arrested 2,986 women including six Sri Lankan from January until now.

title: Video: MR should vacate immediately: JVP
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today said if the incumbent President Mahinda Rajapaksa was defeated at the election in January, he would have to vacate the office right after the results were announced.

title: Taliban attack in Peshawar: 100 killed including 80 children
content: At least 100 people, 80 of them children, have been killed in a Taliban assault on an army-run school in Peshawar, Pakistani officials say.

title: Tissa withdraws oral questions
content: Former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake had withdrawn some of the oral questions he had submitted to Parliament after his defection, it was reported yesterday.

title: Our fishermen treated well by SL-Swaraj
content: Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj said on Wednesday that whenever the Indian fishermen were detained by the Sri Lankan authorities, they were treated in a humane and pragmatic manner and were released expeditiously.

title: Vaiko quits Modi’s alliance
content: MDMK led by Vaiko on Monday decided to quit the NDA alliance in Tamil Nadu alleging that the BJP government at the Centre was acting against Tamils and betrayed the people of the state.

title: I got gastritis due to CBK: Anura Yapa
content: Newly-appointed Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) General Secretary and Minister Anura Priyadharshana Yapa said today he came down with gastritis during the Presidency of Chandrika Kumaratunga because they had to keep eating short eats while waiting for her for hours.

title: Video: Harin determined to take control of Uva PC
content: Saying he was ready to take control of the Uva Provincial Council, Harin Fernando its present opposition leader said today that his party would file legal action and get the council convened once again.

title: No more ministers can be bought over by dollars- MR
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that his cabinet no longer holds any Ministers who can be bought over by dollars or pounds.

title: UK lawmakers urge EU to stop SL trade perks
content: Leading British lawmakers urged the European Union on Thursday to remove preferential trade tariffs from Sri Lanka if it fails to address human rights concerns, the Reuters reported.

title: Vaas to be sacked after England series
content: With less than three months to go for next year’s World Cup, the crisis within Sri Lanka national team has spilled over to the support staff as Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) executive committee discussed yesterday about sacking national team’s famous fast bowling coach Chaminda Vaas after the current home ODI series against England.

title: Video: This may be my last state function: Maithripala
content: SLFP General Secretary Minister Maithripala Sirisena addressing an event at Battaramulla a short while ago said, ‘this may be my last state function’, amid widespread speculation that he might break ranks with the incumbent regime.

title: Legal luminary bids adieu
content: R.K.W. Goonesekere, one of Sri Lanka’s foremost legal luminaries, passed away on Monday and his cremation will take place at the Jawatte Cemetery this evening.

title: ‘Kasuri’ no more
content: Veteran journalist and award-winning novelist Karunadasa Suriyarachchi - popularly known as ‘Kasuri’ passed away today after a brief illness, Government Information Department said.

title: Govt. allays fears about Chinese sub
content: The External Affairs Ministry today in Parliament allayed the fears that the docking of a Chinese Submarine in the Colombo Port had triggered security concerns in the neighborhood.

title: DP alleges its PC members bought over
content: The Democratic Party (DP) said today it would take legal action against the three Provincial Councillors who joined the government and alleged that they crossed over for personal gains.

title: State violence in SL continues: CM Wigneswaran
content: Chief Minister of Northern Province C V Wigneswaran today claimed "state violence" in Sri Lanka continued and the judiciary too played a role in foisting a second-class citizenship on Tamils.

title: Don’t speed on the A9- Police
content: The Police today requested drivers not to speed when driving on the A-9 to and from Jaffna, and especially between Mankulam to Kilinochchi, because of the high death rates reported from road accidents due to speeding.

title: Indian envoy visits TN fishermen on death row
content: The Indian High Commissioner in Sri Lanka, Y.K. Sinha, visited the five Indian fishermen who were sentenced to death by a Colombo court last week for alleged drug trafficking.

title: Monorail in Colombo transport master plan
content: The Transport Ministry has included the monorail transport system in its master plan prepared with Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) for developing the urban transport system linking the Colombo city with the suburbs, Parliament was informed yesterday.

title: Ten schools closed in Haldummulla
content: Ten schools in the Haldummulla Education Division were closed until Monday because of the landslide at Meeriyabedda Estate this morning, Education officials in Uva Province said.

title: CW to assist LLRC implementation: Sharma
content: Commonwealth Secretary General Kamalesh Sharma today said that the Commonwealth Organisation would continue to assist Sri Lanka in the implementation of the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission (LLRC) recommendations.

title: Nine-year-old goes missing
content: A nine-year-old boy had been reported missing along with a monk from Batuwita, Horana since this morning while they were in Horana, the missing boy’s grandmother complained to the Police.

title: Police tear gas Uni. protest march
content: Police used tear gas and water canon to disperse University students as they entered the parliament road a short while ago.

title: How s that? asks Sanga
content: After the West Indies’ pullout from the India tour due to a pay dispute and Sri Lanka Cricket's decision to fill in with a five-match ODI series, Kumar Sangakkara has expressed concerns about the SLC decision

title: Animal rights activists accuse Wildlife chief
content: Animal rights activists today accused the Wildlife Ministry Secretary and Wildlife Conservation Department Director General (WCD) of being directly involved in providing a legal standing to the baby elephants that are smuggled out of national parks and sold off for domestication.

title: Video: Foreigners need prior permission to visit North-Govt
content: The Defence and Urban Development Ministry said today that foreigners wishing to visit the North should obtain prior permission from the Ministry.

title: Video: Abolish the executive presidency without elections: UNP
content: The Government should move towards scrapping the Executive Presidency without holding a Presidential Election, the United National Party (UNP) said today.

title: PCB and SLC chiefs in top secret meeting
content: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Shaharyar M Khan had made a very brief and top secret visit to Sri Lanka last morning to have a discussion with Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) President Jayantha Dharmadasa and invite Sri Lanka “A” and Under 19 teams to tour Pakistan.

title: Man killed by crocodile
content: A 62-year-old man died after he was attacked by a crocodile at Gaminipura in Kataragama last night, the Police said.

title: Kunanayakam hits out at ‘hooliganism’
content: Sri Lanka’s former permanent representative to the UN in Geneva, Tamara Kunanayakam said the assault of High Commissioner Chris Nonis is only one in a series of acts in a tragedy that opened in Geneva in 2009 with the same cast of villains, followed by other acts also in Geneva in 2011 and 2012, and still others played out in Rome and Paris.

title: UNP has secret plan for victory
content: The main opposition UNP is in the process of devising a secret plan to ensure victory at the next presidential election, the party’s Elections Affairs Secretary Talatha Athukorala said today.

title: Indian arrested for overstaying visa
content: A 31-year-old Indian was arrested yesterday on charges of have overstayed his tourist visa and engaging in illegal trade in Nanu Oya, Police said.

title: Jaya’s first day in jail sans visitors
content: AIADMK chief J Jayalalithaa, the first serving chief minister to be convicted in a corruption case, spent her first day in the Central Prison at Parappana Agrahara in Bangalore without meeting any visitors. She has been allotted a normal cell in the women's barracks that she shares with close aide N Sasikala and J Elavarasi.

title: DMK protests against MR’s participation in UNGA
content: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) and its allies observed a “Black Day” protest across Tamil Nadu condemning Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s participation in the UN General Assembly meeting.

title: Video: Tsunami cost US$ 1.5bn: Minister
content: The estimated value of destruction caused by the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami was US$ 1.5 bn, Minister for Disaster Management Mahinda Amaraweera said today speaking at a media conference in view of a three day seminar to be held at the BMICH from September 24. ???

title: Scotland rejects independence from Britain
content: Voters in Scotland have rejected independence from Britain, opting to preserve a more than 300-year-old union in a referendum Thursday that sent shock waves through Europe and opened the door to continuing political tumult in Britain.

title: TN spikers asked to return from SL
content: Two Tamil Nadu volleyball players, V. Hariharan and L. Manoj, who were asked by the Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu (SDAT) to come back midway from the Asian youth volleyball championship in Colombo, returned to the Chennai city on Friday.

title: Rs.4 million worth cigarettes seized
content: A large stock of foreign cigarettes worth more than Rs.4 million allegedly smuggled into the country by a billionaire businessman was seized and the businessman taken into custody by the Panadura –Walana Anti Vice Squad yesterday during a raid on a house at Dharmarama Road in Dematagoda

title: Parents sell infant for Rs. 50,000; buy house for Rs. 18,000
content: Police today arrested the parents of a week-old infant and four others for allegedly selling the infant for Rs.50, 000 yesterday in Modera.

title: Police record statement on Thilini’s complaint
content: Thilini Amalka, who was allegedly harassed by a man at the Wariyapola bus stand prompting her to slap him –- the video of which went viral on the internet -- was summoned to the Kurunegala Police Station yesterday to record her statement on her complaint.

title: Two Indians nabbed with sensitive pics
content: Two Indians were arrested at Modara yesterday for allegedly possessing photographs of high security zones including the Parliament and the Prime Minister’s Residence, the Police said today

title: Two killed in accident
content: At least two persons were killed and seven persons were injured when a container collided with a small lorry at Welisara this morning, the Police said.

title: Bronze for SL-China pair at summer Youth Olympic
content: Sri Lanka’s Sachin Dias and Bingjiao He of China clinched a historic bronze medal in the Badminton mixed double at the Summer Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, China today.

title: Suspected Ebola victim's blood samples to be sent to India
content: The director of the Medical Research Institute said that arrangements had been made to send blood samples of the suspected female Ebola victim to a laboratory in Pune, India.

title: Rain may go away
content: The Department of Meteorology said the rains in the drought hit areas may be temporary as they were brought about by a atmospheric condition that did not usually last long.

title: Sri Sri may return Honorary Doctorate to SL Uni
content: The Art of Living may return the honorary doctorate conferred on its founder Sri Sri Ravi Shankar to the Open International University for Complementary Medicines (OIUCM) in Sri Lanka, after Express reported that the university does not have any statutory recognition.

title: Father, son killed in Meegahatenna
content: A father and son were killed after being brutally assaulted by iron rods by some unidentified men at Meegahatenna last night, Police said

title: Give arms training to fishermen for self-defense: Nedumaran
content: If the Indian Navy “continues to fail to protect” Tamil Nadu fishermen from attacks by the Sri Lankan navy, the State government should then impart weapons training to fishermen to defend themselves from being hunted down on the high seas, Tamil Nationalist Movement leader, Pazha. Nedumaran has said

title: TID arrests uni. student
content: The Police Terrorist Investigation Division (TID) had arrested a third-year student of the Sabaragamuwa University on Tuesday on charges of an assault incident in the University.

title: No one forced us to leave - Team manager
content: Thushara Cooray, manager of the Under-15 cricket team from Sri Lanka which came back from Chennai on Monday  told Express that the decision to return was taken by him and not because anybody in Tamil Nadu forced them to leave.

title: Action against those inciting violence: Army
content: Army said today strict action would be taken against those who circulate false information with the malicious objective of creating social disharmony among communities.

title: Seven sentenced to death
content: Seven suspects produced in the Panadura High Court were today sentenced to death on charges of murdering a man at Pinwatte in Panadura on August 14, 2005.

title: Video: NFF to contest Uva polls on its own
content: The National Freedom Party (NFF) has decided to contest the upcoming elections to the Uva Provincial Council on its own, Party Leader Wimal Weerawansa said today.

title: MR calls Indonesian President-elect
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has telephoned the newly elected Indonesian President Joko Widodo to offer congratulations on his decisive victory at the recently concluded Presidential elections and invited the latter to visit Sri Lanka.

title: Deplorable security by Britain
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has declined an invitation to participate in the Commonwealth’s First World War Commemoration Service at the Glasgow Cathedral on August 4 on the basis of ‘deplorable security lapses’ by the British Government amid protests planned by pro-LTTE groups, Daily Mirror learns.

title: States can't interfere with Centre-BJP
content: Indian Foreign Policy is the exclusive preserve of the Central Government and we expect the political parties in Tamil Nadu to formulate their opinions in line with the realities of the situation, BJP Foreign Policy Cell National Convener and BJP's National Executive Member Dr. Seshadri Chari said in an interview with Daily Mirror

title: Srilankan not using Ukrainian airspace
content: SriLankan Airlines yesterday said that its flights were not using Ukrainian airspace when travelling to Europe.

title: High time to topple this dictatorship: Ranil
content: The lawlessness in this country can no longer be overcome through democratic means but through a well- organised struggle by all parties and civil society groups, United National Party (UNP) Leader Ranil Wickremeisnghe said today.

title: FIFA World Cup: Germany are Champions of the World
content: Germany have emerged as the Champions of the FIFA World Cup, Brazil 2014, after a hard fought 120 minute battle with Argentina at the Maracana.

title: Dayasiri accuses Harin of using unsuitable language
content: North Western Province Chief Minister Dayasiri Jayasekera yesterday accused UNP MP Harin Fernando of using unparliamentary language during the live TV debate with him and says he did not sling mud at his opponent.

title: Gmail in Sinhala
content: Google has added 13 languages including  Sinhala to Gmail’s interface to now cover 94 percent of the world’s Internet population, the company said Monday

title: SA secure solid win in Colombo
content: South Africa beat Sri Lanka by 75 runs with just under 10 overs to spare in the first one-day international in Colombo today.

title: Tangalle killing: Judgement in two weeks
content: The Colombo High Court today directed the parties in the trial into the killing of British tourist Khuram Sheik to conclude their cases and to conclude their submissions by next Friday because it intended to deliver judgment within two weeks

title: Seventeen OICs appointed
content: New OICs (Officer in Charge) have been appointed to 17 vacant police stations by the Secretary of the Ministry of Law and Peace on service requirements, police said

title: Panel to strengthen coastal security
content: The district administration and police in India have decided to constitute a standing committee to share intelligence, strengthen coastal security, prevent smuggling and human trafficking through sea route

title: Rescued Lankan, a ganja smuggler
content: A 21-year-old Sri Lankan, who was found stranded on an islet and rescued by fishermen on June 11, had attempted to flee to Sri Lanka clandestinely with about 80 kg of ganja even as police arrested five local people who helped him in his illegal mission

title: England cannot handle pressure-Mahela
content: Sri Lanka batsman Mahela Jayawardene said England failed to handle the pressure on the fourth day of the second and final test on Monday and questioned the way home captain Alastair Cook had handled recent criticism.

title: SL businessman jailed over football match-fixing plot
content: A footballer and two Asian businessmen including a Sri Lankan have been jailed for plotting to fix the results of English lower league matches.

title: MR visits Beruwala
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa visited Beruwala a short while ago to meet Sinhala and Muslim communities, President's media said.

title: Police curfew in Aluthgama and Beruwala
content: Police curfew has been imposed in the Aluthgama and  Beruwala police divisions with immediate effect after tense situation in the area-police said

title: Bridge collapses on Rakwana- Deniyaya Road
content: The traffic on the Rakwana- Deniyaya Road came to a standstill this morning after the Kalupalama bridge at Hedaraliwatta collapsed while a lorry transporting a load of fertilizer was passing the bridge, police said. Pictures

title: Two killed in Paranthan
content: Two young men had been killed when the motorcycle they were riding on crashed against a tipper truck at Paranthan junction a while ago, the Kilinochchi Police said

title: Police find nine buses with sirens
Ranil to participate at JHU policy launch
content: UNP national leader Ranil Wickremesinghe would participate at the ceremony to launch the National Policy document of the Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU), which is to be held at the BMICH this evening, UNP sources said

title: Sanga ton boosts SL
content: Sri Lanka, after losing the toss, made 300 for nine against England in the fourth one-day international at Lord's on Saturday.

title: Video: UNP awaits Govt.’s response
content: Claiming that the UNP would always back the government if it made a genuine effort to resolve the national issue, UNP MP Lakshman Kiriella today enquired what the government intended doing with regard to the request made by the new Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, for a political solution to the national issue which went beyond the 13th Amendment to the Constitution ???

title: Vaiko arrested
content: Delhi Police today arrested MDMK chief Vaiko as he was leading a protest against Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa's arrival in New Delhi for the swearing-in ceremony of India's 15th Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Wigneswaran rejects MR’s invitation
content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) today rejected the invitation extended to Chief Minister C.Wigneswaran by President Mahinda Rajapaksa to attend the swearing-in ceremony of Indian Prime Minister designate Narendra Modi stating that such collusion would give a false impression to the International Community.

title: Mubarak sentenced to three years in jail
content: Egypt's former president Hosni Mubarak has been sentenced to three years in prison for stealing public funds, in a case locally known as the "Presidential palaces case," three years after he was toppled by massive protests

title: MR leaves for China
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa will leave for China this afternoon to attend the 4th Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA).

title: Landslide victory for BJP
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) led National Democratic Alliance headed for a landslide victory at the Indian General Elections. Jayalalithaa Jeyaram’s ADMK Party won the elections in Tamil Nadu but the BJP may not need ADMK assistance because of its clear majority

title: Duminda gets permission to go to Singapore
content: Parliamentarian Duminda Silva, who is to be indicted in the High Court in the Bharatha Lakshman Premachandra murder case, was allowed by the court to go to Singapore for six weeks, to obtain treatment for the injuries sustained during the shootout.

title: Sri Lankan awarded for his honesty
content: A Sri Lankan student who found more than $100,000 while cleaning toilets at Channel Nine's headquarters has been richly awarded for his honesty.

title: Uni students block Galle Road
content: The Galle Road leading to the Galle Face Roundabout was temporarily closed from Kollupitiya Junction because of a protest by University students.

title: Four arrested over Hambantota attack on UNP
content: Four persons were arrested today in connection with the attack on a group of UNP parliamentarians who were on a fact finding visit to the Hambantota Port and the Mattala Airport last month,update

title: Video: We have done nothing to destroy religious harmony; BBS
content: Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Galagodaatte GnanasaraThera today claimed they had done nothing to destroy religious harmony and whatever they did was in the open and exposed to the media.

title: BASL concerned over new SC appointments
content: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) while expressing concern over the impending appointments to fill Supreme Court vacancies will send a top-priority letter instructing regional branches of the Bar Association to send an immediate response on the intended appointments to the Supreme Court.

title: Random checks on face-covered motorcyclists
content: A random check on motorists wearing face-covered helmets would be carried out throughout the day, Police said.

title: No casino; only a hotel: Govt.
content: Draft Strategic Development Project Bill doesn't allow any casinos and the project was only a hotel project, the Government Information Department said today

title: Bangladeshis using SL as transit hub to Europe
content: Forty one Bangladeshis were arrested from Fort and Maradana areas by the Immigration and Emigration Department on allegations that they were part of a large scale human smuggling racket.

title: SLTB grosses highest ever income during festive season
content: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) said today it had earned an income of about Rs. 450 million within a week starting from April 7 when the special bus service was launched to facilitate commuter travel during the New Year season.

title: SC rejects plea to probe Indian Army's role in SL
content: The Supreme Court Thursday declined to entertain a plea seeking a Special Investigative Team (SIT) probe into the role of the Indian Army as a peacekeeping force in Sri Lanka during operations against the LTTE.

title: OHCHR will commence assessing the evidence on SL-UK
content: Britain said that the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights will now begin the process of establishing an investigation and assessing the evidence regarding Sri Lanka.

title: Rookantha,Chandraleka assault case:10 PSD officers released
content: Ten former Presidential Security Division (PSD) Officers, who were found guilty of assaulting songsters Rookantha Gunathilake and Chandraleka Perera, were released under the Presidential Pardon today, Prison Department official said

title: HC allows Lankan Detenu's wife to See him at hospital
content: Madras High Court yesterday permitted the wife of a Sri Lankan Detenu to see him in hospital. Chenduran, a Sri Lankan national, was in detention under the Foreigners Act at a refugee camp on March 4.

title: Exploitative political system must end – CBK
content: Former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunge said that if the Opposition did not act properly and unseat this government democratically, the people would revolt as has happened in some

title: Sun shines directly above SL
content: With the temperatures rising significantly, the sun will come directly above Sri Lanka between April 5 and 15 and will be above Colombo and the suburbs on April 7

title: Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera acquitted
content: The Bodu Bala Sena General Secretary Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera and 13 others including four monks charged with trespassing and attacking the Cavalry Church in Thalahena at Malabe in 2008 were acquitted today.Pictures

title: 11,000 votes at the first shy: Nadeesha
content: Despite not being among the first four in UNP preferential list, Nadeesha Hemamali said the 11,000 votes she obtained could be considered a real victory being a new entrant to politics and to Matara.

title: Congress downplays Chidambaram’s remark on Lanka issue
content: Congress today downplayed Finance Minister P Chidambaram’s remark that India should have supported the US-sponsored resolution against Sri Lanka.

title: Video: Murdered British aid worker’s girlfriend in SL Court
content: British aid worker Khuram Shaikh’s Russian girlfriend was present at the Colombo High Court today when it took up the inquiry into the killing of Mr. Shaikh at a holiday resort in Tangalle two years ago

title: Traffic congestion on Thurstan Road
content: Heavy traffic has been reported along Thurstan Road Colombo 07, due to a protest carried out by Students of the Law Faculty of the Colombo University, who were on their way to College House, the Police said.

title: Foreign experts to inspect Fmr. CJ’s bank details
content: The Counsel for former Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake today told court that a defence team including foreign experts would be examining the computer data of the NDB bank pertaining to the accounts of the former Chief Justice and therefore they need a longer period for the purpose

title: Poll violence: first death
content: In the first case of election reported deaths for the upcoming Provincial Council elections, a supporter of UNP WPC candidate Harshana Rajakaruna had died allegedly due to an assault by UPFA supporters in Kimbulvilawattha, Dompe a short while ago, Police said.

title: SL puts its No.1 T20  ranking on the line
content: Sri Lanka will start the ICC World Twenty20 Bangladesh, which runs from 16 March to 6 April, as the number-one ranked side on the Reliance ICC T20I Team Rankings Table, the ICC said.

title: JVP street play members assaulted
content: A Street Drama troupe of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) was assaulted by an unidentified group at the Panadura bus stand this afternoon, JVP media said

title: 4,000 Tamils protest in Geneva for SL war crimes probe
content: Thousands of Tamils demonstrated in Geneva on Monday to protest Sri Lanka's rejection of calls for an international probe into alleged war crimes at the end of its civil war

title: India yet to decide on UNHRC resolution
content: Indian External Affairs Ministry on Friday said India was yet to take a final call on the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) resolution on Sri Lanka.

title: If somebody goes to electric chair for war crimes, it would be me-SF
content: Former Army Commander and Democratic Party Leader Sarath Fonseka said that if there are war crimes allegations against the Sri Lankan Army and somebody goes to the electric chair, it would be him

title: India for 'much more progress' in reconciliation in SL
content: India on Monday made it clear that it looks for "much more progress" in the reconciliation process in Sri Lanka while being non-committal on how it will vote at the UN Human Rights Council on a resolution on the country's alleged rights abuses during the war with Tamil Tiger rebels.

title: MR denounces US plan for rights resolution
content: Sri Lanka’s president denounced Washington’s plan to move a UN human rights resolution against the island nation today, comparing the US move over alleged war crimes to a professional boxer taking on a schoolboy.

title: Defamatory texts doing the rounds
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate today ordered two mobile phone service providers to provide details pertaining to three telephone numbers alleged to have been used by a person who allegedly sent text messages posing as President Mahinda Rajapaksa

title: Reconsider the release of Rajiv assassins- Narayanasamy
content: Union minister of state for prime minister's office V. Narayanasamy on Sunday asked the Tamil Nadu government to reconsider its decision to release three convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case

title: Video: SC overrules Appeal Court order in Shirani B case
content: A five-judge bench of the Supreme Court today quashed the Court of Appeal order, which held that the Parliament Select Committee (PSC) decision to impeach the then Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayaka was null and void

title: NPC calls for direct flights to India from Palaly, Trinco
content: The Northern Provincial Council passed a resolution yesterday, calling for the commencement of direct flights from Palaly and Trincomalee to India

title: India allocates more funds for SL
content: The Indian Ministry of External Affairs  today allocated Rs 500 crore for 2014-15 for  Sri Lanka’s development, which is an increase compared to last year, PTI reported

title: SL won’t accept ‘country-specific’ resolutions by UN: Dilan
content: Minister Dilan Perera, special envoy to Namibia said Sri Lanka would not accept any ‘country-specific’ resolutions by the U.N., because such resolutions are aimed at targeting specific countries for narrow political reasons

title: NZ bound asylum seekers arrested
content: A group of 75 would-be asylum seekers including six children were taken into custody by the Police in the  Moragolla, Beruwela area while trying to flee to New Zealand illegally  yesterday, police said.PICTURES

title: Resolution on SL presented to US Congress
content: A resolution, calling on the US and the international community to establish an independent international accountability mechanism to evaluate reports of war crimes, crimes against humanity, and other human rights violations committed by both sides during and after the war in Sri Lanka was presented to the US Congress by the Republican Senator of North Carolina Richard Burr.

title: Lankan caught with gold biscuits worth Rs.15 mn
content: A 40-year-old Sri Lankan was arrested at the Katunayake Airport this morning while attempting to smuggle into the country 31 gold biscuits worth Rs.15.5, Customs spokesman Leslie Gamini said

title: Australia refuses to back int’l probe against SL
content: The Australian government is refusing to back an independent international investigation into alleged war crimes during the Sri Lankan civil war as the government of Sri Lanka rejected a new report detailing "credible" claims of civilian bombings, extrajudicial killings and other abuses.

title: SL rejects US criticism over rights record and democracy
content: Sri Lanka on Sunday rejected “patently unfair” allegations by the United States that its rights record had deteriorated in the five years since the end of a war.

title: Video: NPC has overstepped its powers: UNP
content: The United National Party (UNP) today charged that the Northern Provincial Council has overstepped it constitutional mandate by passing a resolution that called for an international investigation on Sri Lanka

title: SSP passes away
content: Kandy-Nuwara Eliya Special Task Force (STF) Zonal Commander SSP B.D.Chandrasiri passed away this morning at the age of 53 after a sudden illness, the STF said.

title: Special IDs for Gypsies
content: The Ministry of Wildlife Resources Conservation has decided to issue a special identity card for the country’s Gypsies, enabling to carry out their traditional and cultural activities without any hindrance, Ministry sources said today.

title: Centre asks Andhra Pradesh to expedite release of SL fishermen
content: The Indian central government has asked the Andhra Pradesh government to expedite the release of remaining 25 Sri Lankan fishermen detained in the state

title: Cleopatra in Colombo
content: In a complaint to the Ratnapura Police, a man said he found nude pictures of his undergraduate wife with four other men in her mobile phone

title: Fishermen's meeting postponed to Jan 27
content: With Sri Lanka seeking time to finalise the list of representatives for the much-anticipated fishermen's associations meeting aimed at resolving the vexed issue of fishing rights in the Palk Straits, the Tamil Nadu government on Saturday said the discussions would be held on January 27 and not on Monday as announced originally.

title: All fishermen to be released in stages: Rajitha
content: India and Sri Lanka today agreed to release all the arrested fishermen in stages from today onwards, and to develop the fisheries sector through mutual engagement and co-operation, Minister Rajitha Senaratne said

title: Saudi and Sri Lanka to sign labor pact today
content: Saudi Arabia and Sri Lanka will sign a landmark labor pact on Monday in a renewed bid to regulate hiring of domestic workers from the island nation and to ensure protection to all domestic help already employed in the Kingdom.

title: Video: Govt. lost millions due to route permit fraud
content: Lanka Private Bus Owners Association (LPBOA) President Gamunu Wijeratne said today the government had lost Rs. 100 million due to the issuing of what he called ‘illegal route permits’.

title: Rough weather to continue today
content: With the deep depression that is overland and moving towards the Puttalam area very slowly, showery weather and windy conditions over Northern parts of the island will continue today, the Meteorological Department said.

title: Lankan nabbed while smuggling satellite receivers
content: A Sri Lankan male who arrived from Bangalore was arrested today at the Katunayake Airport for smuggling 260 pieces and parts of satellite receivers and 50 kgs of big onion seeds worth Rs. 400,000, Customs Media Spokesman Leslie Gamini said

title: Video: ‘Bribery Chief received kickbacks’- Petition handed over
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today handed over a petition against the Chief of the Bribery Commission, Jagath De Silva Balapatabendi to the Bribery Commission, alleging that he received kickbacks after having sat on a Supreme Court bench, which released a consignment of vehicles.

title: 450 prison officers transferred
content: Some 450 prisons officers will be transferred with effect from January 1, 2014, Prisons Commissioner General Chadraratna Pallegama said

title: OIC nabbed for sexual bribe
content: The Maho Police crimes OIC was arrested at a Kurunegala rest house today while allegedly accepting a sexual bribe from a woman.

title: Lankan accused of molesting teenage swimmer
content: A Sri Lankan lifeguard has been accused of molesting a 14-year-old teenage swimmer inside the women’s changing rooms at a residential tower in Jumeirah Village in Dubai

title: Stepping up defence ties with Sri Lanka outrageous: Jayalalithaa
content: Expressing dismay over reports of Indian Coast Guard participating in naval exercises with Sri Lankan Navy, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa today asked Prime Minister Manmohan Singh to recall the two ships and Coast Guard personnel participating in the event in the island nation

title: Grade-5 exam to get new look
content: Education Minister Bandula Gunawardena today said the present format of the Grade-5 Scholarship Examination would be changed in 2016

title: Video: UNP to take night races to Bribery Commission
content: The main opposition United National Party (UNP) today charged that last weekend’s Colombo night races were conducted in an illegal manner and therefore the UNP would lodge a complaint with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption

title: Largest heroin haul seized at Hikkaduwa
content: Police narcotics bureau seized 10 kilos of heroin from a house at Hikkaduwa yesterday, which is said to be the biggest ever heroin haul detected in the Southern province

title: High Court finds in favour of SL Tamil woman
content: Australian Immigration Minister Scott Morrison will have to consider the case of a Tamil Sri Lankan woman in indefinite detention after the High Court ruled his department made a mistake

title: Man attempts suicide over FEB failure
content: A person from Anuradhapura attempted suicide by taking poison in front of the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau at Battaramulla. He had a grouse against the authorities for ignoring his requests to get his foreign-employed wife back to Sri Lanka.

title: 23 SL health officers to treat Haiyan victims
content: Twenty three Sri Lankan health officers will leave for Philippines today to treat victims of the Haiyan cyclone, the Health Ministry said today. They met President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday. The health officers were deployed on a request made by the President

title: Hulugalle continues to head NGO secretariat
content: Director General Lakshman Hulugalle said today that he will continue to head the Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO) Secretariat.

title: There are chances that Singh will go to Jaffna-Chidambaram
content: Indian Finance Minister and senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday said that there are chances that Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh will go to Jaffna and hold talks with newly elected Northern Province Chief Minister C.V.Wigneswaran.

title: Osu Sala to step in during strikes
content: Government hospital in-house patients could get medicines free of charge on prescriptions from nearby state Osu Sala outlets whenever hospital staff went on strike, the Health Ministry said

title: Cyclonic storm ‘Lehar’ over Bay of Bengal
content: The Meteorological Department said the severe cyclonic storm ‘Lehar’ remained more or less stationary over the Bay of Bengal but would not have a direct impact on Sri Lanka

title: Tangalle PS chairman pleads not guilty, released on bail
content: The Tangalle Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Sampath Vidanapathiranage and five others today pleaded not guilty before the Colombo High Court to the killing of British tourist Khuram Sheikh Zaman

title: Six new DIGs
content: The Ministry of Defence and Urban Development said six Senior Superintendents of Police (SSP) were today promoted to the post of Deputy Inspector General (DIG)

title: City hotel occupancy far below expectations
content: The average occupancy rates of the hotels in Colombo remained far below expectations during the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) 2013, according to the Colombo City Hotels Association Chairman M. Shanthi kumar.

title: C-4 ready to pay driver subject to conditions
content: Channel-4 journalists said they would pay the vehicle driver, who drove them to Colombo from Anuradhapura “if he was forced to drive them against his will and at his own cost.”

title: Video: MR invites C4 men for a cuppa
content: In what appeared to be a consolidation of the charm that President Mahinda Rajapaksa is renowned for, while dismissing questions posed by Channel-4 journalist when he was about to board the car after the opening of the Commonwealth Business Forum, invited them “for a cup of tea” ???

title: Weapons and ammo found from Mirihana
content: A large stock of weapons and ammunitions, including swords and knives were found from a house in Mirihana this evening, police said.

title: SL man's body in Dubai water tank
content: The decomposed body of a man was found in the rooftop water tank of a building in Al Khail Gate community in Dubai’s Al Quoz area.

title: Sharma defends CHOGM in SL
content: The selection of Sri Lanka as the location for the biennial Commonwealth summit has been defended by Commonwealth secretary-general Kamalesh Sharma.

title: German national drowns in Dikwella
content: A 34-year-old German national drowned in Dikwella while he was taking a sea bath in the Dikwella beach area, police said

title: Sharma urges setting up of an Independent EC
content: While commending the Northern Provincial Council elections, Commonwealth Secretary-General Kamalesh Sharma underlined the necessity to set up an independent election commission, which is a widely valued as a Commonwealth good practice

title: E03 after 6 p.m.
content: The Colombo-Katunayake Expressway declared open by President Mahinda Rajapaksa this morning would be opened for public from 6 p.m. today, an official said.

title: Cameron defends summit move amid HR concerns
content: David Cameron has defended the decision to attend a high-profile international summit in Sri Lanka despite his concerns over the country's human rights record

title: Siyam killing: Fausdeen granted bail
content: Mohamed Fausdeen, who is one of the main suspects involved in the killing of businessman M.M. Mohamed Siyam, was granted bail by the Colombo High Court.

title: DP to boycott CHOGM
content: The Democratic Party (DP) Leader Sarath Fonseka said today that his party would boycott the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in November stating the intention of holding the summit was not to benefit the people but to grab commissions from taxes paid by the public

title: Crucial UNP meetings begin
content: The UNP’s factions today will have a series of meetings prior to the final meeting scheduled to be held this evening among UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, Deputy Leader Sajith Premadasa and Karu Jayasuriya.

title: NWPC: Setback for UPFA at inaugural meeting
content: In a major setback for the ruling UPFA at today’s inaugural session of the newly elected North-Western Provincial Council (NPC), UPFA member Dharmasiri Dassanayake was elected NPC Chairman instead of the ruling party choice Indrani Dassanayake

title: Missing businessman, bodyguard return
content: The businessman and his bodyguard who were reportedly missing since yesterday have returned home last night, the police said.

title: Three arrested for cheating SL refugees
content: Three persons were arrested on a charge of cheating Sri Lankan refugees to the tune of Rs.12 lakh in Tamil Nadu on Saturday.

title: Switzerland defends deportation of Sri Lankans
content: Switzerland on Thursday defended the deportation of two asylum seekers who were arrested upon returning to Sri Lanka, saying they were accused of backing Tamil rebels

title: Temple parley to resolve UNP crisis
content: United National Party (UNP) Leader Ranil Wickremesighe will meet UNP parliamentarians Karu Jayasuriya and Sajith Premadasa at the Dhammakithyarama Kollupitiya (Polwatte temple) for a meeting facilitated by Venerable Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera

title: Bus conductors arrested for not issuing tickets
content: The flying squad of the SLTB have arrested 915 bus conductors who have not issued tickets to the commuters who have tendered the money for tickets.

title: US backs Navi's assessment on SL
content: The United States today said the absence of meaningful progress on accountability calls for an international inquiry will persist, as announced by United Nations Human Rights High Commissioner Navi Pillay on Wednesday at the UN Human Rights session in Geneva

title: UNP hails SAARC monitors’ proposals
content: The main opposition United National Party today welcomed the suggestion made by the SAARC election monitors urging that the Elections Commissioner be vested with more powers to conduct elections in a free and fair manner

title: Arrange dialogue between TN, SL fishermen: Jaya to PM
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Sunday requested Prime Minister Manmohan Singh to facilitate a dialogue between fishermen associations in the state and Sri Lanka here in December following frequent attacks and arrests of fishermen by naval personnel of the island nation

title: Death plunge by young couple
content: A girl and a boy are reported to have jumped off a bridge into the sea near the Golden Island at Matara this morning, Police said. They said the victims were aged about 19 and a search was being carried out for them Pictures

title: Mali national arrested in Negombo
content: A Mali national was arrested by the Ethukala tourist police officials in Negombo for overstaying his visa and violating immigration laws, police said

title: Kama fiasco referred to mediation board
content: In a case where a businessman and two bouncers, who were alleged to have been involved in assaulting a 21-year -old youth at the Kama-Colombo nightclub was referred to the Mediation Board by a Colombo Court.

title: Schools in three provinces closed for elections
content: All schools in the North Western, Central and Northern Provinces will be closed on September 20 in view of the Provincial Council elections on September 21, the education ministry announced

title: More than 100 hospitalised for food poisoning
content: More than 100 people, including children, who took part in a Pooja at a Kovil in Dik-Oya, Hatton this morning had taken ill due to food poisoning and were admitted to the Dik-Oya Hospital, hospital sources said

title: Pakistani arrested with gemstones at BIA
content: A 38 year-old Pakistan national who was alleged to have attempted to smuggle more than 700 gemstones into Sri Lanka was arrested by the police Narcotics Bureau at the Bandaranaike International Airport last night

title: CJ 43 to boycott Bribery Commission hearings
content: Chief Justice 43 Shirani Bandaranayake informed the Bribery Commission today that she would not present herself before the Commission in the future, as she did not trust the integrity of the process and the Commissioners

title: Kachchatheevu: Karuna condemns Centre's position
content: Taking exception to Centre's position in the Supreme Court over ceding of Kachchatheevu to Sri Lanka, DMK chief M Karunanidhi on Sunday said there was evidence that the islet belonged to and was under the administrative control of the King of Ramanathapuram.

title: Jaya slams Centre for ‘muted response’
content: Slamming the Centre for remaining a “mute spectator” on the frequent arrests of Indian fishermen by Sri Lankan Navy, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Thursday said there was no concerted action on securing their release

title: Some countries using UNHRC to attack SL-MR
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has condemned the practice of certain countries for using the UN Human Rights Council against countries like Sri Lanka and Belarus, the President’s office said

title: New Ministry set up under MR
content: A new ministry to be known as the Ministry of Law and Order had been set up under President Mahinda Rajapaksa in keeping with the recommendations of the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission (LLRC), informed sources said

title: Three arrested for smuggling gold at Dabolim
content: Two Sri Lankan nationals and an Indian were arrested by customs sleuths on Tuesday at the Dabolim international airport for smuggling gold concealed in their rectums.

title: Love triangle end in shooting
content: Two Air force personnel, including a woman were killed following a shootout at a guesthouse at Marble Beach, Trincomalee today

title: SL umpire Ponnadurai dies, aged 78
content: Former test and one-day international umpire Selliah Ponnadurai has died at the age of 78, Sri Lanka Cricket said on Thursday. Ponnadurai officiated in the country's maiden test victory over India in 1985

title: EU concerned on Weliweriya and Grandpass incident
content: While expressing concern over the incidents in Weliweriya and Grandpass, the European Union said it looked to the Sri Lankan authorities to ensure justice through speedy, impartial investigations and to enable all Sri Lankans to exercise their human rights freely

title: Police curfew in Grandpass
content: Police curfew has been imposed in the Grandpass police area till 7 am tomorrow following the clash between two groups in the Grandpass area this evening, police said.

title: Parliament sittings suspended
content: Parliament sittings were suspended a short while ago after the government opposed the adjournment debate proposed by TNA leader R. Sampanthan regarding the land issue in the north

title: Shiral going independent
content: UNP Western Provincial Councillor Shiral Lakthilaka announced at the council session a short while ago that from today he would act as an independent member of the council

title: Army to launch internal inquiry
content: Army Commander Daya Ratnayake has appointed a Board of Inquiry headed by Adjutant General of the Sri Lanka Army Major General Jagath Dias to inquire into the allegations levelled against the army during the  Weliweriya incident on Thursday.

title: Pay more for liquor
content: Excise duty on liquor has been increased from today, Finance Ministry said. Accordingly the price of a litre of arrack will be increased by Rs.25 to 30 while a litre of beer will be increased by Rs. 10.

title: No dilution of the 13th Amendment-India
content: Top Indian minister reiterated that the Indian government was firm that there should be no dilution of the 13th Amendment to the Sri Lankan Constitution, PTI reported.

title: Electricity supply to Colombo 11, 12 & 13 disrupted
content: The electricity supply to Colombo 11, 12 and 13 has been disrupted due to a technical fault, the CEB Emergency Unit said

title: Nawagattegama teacher’s spouse complains of threats
content: The husband of the Navodya Maha Vidyalaya teacher -- who was allegedly asked to kneel in the presence of former provincial councillor Ananda Sarath Kumara -- had in a police complaint said Mr. Kumara had threatened him and his wife

title: Suspect’s mother in high handed act
content: A woman who allegedly threatened an estate worker, a Tamil woman, who provided information on the murder of the superintendent of Nooriwatta Estate in Deraniyagala was arrested by police today.

title: 3,000 SL migrant workers return
content: Over 3,000 Sri Lankan migrant workers with expired visas have returned home under a special amnesty granted by the Saudi Arabian government, a statement said here on Wednesday

title: Video: Two Pakistanis nabbed with heroin
content: Two Pakistan nationals were arrested at the Panadura railway station with heroin valued at Rs. six million rupees by the Excise Department (Narcotic) Division officers last evening ???

title: Angelo banned
content: Sri Lanka Cricket captain Angelo Mathews has been banned for two One Day Internationals after the team was found guilty of a slow over rate in yesterday’s final against India

title: Traffic in Kollupitiya
content: A Traffic congestion  reported in the Kollupitiya area due to the roads being closed around Galle Face roundabout.

title: Menon arrives
content: Indian National Security Advisor Shivshankar Menon arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago.According to officials Mr. Menon is here to discuss a tri-lateral maritime security treaty among India, Sri Lanka and the Maldives

title: India asks SL to fully implement power devolution provision
content: India today emphasised to Sri Lanka the need to fully implement the constitutional provision dealing with devolution of powers to provinces without dilution and to go beyond it to ensure meaningful development there

title: Open warrant issued against LTTE ‘pitch invader’
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya today issued an open warrant to arrest Logeshwaran Manimaran who invaded the pitch at Cardiff Grounds in the United Kingdom (UK) carrying a 'Tiger' flag during the semifinals match on June 20, played between Sri Lanka and India in the ICC Champions trophy tournament.

title: Madras High Court upholds ban on LTTE
content: The Madras High Court has upheld the Centre's ban on the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) between 2010 and 2012. The ban has been renewed for years till 2014 international media reports said.

title: One way rehearsal in Maradana
content: The Police said today that the road from the Maradana bridge leading up to technical junction and the Sri Sangharaja Mawatha roundabout leading up to Maradana will be made one way on June 29, and June 30 from 8 am to 4 pm

title: Train-van collision in Aluthgama
content: At least five people were killed and four injured when a van collided with Maradana- Hikkaduwa train at an unprotected railway crossing near Aluthgama Railway Station this evening, police said

title: Use the ‘come and see’ policy- Navy Chief
content: Navy Commander Jayanath Colombage requested not to judge Sri Lanka’s commitment and decision to end violence through the Humanitarian Operation from thousands of miles away but use the ‘come and see’ policy to know what had really happened

title: Govt. looks into threats against SL cricketers
content: The government today charged that the Tamil youth in England had been hired by certain groups to carryout various activities including death threats against Sri Lankan cricketers who are participating in the ongoing Champions Trophy one day tournament, but assured the matter would be looked into by the government

title: JHU presents 21Amendment
content: Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) presented its bill which sought to  repeal the 13th Amendment to the Constitution, a short while ago

title: Vaas Gunawardena transferred to Prisons hospital
content: Colombo North DIG Vaas Gunawardena who was arrested by the CID under over the murder of a businessman has been transferred from the Colombo National Hospital to the Prisons Hospital, Prisons Commissioner (Operations) G.B. Kulatunga said.

title: Tense situ at Fort railway
content: A tense situation has erupted at the Fort Railway Station over the delay of trains, sources said.

title: Govt. 'minorities' also call for repeal of 13A powers
content: Minister Faiszer Musthapha and SLFP Batticaloa District organiser Arun Thamabimutthu asserted that the Provincial Council system was a ‘white elephant’ and called for the repealing of the land and police powers enshrined in the Constitution if the government were to proceed with the Northern Provincial Council elections

title: ICC Champions Trophy 2013: SL elects to bat
content: Sri Lanka skipper Angelo Mathews won the toss and elected to bat first against New Zealand in their opening encounter of the ICC Champions Trophy 2013 at Cardiff.

title: Jaya writes to PM over fishermen issue
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa has shot off a letter to Prime Minister Manmohan Singh demanding the release of 49 fishermen from the state who have allegedly been captured by the Sri Lankan Navy, the NDTV reported.

title: Sigiriya beer advert in legal soup
content: The National Heritage Ministry said today it would take legal action against the company that had produced a Beer commercial disgracing the Sigiriya national heritage site

title: Video: Tense situation at Lahugala Primary school
content: A tense situation prevailed at the Lahugala Viharamahadevi Primary School in Ampara yesterday when Eastern Province Governor Mohan Wijewickrama visited the school to look into shortcomings there Pictures

title: Dr. Jayalath Jayawardane passes away
content: The Main opposition United National Party (UNP) parliamentarian Dr. Jayalath Jayawardena passed away on Wednesday after a brief illness in Sigapore

title: Mother jumps into river with 2 children
content: A mother jumped into a river with her two children aged three and seven in Valachchenai this morning following a domestic dispute, police said

title: Fire at warehouse at Colombo port
content: A fire broke out at a warehouse at the JCT terminal of the Colombo port in the early hours today causing heavy damage to the warehouse, sources said.

title: Jaya renews demand for retrieval of Kachatheevu
content: Voicing concern over attacks on Indian fishermen, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa today asked the Centre to take urgent steps for the retrieval of Katchatheevu islet, ceded to Sri Lanka in 1974, besides redrawing the International Maritime Boundary Line

title: Video: Two killed, three injured in bus accident
content: Two persons were killed and three injured when a private bus veered into a bus halt near Thalangama Hospital due to a technical defect Pictures

title: No HR groups to speak against A’pura massacre-MR
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday said that twenty eight years ago 146 innocent civilians were massacred by terrorists in the vicinity of Sri Maha Bodhi and there was no human rights organization then to speak against such killings

title: TUs try to grab the people’s wealth-Amunugama
content: There is an acute struggle by trade unionists and some others to grab most of the wealth amounting to billions of rupees earned through the hard labour of the ordinary people of the country.

title: University scholarship scheme to be extended
content: Amid protests against the admission of foreign students to local universities, Cabinet yesterday approved a memorandum submitted by the Ministry of Higher Education to expand the scholarship scheme to such students from ten more countries, Daily Mirror learns

title: I still have a bit of cricket left in me: Mahela
content: Sri Lanka cricket Captain Mahela Jayawardane said that he had a ‘bit of cricket’ left in him. “I feel that I have a bit of cricket left in me, but that said, it’s always good to look back and introspect,” Jayawardane told Wisden India, when he was asked if it was the right time to look back at his career

title: Duminda Silva hospitalised
content: MP Duminda Silva was admitted to the Nawaloka Hospital last night due to a medical condition, family sources said.

title: SL asylum seeker dies on Christmas Island
content: A 35-year-old asylum seeker has died hours after being transferred to Christmas Island by Australian authorities.

title: SL intensifying its crackdown on critics-AI
content: The Sri Lankan government is intensifying its crackdown on critics through threats, harassment, imprisonment and violent attacks, Amnesty International said in a report released today

title: Australia rejects calls to boycott Sri Lanka meet
content: Australia has vowed not to boycott the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in Sri Lanka over allegations of human rights violations, despite mounting calls not to attend

title: Video: Bangladesh building collapse kills at least 70
content: An eight-story building in Bangladesh that housed several garment factories collapsed on Wednesday morning, killing at least 70 people, injuring hundreds of others, and leaving an unknown number of people trapped in the rubble, according to Bangladeshi officials and media outlets ???

title: Five killed in US apartment shooting
content: Five people, including a woman, were killed in a shootout, apparently sparked by a dispute, at a Washington state apartment complex, police said on Monday.

title: Van ablaze on expressway
content: A van heading to Akuressa caught fire at the 54.1 milepost on the Southern Expressway this morning, police said. Five people including the driver managed to escape the van

title: 10 gambling women arrested
content: Thirty suspects including 10 women were arrested yesterday during a raid on three gambling dens in Walgama and Gungamuwa in Bandaragama, police said

title: Value the traditions-President
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his Sinhala-Hindu new year message said that ‘the true happiness of new year is safeguarded by a verdant and free and independent country.’

title: Audio:SL asylum seekers likely to be deported to SL-Australia
content: The Australian government today warned that the group of Sri Lankan asylum seekers, who reached Australian soil two days ago, is likely to be deported to Sri Lanka

title: Power failure in Colombo and suburbs
content: Residents in several areas in Colombo and it's suburbs were hit by a sudden power failure this morning and  several attempts  made to contact Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Chairman W. B. Ganegala  and other CEB officials proved futile

title: Bus driver and conductor sentenced to death
content: The Kurunegala High Court today sentenced to death a bus driver and a conductor,who were found guilty of the charge of having caused the death of 41 passengers in a bus-train tragedy in 2005 at Yaangalmodara

title: No proof of Bala’s murder: Indian MP
content: Cuddalore MP K S Azhagiri raised doubts over Prabhakaran’s son Balachandran’s death and claimed that there was no video evidence on the killing by the Sri Lankan armed forces

title: 12 hour water cut in Colombo
content: Water supply to several areas would be interrupted from 8.00 pm today to 8.00 am tomorrow due to the laying of new pipe lines, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board announced

title: Queen’s visit:cannot confirm or deny-Buckingham Palace
content: The Press office of Buckingham Palace said they could not ‘confirm or deny’ if Her Majesty the Queen would be attending the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting to be held in November in Sri Lanka.

title: Audio: Prohibit visiting India: Ven Omalpe Thera
content: “Taking serious note of the harassment caused to Sri Lankans by Indian extremists continuously, it is time that a decision is taken to ban travel between Colombo and Chennai at least for one year”, Ven. Omalpe Sobhitha Thera said ???

title: Lanka should solve Tamil issue in India's interest: NSA
content: Amid continued agitation hereover Sri Lankan Tamil issue, national security adviser Shivshankar Menon on Friday said it is in India's interest that Sri Lanka solves its ethnic issues and make the minority community confident of its fate there

title: House of Karunanidhi's son raided
content: The heat, it seems, has been turned on the DMK just a day after its President M Karunanidhi announced his decision to pull out of the UPA government over the Sri Lankan Tamil issue.

title: Video: DMK withdraws from Indian Govt. over SL issue
content: The DMK party led by M. Karunanidhi pulled out of the Congress-led UPA coalition on Tuesday in protest against the government's position on a US-backed United Nations resolution on war crimes allgedly carried out during the Sri Lanka's civil war. ???

title: SL bars Briton with Buddha tattoo
content: Sri Lanka denied entry to a British tourist sporting a Buddha tattoo on his arm because he showed disrespect to Buddhism, a newspaper report said Saturday.

title: Govt. to formulate new Halal mechanism
content: The Cabinet Sub-Committee yesterday decided to recommend to the government a legal mechanism worked out to deal with the Halal certification of food items, a Minister said yesterday

title: MR in Japan
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa arrived in Japan this morning on a four-day official visit, the Office of the Presidential Spokesman and International Media Adviser said today

title: SLC censures Lasith Malinga
content: Lasith Malinga has been warned by Sri Lanka Cricket to maintain better relations with the media following his spat with journalists.

title: Chavez,a strong advocate for the developing world-MR
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa today described late President of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela Hugo Chavez Frias as a ‘strong advocate for the developing world’

title: Former Maldives President arrested
content: Former Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed has been arrested from his residence in Male'. The arrest comes after a lower court issued a third arrest warrant against him

title: Sanath to meet cricketers
content: Chief selector Sanath Jayasuriya is to meet national cricketers at 6.30 pm today in a last minute attempt to resolve contract issues before selecting final Test squad, informed sources said.

title: Even ministers getting death threats-UNP
content: The dangers facing the people of this country were made even more evident by the death threats received by Minister Maithripala Sirisena, UNP MP Akila Viraj Kariyawasam told a news conference today

title: Canada firm on C’wealth boycott threat
content: Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper has held firm on his threat to boycott the Commonwealth summit in Colombo later this year, rejecting calls to make nice with Sri Lanka.

title: Illegal hiring of SL maids continues
content: Brokers and labor offices in Saudi Arabia are continuing to promote recruitment services of housekeepers from Indonesia and Sri Lanka despite an announcement by the Ministry of Labor that negotiations for recruitment are still ongoing.

title: Gota rubbishes Channel 4 photos
content: Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa yesterday rejecting the photographs displayed by Channel 4 television station of UK which is alleged to be of Prabhakaran’s youngest son Balachandran,

title: UN rights council should launch inquiry-HRW
content: At its March 2013 session, the United Nations Human Rights Council should authorize an independent, international investigation into war crimes committed during the final months of Sri Lanka’s armed conflict, Human Rights Watch said in a letter to council members today.

title: Over 40 injured in wasp attack
content: At least 38 students from a Sunday school and seven monks were hospitalized after they were attacked by wasps this morning in Wennoruwa, Katugastota, hospital sources said.

title: Gamini Senarath as People’s Bank Chairman
content: Gamini Senarath, who is the Chief of Staff at the presidential office, was appointed as the new Chairman of People’s Bank by President Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Finance Ministry said today

title: C’ wealth denies confirmation of location
content: Spokesperson for the Commonwealth Secretariat, yesterday denied that Secretary-General of the Commonwealth Kamalesh Sharma “ made any statement with regard to Sri Lanka as the host venue of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in November 2013”.

title: ‘Choon pan’ tourists are of no use: JVP
content: JVP leader Somawansa Amarasinghe said at a meeting in Akuressa that though the government boasted of 2.5 million tourist arrivals in Sri Lanka by 2015 most of the tourists who come to the country now are hard up and depend on vendor - bakery vehicles (Choon Pan) for their meals.

title: Hazardous smoke-emitting vehicles to be banned
content: The Motor Traffic Department (DMT) has taken steps to ban vehicles with high smoke emissions in an attempt to reduce air-pollution in the City of Colombo

title: Three prisoners want death sentence carried out
content: Three prison inmates who were sentenced to death have begun a protest on top of the roof in Bogambara prison, prison department said

title: Australia has new Sri Lanka boat plan
content: The Australian Opposition immigration spokesman Scott Morrison said he would toughen the Coalition's policies after this week visiting Sri Lanka with Deputy Opposition Leader Julie Bishop.

title: Govt. urged to reveal observations of indep. panel
content: It is learnt that the committee appointed to look into the charges against ousted Chief Justice Dr. Shirani Bandaranayake comprised Professor Mark Cooray, former Central Bank Deputy Governor Ranee Jayamaha, former Parliament Secretary General Dhammika Kithulegoda and Consortium of Humanitarian Agencies Chairman Jeevan Thiagarajah.

title: Reptiles in a bus traumatize passengers
content: In a bizarre incident reminiscent of the popular Hollywood movie ‘Snakes on a Plane,’ at least 20 passengers inside a CTB bus were traumatized when nine venomous snakes, a python and a monkey ran amok inside a bus bound to Galagedara on Sunday night

title: MR to visit Bodhi Gaya
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa would visit Bodhi Gaya in India on February, Sri Lanka High Commissioner to India Prasad Kariyawasam, an Indian news agency PTI reported.

title: Bilingual national anthem proposal sent to President
content: The National Languages and Social Integration Minister have proposed to President Mahinda Rajapaksa and the presidential secretariat to rewrite the ‘National Anthem’ with Sinhala and Tamil verses to be sung particularly at national events

title: Pillay’s statement full of innuendos-SL
content: The government today expressed its ‘regret and concern’ over a statement made by United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Navinethem Pillay regarding the impeachment of former Chief Justice ShiraniBandaranayake and the subsequent appointment of Mohan Peiris to the post.

title: Massive e-commerce racket busted
content: Fourteen suspects who were allegedly involved in a massive financial fraud by withdrawing money from foreign credit card holders through an e-commerce application service provided by a State bank in Sri Lanka had been arrested and detained under the custody of Criminal Investigations Department (CID)

title: Golu Hadawatha ‘Sugath’ is no more
content: Veteran Wickrama Bogoda who shot to fame with his role as Sugath in Dr. Lester James Peries’ ‘Golu Hadawatha’, passed away early today at the age of 72

title: Sri Lanka beat Australia by 8 wickets
content: Sri Lanka thrashed Australia by eight wickets to win the second one-day international with nearly 10 overs to spare at Adelaide Oval on Sunday and level the five-match series.

title: Video : Bloodiest day in years for Pakistan as blasts kill 115
content: A string of bombings in Pakistan including a twin suicide attack on a snooker hall used by Shiite Muslims has left 115 people dead, in one of the nation's deadliest days in years

title: Lawyers to boycott courts
content: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka severely condemned the Parliament’s move to take up two-day debate on the impeachment against the Chief Justice Dr. Shirani A. Bandaranayake and decided to boycott courts on January 10 and 11.

title: Kelaniya PS chairman complains of death threats
content: Kelaniya Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Prasanna Ranaweera said today that there had been repeated death threats made to him and 12 other members of his council for more than a year, at the instigation of a local politician.

title: 22 SL Government sites hacked
content: A number of 22 subdomains of the North Central Provincial Council (nc.gov.lk) owned by the Sri Lanka government have been defaced by Bangladeshi Grey Hat Hackers (BGHH)

title: New Year rot found
content: Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) recovered 20,000 Kg’s of rotten potatoes in Dambulla while 15,000 Kg’s of rotten potatoes were also recovered from a shop in Pettah during a raid caried out by the CAA.

title: Jaffna students deny “supporting the cause”
content: A special meeting will be held between Faculty Deans and Jaffna University Lecturers, sequent to a meeting with the four students detained at the Welikanda rehabilitation camp before deciding on the future course of action.

title: NCPA - OIC transferred
content: The Officer in Charge of the National Child Protection Authority Chief Inspector Buddhika Balachandra has been transferred with immediate effect to the Police Training College, sources said

title: A9 road closed
content: The A-9 (Kandy-Jaffna) main road has been closed at Nochchimoddai in Vavuniya as the road went under water due to heavy rains experienced in the area, our reporter said.

title: Video: GK depositor also climbs a tree to protest
content: A Golden Key Company depositor had staged a protest by climbing a tree outside the Supreme Court Complex to urge the authorities to take legal action against the Golden Key Company, our reporter said ???

title: Two cops allegedly gatecrash night races
content: Two Ministerial Security Division (MSD) officers were released on bail when they were produced in Court on charges of having attempted to gatecrash the Colombo Night Races while they were under the influence of liquor. They are also alleged to have obstructed the police officers on duty

title: Petrol price up
content: The state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has increased the price of a liter of Octane 90 Petrol by Rs. 10 effective from midnight yesterday (14).The new price is Rs. 159.

title: India sitar legend Ravi Shankar dies
content: Indian sitar maestro Ravi Shankar has died in a hospital in the US, aged 92.

title: Video: Proceedings ended in an unexpected hurry-Herath
content: DNA MP Vijitha Herath, who was a member of the Parliamentary Select Committee that probed into the impeachment motion against CJ Shirani Bandaranayake, claimed today that the PSC proceedings were ended in an unexpected hurry following a ‘sudden’ order from the ‘top’. ???

title: 33 skulls unearthed in Matale
content: Thirty three skulls and skeletal remains have been found at the Matale hospital premises so far, police said

title: Over 20 Chinese nationals detained
content: All Chinese nationals detained in Sri Lanka have been freed following the release of two Chinese women on Tuesday, said sources close to the case.

title: Arrested for transporting endemic plants
content: Eight persons including an Indonesian national were arrested by the Norton Bridge police for transporting a special variety of plants (Gyrinops Walla), endemic to Sri Lanka. PICTURES

title: Act like Anura-Ranil tells Chamal
content: Opposition leader Ranil Wickremesinghe today said Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa should act according to the ruling given by late Speaker Anura Bandaranaike in responding to the judicial process against the parliamentary select committee that probes allegations against Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake.

title: Chinese national with ammunition arrested
content: A lone Chinese national was taken into custody yesterday along with his fishing trawler in the sea off the Colombo harbour for possession of live and used M-16 ammunition, the police said

title: More families affected
content: The number of families affected due to the heavy rains has increased upto 271 in Monaragala and Hambanthota areas.

title: Govt. distances itself from satellite launch
content: The Government yesterday distanced itself from the first communications satellite to be launched today, despite it being endorsed by Scientific Affairs Senior Minister Tissa Vitarana and backed by President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s youngest son Rohitha

title: SL beat NZ by 10 wickets
content: Sri Lanka beat New Zealand by 10 wickets on the third day of the opening Test in Galle on Monday to gain a 1-0 lead in the two-match series

title: 2 died in three-wheeler accident
content: A 75 year-old mother and her son aged 52 died after their three-wheeler plunged into a precipice of 300 feet in Bandarawela yesterday. Police said

title: Teachers sound alarm bells
