content: The academic activities of all schools are likely to be crippled on December 4 as disappointed principals and teachers announce their plans to launch a countrywide token strike to protest the Education Minister’s lax attitude towards their demands

title: UNP-JVP working together: Ranil
content: The UNP was gradually building rapport with the JVP and would work together whenever a need arises, UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: MR invites Ranil and TNA
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa concluding the Budget 2013 speech, extended an invitation to UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, Tamil National Alliance and other opposition parties to join hands with him.

title: VIP Security Division head passes away
content: Director of the VIP Security Division, SSP Nanayakkara (STF) passed away this morning following a heart attack, Police sources said.He was the former director of Police Narcotic Bureau.

title: Body of TNA MP’s brother-in-law found
content: The body of the brother–in-law of TNA MP, Selvan Adekkalanathan has been found in the Nanu-Oya area.

title: Heavy rain continues
content: Under the influence of the cyclonic storm ‘Nilam’, South-western parts of the island ( Western, Central, Sabaragamuwa and Southern provinces) are receiving  heavy rainfalls  and it is likely to continue for next 09 hours, the Met Department said

title: Private bus strike on Colombo-Aluthgama, Moratuwa
content: Private buses operating on the Colombo-Moratuwa, Colombo-Panadura, Colombo –Aluthgama and 20 other routes have launched a strike over several issues, Private Bus Owners’ Association President Gemunu Wijeratne said

title: Museum robbery main suspect arrested
content: The main suspect in the theft of artefacts from National Museum in Colombo was arrested by a special CID team on Saturday, police said.

title: Accident involving US envoy’s vehicle convoy
content: An accident involving a motorcycle and one of the backup vehicles of the US Ambassador’s convoy was reported from Karadiyanaru, Batticaloa this evening. The Ambassador was unharmed, police said.

title: Bollywood filmmaker Yash Chopra dies
content: Veteran bollywood filmmaker Yash Chopra died at Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital on Sunday, a hospital spokesperson said. He was 80. Chopra was admitted to Lilavati hospital in suburban Bandra on October 13 after being diagnosed with dengue.

title: Road closed due to NBF rally
content: Roads leading to Hyde Park including road from Union Place to Lipton circus to Colvin R. de Silva Mawatha have been closed due to a rally organised by the National Bikkhu Front (NBF).

title: UNP accuses SF
content: Main opposition United National Party (UNP) today accused former Army Commander Sarath Fonskea and the organisers of the joint opposition rally on October 18 of attempting to divide the opposition.

title: UNICEF commends Sri Lanka
content: UNICEF Regional Director for South Asia, Ms. Karin Hulshof commended Sri Lankan government’s programs and efforts to uplift the welfare of rural communities, during her meeting with President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday.

title: Trafficking racket: Sri Lankan held
content: A trafficking racket was busted with the arrest of a 42-year-old Sri Lankan national on Tuesday. The man had allegedly duped several youth on the pretext on getting them jobs in Malaysia.

title: JSC Secretary discharged
content: Judicial Services Commission Secretary Manjula Tillekaratne, who was at the National Hospital following an assault on him, has been discharged a short while ago, hospital sources said.

title: Indian Academics express support to striking teachers
content: As the three-month-old agitation by teachers, which has crippled universities in Sri Lanka, including Jaffna, shows no sign of ending in an amicable manner; prominent academics from India have joined a large group of intellectuals from different parts of the globe, to express solidarity with the protesting teachers.

title: Court allows ‘Girl with snake’ FR case
content: Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed in the Fundamental Right case filed by the girl with a snake arrested in Cleopatra Club. Leave to proceed was granted in respect of Articles 12, 13 & 14.

title: Video: Ruwanwelle Sobitha sentenced
content: Former monk Ruwanwelle Sobitha alias S. Shantha has been sentenced to 20 years imprisonment, after he was found guilty of having raped a 28-year-old woman in Kegalle

title: Ban on LTTE should be lifted: Vaiko
content: Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK) chief, V. Gopalsamy, popularly known as 'Vaiko', has argued before the tribunal court in Chennai that the ban imposed by the Central Government on Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) should be lifted.

title: Four-year-old dies under tragic circumstances
content: A four-year-old child was killed when he was accidently knocked down by the bus driven by his father at Thabbowa in Puttlam

title: No more displaced people in SL from today
content: With the resettlement of the last group of Internally Displaced People (IDPs) in the Northern region’s Mullaitivu district the Menik Farm in Vavuniya would be closed today, a top military official said yesterday.

title: Suspect injured in police fire
content: A person was injured by police fire when he allegedly attempted to grab the weapon of a police sergeant in Koggalla , Ambalanthota area last evening, police said.

title: UNP: Did army major recant under pressure ?
content: The main opposition United National Party (UNP) yesterday raised concerns whether the army major, allegedly assaulted by Minister Mervyn Silva’s son Malaka, was under pressure from certain quarters to recant his earlier complaint through an affidavit.

title: More contenders seeking CM’s post in East
content: The battle for the chief ministerial post of the Eastern Provincial Council has become intense with two Muslim parties aligned with the ruling coalition at the last election and the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) which contested alone, asking for the post, party officials said.

title: Blake expresses interest in Northern economy
content: The United States Assistant Secretary of State Robert O. Blake who is on a three-day visit to Sri Lanka met External Affairs Minister G.L. Peiris on Thursday and expressed interest in the economy of the North.

title: A 16-year old boy stabbed to death
content: A 16-year old school boy was allegedly stabbed to death over a personal dispute in Puttalam area last night. The victim was an O/L student in a leading school in Puttalam.

title: 'Low voter turnout, no major incidents'
content: Polling in all three provinces is taking place smoothly without any interruptions or any major incidents, Deputy Election Commissioner R.M.A.L Ratnayake said.

title: “Wele Suda’s” Rs.185 million assets frozen
content: Colombo High Court freezed assets valued at Rs.185 mil. belonging to alleged drug kingpin Samantha Kumara alias “Wele Suda” and his family.

title: Van without number plate taken into custody
content: A van without a number plate was seized by Trincomalee Police last night when it was transporting election propaganda posters of a son of a prominent UPFA politician in the area contesting for the forthcoming Provincial Council election, police sources said.

title: Singapore are Asian Netball Champions
content: Singapore won the Asian Netball Championship defeating Sri Lanka 48-47 in the final played at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium a short while ago

title: SEC spotlight on two dozen companies
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has initiated investigations into suspicious activities and share transactions of nearly two dozen companies listed in the stock exchange, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Youth saved from drowning but dies later
content: Five youth who got into difficulty while bathing in the Kaluganga off the Kalido Beach were saved by residents of the area. But one of them identified as Vithanage Asain Shalitha died on admission to hospital.

title: Wimal to be airlifted
content: Minister Wimal Weerawansa who suffered a heart attack and was admitted to the Kurunegala Teaching hospital was to be airlifted to the Colombo National Hospital in a short while, hospital sources said.

title: 83 asylum seekers arrested in Trinco
content: At least 83 people bound to Australia were arrested by the Navy together with two multi-day trawlers today in the Trincomalee seas

title: Police willing to provide security for docs
content: The Police have agreed to provide doctors with adequate security upon consideration of any threats they might face in future.This was agreed at a discussion held today at the Police Headquarters with representatives of the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA).

title: Audio: I have something to tell the Govt-Mervyn
content: Public Relations and Public Affairs Minister Mervyn Silva today said it was the duty of the government to resolve the university academics’ issues considering them as a special category.

title: SLPL:Nagenahira Nagas wins
content: Nagenahira Nagas beat Ruhuna Royals by 5 runs on Duckworth/Lewis method in the first match of the Sri Lanka Premier League tournament at the R. Premadasa Stadium this evening.

title: Police media spokesman promoted
content: Twenty-two Superintendents of Police (SP) including the Police Media spokesman SP Ajith Rohana have been promoted to the rank of Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) with effect from last month, the Police said.

title: Detention of Lankans: Families to appeal
content: Family members of six Sri Lankan sailors who are still being held hostage aboard the MV Albedo will launch a nationwide appeal today in a bid to raise enough money to free their men

title: 6 children injured in school van crash
content: Six school children were injured when a school van collided with a private bus near Horragolla this morning, the police said. The drivers were also injured in the accident.

title: Courts in North at a standstill
content: All lawyers in the North have decided to refrain from court duties today and tomorrow urging the authorities to arrest the suspects who pelted stones at the Mannar District courts.

title: Solheim reveals assassination attempt
content: Former Norwegian peace envoy Erik Solheim has revealed that there were specific plans to assassinate him when he visited Sri Lanka in 2000

title: Duminda cannot recall shooting incident: CID
content: CID informed Colombo magistrate Court that MP Duminda Silva told from Singapore that he cannot remember the Kolonnawa shooting incident where presidential Advisor Baratha Lakshman Premachandran was killed

title: 200 Kg's of TNT found
content: The Army discovered over 200 Kilo grams of TNT explosives in Puthukuduirippu this morning during demining, Military Spokesman Brigadier Ruwan Wanigasuriya said

title: Video: UNP is united -Sajith
content: UNP deputy leader Sajith Premadasa said today that he and the party leader Ranil Wickremesinghe were of the same mindset and was working towards achieving victory at the forthcoming elections.

title: Sinhala film release in Jaffna after 30 years
content: For the first time after 30 years, a Tamil sub-titled version of a new Sinhala film will be released at Raja Cinema, Jaffna on Friday July 20. Chandraratne Mapitigama’s latest Sinhala movie ‘Sihinaya Dige Enna’ will be screened in the Jaffna cinema bringing new hope for peace through the arts.

title: New secretaries for 18 ministries
content: The Government Information Department said that 18 new secretaries have beenappointed to ministries by President Mahinda Rajapaksa. Charitha Herath was appointed as the Secretary to the Ministry of Media UPDATE

title: Human smuggling continues: 82 more arrested
content: As illicit migration or human smuggling continued, 82 people including two women and two children, believed to be on their way to Australia, were arrested today by the Navy some 35 nautical miles south east of Trincomalee PICTURES

title: Lankan mission slams report on jailed maid
content: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Saudi Arabia has rejected reports in Colombo claiming a Sri Lankan domestic worker has been arrested in Saudi Arabia for worshipping a statue of the Buddha.

title: Video: Media laws to be amended
content: The government said today that laws with regard to the media would be amended making the registration of news websites compulsory by law.

title: Manager of mobile prostitution ring nabbed
content: A Colombo Court yesterday remanded a woman who had allegedly bitten the hand of a decoy when the police tried to arrest her for allegedly operating a mobile prostitution ring

title: US to continue with GSP concession
content: While announcing that Sri Lanka will continue to enjoy the US Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) concession, the United States said that the government of Sri Lanka has taken significant steps to improve the worker rights environment in the country.

title: Video: UNP claims 'economy militarised'
content: The UNP claimed today that the countries economy has been ‘militarized’. Speaking at a news conference UNP MP Dr. Harsha De Silva said that the “economic management of the country has been completely militarized”.

title: Lankan refugee exodus, fears of crisis in Tamil Nadu
content: As many as 150 Sri Lankan refugees are believed to have disappeared from camps across the Indian state of Tamil Nadu in the past fortnight, raising fears of another impending asylum-seeker tragedy in the monsoonal waters of the Indian Ocean, The Australian reported

title: Judge makes shocking disclosure
content: Tangalle High Court Judge Chandrasena Rajapaksa in a disclosure in court said he had come to know that Geeganagamage Amarasiri alias Julampitiye Amare who had more than a 100 arrest warrants against him had visited an inmate at the Tangalle prison last week.

title: Deputy Minister hospitalized
content: Deputy Minister of Buddhashasana and religious affairs M.K.D.S Gunawardena was reportedly admitted to a Hospital in Colombo a short while ago after he suffered a heart attack, informed sources said

title: Pakistan HC attack suspects indicted
content: Three men were indicted before the Colombo High Court for attempting on the life of Pakistan High Commissioner   and committing the death of seven others at Colpetty on 2006

title: No invitation to join UNP: DNA
content: There is no invitation from the United National Party (UNP) to the Democratic National Alliance (DNA) to join together, DNA president Jayantha Ketagoda told Daily Mirror Online yesterday

title: SF should join MR - Muthuhettigama
content: UPFA Parliamentarian Nishantha Muthuhettigama has requested former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka to join hands with President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Eighty one year old hacked to death
content: An  eighty one year old man was hacked to death early this morning in Polonnaruwa. Two others who had been in the vicinity of the incident had also been attacked and sustained injuries

title: 36 deported asylum seekers arrive
content: A group of 36 Sri Lankan asylum seekers deported from the UK arrived in Sri Lanka this morning on a chartered flight.

title: Video: Seven remanded, 112 released
content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Rashmi Singapuli, today ordered that seven suspects be remanded and granted personal bail to 112 suspects who were arrested while attempting to migrate to Australia illegally.

title: Video: I won’t take revenge- SF
content: Former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka who was released this week said that he would not take revenge against those who had put him through an atrocious ordeal over  the past two and a half years.

title: Heroin found in Kirulapone
content: A team of soldiers who were on a foot patrol mission  along Balapokuna road, in Kirulapone this morning, found 320 packs of heroin each containing 30 miligrams.

title: SLMC urges govt. to strengthen good governance
content: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) has urged the government to take steps, among others, to strengthen good governance, to restore civil administration and to maintain law and order, party’s General Secretary Hasan Ali said yesterday.

title: MR promised to free SF-Anoma
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has promised to free jailed former army chief SarathFonseka unconditionally and at the earliest opportunity, the ex-general's wife said on Thursday, AFP reported.

title: Fonseka to be freed?
content: The pressure mounted by international and national forces might see jailed former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka out of prison in the coming days, DNA MP Jayantha Ketagoda said today.

title: Jaffna GA Sukumar transferred
content: Imelda Sukumar , Government Agent for Jaffna has been transferred with immediate effect to the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo. She is the most senior civil servant and she is now in the Special Grade of the Sri Lanka Civil Service.

title: Mixed reactions over hoisting national flag
content: The hoisting of the national flag at the UNP/TNA May Day rally in Jaffna has created uproar with some Tamil politicians being critical of the move  while some others hailing it as a gesture of goodwill

title: UN vehicle kills one, injures two
content: A UN vehicle was damaged by angry residents after it killed one woman and injured two when they were crossing the road in Vandaramullei, Batticaloa this evening. The vehicle is said to have been a part of a convoy of an EU delegation which was headed towards Batticaloa from Valachchenai.

title: Private bus accident kills one
content: One person was killed and eight others were injured when a private bus plying on the Aluthgama-Colombo road ran over a motorbike and crashed into a wall in Moragolla a short while ago.

title: TNA forced to seek int’l help: Sampanthan
content: Tamil National Alliance (TNA) has been forced to seek international assistance to find a political solution to the national issue as all its efforts to come to a deal with the respective governments have failed, its leader R. Sampanthan said yesterday

title: Video: Britisher further remanded
content: A Britisher, who visited the Colombo Central Mail Exchange to collect three parcels addressed to film actress Angela Seneviratne and alleged to have contained hashish was produced before court and remanded till May 8, by the Colombo Fort Magistrate today.

title: Angela denies allegations
content: Actress Angela Seneviratne yesterday denied the allegations saying that even she was unaware of such a thing, and therefore, disappointed about adverse media publicity given without verifying details. She said that she only knew it through some journalists.

title: Uni student snatches gold chain
content: A female second year university student, who was trying to flee after snatching a woman’s gold chain was caught by a group of three-wheeler drivers in Gampola and handed over to the police

title: Thunder showers to continue
content: The Department of Meteorology said today that the country is currently experiencing inter tropical convergence on the south of the Island which resulted in heavy thunder showers during the past two days

title: Tsunami warning in South and East
content: Tsunami warning issued for Sri Lanka’s coastal areas and the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) advices people in coastal areas to evacuate to safe areas, the Government Information Department said. UPDATED

title: Fuel bowser owners to strike
content: The Ceylon Petroleum Private Bowser Owners Association today threatened to suspend transportation of fuel on April 9th &10th if their demand to increase fee rates are not met by the CPC.

title: Swedish FM to visit SL
content: While indicating the Swedish government interest in establishing a bilateral relationship with Sri Lanka, Swedish Foreign Minister Carl Bildt said that he will visit Sri Lanka in the near future.

title: Businessman's son abducted
content: A gang which abducted the 22-year-old son of a millionaire in Vakarai is demanding Rs. 30 million to free him, police said.

title: ‘Lankans join hands with Maoists’
content: The Karnataka government in India has come to know that Sri Lankan nationals have joined hands with a small group of Maoists operating in forests of Western Ghats, state Home Minister R Ashok said on Monday.

title: Navi Pillay warns Sri Lanka
content: The High Commissioner for Human Rights Navanethem Pillay today warned that there must be no reprisals against Sri Lankan human rights defenders in the aftermath of yesterday's adoption by the Human Rights Council of a resolution on Sri Lanka.

title: BE PREPARED TO FACE MEDICAL EMERGENCIES
content: March 20, 2012 Colombo: Taking a bold step forward in safeguarding the wellbeing of the nation, AVIVA NDB launched a carefully crafted health insurance plan recently.  AVIVA NDB HealthInsurance promises to be as outstanding as its forerunner AVIVA NDB Pensions which created a paradigm change in the market place last year.

title: IGP asked to submit list of corrupt SLFPers
content: Minister Maithreepala Sirisena today informed the Police Chief to submit a list of all SLFP organizers, members of Provincial and Local councils who have police complaints of corruption against them. Spokesman for the Minister said that as the General Secretary of the SLFP the Minister also requested the district

title: Lankans charged with killing
content: Two Sri Lankan men charged with the murder of an Oxford farmer have been further remanded in custody to June 5 for a scientific report to be completed

title: Coordinating secy. removed - Minister
content: Public Administration and Home Affairs Minister W.D.J. Seneviratne said his Coordinating Secretary Lokugam Hewage Dharmasiri has been removed from his post and all powers delegated to him were withdrawn

title: Lankans in emphatic win
content: The Sri Lankan cricket team leveled the three match finals by beating Australia emphatically in the second one day played in Adelaide a short while ago. The Lankans chased down a target of 271 with six overs and eight wickets to spare.

title: Majority praise SL progress -Samarasinghe
content: Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe, who returned to the country today after attending the UN Human Rights Council Sessions in Geneva said the majority of participants at the session had praised the progress made by Sri Lanka since the end of the war AUDIO

title: Govt. should listen to friendly countries - UNP
content: Government should listen to the countries that had pledged their support to Sri Lanka in Geneva and implement the recommendations made by the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission (LLRC) as these nations have stressed that these recommendations should be implemented soon

title: More questions about Duminda Silva’s case
content: In the Bharatha Lakshman murder case, Counsel Ajith Pathirana appearing for the aggrieved stated that two months had passed since the order was given to arrest Duminda Silva but still no action had been taken to arrest him

title: Nigerian national arrested
content: A Nigerian national was arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) for cheating money from businessman by giving them calls and sending SMS’s by using his foreign connections.

title: News editors ordered to present video footage
content: The Colombo Fort magistrate a short while ago ordered the news Directors of the Sirasa Media Network, Swarnawahini, Derana and ITN to present video footage to the CCD regarding the protest organised by the UNP and several other parties on February 17, 2012

title: Marie Colvin killed in Syria
content: Veteran war correspondent Marie Colvin of the Sunday Times was killed in Syria on Wednesday along with French photojournalist Remi Ochlik, the French government said

title: Railway ballast and earth went in to build LTTE bunkers
content: Contractors restoring the northern railway from Omanthai to Jaffna have found that ballast and earth in the railway line had been removed by the LTTE to build bunkers and other buildings when the area was under their control.

title: Woman sentenced to death
content: A woman who stood indicted with murder was found guilty and sentenced to death by Kegalle High Court Judge Menaka Wijesundera on February 14.

title: National Reconciliation Policy to be presented shortly
content: A draft towards a National Reconciliation Policy is currently being prepared and will be presented shortly for public discussion by Presidential Advisor on Reconciliation and MP Prof. Rajiva Wijesinha

title: CID team to probe Chilaw shooting
content: Inspector General of Police (IGP) N.K. Illangakone said that investigations are presently underway to investigate the series of incidents that took place in Chilaw

title: Kataragama suicide kit, suspect arrested
content: The police arrested a former LTTE cadre a short while ago, who is suspected to have brought the suicide kit which was found in a guest house in Kataragama

title: People must take to the streets: Dayasiri
content: UNP Kurunegala District Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara speaking to Daily Mirror online urged the people to take to the streets against the government’s decision to increase fuel prices. EXCLUSIVE  (AUDIO)

title: Old votes to be counted at new elections
content: Postal votes cast early last year by voters of Pudukudairuppu and Maritimepattu before the postponement of the polls, will be used at the March 24 mini local government elections to be held for the two Pradeshiya Sabhas, election officials said yesterday.

title: PBOA requests for diesel subsidies
content: Private Bus owners have requested the Finance Ministry for diesel subsidies of Rs.76 per litre to keep up with the imminent rise in the price of diesel

title: Crowds moving towards Prison
content: A section of the protesters who were gathered in front of the court complex in Hulftsdorp urging the government to free former Army Chief Sarath Fonseka are now marching towards the Welikada Prison where the former Army Commander is currently being held

title: SL to market Ayurveda drugs
content: Sri Lanka is to enter the global medicinal drugs market by producing Ayurvedic drugs to international standards, Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation (ADC) Chairman Somaweera Chandrasiri said.

title: Mahela fetches a million dollars
content: Current Sri Lankan cricket captain Mahela Jayawardena was bought for US$1.5 million at the IPL auction this morning. Jayawardena was bought by the Delhi based franchise the 'Delhi Daredevils'

title: First fatal accident on E01
content: A 26-year-old was killed when his car skidded off the road on the Southern Expressway (E01) reporting the first fatal accident on the expressway PICTURES

title: Complaints on NCPA hotline sees sharp increase
content: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) yesterday said that the number of complaints received by the NCPA hotline 1929, had increased sharply from 1,391 complaints in 2009 to 3,811 complaints in 2010

title: Derailment in Badulla
content: The “Podimenike”  express train from Colombo derailed at the Badulla railway station this evening when it was moving to the yard after de-training passengers. The train ground to a halt obstructing the level crossing on the Badulla–Mudunpita road.

title: India–SL bilateral trade surges by 70 per cent
content: Trade between India and Sri Lanka surged by more than 70 per cent in 2011 over the previous year, touching an all-time high of $5 billion, Indian High Commissioner Ashok K. Kantha has said

title: Will form wide alliance to take on Govt., Sajith says
content: Deputy Leader of the UNP Sajith Premadasa says, “We are not dissidents of the United National Party,” adding, “We will always be with and have been with the UNP.” Mr. Premadasa went on to state that they will form a wide alliance to take on the currenty government with people of all strata

title: Police probing into the mysterious death of a PC
content: The Kandy police have commenced a special probe into the mysterious death of Police Constable Anura who was found dead on Rajapihilla Road in Kandy on Saturday evening.

title: Two Indian youth compelled to take U-turn
content: Two youth of Indian nationality who were deported from Sri Lanka a year ago for overstaying their Visas were nabbed by Immigration and Emigration officials at the Katunayake Airport early morning when they tried to re-enter the country and were sent back to India in the same aircraft they arrived in.

title: 2 Sri Lankans held for credit card fraud
content: Two Sri Lankan nationals, who allegedly cloned credit cards using information pertaining to customers of banks abroad were arrested Chennai on Wednesday.

title: A/L results controversy continues
content: Bringing the controversial 2011 GCE Advanced Level results to further chaos the Examination Department has released the results of the Russian Language paper on Monday without district and island rankings.

title: TNA dismisses LLRC report and sets the agenda for talks
content: Barely two days before the commencement of a crucial round of talks between the Tamil National Alliance, an umbrella group representing Tamil political parties, and the Sri Lankan government, the outfit again called for outside scrutiny of the Eelam War IV.

title: Charity trust to support Mahesh Wickramasingha
content: A support fund has been set up to help the grieving widow and two young children of a Sri Lankan man who was murdered in the Huyton shop where he worked.

title: Five accidents reported on Sunday in E-01
content: Five accidents took place on the Southern Expressway on Sunday bringing the number of accidents reported so far in Sri Lanka’s first highway to 57.

title: Attack on fishermen is mere allegations: Centre
content: The Centre has dismissed claims of recent attacks on Indian fishermen by the Sri Lankan Navy as mere allegations sans any proof.

title: Five Lankans arrested with foreign currency
content: Five Sri Lankans who attempted to smuggle three pieces of gold and foreign cash worth over five million rupees to India were arrested today by the Katunayaka Airport customs

title: Threat to Pera student's lives discussed at meeting
content: The meeting which was held between the leaders of the Student Unions of the nine faculties, Deans and the Vice Chancellor had ended cordially sources say. The Unions had put forward their request to remove all conditions that harm the smooth functioning of the unions stating that their actions never put the student's lives at risk and did not bring the university into disrepute

title: Somawansa re-appointed as party leader
content: JVP leader Somawansa Amarasinghe was reappointed as the party leader and nine dissidents were expelled from party at a special convention today in Debarawewa.

title: Two Lankans remanded in connection with attempted murder
content: The Limassol District Court issued an eight day remand yesterday for two Sri Lankan suspects aged 25 and 38, in connection with the attempted murder of a 32-year-old compatriot on December 17 in Limassol.

title: Dissidents won't be JVP members from Jan.1
content: JVP dissidents will cease to be members of the party on January 1, 2012 with their decision not to participate in the party’s special convention scheduled for that day in Tissamaharama, Hambantota, the Daily Mirror learns

title: Water cut
content: Water cuts will be experienced in Peliyagoda, Kandana, Wattala, Kelaniya, Ja-Ela and Kadawata till 5pm today, due to urgent maintenance work, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board stated

title: New Examination Commissioner appointed
content: W.M.J. Pushkpakumara has been appointed as the Examinations Commissioner with effect from January 1, 2012. The cabinet made this decision due to the fact that the current commissioner Anura Edirisinghe is scheduled to retire on December 31, 2011

title: They didn’t recognise what I did for the party: Dayasiri
content: UNP Kurunegala District parliamentarian and contestant for the post of National Organiser, Dayasiri Jayasekara speaking to Daily Mirror online yesterday said that the vote did not reflect the true will of the people. He further went on to point out that despite the repeated assurance that the ballot would be secret in actual fact the vote was not a secret ballot

title: Flood situation again
content: Reservoirs in the Polonnaruwa District have reached spill level due to heavy rains experienced in these areas, Irrigation Department officials said

title: Not aware of closing down of Ministry
content: “I am not aware of the closing down of the ministry,” Minister of Resettlement Gunaratne Weerakoon tells parliament

title: Illegal stock of BTI suspended
content: Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena today suspended payments on a stock of BTI with immediate effect imported illegally and secretly to the country by a group of officials with the blessings of a prominent sports personality turned politician, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Five given the death sentence
content: Five in the same family, a mother, three sons and a daughter-in-law were given the death sentence by the Tangalle High Court over a murder in 1996 in Beliatta.

title: Economically backward persons choose to be in prison: DM
content: Prime Minister D.M. Jayaratne said today that some economically backward persons had chosen themselves to be prisoners because of good meals served to them inside prisons

title: Gold smuggling cases shoot up at Chennai airport
content: Chennai airport is seeing a steady build-up of gold smuggling cases this year compared to last year. ince April 2011, over 63 smuggling cases have been registered at Chennai airport against 45 cases last year.

title: Hand over KP to Interpol soon: Jayalath
content: UNP MP Jayalath Jayawardane said yesterday that he would ask the Inspector General of Police and the Attorney General to take steps to hand over LTTE chief arms procurer Kumaran Pathmanathan alias KP to Interpol as soon as possible.

title: Additional UK funding for re-integration
content: British Deputy High Commissioner, Robbie Bulloch, visited the North this week, where he announced additional UK funding of £150,000 for the reintegration of ex-combatants after their release from custody

title: Grero to vote for budget
content: UNP MP Mohan Lal Grero announced a short while ago that he would for the budget, in favour of the government.

title: JVP not allowed to visit A’pura prisoners: Udul
content: The attempts by JVP dissidents to visit LTTE inmates in the Anuradhapura prison were thwarted by the prison authorities yesterday, a dissident member said today.

title: One killed,12 injured in bus collision
content: One person was killed another 12 persons were injured when a private bus collided with a luxury bus while attempting to overtake it in the Mundalama area on the Puttalam-Chilaw main road a short while ago

title: SL Tourism welcomes 750,000th tourist arrival
content: Sri Lanka Tourism welcomed the arrival of 750,000th tourist in year 2011 at the Bandaranaike International Airport today. This is the first time ever; the tourism industry has received number of arrivals exceeding 700,000 mark in any given year making it a ground breaking figure in tourism records UPDATE

title: Cricket-ICC chief executive Lorgat to step down in June 2012
content: International Cricket Council (ICC) chief executive Haroon Lorgat will step down after a four-year tenure in June 2012, the governing body said on Tuesday.

title: Tamil refugees get Lankan birth certificate
content: In a confidence gaining initiative, Sri Lankan authorities on Saturday began issuing birth certificates to children of Tamil refugees who have been living in Ramanathapuram camps.

title: Kambli suspects 1996 World Cup semi final was fixed
content: Fifteen years after a crying Vinod Kambli walked off the Eden Gardens when the World Cup semifinal against Sri Lanka was stopped due to crowd violence with India on the verge of defeat, the batsman has hinted the game could’ve been fixed.

title: Embilipitiya paper mill leased out
content: Hot on the heels of the enactment of a new law to acquire underperforming and underused assets, the government today leased out the Embilipitiya Paper Corporation to an Australian company on a 30 year-period under the government’s plan to restructure some state enterprises, a Minister said today

title: Sri Lanka peace process evaluated
content: The first evaluation of Norway’s peace efforts in Sri Lanka has been presented. “We want to learn from the experience we have gained from the peace process in Sri Lanka,” said Minister of International Development Erik Solheim.

title: PM discusses fishermen issue with MR
content: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh is understood to have discussed the Tamils’ issue and frequent attacks on Indian fishermen by the Sri Lankan navy during his meeting with President Mahinda Rajapaksa here on Thursday

title: Re-build leftist movement: JVP Dissidents
content: JVP dissidents said today that they would commemorate the 22nd death anniversary of the party’s founder leader Rohana Wijeweera in the hope that Sri Lanka’s leftist movement should be rebuilt from zero

title: Two soldiers who carried out the killing of Dr. Jayasinghe arrested
content: The two soldiers who allegedly carried out the killing of Dr. Prasad Jayasinghe in front of his dispensary in Thalagashandiya, Karandeniya on September 29 were arrested by the Military Police (MP) and were subsequently handed over to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID).

title: Contempt application filed against top Central officials
content: A contempt of court application has been filed in the Madras High Court Bench here against top Union Government officials for having allegedly disobeyed interim orders passed by the court on October 14 to strengthen security on the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) between India and Sri Lanka in order to prevent attacks on Tamil fishermen allegedly by the Sri Lankan Navy

title: Committee says no engine, brake defects
content: The three-member committee appointed by the Transport Ministry to investigate the Alawwa train accident today said the collision had taken place as train signals and speed limits were not respected by the train driver and that there were no defects in the train engine or the brake system

title: Bus fare hike?
content: Private bus fares are likely to be increased due to the hike in fuel prices. Bus owners to meet on Wednesday to take a decision, the Private Bus Owners Association stated.

title: Samarasinghe questions UNHRC transparency
content: The Special Envoy of the President for Human Rights Mahinda Samarasinghe addressing the Third Committee meeting of the United Nations General Assembly in New York today expressed Sri Lanka’s concerns about the transparency of the UN Human Rights Council

title: Turkey earthquake: More aid pledged to worst-hit areas
content: The Turkish government has pledged more aid to thousands of people affected by Sunday's deadly earthquake in the east. Officials said 12,000 more tents would be delivered to the cities of Ercis and Van and also to nearby villages

title: Two men arrested for abducting two females
content: Police arrested two men who allegedly abducted two women in a double cab in the Thiriyaya area in Morawewa.

title: Establishing diplomatic ties with Mali
content: A proposal was made by Prof. G. L. Peiris to establish diplomatic relations with the Republic of Mali. Mali is a republic with a population of 14,159,904 and the country is located in the interior of Western Africa

title: Reformists shout
content: UNP reformists who fired their first shot against the party leadership after the recently concluded local government election today said the leadership cannot claim credit for the party’s success at the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: ASP released on surety bail
content: The Colombo High Court released an ASP of the Terrorist Investigation Division (TID) who was the main witness in a voir dire case in Rs. 100,000 surety bail for failing to appear in court for the prosecution.

title: Duminda’s bodyguard remanded
content: Parliamentarian Duminda Silva’s official bodyguard who was alleged to have shot former parliamentarian and presidential adviser Baratha Lakshman Premachandra on Election Day at Mulleriyawa was remanded till October 18, pending an identification parade.

title: Duminda under strict observation: Hospital
content: Parliamentarian Duminda Silva continues to be on a life support system at the Sri Jayawardenepura Hospital following a surgery on Saturday evening to remove two bullets from his head

title: ICC warns SLC
content: Sri Lanka's cricket board (SLC) has been officially warned for the "poor" quality of the pitch at Galle, which hosted the first test in their recent series against Australia, the International Cricket Council (ICC) said on Friday

title: Vaiko accuses Colombo of colonising Tamil minorities
content: Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK) Chief V. Gopalswamy, also known as Vaiko has slammed the Sri Lankan government for oppressing and colonising its Tamil minority community.

title: Increased alcohol consumption could affect development: Chandrakanthan
content: Eastern Province Chief Minister Sivanesathuri Chandrakanthan said the increased alcohol consumption in some parts in the East including in the Batticaloa District, could affect the development of the area dispute good results achieved this year.

title: Stephen Harper presses SL on human rights
content: Stephen Harper’s government, which alienated many Tamil-Canadians in the last days of Sri Lanka’s civil war in 2009, is aggressively campaigning to pressure Sri Lanka on human rights and political reconciliation.

title: Powerful Typhoon Nesat hits Philippines
content: A powerful typhoon has struck the Philippines, triggering floods, cutting power and halting work in the capital Manila.

title: Parliament sessions halted today
content: Parliament sessions came to an abrupt end today as there was no one present to second an adjournment motion moved by TNA MP A. Vinayagamoorthy.

title: Main suspect in Rizana Nafeek case remanded
content: The main suspect who is alleged to have forged the passport and the Birth certificate of Rizana Nafeek to seek employment in Saudi Arabia was remanded by the Colombo Chief Magistrate on Tuesday

title: Another committee appointed to investigate substandard fuel
content: Petroleum Minister Susil Premajayantha has directed the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to appoint a second committee to look into the compensation of some 3000 complainants whose vehicles were suspected to have been damaged by substandard petrol.

title: Maharoof expelled from WC
content: Former UNP MP Mohammed Maharoof has been removed from the UNP’s working committee today, by UNP Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe.

title: Only Sri Lankan Police: Karuna
content: Responding to Robert O. Blake, V. Muralitharan, Deputy Minister of Resettlement has said there is no Sinhala, Tamil or Muslim police in Sri Lanka but only Sri Lankan police

title: Last survivor in ice hockey tragedy dies
content: Alexander Galimov, a forward on Russia’s Lokomotiv Yaroslavl hockey team, died today in the hospital after a September 7 plane crash that killed his coach and fellow players, an official at the Vishnevsky Surgery Clinic in Moscow said today by phone, confirming a report by the Interfax news service.

title: UNP on beautification of Cmb
content: The UNP said today that the government did not have the right to break down walls or damage homes for the purpose of beautifying the city of Colombo as it had no authority to do so

title: Blast outside Delhi High Court
content: A powerful explosion occured outside Gate No. 5 of the Delhi high court at 10:15am. Around 24 people are reportedly injured

title: Airconditioned pharmacies
content: The Health ministry is set to introduce new laws which compell all pharmacies in the country to be airconditioned

title: Cabinet committee to monitor fuel purchases
content: The purchase of oil in future will be only permitted after a newly appointed cabinet subcommittee scrutinizes and approves the purchase, a reliable government source said yesterday

title: CPC lapses in low-quality petrol issue
content: The three member committee that probed into the circumstances that led to the import a stock of contaminated petrol and the aftermath of it last month, has found a series of lapses on the part of CEYPETCO officials and recommends to charge the losses either from the company that exported low quality petrol and from the officials who were involved in the racket

title: Owner of orphanage remanded
content: An owner of an orphanage who had allegedly sexually harassed four underage girls who were living in the orphanage was remanded till August 29 by a Colombo Court today.

title: SL Tamils' debate loses to corruption
content: The Rajya Sabha saw a brief ruckus Wednesday as members clashed on whether to take up a discussion on Sri Lankan Tamils or corruption, with the latter winning the duel

title: SL grants import credit to the Maldives
content: The government of Sri Lanka has granted a $10m (£6.1m) import credit to the Republic of Maldives. Analysts say the agreement signed in Colombo on Thursday during a visit to the island by President of Maldives

title: Traffic cop snatches pedestrian’s gold chain
content: The Colombo Chief Magistrate remanded a traffic police constable of the Slave Island Police till August 19 for allegedly snatching a gold chain and a gold pendant of a pedestrian, at Ward Place Colombo 7

title: Sri Lanka make 286/9 in the 3rd ODI
content: Sri Lanka made 286/9 in their 50 overs in the third ODI against Australia. Upul Tharanga made a superb 111 to give Sri Lanka a chance of keeping the series alive.

title: Fowzie says no truth to rumours
content: Senior Minister A.H.M Fowzie speaking at the meeting held yesterday,with the residents of  Pothtuvil had commented on the rumours surrounding the "Mystery man". Fowzie told  residents

title: Reformists to hold Sathyagraha
content: The UNP reformists group had summoned a meeting of the party’s provincial council members in order to re-educate them on the latest developments with regard to the present crisis.

title: Rajaratnam seeks leniency
content: Raj Rajaratnam, the Galleon Group hedge fund founder convicted of insider trading in May, asked a federal judge to impose a sentence "substantially below" what U.S. guidelines recommend

title: Karu’s proposals to Ranil today
content: The crisis within the main opposition UNP is likely to take a crucial stage today with Deputy Leader Karu Jayasuriya due to handover some proposals with regard to party reforms, to party leader Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: UK visa applicants arrested
content: Two Sri Lankan visa applicants have been arrested in the last two weeks for using deception and false identities to apply for UK visas. They were referred by the UK Border Agency to CID police in Colombo

title: SL makes request to EU
content: Sri Lanka updated its request to the European Union to list organizations of the LTTE as terrorist entities, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Brussels said

title: Karu assigned to unite party-Ranil
Buddhadasa lashes out at Wimal
content: Kaduwela UPFA Group Leader G.H. Buddhadasa yesterday lashed out at Minister Wimal Weerawansa, accusing him of parachuting into the area and violating various election laws.

title: Elections violence and security in Jaffna
content: The police department had deployed around 8,000 policemen and 500 personnel from elite Special Task Force (STF) for duty on elections day to maintain law and order in places identified as hot spots by the Elections Commissioner, police sources said.

title: Defence spending going down-PB
content: Treasury Secretary P. B. Jayasundera said the country’s defence spending was further going down as there was no requirement to spend money on military hardware, the LBO reported.

title: Agency faces ban over 'maid abuse'
content: A manpower agency could be blacklisted after it failed to report the case of a housemaid who ended up in hospital after jumping from a second-floor building in Riffa.

title: MR condemns attacks
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa, last night,condemned the 'cowardly' terrorist attacks in Mumbai and expressed his condolences to the bereaved families, the government and the people of India, Drector General of the Presidential Media division Bandula Jayasekera said.

title: Lasantha murder suspect released on bail
content: The Colombo High Court today released a Lance Corporal of the Sri Lanka Army on   cash and sureties bail for alleged involvement in the killing of Sunday Leader Editor Lasantha Wickramatunge

title: China increase aid, to gain influence - report
content: China, seeking to gain influence in the Indian Ocean , has reportedly increased its aid to Sri Lanka dramatically since 2005, a US Congressional report has said.

title: Two Lankans nabbed in Kolkata
content: Two Sri Lankan nationals were arrested at NSC Bose International airport, Kolkata yesterday for trying to travel to Dubai with fake passport, police said.

title: SLC board named
content: Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage today announced the appointment of the new members of the Sri Lanka Cricket Interim Board. The members include Upali Dharmadasa as the new Chairman,  P. Shaffter (Secretary), Nimal Perera (Treasure) and Sidath Wettamuni VIDEO

title: Not under Indian pressure - MR
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday denied that he had come under pressure from India to offer the minority Tamils a political solution, saying that any settlement to the matter will have to be approved by Parliament.

title: SL lack lobbying in the West
content: While claiming that Sri Lanka is not a matter for the UN Human Rights Council, Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to India Prasad Kariyawasam said Sri Lanka doesn’t have strong local lobbying in the Western world, whereas the LTTE still has a strong lobby.

title: Private buses to go on strike
content: The Lanka Private Bus Owners Association today confirmed that arrangements have been made to go on an all-island strike on June 27 (Monday) owning to the transport authorities unwillingness to increase bus fares by 15% and the minimum bus fare by Rs.6 to 8.

title: TNA wants to re-merge N&E
content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) had renewed its call for the re-merger of the Northern and Eastern Provinces as a single political administrative unit, former MP M.K. Sivajilingam said yesterday.

title: Police asked to retain uni suspects
content: Gangodawila Chief Magistrate Rohana Anura Kumara Herath authorized the Mirihana police today to retain the suspect students of the Arts faculty of Sri Jayawardenapura University who have been arrested under charges of terrorism

title: CID raid SLC
content: A special team from the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) conducted a search inside the Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) office in Maitland Crescent yesterday evening to find a missing hard disk which contained valuable information, sources said

title: UK visa rules to change
content: The British government announced that proposals have been made where migrants coming to the UK to work on temporary visas will no longer be able to apply for settlement, the British High Commission in Colombo said

title: ‘Pension bill not withdrawn’
content: The opposition today charged that the Private Pension Scheme Bill has not been withdrawn from the parliamentary order paper despite the cabinet decision to do so

title: Son of UNP MP arrested
content: The police today reportedly arrested the son of a leading UNP Parliamentarian after he assaulted a police officer at the Colpetty junction this morning

title: Karuna’s help was taken-Army
content: Major General Chagi Gallage, the then Commanding Officer of the Army’s Task Force-1 said that Karuna’s cadres were not used at tactical or operational level but they were used to man a withdrawal route after the fall of Vakari.

title: Indian coastguard arrest SL fishermen
content: The Coast Guard (Eastern) region has apprehended ten Sri Lankan fishermen for allegedly fishing in Indian waters and seized two Lankan fishing boats from them.

title: HC Notice on fishermen killings
content: The Madras High Court yesterday issued notice to the central and state governments on a petition seeking to set up a system along Tamil Nadu coast to protect the lives of Indian fishermen straying into Sri Lankan waters

title: Eight fined for indecent behaviour
content: Eight persons who were accused of behaving in an indecent manner under the influence of liquor at a public place in Slave Island on Vesak Poya Day were ordered to pay a fine of Rs.28,000 by the Colombo Fort Magistrate today.

title: Court orders Kanimozhi's arrest in 2G scam
content: A Delhi court today ordered "forthwith" the arrest of DMK MP Kanimozhi and Kalaignar TV Managing Director Sharad Kumar after rejecting their bail pleas in the 2G spectrum case.

title: Dr. Shirani Bandaranayake new Chief Justice
'Salary figures manipulated'
content: Federation of University Teachers Association (FUTA) today said that the academics’ salary figures publicized by the University Grants Commission (UGC) are manipulated to benefit the claims of FUTA demands to be unfair

title: Order to accept UPFA nominations
content: Court of appeal today directed returning officer and election commissioner to accept all 19 UPFA nomination papers for Local Government Election in Jaffna and Kilinochchi districts

title: Govt ready to protect Hashan
content: Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage has promised security to Hashan Tillekaratne if the former Sri Lanka cricket captain is ready to reveal the names of those involved in match fixing since 1992 as alleged by Tillkaratne earlier, Sports Ministry stated in a release today.

title: School drop-outs
content: An estimated 200,000 school-going children drop-out of school annually in the country, Commissioner of Probation and Childcare Services, Sarath Abeygunawardena said

title: Did US violate Intl laws? - PM
content: Prime Minister D.M Jayaratne yesterday questioned into whether the killing of Osama Bin Laden by US forces in Pakistan was a violation of International laws

title: May day traffic plan
content: A special traffic plan will be implemented for the May Day tomorrow, where eleven May Day rallies are to be held within the Colombo city, Inspector General of Police (IGP) Mahinda Balasuriya said

title: Fake fishermen nabbed
content: The Sri Lankan Navy nabbed the trading of ganja from India to Sri Lanka by a group posing off as fishermen in the deep sea off Pesalai. It is suspected that the Lankan fishermen who obtain permission for fishing in the secured areas enter the deep sea and deal in the purchase of ganja strictly on cash basis

title: Minister Athauda threatened
content: A UPFA Pradeshiya Sabha member and several of his supporters who threatened Senior Minister for Rural Affairs, Athauda Seneviratne at several occasions have been remanded after a police complaint was made by the Minister.

title: Don’t complicate reconciliation process- Russia
content: While claiming that the United Nations should not complicate the process of reconciliation in war-battered Sri Lanka, Russia said that the report prepared by the panel of experts, appointed by the UN Secretary General is not a UN report

title: No HR violations - Mahanayaka
content: Mahanayaka of the Asgiri Chapter Ven. Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero said unlike countries waging wars to protect their interests worldwide, the Sri Lankan government initiated a humanitarian operation to safeguard the people of the country and claims that these operations violated Human rights cannot be accepted

title: A long-term captain needed- Sanga
content: Kumar Sangakkara has said that the Sri Lankan board should choose a long-term captain as his successor and not succumb and give someone a caretaker role

title: Uni. teachers threaten authorities
content: The Federation of University Teachers Association (FUTA) announced that they will take steps to vacate the university administration force by May 9 and would abstain from participating in the 2011 G.C.E. A/L examination evaluation process if their requests are left unanswered by the authorities

title: April 15th declared as holiday
content: The government has declared April 15th, the day after the Sinhala and Tamil New year, as a special Public and Bank Holiday, the government information department announced.

title: World cup bookies arrested
content: Around eleven bookies were arrested on Sunday for accepting bets on the India-Sri Lanka World Cup final.Police have recovered 10 mobile phones, two LCD televisions and two laptops from the the accused

title: Bus falls on roof of house
content: A Badulla  bound CTB bus from Welimada  that ran off the road at Galaboda ella this morning in Ettampitiya rolled down a slope and fell on the roof of a house causing serious injuries to ten passengers

title: Suspect flees from custody
content: A suspect who had been remanded in connection with several criminal activities fled from the police custody when he was being transported to the Anuradhapura Magistrates court yesterday, Anuradhapura Police said

title: West should decide-SL
content: Sri Lanka said that Western governments should come to a conclusion as to who speak for the Tamils of Sri Lanka, whether those in the diaspora, who continue to seek an independent Tamil Eelam or peace loving Tamils in Sri Lanka and abroad

title: Deshapriya new Polls Chief
content: Assistant Election Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya was appointed as the new Election Commissioner with effect from March 25, official sources said

title: UN Chief attacked in Cairo
content: Supporters of the Libyan government, protesting the UN-sanctioned military operation in the North African country, on Monday attacked UN chief Ban Ki-moon in central Cairo, the Agence France Presse news agency reported.

title: Sanga, Murali secure Lankan win
content: Sri Lanka recorded a comprehensive 112 run win against New Zealand in its final Group A game of the 2011 Cricket World Cup at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, a short while ago

title: Polls commence
content: Polls to elect a total of 3036 members for 234 Local Government bodies commenced at 7 am today at 7396 Polling Booths Island wide with tight security. VIDEO

title: Indian power sets suspended
content: The government suspended the import of 17 power sets (trains) from India, until the completion of the ongoing investigations into the quality of the recently imported power set from India, a minister said

title: Information desk setup
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has set up an information desk at the Consular Affairs Division of the Ministry to provide information to Sri Lankan nationals who wish to ascertain the wellbeing of their next of kin in Japan. Contact the Consular Affairs Division on -  011-4719593, 011-5743362 and 077-2267929 (24 hours)

title: Paba against domestic violence
content: MP Upeksha Swaramali popularly known as Paba, speaking in Parliament today stressed the need for all her parliamentary colleagues to unite against domestic violence

title: Fire at Peradeniya Uni
content: More than 10 acres of land near the Wijewardena Hall of the University of Peradeniya was damaged due to a fire that spread in the area earlier today, the Kandy Fire Brigade told Daily Mirror online

title: Make peace MR tells Gaddafi
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa today requested the Libyan leader Colonel Muammer Gaddafi to establish peace in his country as soon as possible. Bandula Jayasekara Director General President Media Division said that President made the request when the Libyan leader had phoned him today

title: We will not sell our victories
content: "We will not sell the victories we gained from the humanitarian operations and the people will never forget what the armed forces did during the war," President Mahinda Rajapaksa said during his speech at the 60th Anniversary of the Sri Lanka Air Force this morning

title: Two die in accident
content: Two people have been killed when the motor bike they were riding on, crashed into a lorry that was parked near a porcelain factory in Dankotuwa, last morning. Police said the deceased were residents of Singakkuliya.

title: Brawl inside Court
content: The Chief Magistrate of the Kalutara Magistrate Court suspend presiding of the Court yesterday after three suspects exchanged fisticuffs inside the cell within the court premises.Thereafter charges were framed against them and two of them who pleaded guilty were sentenced to rigorous imprisonment

title: SL to upgrade air-to-air capabilities
content: The Sri Lanka Air Force will upgrade its air to air capabilities in the near the future and encourage more research and development programmes, CDS and Air Force Commander Roshan Gunathilake said today

title: Mahela scores a century
content: Mahela Jayawardena scored the first hundred by a Sri Lankan at the 2011 World Cup a short while ago at the Mahinda Rajapaksa International Stadium. This was the fastest hundred by a Sri Lankan at a World Cup which was earlier scored by Sanath Jayasuriya. Mahela achieved the century in 80 balls

title: School punishment for drunks
content: A group of 60 people, who in a drunken stupor had attempted to climb Adam’s peak with 15 bottles of arrack in their possession, were apprehended by the Nawalapitiya Police and were asked to kneel till they were sober

title: IUSF convener gets bail
content: The Inter University Students Federation (IUSF) convener Sanjeewa Bandara was released on bail a short while ago, the IUSF said

title: Ranil prevented from taking action
content: UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe was prevented from taking any disciplinary action against SLMC leader Rauff Hakeem and six other SLMC party members by an order of the District Court today. The Court order is operative till February 24th

title: Sun Sea costs $25mn for Canada
content: The arrival of the MV Sun Sea off the coast of British Columbia last August has cost Canadians at least $25 million, so far

title: Karunanidhi betraying Tamils: Vaiko
content: Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam general secretary Vaiko observed a one-day token hunger strike here on Sunday to protest against the alleged Sri Lankan Naval attacks on Tamil fishermen

title: MR insists on Mathematics
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has stressed that the Education Ministry should maintain the status quo that at least a simple pass is required for Mathematics at the GCE Ordinary Level Examination for students to do their Advanced Level studies in any stream

title: Heavy rain and floods displace 2000
content: A child died of drowning in Vavuniya while Trincomalee and Vavuniya Districts were hit hard by heavy rain and floods displacing close to 2050 persons, the Disaster Management Center reported

title: Be vigilant for unexploded ordnances
content: The army requests the public to be vigilant and not to meddle around with suspicious articles that may be explosives and to inform the nearest army detachment, in such an instance, Army Spokesman Major General Ubaya Madawela told Daily Mirror online

title: 36-hour water cut
content: There will be a 36-hour water cut in several areas in the Colombo suburbs and a 12-hour water cut in and around Colombo on the weekend, Deputy General Manager of the Water Supply and Drainage Board (WSDB) Gerard Fernando said

title: Cocaine worth Rs.150mn seized
content: Airport Customs officers arrested an Indian national with 10 kilos of cocaine worth Rs.150 million that was hidden in a traveling bag. The suspect was heading to Bangkok from India, Superintend of Customs M.V Jayaratne said

title: Lanka IOC makes price hike request
content: Lanka IOC has made a request to the government to increase the prices of petrol and diesel as the crude oil and petroleum product prices have been increasing in the international market, Managing Director of Lanka IOC Suresh Kumar said

title: Home guards for teaching
content: United National Party MP Anoma Gamage revealed in Parliament today that members of the Civil Defence Force known as ‘Home Guards’ have been assigned to teach in pre-schools in the morning and to man checkpoints at night.

title: Mahout’s spear kills elephant
content: An elephant at the Pinnawela elephant orphanage died under tragic circumstances, allegedly due to injuries caused by its caretakers’ spear, an official said today.

title: DS and GN leave canceled
content: All leave of Divisional Secretariats and Grama Niladharis of all flood affected districts have been canceled with immediate effect, the Ministry of Public Administration announced.

title: No extension after 60 years
content: The government has accepted as a policy that the age limit of service for public servants as 60 years and there will be no extensions after that, Public Administration and Home Affairs Minister John Seneviratne said today

title: Bus operators seek MR intervention
content: The private buses operators in the Western Province will go on strike from midnight tomorrow, while seeking an intervention regarding their demands from the President, Private Bus Operators said a short while ago

title: Fear psychosis in North
content: A fear psychosis is present in the North and the crime rate is rising in Jaffna, Minister Douglas Devananda informed Parliament today

title: Over 360,000 affected by floods
content: More than 364,854 persons belonging to more than 97,144 families have been affected due to floods and heavy rain in Ampara, Batticaloa, Trincomalee and several other districts in the North and East, while more than 16,117  are currently housed in displaced camps, the Disaster Management Center said

title: LC elections in March
content: The government will dissolve the Municipal Councils, Urban Councils and Pradeshiya Sabhas in January and hold elections to the Local Councils in March next year, Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) General Secretary, Minister Maithripala Sirisena said today

title: Tsunami victims remembered
content: A nation-wide two minute silence was maintained a short while ago between  9.25 a.m to 9.27 a.m as a mark of respect for those who died in the 2004 tsunami

title: GL meets Butenis over WikiLeaks
content: External Affairs Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris today raised concerns with US Ambassador Ms. Patricia Butenis about the references to Sri Lanka in the WikiLeaks website cables

title: Fox postpones SL visit
content: British Defence Secretary Liam Fox has postponed a visit to Sri Lanka, following reported Foreign Office concerns about the trip, the Guardian reported.

title: Sumana thero released on bail
content: The Colombo High Court today ordered the release of Ven. Uvathenne Sumana Thero, on a cash bail  of Rs. 100,000 and a split personal bail of Rs.1 million by two sureties each. The thero was indicted for possessing explosives and fires arms

title: SL to boycott Nobel
content: Sri Lanka will not attend Friday's Nobel Peace Prize award ceremony for jailed Chinese dissident Liu Xiaobo. External Affairs Ministry sources stated that this was a move to support the Chinese boycott of the event

title: LeT in Lanka - WikiLeaks
content: Information coming out of a secret State Department cable dated June 19, 2009 released by WikiLeaks indicates that Lashkar-e-Toiba (LeT) T has established a facilitation centre in Sri Lanka and was looking at setting up a base of operations in Kerala and Tamil Nadu

title: Wimal finds fault with SL mission
content: Minister Wimal Weerawansa today found fault with the Sri Lankan mission in London for failing to asses and make President Mahinda Rajapaksa aware of the possible security concerns that would arise during his visit

title: Pirates seize ship with Lankans
content: Sri Lankans are among the crew of Malaysian-owned cargo vessel, which was hijacked by the Somali pirates on November 26th, the European Union's anti-piracy task force said today

title: 50 students hospitalized
content: At least 50 students of a Tamil School in Nawalapitiya have been hospitalized today after they fainted due to inhaling of contaminated air, police said.

title: Trial postponed
content: The trial against Former MP M.M Mustapha for bribery was postponed today after his lawyer presented a medical certificate explaining that Mustapha was in the UK receiving treatment for heart disease

title: Provide exercise machines for SF
content: The Colombo High Court today ordered the Prison Department to provide necessary facilities for Sarath Fonseka to exercise and also to repair the roof of the Welikada jail

title: Meteor showers expected
content: A meteor shower will occur at dawn on Wednesday and Thursday , Arthur C Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) spokesman told Daily Mirror

title: Rs. 15 billion approved
content: The motion which was submitted seeking the approval of Parliament for a supplementary estimate of Rs 15 billion to expedite development projects in the country was approved in parliament a short while ago

title: Calls for Rs. 9000 pay hike
content: The JVP led National Trade Union Center (NTUC) will call for a Rs. 9000 pay hike in the 2011 budget for government and private sector employees due to the raising cost of living, NTUC President Lal Kantha said

title: Gaming bill, JHU wants changes
content: The JHU said yesterday that they would vote against the Gaming Levy (Special Provisions) Bill unless the amendments proposed by them were incorporated in the new legislation during the committee stage in Parliament

title: Arbitration begins tomorrow
content: The arbitration on the controversial hedging deal signed between the US based CITI Bank and the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) will start tomorrow in Singapore and go on until November 13, Petroleum Industries Minister Susil Premajayantha said today

title: Amnesty fights for Rizana
content: Amnesty International today urged the Saudi Arabian King to halt the execution of a young Sri Lankan woman who has lost her appeal against a death sentence for a murder committed when she says she was 17 years old.

title: Miscarriage of justice
content: A group of religious leaders today said that there is a miscarriage of justice with regard to the case of former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka

title: Another set of immigrants
content: A group of 87 asylum seekers from Sri Lanka had been rescued by Indonesian Maritime Police in Panaitan Island where they were stranded after they ran out of fuel, food and water, the Gulf Times said.

title: New company for Golden Key
content: The assets of Golden Key Credit Card Company is to be transferred to a new company to be formed under the Companies Act and the depositors of Golden Key will be appointed as the shareholders of the new company

title: Ranjan Ramanayaka arrested
Lankan’s clash in Jordan
content: Jordanian police fired tear gas at Sri Lankan garment workers, after the workers threw stones damaging a police vehicle and injuring police officers following a dispute at the garment factory

title: SF to meet Prisons Chief
content: Former Army Commander Sarath Fonseka, who is currently serving a jail term, has reportedly requested to meet Commissioner General of Prisons Major General V.R De Silva.

title: No tax change
content: The government announced today that the vehicle import taxes will remain unchanged and requested the pubic not to be misled by false information and postpone or speed up the import of vehicles unnecessarily.

title: Lankans under house arrest
content: A Sri Lankan Tamil couple perceived as a threat to national security by the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO), are housed in a residential detention facility in Sydney along with their children, The Australian reported.

title: IMF clears instalment
content: The IMF has given approval for the release of its 4th instalment of funds and Sri Lanka will receive about US Dollars Two Hundred and Ten million on Monday, Governor Central Bank Nivard Cabraal said

title: Sanuja tops
content: Sanuja Kalhan Edirisinghe of Dharmapala Vidayalaya-Pannipitiya has topped the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination with 196 marks. The names of the students who gained highest four marks at the Examination, were released by the Department of Examinations today.

title: Shadow authority to fight alcoholism
MP for council
content: UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe says he has named TNA Parliamentarian M.A Sumandiran as his nominee to the Parliament Council. However the TNA has rejected it.

title: Suicide threat
content: The man who is staging a protest on top of a tall post near the Horton Place round-about is threatening to commit suicide unless President Mahinda Rajapaksa himself comes and meets him  VIDEO

title: CWC MP sits out
content: Ceylon Workers Congress (CWC) Parliamentarian V. Radhakrishnan has reportedly decided to sit independently is Parliament and support the government as he has been sidelined by his party.

title: LET links Lanka
content: The key accused in the Pune German Bakery blast in India has made a startling revelation to his interrogators saying that Colombo is a training hub of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LET).

title: Uproar in House
content: An uproar broke out in Parliament a short while ago as the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) voiced their opposition to the 18th Amendment to the constitution.

title: ICC probes Lankan
content: The International Cricket Council's anti-corruption unit has been monitoring the activities of a leading Sri Lanka player since the World Twenty20 in England last year, the British Guardian reported today.

title: Hakeem flies
content: SLMC leader Rauff Hakeem was offered a chopper ride by President Mahinda Rajapaksa this afternoon to go to the funeral of the ex-SLFP strongman and former Minister Lakshman Jayakody.

title: Mervyn not guilty
content: Former Deputy Minister Mervyn Silva was found not guilty by the SLFP Disciplinary Committee over his conduct of tying a Samurdhi officer to a tree earlier this month, Minister Maithripala Sirisena said AUDIO

title: Cycling to Jaffna
content: A 60 year old man from Deniyaya in the Matara district, Malawarachige Ratnapala, has ridden a bicycle all the way to Jaffna on a sight seeing tour and is to return to his home town today.

title: Roads closed
content: The road between the Bellanthara juncition to Boralesgamuwa along the Dehiwala - Maharagma route will be closed tomorrow evening as a result of the Esala Pereraha of the Bellanwila temple.

title: Lankan maid nailed
content: Inquiries will be made regarding the Saudi maid who had returned to the country with 23 nails inserted into her body, Kingsley Ranawaka, Chairman of the Foreign Employment Bureau said

title: Demand for LTTE land
content: Civilians who have been recently resettled in the north have complained to the Government Agent in Kilinochchi that the land which was forcefully taken away from them by the LTTE is not being returned

title: ADB VP in Lanka
content: ADB Vice President , Xiaoyu Zhao will visit Sri Lanka from this week where he will hold discussions with the Government and visit ADB funded projects especially in the north of Sri Lanka.

title: DNA MPs released
content: Democratic National Alliance MPs Vijitha Herath and Ajith Kumara were released on personal bail today.The two MPs were arrested following a demonstration conducted by the DNA in Galle last week.

title: Vijitha remanded
content: Democratic National Alliance (DNA) MPs Vijitha Herath and Ajith Kumara, who were arrested last evening over charges of assaulting police officers in Galle, have been remanded till next week.

title: US wants probe
content: The US Congress has called for an independent international investigation on alleged war crimes in Sri Lanka saying panels set up by the government lacked the needed credibility.

title: Over 30,000 prostitutes
content: Some 30,000 – 40,000 prostitutes currently operate countrywide in thousands of trafficking centers, the Health Education Bureau (HEB) told Daily Mirror online. VIDEO

title: CBK slams government
content: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga said today that although the war has come to an end, the country cannot be developed with casino owners, shrewd people and murderers.

title: Mervyn ties man to tree
content: Deputy Minister Mervyn Silva tied a samurdhi officer to a mango tree a short while ago over his failure to attend a dengue prevention programme in Kelaniya last week  VIDEO

title: Canada to intercept ship
content: The Canadian Ministry of Defence says it is prepared to intercept a migrant ship, reportedly carrying about 200 suspected Sri Lankan asylum seekers, that is due to arrive on B.C.'s coast in the next few weeks.

title: Porn ban in final stage
content: The Police Women and Children’s Bureau held discussions with the TRC, senior officials from the IT faculty of the Colombo University and the Magistrate of the Bambalapitiya Juvenile Court today in a bid to ban porn on mobile phones

title: Tender process ignored
content: A large number of medical supplies were purchased under the emergency procedure in 2008 overlooking the tender process, the Health Ministry quoted Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena as saying.

title: TRC director remanded
content: The Deputy Director of Human Resources of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) was today remanded by the Colombo Additional Magistrate for the fraudulent misappropriation of Rs 1,619,899 of public money.

title: Recruitment scam in Galle
content: FORUT International Sri Lanka has warned of a large scale recruitment scam of youth underway in Galle using the name of the development agency in the capacity of a Chief Program Officer.

title: Lanka at risk of sea rise
content: Sea levels are rising unevenly in the Indian Ocean, placing millions at risk along low-lying coastlines in Bangladesh, Indonesia and Sri Lanka, Researchers from the University of Colorado and the National Center for Atmospheric Research have said

title: Protest in Jaffna over death
content: The mid wives at the Jaffna hospital have come to duty to the hospital wearing blank bands protesting over the alleged murder of a mid wife. The mid wife was allegedly murdered by a doctor last week.

title: Tamils registered again
content: The Police have begun registering Tamils in the Wellawatte area under the police ordinance, the police said. However, the Democratic People’s Front charged the police of registering Tamils under section 23 of the Emergency regulations.

title: Power pirates arrested
content: Over 100 power pirates were arrested in Pottuvil this morning following a raid conducted by the Ceylon Electricity Board. The 128 people arrested for tapping electricity were to be produced in Court.

title: Soldiers injured in accident
content: At least 13 soldiers were injured following a road accident in the Kekirawa area and have been admitted to a nearby hospital for treatment but police said they had no further details of the incident.

title: UNP protests in Parliament
content: The UNP staged a protest in parliament a short while ago holding up placards against the government budget for 2010. Some government members were seen shouting slogans at the UNP creating a noisy commotion in parliament

title: 12,000 stuck in prison
