content: At least 12,000 prisoners jailed over minor crimes are stuck in prison unable to pay the fines in order to be released or because the government analyst report has not been obtained in order to clear some of them of their alleged crimes.

title: MR holds urgent meeting
content: External Affairs Minister G.L Peiris, speaking to reporters a short while ago, said that President Mahinda Rajapaksa has called him to attend an urgent meeting this evening but did not elaborate on what the meeting was about.

title: Top US official in Lanka
content: Deputy Assistant Secretary for Population, Refugees and Migration of the U.S. Department of State, Kelly Clements  is in the country to discuss the needs of the IDPs and is expected to visit the war torn north, the US Embassy in Colombo said today

title: Court must clear Fonseka
content: Parliamentarian General Sarath Fonseka who was given permission by the Speaker to attend the Commonwealth Parliamentary Union (CPU) conference in Kenya has to get Court permission to be released for his visit, Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said.

title: Lankans stranded in India
content: A group of Sri Lankans who were promised jobs in Afghanistan have been stranded in India by their agent, the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau said. The Sri Lankans are now being attended to by the Sri Lankan High Commission in New Delhi.

title: LTTE attempting to re-group
content: The government today warned that the LTTE was trying to make contact with former rebel members who had been released after rehabilitation in the north and said that the LTTE had its sleeping cells in Colombo, the Chinese Xinhua reported.

title: UK to continue Tiger ban
content: Britain has assured the ban on the LTTE will continue to remain in force and UK will continue to prevent actions supportive of the LTTE on British soil. The assurance was given by the British envoy in Sri Lanka to Prime Minister D. M. Jayaratne.

title: Public proposals for UNP
content: The UNP said today that anyone from the general public who is interested in the affairs of the UNP can submit proposals on party reforms. The UNP says they can submit their proposals at the UNP Headquarters ‘Siri Kotha’ or send it in by writing

title: Report on new court martial
content: A report is to be submitted soon to Army Commander Lieutenant General Jagath Jayasuriya calling for the holding of a third Court Martial against General Sarath Fonseka over alleged illegal tenders carried out during his term as the army chief

title: Draft political solution to India
content: President Mahinda Rajapakse will present his government's first draft of proposed solutions to Indian Premier Dr. Manmohan Singh in New Delhi in June, government sources have said.

title: UN to continue with panel
content: The UN says the forming of a commission by President Rajapakse to investigate alleged incidents which took place during the war will not substitute the need for a panel of experts to brief the UN Chief on accountability issues relating to Sri Lanka

title: Surveillance cameras in town
content: Police surveillance cameras are to be installed in Colombo to curb crime and traffic offences. A delegation which includes some senior police officers have already left for Singapore to study the use of the security cameras, reports said.

title: Freed crew heading to Oman
content: The Sri Lankan crew of a cargo ship which was held captive and later released by Somali pirates, Tuesday, are heading to Oman where they will be met by Sri Lankan authorities, a Foreign Ministry spokesperson told Daily Mirror online.

title: JVP sees an MR budget
content: With President Mahinda Rajapaksa taking over most of the Ministries under his belt the opposition Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) feels 80-90 percent of the budget will be proposals of the President himself.

title: UNP, DNA stage a walkout
content: The UNP and the DNA walked away from the parliament proceedings today after DNA Leader General Sarath Fonseka was not allowed to attend today’s parliamentary sessions due to the court martial hearing.

title: Salvaged vehicles advertised
content: The Government has started advertising details of the salvaged vehicles belonging to civilians which were recovered from such areas as Pudumathalan and Puthukkudiyirruppu so that their rightful owners could get them back.

title: Resettlement in six months
content: The government hopes to resettle all the remaining Internally Displaced People (IDP) who are in IDP camps at Vavuniya within a period of six months, Newly appointed Minister of Resettlement Milroy Fernando said.

title: Key changes in the UNP soon
content: The possibility of a change in leadership has arisen in the UNP with the party expected to make some key changes during the course of this week. The changes would be finalized by the party at the working committee meeting

title: Bamba youth forced to drown
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate making a judgment today on the drowning of a youth in Bambalapitiya, said that it was clear, based on the available evidence, the youth was forced to drown by the suspects in custody including a police officer.

title: Sampanthan tops in Trinco
content: ITAK Leader R. Sampanthan has received the highest preferential votes in the Trincomalee District with 24, 488 votes followed by UNP’s M.S. Thaufee who received 23,588 votes.

title: Eight indicted on embassy attack
content: The Oslo District Court indicted eight Tamils of Sri Lankan origin for vandalism on the Sri Lankan Embassy last year in Norway. The accused risk punishment with up to seven years in prison if they are found guilty.

title: Lanka wants to forget the past
content: Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to the United States Jaliya Wickramasuriya says the world now recognizes the strategic significance and economic potential of Sri Lanka’s lasting peace and added that it is time to forget the past and begin anew

title: Secure human rights says US
content: The United States says the UPFA victory at the General Elections coupled with President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s win at the Presidential elections, provides a mandate to move forward on important issues including securing human rights

title: UPFA secures Badulla
content: The ruling UPFA has won the General Elections in the Badulla District by obtaining 203,689 votes and securing 6 seats while the UNP has obtained 112,886 votes and secured 2 seats. The Democratic National Alliance secured 15,768 votes

title: Sanath casts his vote
content: Sri Lankan cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya cast his vote for the General Elections in Matara today, a day before the actual polls, after obtaining special permission from the Elections Commissioner as he will be out of the country for the IPL cricket tournament

title: Monks to continue fast
content: A group of monks who began a fast unto death yesterday calling for the release of General Sarath Fonseka have decided to continue their fast today despite the police removing their temporary shelter using a court order last night.

title: Solis Director remanded
content: The Director of the Solis business establishment, who was arrested yesterday over his alleged involvement with Dhanuna Tillakaratna, the son-in-law of General Sarath Fonseka, was today remanded till April 7 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate.

title: Probe over ransom murder
content: A full scale investigation is underway over the murder of a school boy in Chavakachcheri, Jaffna who was earlier abducted for ransom allegedly by three of his class mates who are now in police custody. The body of the youth was found yesterday

title: Gota trial date fixed
content: The Mount Lavinia Magistrate today fixed the dates for the trial in the case filed by Defence Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa against the Sunday Leader newspaper seeking compensation over a defamatory article published against him.

title: Political parties criticize IGP
content: Political party representatives criticized IGP Mahinda Balasuriya in front of Elections Commissioner Dayananda Dissanayake today, for the police’s failure to remove all unlawful election related cut-outs, posters and banners.

title: Clash at Colombo University
content: A clash has erupted at the Colombo University between two student groups of the management faculty eye witnesses said. The riot police armed with teargas and water cannons have been called in to bring the situation under control.

title: Lanka refugee guidelines reviewed
content: The United Nations is reviewing its refugee guidelines for Sri Lanka in a move that could see the Australian Government deny protection claims for the majority of asylum seekers heading to Australia.

title: LTTE proxies searching for Prabha
content: The government is concerned that some umbrella organizations of the LTTE are still trying to trace their leader LTTE Chief Velupillai Prabhakaran and the matter has been discussed with India, the government said.

title: MR to take oaths November 18
content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa is to take oaths for the second term in office on November 18 this year, Government Minister G.L Pieris told reporters this morning. President Rajapaksa is yet to take oaths after wining the Presidential elections this year.

title: Major arrested over club incident
content: An Army Major has been arrested and remanded over an incident at a club in Bambalapitiya where he had brandished his weapon, threatened the staff and damaged property. Police are on the lookout for two others in connection with the incident

title: Body found near Parliament
content: An unidentified body was found near Parliament this afternoon. Police said that the decomposed body was found in the lake near the official residence of the Parliament Speaker.  Investigations are underway.

title: Candidate demands compensation
content: A UNP candidate who was to contest the upcoming General Election is seeking ten million Rupees from the Anuradhapura police as compensation for the physical harm they caused him while dispersing a group of protestors recently.

title: Sri Lanka will not be sold
content: Sri Lanka is not prepared to be sold in order to regain the GSP plus facility from the European Union and has taken remedial measures to maintain the economy minus the trade concession, Central Bank Governor Ajith Cabraal told Daily Mirror online...VIDEO

title: Daily Mirror Tamil web launched
content:

title: Fonseka appeals for calm
content: Former army chief and defeated presidential hopeful Sarath Fonseka has appealed for calm after violent clashes triggered by his arrest, his wife said. Fonseka urged the people especially the troops to remain calm and not to be provoked by his arrest.

title: Lanka to clear allegations with UN
content: The government has decided to meet the UN Human Rights Council Chief Navaneethan Pillai in Geneva tomorrow in order to counter allegations raised by former Army Chief General Sarath Fonseka regarding the final stages of the conflict.

title: Lanka E news journalist still missing
content: There is no trace yet of missing Lanka E News journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda and foreign missions in Colombo have been notified on the latest developments. Eknaligoda was reported missing on January 24, his wife Sandya Eknaligoda said

title: Lanka confirms Prabha’s death
content: India’s Union Home Minister P, Chidambaram said that India’s Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has received the 'documentation' from Sri Lanka confirming the death of LTTE Chief Vellupillai Prabhakaran. His body was recovered last year.

title: LTTE operative arrested in Colombo
content: A foreign LTTE operative identified as Subramanium Sivakumar was arrested by the Terrorism Investigations Department (TID) in Colombo, the Director of the Terrorism Investigations Department told reporters in Colombo this evening.

title: Special team to find Eknaligoda
Over 300,000 fake ballot papers
content: The police have received information that around 300,000 fake ballot papers are circulating around the country and sought public support to crack down on its distribution. The police are trying to identify where the fake ballot papers are being distributed.

title: Congress rejects Lanka’s claims
content: India’s ruling Congress party rejected claims by a top Sri Lankan official that the Sri Lankan government’s decision to stop the use of heavy weapons during the latter stages of the war helped the Indian government win the elections in Tamil Nadu last year.

title: Segu Isadeen supports Fonseka
content: Non Cabinet Minister Segu Isadeen met Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) leader Rauff Hakeem this morning and extended support to the party. The Non Cabinet Minister has said he will support General Sarath Fonseka at the Presidential elections.

title: CCD to probe Kiribathgoda clash
content: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) is to investigate the clash which took place in Kiribathgoda recently. The Colombo Additional Magistrate, today, ordered that the CCD file a report over the incident in April.

title: Alston says Lanka video authentic
content: Three independent experts have concluded that a videotape aired last August showing the execution of suspected LTTE cadres allegedly by the Lankan military is authentic, the special rapporteur of the UN Philip Alston told reporters at the UN a short while ago. VIDEO

title: Elections Chief instructs IGP to take action against police
content: Elections Commissioner Dayananda Dissanayaka has instructed the Inspector General of Police (IGP) to take disciplinary action against police officers who incorrectly reported that election propaganda including cutouts and banners had been removed in their respective divisions.

title: Lanka denies reports Thaksin to be appointed as an adviser
content: The government has denied Thai media reports which said that former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra is poised to be appointed as an economic adviser to the Government of Sri Lanka.

title: Venerable Dambara Amila arrested by the CID
content: The Venerable Dambara Amila thero, an ally of Presidential candidate Sarath Fonseka, has been taken in by the CID for questioning, JVP MP Vijitha Herath told Daily Mirror. He is being questioned over several complaints received against him, the police said.

title: Caretaker government will not have executive positions – JVP
content: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) today asserted that the caretaker government which will be created in the event General Sarath Fonseka comes to power at the next Presidential election will not have any executive positions.
